reviews.title: “Best chatting software for communication”

reviews.pros: It is easy to stay organized. You can keep all your chats, files, and conversations in one place, and the way it works with Google apps like Gmail and Drive just makes everything flow smoothly. It's super simple to reply and stay on top of things without it feeling overwhelming.
reviews.cons: What I like least about Google Chat is that it can feel a bit disconnected from other messaging apps sometimes.

reviews.cons: What I liked least about Google Chat is that it is not as professional as other communication platforms.  I receive messages or have received unwanted messages in the past from fraudulent users.  In my opinion it is a waste of space, and I need to delete it from my linked email accounts.

reviews.title: “A Seamless Communication Tool for Google Workspace Users"”
reviews.text: Overall, Google Chat offers a streamlined and efficient communication experience, especially for users already integrated into the Google Workspace ecosystem. Its strong integration with Google services like Drive, Calendar, and Meet facilitates seamless collaboration. The platform supports both direct messages and group conversations, making it versatile for different communication needs.
reviews.pros: one of its strengths is its integration with other Google Workspace tools. This makes it easy to share documents, schedule meetings, and collaborate on projects seamlessly within a unified platform. Its ability to facilitate both one-on-one and group conversations, along with its strong search functionality, also enhances productivity and communication for users.
reviews.cons:
Compared to other messaging platforms, it may lack some advanced features and customizability options.

Although it integrates well with Google Workspace, it may not work as smoothly with non-Google tools.

reviews.title: “Easy communication tool”

I can also pin it so I always know where it is, and I can set notifications that don't interrupt me all day. I can also pin certain people and groups to easily find them, because those are the ones I need most often.
reviews.cons: Because we use it so much, I do get a lot of pings from chats I don't really care about, like a social chat, but I still need to be a part of them. That is really my only complaint, and compared to the upsides, it's really nothing.

Overall, while the tool is highly useful for professional purposes, adding message read receipts would improve more its functionality.

reviews.title: “The best chatting platform for anyone”
reviews.text:
Google Chat has been with me for years of work, both individually and as a team.
The Google Chat is definitely worth using for workspace, business and educational purposes. It is a very versatile, easy to use and professional tool. Totally recommend this app!
reviews.pros:
I find Google Chat to be the best instant chat platform when in comes to professional or educational purposes.

I love that at the palm of your hand, and in a few seconds you can be talking, organizing and working together with one or several people, from and to anywhere in the world.
It is a simple and easy to use platform, without losing effectiveness and professionalism.
I also find impressive the amount of options and tools included to improve teamwork and in real time.
I can easily schedule a meeting and the whole team (or the people I invited) will be notified via the Google Calendar, with time and confirmation request included.
The Google Chat is definitely worth using for workspace, business and educational purposes.
reviews.cons:
One tool that I think is missing is the ability to record audios instantly.
This could increase the agility of the work and increase conversational fluency.
I think is missing, as other chat platforms already have this option, and it would definitely give Google Chat a leg up.
I think that there are no other things that I would change, or that I don’t like.

reviews.title: “Inexpensive Team communication and collaboration app”
reviews.pros: Google Chat offers a seamless real-time messaging and allows for secure communication and collaboration with team members or people you working with on a project.  Google Chat is very reliable and inexpensive because it is part of your Google account, and can also be downloaded as a standalone app if that's a preference. It is a very useful collaboration tool for team, especially if you're using Google workspace. The feature allows to integrate with other google products making it easy for to streamline your project flow as well as getting work completed without switching between tabs or different apps.  This mean from Google chat, you are able to share files from G-Drive, schedule appointments from calendar, access contacts, set a video meeting with Google Meet or have one-on-one chats with colleagues and get feedback in real time.  Another amazing thing is that Chat is available on available on mobile as well as desktop, making it accessible from sn office o remotely.  And if you have multiple projects, Chat allows to create channels or groups and you can customize notifications for each of them so you do not miss a thing.  To make even better, Chat provides information if or not a colleague is online and also is handy as it displays automated replies to messages, making it easy to respond on a busy day.
reviews.cons: Google Chat is all in all a very good app and can be recommended for a small business setting.

reviews.title: “A review about Google Chat”
reviews.text: A solid product, which despite being simple, is very powerful. It can add a lot of value to your company depending on which service is being migrated, however, there are competitors that provide better (but more expensive) tools.
reviews.pros: Extremely easy to use tool. It has an easy and intuitive interface, people with little experience in the technology can quickly learn to use it. It has excellent integration with other Google Workspace applications. Today, within Google Chat it is possible to interact with other applications such as Tasks (create, edit), Calendar (schedule events with co-workers), Drive (create and edit files), all without leaving the Gmail interface. It is also possible to integrate the tool with other applications, such as chat bots.
reviews.cons: Compared to other communication tools on the market like Slack or Discord, the tool becomes inferior. However, Google is constantly updating the tool and promoting integration with other services in order to improve the experience.

reviews.title: “Google Chats review”
reviews.text: I think this is by far the best app (next to discord) for chatting. Simple, easy to use, snd trusty. I can log in to my google account without having any fear, because it was made by google.
reviews.pros: I think the notifications were the best feature. The instant send thru messages combined with the notification’s buzz really tops it off and makes it by far the most useful addition.
reviews.cons: Like any other product, learning how to use the app and the controls can be hard to learn. But since this is a chatting app, Imdon’t have to worry about anything like that, and I can use it with ease.

reviews.title: “Very good chat, but not quite up to the level of Apple iMessage”
reviews.text: Overall, Google Chat solves the issue of business communication being slowed down by long e-mails back and forth. Business colleagues are more likely to quickly answer Google Chats than to answer e-mails, and group chats allow for great collaboration.
reviews.pros: Google chat is overall a great product. It's integration into Gmail and excellent mobile execution help maximize work productivity. I like that messages can be edited after being sent, that images can be pasted inline, and that hyperlinks can be added.
reviews.cons: I don't like that Google chat allows for only one hyperlink or inline image per chat message. I also wish the feature to send chats to your Gmail was more robust (so I could pick and choose what portion of the chat gets sent) and that it was easier to add someone to a group chat. I wish Google chat was more like Apple iMessage in polish and execution.

reviews.title: “Google Chat is Great, But Don't Forget to Turn On History or You May Lose Critical Info!”
reviews.text: We use to it stay in contact with our staff, especially given that many people are working remotely.
reviews.pros: Easy to use.  Integration with Google Drive.  Elegant mobile app.  Everyone in our organization uses it, so guarantees we have a way to communicate with everyone.
reviews.cons: The fact that history is not turned on by default is frustrating.  There have been multiple times where I needed to get info from a previous chat with someone, but because history was not on I lost that data.  I also would say that I find Slack easier, more fun and more fully-featured than Google Chat, even the free version of Slack.

The upper management can also work at ease to reach out to me the same way without having to wait for an email to be sent if there is an urgent project. My favorite would be the ability to search for a word I am looking for since I have the tendency to become forgetful. I also love the idea that it sends out a quick summary of the personal messages that I missed and I am ever mentioned to it. Kudos!
reviews.cons: I hope there will be live emoticons, apart from emojis (?), or be able to change the font, background, or colors, just for it to appear lively. As well as the sounds/notification. But overall, it won't really the affect the function, but thought it would make it a little bit more enjoyable to engage with the conversation.

reviews.title: “One of the best messaging tool”
reviews.text:
My experience overall is quite good with Chat. It provides a very user friendly messaging tool which has rooms and groups both. You can browse rooms as well and while joining any room, you can Preview the room and messages in it to make a decision whether to join or not. The overall functionality and features of 'rooms' are great and I find them very useful which in turn saves a lot of time and effort.
Other all  basic functions are present like mute notifications, online status. To add to it, you can also set push notification in case you are not available. Simple yet very useful feature.
Then there's smart reply and desktop notifications feature too. Desktop notification is useful if you google chat window is not open. You can also block members.
In conclusion, this is one of the best messaging tools which I have used and I would recommend this to everyone.
reviews.pros:
The interface of the tool is user friendly and very easy to use. Search is very simple and straight forward. Simply put the name of the person you want to chat with and results are displayed instantly using smart search feature. You can create various discussion rooms by inviting members. I never had any problem creating room , in fact once I have to create a room with a lot of members from different projects but never faced and delays or problems with it. You can create multiple threads in a room which is very useful feature. You can also customize name of the room as per your need and project.
Then there are groups which are very similar to a group in any messaging app. You can add multiple people but it's a single threaded chat. this is basically a personal group and rooms are for primarily for project related conversations. Search feature is also useful and easy. You can also search individually in a room. The results are easy to obtain  and very helpful.
Furthermore, a great feature is, you can edit you messages. A lot of times we enter incorrect information in the message which can create confusion. You can edit it or delete as required by the user. I personally, find this feature very user friendly.
You can also shared a file form google drive directly or from your desktop. Additionally, there's a shortcut for video meeting, which when clicked send video meeting invite and the best part, creates dial in number is automatically generated which saves a lot of time.
reviews.cons:
Apart from all the great features what I don't like about it is, Google chat and hangouts and not synced. When you delete something from chat it is still present in hangout. So, basically you you are still looking at the deleted information in hangouts which is not required. 
Another functionality which I miss from microsoft lync is that, you can not control other persons machine during screen share with mutual consent and continue with the discussion / transition.
Except this, almost everything is great about this tool.

reviews.title: “A great partner when you need a communication tool with others.”
reviews.text: An excellent tool to use when you are communicating with others and I use it on daily basis.
reviews.pros: You can add video meeting links which make things more visualized when talking to others.
reviews.cons: The conversation can jump around here and there at times which is annoying. Hope this can be fixed.

reviews.title: “Un prodotto fantastico e gratuito per la comunicazione in azienda”
reviews.text: In azienda usiamo Google Chat quotidianamente perché è integrato alla Google Suite e quindi ci risulta molto comodo e facile da utilizzare per contattare rapidamente un collega, un team o semplicemente mettere un avviso sul gruppo aziendale.Lo usiamo spesso anche per tenere riunioni virtuali immediate per il controllo dello stato di avanzamento dei progetti.
reviews.pros: Google Chat è un prodotto fantastico e gratuito per la comunicazione in azienda. Offre agli utenti, infatti, tutte le funzionalità di messaggistica istantanea come l'invio dei messaggi, la possibilità di sapere se l'utente contattato è presente e se sta scrivendo una risposta, la possibilità di sapere se il messaggio è stato ricevuto e visualizzato, la possibilità di creare gruppi o riunioni virtuali e molto altro. Google Chat è molto semplice e facile da usare, dispone di un'interfaccia intuitiva ed è perfettamente integrato con tutti gli strumenti presenti nella Google Suite.
reviews.cons: Google Chat è un prodotto che ci soddisfa ma che mostra anche delle limitazioni che speriamo, in futuro, siano superate. Il sistema di ricerca, semplicemente, non funziona bene e ci sono problemi grossi anche nell'invio di file che crediamo siano dovuti a problemi legati alla sicurezza. Abbiamo inoltre riscontrato problemi anche sullo stato dell'utente che a volte viene mostrato erroneamente disponibile o non disponibile.

reviews.title: “Active google chat user ”
reviews.text: I’ve used google chat for over two years to communicate during group projects for school. I’ve found it to be the best program for messaging as it’s easy to integrate other google programs.
reviews.pros: I like the file section the most. Having all the files that were sent in the chat in one location for easy access is very convenient especially when working on a project.
reviews.cons: I wish google chat had its own video call feature but google chat does make it easy to set up a google hangouts meeting with the members in the chat.

reviews.title: “A efficient collaborative software for your team.”
reviews.text: One of the nicest tools we use at work is Google Chat because it's so easy to use. There are no downloads necessary, and there are no restrictions on the operating system you are running; all you need is an internet connection. The only problem with Google Chat is that it occasionally jumps, so it would be excellent if they could fix it. Till now it has perfectly fine for us and we think this can suit all types of companies with different sizes.
reviews.pros: The best features of Google Chat are -- make internal and operational improvements.- make better decisions.- The technical help is fantastic.- There is no restriction on how many individuals can participate in the chat.- Private chat rooms are an option.- Boost the agility of corporate processes.- SSO is top notch and works perfectly fine.- Customised notifications are also available.- If your network bandwidth is low then also it works perfectly fine.
reviews.cons: The cons of the Google Chat are -- The no. Of characters which you can send in a message is limited.- Text boxes have a frustrating tendency to resize themselves.- Docking the conversation list is not possible.- Conversations frequently veer off topic.- Finding precise examples or keywords might occasionally be difficult.- There might be some scepticism regarding the Google privacy policy.

reviews.text: My overall experience with the google chat has been extremely wonderful. It makes my day to day teams call and interactions very easy and faster. It is very easy to use and manage.

reviews.title: “Google Hangout for you and your Hangout Friends”

reviews.title: “a complete and pleasant software to work with”
reviews.text: my experience with Google Chat is designed to be seamless, intuitive, and efficient, allowing me to communicate and collaborate easily and stay productive.
reviews.pros: Google Chat is a powerful messaging tool that offers a range of features and benefits for users and teams.
reviews.cons: It's worth noting that Google Chat is a relatively new product, and the team behind it is likely working on adding new features and improving the user experience over time.

reviews.title: “Simple to use and preferred over other chat systems”
reviews.text: Fantastic user interface and easy to use tools.  It has been a life saver in many instances!
reviews.pros: I love that we have full history available for all chats and channels.  This is very useful as in the roofing business, sometimes it can take years to finish large commercial jobs through various phases.  This history helps keep all of our internal company conversations and data at our fingertips.
reviews.cons: I wish that the search feature could be a little more user friendly.  You have to remember which person you were chatting with to find a specific word or topic and a lot of our communications cross-over other individuals or channels so finding a specific thing takes more time than it should.

reviews.title: “Fun and easy to use!”
reviews.text:
Overall, google chat is a great product that fits in wonderfully with the entire Google product suite. You can easily copy/past from chat into a word document (though there is formatting issues to deal with; I typically go from chat to notepad then to word). It's user friendly, has an app to use on other devices, and you can use chat either inside gmail or as a "pop out", so the email page can be minimized (not closed!) and still use the chat box. Chats can be saved, so you don't have to worry about ever saving it and loosing it. 

I've been using gmail since it was by invite only, and have seen gmail grow, including the inclusion of the chat feature. It's definitely a product I would recommend to anyone.
reviews.pros:
Gmail Chat has been around for a good long time. It's a great tool if you're wanting to contact a fellow gmail user and strike up a conversation for work or personal use. I often use it to discuss the current novel I'm writing with my husband (who is my sounding board and listens to me prattle on about the corner I've written myself into). I've also used it to send links, grocery lists, recipes, etc. 

It's really easy to use: you sent an invite to someone using their email, phone number, or name. The other person gets the request, and they can either accept or decline it. If they accept (and are a fellow gmail user), they can immediately start chatting via text.  

Quick, simple, and very user friendly! 

Also, the chats are always saved (though you can turn that option off), and are searchable. (I've had to use that feature MANY times!)
reviews.cons:
There is a limit to the characters you can send. Since I frequently send stuff to the husband while writing, I often have to divide it up into sections. Same with anything else I send that is very long. I haven't used it for anyone that isn't a gmail user, so I honestly have zero clue how that would even work.  

The app for using it on an iphone is called "hangouts" and not "chat", so that can be confusing when you're trying to find the right app. But it works great once you find it, download and install it.

reviews.title: “Easy to use but slow and with many things to improve”
reviews.text: I like most of the features and design, but must improve stability.
reviews.pros: It's very easy to use and create teams, also starting a Google Meet in just one click.
reviews.cons: You can't send more than 1 file at the same time, and sometimes it becomes so slow you have to restart it. You cannot save favorite or important messages.

reviews.title: “A user-friendly messaging tool ”
reviews.text: The app is free to use and is a cheap way for communicating with employees, especially, since I have employees who have the habit of ignoring text messages. I can send unlimited texts at no cost whatsoever, which is a very cost-effective way of communicating with employees.
reviews.pros:
I like it how easy it is to search for a contact within the chat. 
It also enables me set reminders, which keeps me on tabs of all the things I need to do throughout the day. 
The messaging app is reliable and very secure. 
It allows for all of us with Gmail accounts to interact seamlessly. 
It is a wonderful tool that has reduced the number of messages in my inbox. 
If I want my chatbox to read unavailable, I can easily sign out from the chat.
reviews.cons:
The pop up messages can be so distracting especially when concentrating on work. 
At times the messages fail to send and I cannot make out if its the internet connection that has issues or the app. 
At times the app can be too slow and groggy.

reviews.title: “Un chat para todo equipo ”

reviews.pros: Me agrada su facilidad de uso, lo integre en mi equipo de trabajo de manera simple y nos ha permitido interactuar sin inconvenientes y compartir información de manera segura.

It helps you take care of your own team, coordinate meetings, integrate google calendar, drive and docs to better synchronize your workflow. You can coordinate with other teams, and request their collaboration with docs or files, it becomes a very hollistic and pivoting software for home office workers.
reviews.cons: The space configuration is a bit lacking, you can create spaces and set them up. I would love to see more additional extensions where you can even deploy bots.

reviews.cons: I don't know that I have any cons. We don't use all of the functionality Chat offers. It works wonderfully for what we use it.

reviews.title: “Best and most robust Team Messaging & Conversational Application”
reviews.text: We love the seamless and smooth conversations enabled by Google Chat. It provides history of all conversations at one safe place for future reference and the search feature is also available.
reviews.pros: Google Chat is the most handy, all devices friendly, fast, accurate, secure and an excellent software to communicate with business partners, clients, teams and other industry contacts in a very safe manner.
reviews.cons: It's not very popular yet as an official tool for formal conversations. It's still picking up.

reviews.title: “Hangouts is now replaced by Chat”
reviews.text: RIP Hangouts. You were limited in features but simple was somehow better. Your successor in its current iteration is an annoying arriviste
reviews.pros: The font UI is better on Chat than Hangouts. Google app so it's easy to msg Google/Gmail contacts. Free. That's it
reviews.cons:
TBH, this would not even be on my list of chat apps if I had a choice, but certain work situations require it. Sigh. What's lacking? 
Can't see if read/unread. Replying specific message is impossible, but you can manually copy, put in ```quotedtext``` to quote in a very unaesthetic monospaced font display. Emojis are a multi-step selection process unless you somehow memorise the text shortcuts for less basic ones like :(
On desktop if you use the chat sidebar in Gmail, it will take up your full Gmail inbox space OR pop up into a little window that's way too small by default and stuck to the bottom of the screen — this is a massive UX irritation if you need to arrange your windows/tabs in a certain way for quick switching between apps for work. Would seriously suggest Google allows free floating chat windows in Gmail. And get rid of the INSTANT contact popup when hovering mouse over the chat threads – set it to like a long hover or right click for goodness sake

reviews.title: “Good platform for real time information sharing ”
reviews.text: Real-time messaging is possible between users on the chat service Google Chat. It is intended to be a quick, safe, and dependable method of communicating with friends and coworkers.
reviews.pros: All the services of google suit can be integrated so its a great help when you need to collaborate with your team mates and you can seek assistance remotely. Users may easily share files and work together in real-time on projects.Notifications that can be customised are available in Google Chat, making it possible for users to remain on top of crucial conversations without being overrun by notifications.Google Chat is accessible on both desktop and mobile devices, including iOS and Android.
reviews.cons: Google Chat doesn't offer as many features as some of its competitors, such as Slack or Microsoft Teams. For example, it doesn't have advanced project management or task tracking features.Integration with non-Google services: While Google Chat integrates well with other Google services, it can be more difficult to integrate with non-Google services, which can be a drawback for some users.

reviews.title: “Modern Enterprise Chat”
reviews.pros:
One of the obvious competitors for Google Chat is the prevalent Skype (previously Lync) instant messaging application often bundled with Microsoft products such as Outlook and Office for ease of integration. 


Unlike Skype, Google Chat offers a more modern set of features. Foremost is the way in which content can be directly shared in the chat window such as images or image previews from URL resources. Rich content can simply be pasted directly into Google chat and seamlessly integrated into the conversation. In Skype, copy pasting an image results in the image being sent as an attached file which is disruptive and really negates the convenience of sending an image over IM versus more conventional means such as e-mail. 


Overall Google Chat offers a modern approach to enterprise instant messaging that simply works and works well.
reviews.cons:
One of the main concerns for Google Chat revolves around the precarious nature of Google long term product support. On the other side of the fence Skype users are migrating to a more Discord or Slack like application called Microsoft Teams. This next generation of application incorporates IM into a broader context that includes more robust moderation and content sharing capabilities.


As of now, Google Chat is in a branding transition to be incorporated as Google Hangouts Chat which indicates that Google intends to stay in the IM application space, but its not clear what features will be updated to bring Google Hangouts Chat in-line with competing applications.

reviews.title: “Evaluando Google Chat”
reviews.text: Google nos tiene acostumbrados a sus cambios y actualizaciones constantes. Sus progresos con respecto al desarrollo de sus aplicaciones y software, no se detiene y esto es positivo. Aparte, siempre ha sido un haz bajo la manga, cuando los apps de mensajería que utilizo frecuentemente, funcionaban mal.Es fácil de utilizar, fluida, se integra con otras aplicaciones a la perfección, y tiene una interfaz limpia (sin obstrucciones).
reviews.pros: Desde sus inicios como Hangout, siempre ha sido una app alternativa, con la que he podido conectarme casi con cualquier persona, en todo momento. Su interfaz es limpia, fluida, con una facilidad de implementación y uso adecuada (cualquier usuario, puede aprender a utilizarla fácilmente). Aparte, esta presente en la mayor parte de los dispositivos con SO Android.
reviews.cons: Su presentación reciente hace que todavía no sea muy popular entre los usuarios. Además, se mezcla mucho con cuestiones referidas a Gmail, lo que hace que las personas no entiendan que estan usando. Pero como todo nuevo desarrollo, debe crecer y generar mejoras.

reviews.cons: I wish it was compatible with other software like Dropbox.  This would make it easier to share files outside the G-suite. Furthermore, more features such as users being able to rename themselves on calls and even breakout rooms in video calls would increase its usability.

reviews.title: “Google Hangouts Review”
reviews.text: I  have first-hand experience with using Google Hangouts (Classic). I use it daily for local and international communication, chats groups, audio, and video calls. Specifically, I use Google Hangouts for my meetings, lecturers and conference presentations regardless of time and location constraints. It has been a highly effective platform for one-on-one and group interaction. Besides, Google Hangouts is compatible with iOS and Android apps. I highly recommend Google Hangouts for individual, professional and business use.
reviews.pros: Google Hangouts is an integrated communication app that allows users to make calls, send messages, and attend video conferences. I  use Google Hangouts (Classic) for my lectures, departmental, faculty and international communication. Setting up Google meeting is easy, even from a shared work calendar. As a lecturer, I communicate effectively and remotely with my students, particularly during the COVID -19 pandemic because social distancing is a norm. Google Hangouts also has a user-friendly interface, launched from a web browser, with buttons for calls, video, instant messenger, messenger and chats. It also allows for seamless integrating with other apps, Google Docs or Drive and can be launched from Gmail.
reviews.cons: I have not encountered problems with Google Hangouts yet.

reviews.title: “Honest Review of Google Chat”
reviews.text: Overall Google Chat is a suitable software for internal communication of an organisation. The software offers great features like chat features, file sharing, screen sharing, etc ... in a very reasonable price.
reviews.pros:
Few things I like most in the software are-

User friendly interface.
You can download and upload image file that can be use for business process and more.
It allows you screen sharing while on call.
It provides Mobile access. That's means you can access your account various devices like computer, laptop, smartphone, etc...
It allows you make video calls.
Integration with other Google tools is easy.
reviews.cons:
Few things that can be improve in the software are-

There is no free trial in the software.
Quality of video call can be improved.
One more problem that I have faced , It allows only 100 to 150 participants.
Sometimes it feels lagging while sharing large files.

2. Always have to load the previous comments when we come back to the chat as only last 5 comments are visible. We can always more than 5 comments (at least 50) always loaded.

reviews.text: Since I have joined the new company, I am using this tool. Notifying the related channels, creating alerts and communicating with intersection teams are in my daily jobs. Rather than its competitor, this is really better.
reviews.pros: First of all, it is simple and has easy usage. No need to learn additional commands or screens. If you already know how to use Gmail, it is as easy as this. A new channel is can be created easily. The most important point, I have never faced an outage even in the rush hours or dates. Its design is clean and there is no unnecessary complexity. By using its API, easily we can send notifications to the related teams if needed.
reviews.cons: Text formatting is not easy. They might put some buttons to make it easy. You need to remember the special characters (for bold, use * like that)to format your text.

reviews.title: “Google Chat is a team game changer”
reviews.text: It has been seamless from implementation to getting everyone's buy in and participation.
reviews.pros: The ability to have everyone in the same place when we cannot physically be in the same place is outstanding
reviews.cons: I am no techy so I am not sure anything is missing per se but I am sure I will love enhancements at they are unveiled

reviews.title: “Google Chat Review”
reviews.text: Google Chat has made it very easy to get things done around the office and to send quick updates to everyone on the team. The 'read' feature allows us to see who has read a message, making it easier to stay on top of communication and hold people accountable if required. The team loves this product as well because it allows employees to conversate casually if needed, which in return helps with creating a positive office culture/environment. 10/10 would recommend it.
reviews.pros: Google Chat provides on-the-go access to team communication and allows documentation of this communication. Whether it be casual employee interactions or important team updates, Google Chat facilitates a safe and secure environment to stay connected with your team.
reviews.cons: I truly have no cons at this time. Google Chat is a great resource! If anything arises that I feel will take away from the product, Google makes it easy to submit user feedback.

reviews.title: “An inexpensive product to use when on budget”
reviews.text: Average, again its used only coz we didn't want to spend on Slack. Once we grow there is no way we would use Google Chat
reviews.pros: Almost free tbh, it comes with GSuite. Most of the features are basic and it does look like Google doesn't want to make this product superior. Slack cannot be compared to Google Chat
reviews.cons: Buggy and Slow. Once someone uses Slack, there is no way a person will ever go back to Google Chat.

reviews.title: “If your team uses Google Workspace, this is the best way to comunicate ”
reviews.text: My experience with Google Chat is generally positive. My team successfully uses this platform every day. In a short time it became the reference point for our group communication by significantly reducing the internal email exchange.
reviews.pros:
Google Chat is effectively integrated into our Google Workspace suite, it was easy to deploy this solution because our team was already used to using Google services.
The platform is reliable and has good features. The ability to separate spaces and individual chats allows you to communicate in an orderly way with a team of all sizes.
reviews.cons: While overall it is a complete solution, to date some key features are missing from the appeal. It is not possible to reply to individual messages in a group chat, it is not possible to upload more than one file at the same time (not even images).

reviews.title: “Google Chat for work and everyday use”
reviews.text: My overall experience has been good so far. This is very easy to use, I love the video chat option, the fact that, even with the free version, you still can do a lot.
reviews.pros: The ease of use, price, the fact that its a secure way of communicating and you can connect with a number of people quick and easy.
reviews.cons: There hasn't been anything really. One thing that is a bit annoying, you can't video call without sending a request even if this is a person that you video call regularly. The AI should be able to pick up if its a new contact then send it as a request.

reviews.title: “provides good integration with google workspace”
reviews.text: Google chat integrated well with google workspace and all its tools, being able to create spaces rather than just groups is something that I find interesting. It is fairly new though so it may not allow the flexibility of slack or teams but im sure it will improve as they update something every few months
reviews.pros: I like the vault feature best, so even if i delete an important chat it will be available for compliance and archiving. File permissions is another thing i like in google chats compared to other communication tools as it allows me to select share a file in a group with a particular set of people within that group.
reviews.cons: I think its APIs at the moment are fairly limited and do not provide a lot of integration options with third party tools. Search features can also be better if they include search filters for specific times or exclude certain channels.

reviews.title: “A typical chat application with some google's advantages.”
reviews.text: Very nice and clean chatting app , easy to sign in have some powerful features from gmail.
reviews.pros: It is very easy to use good UI , good filter or search features , have group option.
reviews.cons: Chats looks one sided , both person's chats are shown on left side which makes initially little difficult for peoples who have used with other kind of chat apps.

reviews.title: “Simple instant chat software”
reviews.text: Having a simple quick messenger is really improving my work progress and letting me and my team to connect quickly to collaborate on task quickly. Wonderful experience is all that i can said.
reviews.pros: Google Hangouts is free to use and comes with Gmail account. I can create and join multiple chat group to help me separating from work group chat and personal and social group chat. Another thing that i like is, it can be easily accessed from my smartphone as i mostly only have my smartphone when i am out from office.
reviews.cons: What i like the least with Google Hangouts is, it has limitation on file size that can be sent thru the software. I can only sent and attach a maximum of 200MB file size, and need to switch to other file transfer software to sent a file that sized more than 200MB. Other than that, this software is very helpful in connecting me and my colleague.

reviews.title: “Good for everyday communication”
reviews.text: Overall, I like Google Chat and have been using it for many years. Gmail won't be the same without having Google Chat attached to it.
reviews.pros: I like how Google Chat is integrated into Gmail. You can easily message people on your contact list while writing emails. I also like how you can actually call phone numbers on the call/video feature. Not all chat programs have this. I used to use this feature when calling clients so my personal number would not show up on caller ID. It's easy to have group chats as well.
reviews.cons: I heard that they are phasing Google Chat out of the desktop version of Gmail. This is unfortunate as this is really the only place I use it. I tend to use other messenger apps on the phone. One thing I wished they had changed was the ability to scroll through contacts easier when looking for the person you want to send a message to. Right now, only a small pop up box shows up, and you need to scroll through the entire list. There needs to be a way to just type in the contact name to have the message box pop up.

reviews.title: “Google chat, if you use gmail its just the obvious choices”
reviews.text: Over all i like the user interface the UX design is good and the only issues i have with it is the same issues i have with most chat programs of the like. Honestly I would like a more fictional view for all my chats instead of the list view but once again just being nit picky.
reviews.pros: I like that it saves my chats from google and from gchat. it creates a seamless transition from the app on mobile or computer to my gmail on computer for sure. Helps me always keep up to date on work conversations I may have missed especially in group chats.
reviews.cons: I dislike the mobile version. i miss the connection to gmail. when its on mobile its more its own app. more like a skype clone which is not bad just not the same as on computer but its still good.

reviews.title: “Useful video conferencing software ”
reviews.text: In general, I have a very good experience using Hangouts. As it is linked to google, many things can be done with and through it. It's a great software to help team meet and discuss.
reviews.pros: Super easy to use as it is directly linked to events in your G-calendar. Once you create an event to book a video call with someone, the link appears directly. You can easily find it back in your calendar. You can also add in some integration like Modjo and else to make it even more powerful. It's a cool software because it allows teams/people/companies to meet and see each other. Features are great : You can chat in parallel, raise hands, share screens etc.
reviews.cons: Sometimes it seems like the software is not fluid enough. It depends a lot on how many people have their camera on, the internet reach, etc to make it work efficiently. When it bugs, people in my team tend to switch to other softwares.

reviews.title: “Google Chat: Chat anywhere, anytime”
reviews.text: Google Chat is indeed one of the best messaging software out there. It is so easy to use, integrated with GSuite environment, and not to mention its ability to share files and documents with other people inside or outside of the team.
reviews.pros: What I really like about this software is its integration with third-party applications. For instance, in Gmail, I can see all my messages and conversations at once. This helps me to keep track of everything I need to do and be mindful of my tasks.
reviews.cons: I don't have anything to dislike with the software. Google Chat is the best for messaging. It helps me and my team to collaborate and connect with each other, anywhere.

reviews.title: “Google Chat Attractive application to keep in touch”
reviews.text: The benefits obtained through this tool are to actively maintain or start conversations with third parties to guarantee stable communication in such a way that it is convenient for us to improve from an educational, labor and social point of view.
reviews.pros: I like this Google Chat tool because with it I can establish and stay in constant communication with my friends and family at all times because I can send a message to a recipient, I also like it because it maintains an attractive design that makes this application not be complex tan
reviews.cons: I have nothing wrong with mentioning this application, since I consider that it meets all the expectations and services it offers, it is an essential tool that guarantees its operation to the maximum

reviews.title: “Increase team communication effectiveness”
reviews.pros: The fact that Google has integrated hangouts directly into your email page makes it appear to be more user-friendly, even to those who have never used it previously. I appreciate that I can post messages and get alerts promptly. You may even hold team meetings from one central location—technology at its most advanced.
reviews.cons: While utilizing workspace, I haven't delved into the Google Hangouts part of things yet. It has been brought to my attention that the price is a bit unclear. If the designers could provide a better choice to integrate all of these aspects into one and make it so that the cost can be identified, we would most likely employ it on the business side.

reviews.title: “Best way to stay linked”
reviews.text: Besides the phase out it was my go to chat and text and calling source with Google voice and it kept me able to work and stay in contact with work and personal life
reviews.pros: Up until this year Google had Google voice and Hangouts integrate so incoming calls and texts for voice went to Hangouts. This kept everything organized and in one space. That's been phased out and Google is pushing for Google meet and chat to take over but besides that it's been my go to for over ten years now. You can keep your personal number private and have Hangouts be the business cover and still have everything go to one device if you choose.
reviews.cons: It's very minimal on it's capabilities now that Google voice has been removed. You can't make calls without voice. Also the need to have a Gmail account can be frustrating if the person you want to talk to doesn't have Gmail, now that voice is removed. Google has basically said they are transitioning to meet and chat and will be phasing out Hangouts next year

reviews.title: “A lightweight alternative to Zoom”
reviews.pros: It's easy to use and doesn't require launching an whole new program given that most people have Gmail open in tab during work hours. For that reason, it's my go-to video chatting tool. The integration into Google Calendar is also handy.
reviews.cons: It's not nearly as feature-rich as some alternatives. It won't replace your need for a tool like Zoom or WebEx, but it is a nice alternative for quick calls.

reviews.title: “I never use my phone anymore”
reviews.text: We notify groups of important process events from our software. Besides that, our daily work communication and collaboration is easy with it, even for non tech users. And being a part of GSuite, integration with the rest of it gives us a lot of possibilities, beyond daila chatting.
reviews.pros: Clean and simple. Easy to access existing chats or create new ones, groups. I use the webhooks in some modules I've developed for my company and there are never any issues with them. API is very well documented so it was very easy to integrate it. Easy to find keywords or people. Collaboration during pandemic home office was possible thank to this software. Integration with the rest of GSuite is cool too. Love the dark mode.
reviews.cons: If there still wasn't a dark mode that would've been it. But since we have it I can't think of anything.

reviews.title: “No complications.”
reviews.text: I use Google chat because the access is extremely easy, if someone doesn't use this tool, they just need their Gmail account and they are in, plus this chat is a bit more professional because you can integrate it with applications like Asana through Bots.
reviews.pros: What I like most about Google chat is that I don't require installations and learning curves; having my Gmail account, it's as easy as logging in or activating it. I can easily add contacts through their email (this is the main way I use, but there are more ways to do it). It also has the connection to Workspace tools, so I have access to my Drive files to collaborate in group rooms or in a private chat.
reviews.cons: I do not recommend it for sending or sharing large files, it can take a long time or simply stop in the process.

reviews.title: “Essential.”
reviews.pros:
What's not to like? It's a chat function! It's very basic but I find it essential for dealing with colleagues. I work freelance right now, so am using it less these days, but in the past have worked in charities and it is essential to day to day communication with co-workers. It allows you to easily and quickly ask small questions without clogging up the inbox with unnecessary emails, and also without physically getting up and having to disturb people in the middle of their work day. 

I've been with orgs that have used project management software; they have been very expensive and in the end the only function we've really ended up using is the chat. GSuite already has that, and it's free.
reviews.cons: It doesn't pretend to be anything different, but it's very basic. If Google expanded it even a little bit it could easily supplant things like Slack, which many people/organizations are currently making use of, as it allows for things like topic threads and easier group file sharing. I would love to see Google flesh this app out a bit more - as it is it is good, but it could be so much better.

reviews.title: “Great tool for communication”
reviews.text: Overall experience is that i am very satisfied with the user experience and very happy with the tools performance
reviews.pros: Easy to use, minimum training required and good tool for collaboration
reviews.cons: Wish it had project management inculcated in to the tool

reviews.title: “Great for instant chats as well as team chats”
reviews.pros: Instant chat, share pics, upload files, emojis
reviews.cons: Tasks. We did not really use tasks as there were other tools we used to track tasks.

reviews.title: “Free communication platform”
reviews.text: Me and my team use it to have a quick chat between us. We are happy to use it daily.
reviews.pros: Google Hangouts is a free communication platform that have a a quite a good feature like private messenger and video call. I can add my colleague to the contact list from their Gmail account and it will gives the current status of them if the are available or offline.
reviews.cons: I feel that this software is quite basic and not too many tools are available to customized it. The smartphone version is constantly crash and had to restart my phone every time the software is crashing. The software has no newly additional feature and i afraid it will be obsolete.

reviews.title: “Google Chat: Simple professional chat”
reviews.pros: The big pro is that it's a well-integrated service with Google Workspace. Furthermore, the chat is very simple and intuitive. We haven't had any major problems so it's very stable and updates are transparent to us users
reviews.cons: The downside is that it doesn't have a ton of features like Slack for example. The code cannot be formatted. Files are sent one at a time and it's not very customizable

reviews.title: “Team communication with Google Hangouts”
reviews.pros: In my experience, Google Hangouts is fairly easy to use for team communication, or with anyone on my contact list. It will automatically shown which user is available in real-time and user don't need to change their availability status when they login to the application. File sharing also work flawlessly.
reviews.cons: This software is rebranded to Google Chat, and with it, some of the feature that it used to has have been removed or reallocated. Video call are now separated to Google Meet, which mean we have to use another software to have a video call. It would be better if they keep everything on one place.

reviews.title: “Google Hangouts is convinient both in Web and in mobile version.”
reviews.text: Overall experience is good. This is the software where we actually have group chat at work. One of our group chat is for log-in information so we can track the chat time stamp from there and compare it with the log information we have on the screen monitoring software of the company.
reviews.pros: It is the quickest way to communicate with the people at work specially when you are always on your google email. The mobile version also give me the ease of getting important or urgent worl related matter even when i'm not in front of my computer.  File sharing is also great because other platform doesn't have this option. I can easily send screen capture needed by my team leaders for checking our work progress.
reviews.cons: Only with the screen sharing, there is no option to share sound of your computer. I believe that this feature requires improvement. But if you are not doing any post production job then its fine. It is the easiest and quickest way to communicate with people at work specially if your companmny is using google server email.

reviews.title: “Cheap but frustrating”
reviews.text: Google is clumsily trying to turn Google Chat into something like Microsoft Teams, but it isn't really working. It still doesn't have nearly the sort of integration support that Teams does and it's certainly nowhere in Slack's territory. But if you want something that "works" just to have a chat platform, well, it's there.
reviews.pros: Google Chat is included with a Google Workspace subscription, so if money is an issue, using Google Chat can help you save money versus paying for something much more expensive like Slack.
reviews.cons: Google Chat's interface is frustrating to say the least. They killed the Google Chat desktop application, and the web application has a habit of being slow and clunky. There aren't nearly the same sort of integrations with Google Chat as with Slack or even Microsoft Teams; and believe it or not, I've actually spoken with the [SENSITIVE CONTENT HIDDEN] at Google, and he's an absolute idiot. Thanks to him, for instance, every time you paste in a link in Google Chat, a MASSIVE preview bubble appears, and there's no way to disable this. He seems to think it's the bee's knees.

reviews.title: “The most Underrated messenger ”
reviews.text: I love hangouts. I believe this app and it is a Secured one. But team need to concentrate more on some issues. Still this app is the most Underrated app and I want hangouts team to look into these technical issues.
reviews.pros:
I love using hangouts. I suggest using this app due to following reasons:
1. This is more secured chat app than many
2. Easy to connect
3. Meetings are easier here as this is integrated with google
4. Smileys,  GIF's and emotes which are funny and can enjoy using them
5. Switching voice call to video and vice-versa. this is the first app to introduce this feature
reviews.cons:
1.The call timer wont stop immediately, I encounter this glitch after I end the call and this is sometimes irritating too. 
2. Sending Voice notes. I hope this function will be added soon and I bet the usage of this app will increase with this one feature.
3. One more difficulty with hangouts I face is with ringtones, I could not change ringtone of calling and notification on Realme 5 pro.
4. Sometimes i need to uninstall the app and reinstall  as it keep on popping up "the app isn't responding"

reviews.title: “A web messenger from Google”
reviews.text: My overall experience with Google Hangouts is Ok. It works but I prefer to switch to any other messenger when I have a chance. Even Skype I like more. The only plus of Google Hangouts is an easy access from Google Mail. This is the only reason why I continue using it.
reviews.pros: I have been using a lot of different messengers for my work and every day life, and I should say that I do not like Google Hangouts. It is stable, simple, multi-platform, it is in-built in google mail, you can use it to text and call. And these are all positive things that I can say about it. These are the minimum any present messenger can do.
reviews.cons: Comparing to other messengers, functionality of Google Hangouts is very limited.  You cannot reply, delete or edit your messages. Its design is very primitive and outdated. When I started a video call from my mobile device with my colleague I could not join the same call from my computer. I was added to a work group chat and I have never received a notification about it. I have sent invitations to my colleagues and they were never accepted, I suppose for the same reason.

reviews.title: “Review for Google Hangouts”
reviews.text: My team like to use this application as it is quick to connecting to the software.
reviews.pros: Google Hangouts is easy to use directly from the Gmail account and can be access from the web browser or the smartphone. It is good for video conference between a team and the quick chat help us to contacting with each other quickly. We can linked it with Google Drive for sharing files between us.
reviews.cons: There are limitation on people that can join the video conference and it is not too effective to be use with a large audience. The video conference has no tools like hand rise or changing the presenter. All of it need to be done manually and no specific tools for it.

reviews.title: “An Application With Some Problems, With A Lot Of Potential”
reviews.text: While it is a chat application with many possibilities to be the suite of Google products, for the moment I think it has several points against it do not allow you to be up to the rest of the tools for chat. However, I still use it! ;)
reviews.pros: The fact that this chat tool is 100% integrated to the suite of Google applications that we use in the company, makes everyday work with it very simple. It has the possibility of being used both from a PC (via web or through the standalone version) or from a mobile device.
reviews.cons: Several points against: 1- the mobile version for Android does not solve the whole well to do with notifications, even more if it is used with the standalone version together. 2- The notifications in the mobile version take a while to arrive in comparison with other chat applications that we have used (HeapChat, for example). 3- The user interface and the actions that are carried out many times are not entirely clear until you learn them (for example: how to attach an image or document in a conversation, in which it is unclear what to send this document once attached to it). 4- The updates: they are very frequent and many times the session is lost when restarting the application after it.

reviews.title: “Integrated, User-Friendly Chat Tool”
reviews.text: We're able to chat in real time and continue our conversations without the tediousness of an email. If a team member is out of the office or away from the PC, the conversation is there waiting for them to return.
reviews.pros: It just works. It's built into other products that we're suing and we don't have to search for another app or manage another database. It just works, to quote somebody famous.
reviews.cons: Can't really think of anything that we don't like. It works so well, that Google Chat isn't something we spend any time thinking about. When we need it, it's there.

reviews.title: “Online conversations made easy”
reviews.text: Chat with Google has enabled my marketing team to be more interactive and real time on common web projects. Calls which previously used to be discussion forums have now become working sessions. The hassle of documentation and email exchange has been replaced with real time takeaways and actions. Work from home is now a reality. Chat app if installed in a smart phone makes text, video or audio exchange a breeze. In a nut shell, Chat is seamlessly integrated with other Google tools which makes us more efficient.
reviews.pros: I use Google Chat to remotely engage with my marketing team and consultants. Using Chat I am able to see messages while I am typing an email within my Gmail account. Once I set-up a conference call to discuss campaign performance or implementing a new tag, Chat is automatically activated during the call. So, my favorite feature is the ability of Chat to seamlessly integrate with Gmail and Google Calendar. Additionally, with the click of a button I can share links, images or videos and create Chat rooms. So, it helps me collaborate productively with product owners, web developers and marketing specialists. Hence, driving high ROI.
reviews.cons: Chat by Google needs high random access memory and high speed internet to function. If there is not enough RAM or there are lots of Google Chrome tabs which are consuming the available RAM, Chat will lag in response time or slow down. When using a smart phone, Chat works well only if its mobile app is downloaded which again takes high phone memory. New users or non-IT employees who are not familiar with G suite, have a learning curve. So, adoption rate is low for non-Google users.

reviews.title: “I pull up Google Chat even when my whole team is talking on Teams Chat”
reviews.text: It feels like a lost opportunity; it's a fine product that meshes so well with other Google products, as it's of course meant to. However, I haven't been able to use it in most of my work experiences. Even when I worked on a team that exclusively used G-suite (Google Docs, etc) we found ourselves communicating through Discord.
reviews.pros: This is easier to navigate and more aesthetically pleasing than anything Microsoft produces, in my opinion; it certainly blows most third-party apps out of the water. Everything simply feels "figured out" by now, I never experience bugs or pause to lament on some missing feature, I just get my work done and my messages out. Mobile sizing as an app on computer screens is especially nice, to have it pulled up but neatly out of the way.
reviews.cons: Unfortunately, I just haven't worked in many places or met many friends who use Google Chat. I find it superior to most workplace options, but it doesn't fit in well with Microsoft products even though I try. Friends of course would rather communicate another way, including myself. Therefore the integration chances don't seem very high, which is a bit of a shame.

reviews.title: “Quick Internal Communication”
reviews.text: This is the best and quick function that you can send your files, messages to your colleagues through the PC screen as well as you can install separate application on your mobile phone if you want. I recommend this is the informal internal communication if you don't want to send the email.
reviews.pros: It's the great channel to communicate on the computer screen without installing any extra application as this software was packed with the Gmail.
reviews.cons: It's a hidden functions that not everyone knows there is a chat function on Gmail and yet you have to request the receivers and wait till they accepted the requisition

reviews.title: “Great quick messenger quality”
reviews.text: My experience of more than 5 years using this software is wonderful and will continue working with it.
reviews.pros: I use Google product a lot and this software is one of the best quick messenger software that i have use to communicate with my team. It can be integrated easily with other software like Google Calendar and Drive which make a speedy process to share files and document with my team directly from the messenger.
reviews.cons: Nothing that i dislike with this software. It is free to use and included in the Google Workspace that we have use.

reviews.title: “Communication and collaboration.”
reviews.text:
We have been using this tool for many years and it has always worked well for us, as it allows us to organize meetings and chat with colleagues in private or in groups.
It helps us to be in constant communication and to send documents, audio and video files to each other.
reviews.pros:
It is easy to use, allows me to organize meetings and share screen with my colleagues.
The sound and video quality are very good.
It is free.
reviews.cons: There is nothing I dislike about this software.

reviews.title: “Google Hangouts- My personal favorite”
reviews.text: I highly recommend and appreciate it
reviews.pros:
ease of use
flexibility
communications
file and link sharing
reviews.cons: there are less members allowed which should be more, because this is one finest app

reviews.title: “Google hangouts is ok software for business ”
reviews.text: For the software to be free, it is decent to use. The features that are offered work well and reliably, so you can be confident using the messaging, chat, or video calls for your business. I would have liked to been able to record and live stream though. The recordings are so important for employees that miss meetings or for tracking our clients pets while in the facility.
reviews.pros: I like that it is free and easy to use. The chat and video feature is great for having meetings without everyone present.
reviews.cons: I really don’t like that you can not screen share or record your meetings. The live steaming feature is absent as well.

reviews.title: “Great Cross Platform Chat Service”
reviews.text: This is a great alternative to other more “popular” chat software. It does not require a mobile number to be used and best of all its free! I haven’t experienced any deal breakers and I will continue to use this.
reviews.pros: It is extremely easy to set up once you have a google account. You can use this without a mobile device as well which helps me keep in contact with friends , coworkers and family for free. You also do not need a mobile number which is a massive benefit.
reviews.cons: Not everyone is aware of it. This can be easily fixed if more people download and use it, but as of right now, I cannot use it to its full capabilities.

reviews.title: “Google Chat For All”
reviews.text: Overall, serves me whenever I need it.
reviews.pros: This comes in handy for me when I have to instant chat an email address in my email inbox, so I don't necessarily have to be out of my inbox to do it. That neat
reviews.cons: I've noticed that alot of scammers use the Google  chat, Google Chat needs to tighten security

reviews.title: “The ease of Google chat”
reviews.text: Communication around the workplace.  All chats in one place which seems to work well with all my employees
reviews.pros: The chat feature works great for desktop or mobile. Very easy to use even for my older employees.
reviews.cons: Nothing it's great we'll designed easy to use

reviews.title: “Swift communication within team”
reviews.pros: Google Hangouts has made team communication more straightforward and more effective. It's a great alternative to email in a pinch because of how easily it can be integrated and used across teams, industries, and geographic locations.
reviews.cons: It makes no pretensions to be anything other than what it is: a simple website. However, with features like discussion threading and streamlined group document management, it's easy to see how Google might extend it even slightly and make it a serious competitor to Slack, which many individuals and businesses use today.

reviews.title: “This review is for Google Voice”
reviews.pros: What I like most about the Google Voice software is the ability to have a separate phone number connected to my active phone number to use for my company number. I was able to choose something that was easy to remember (at least I think) and completely dissociates Peanut Media from me when I need it to. Another reason it is great is that I can tell it to show me the number so I know it is a customer calling and I make it an importance to answer, especially because of the time we live in now, where telemarketers knows how to get local numbers and you get 20 calls a day.
reviews.cons: I would love if there was a way to mask the call but also show you it is Google Voice calling? Like a notification that pops up as the phone number is calling so that there would be no need to mask the call with the phone number instead of showing the customer. It is completely Russian roulette when answering otherwise.

reviews.title: “Available to all, practical and efficient.”
reviews.text: I am satisfied. From the beginning it was very easy to use, it has a simplified and intuitive interface, with what is necessary, no more and no less.
reviews.pros:
Google Chat is an underrated tool and may seem very simple, but it is actually quite useful and efficient as it is directly connected to their platforms: G Workspace and G Meet, which gives more ways and solutions to digital work, and for me it has been a great alternative; it is hard not to take advantage of such an accessible product, with which I only need my gmail account, and to add my contacts I only needed their emails or phone numbers; so we are all in a more secure, reliable and private space but with all the advantages of group collaboration (chat rooms, bots to integrate more apps, external file upload,
information and document sharing, etc. )
reviews.cons: Nothing really. It has very few limitations, but I can't be picky about something that has been so useful to me.

reviews.title: “We use G Suite including Gmail for our business email and we use the integrated G Suite Chat  Daily.”
reviews.text: As users of Gsuite and Gmail, it makes perfect sense to use Chat within the Gmail window for informal daily communications and collaborations.
reviews.pros: We use Gmail for our business emails, so it is very convenient to have the integrated G Suite Chat available in the same tab and window of our browser.  We will typically use Chat when it is more appropriate than sending an email for quick daily messages to keep our business running smoothly and efficiently.  Chat allows us to quickly share status, have 1-1 and group conversations, share links and even quickly paste and send a screenshot.  Chat is used daily by all business members, and chat logs can be optionally saved and searched later right within Gmail.
reviews.cons: Chat messages that are send while the recipient is not online are usually not seen or noticed when the recipient does log on later.  This is a major issue for Chat and makes it unreliable for important communications.

reviews.title: “Easy way to chat”
reviews.text: Overall, I would say that Google Chat is a very convenient and user-friendly messaging platform that is well-suited for teams looking to improve their communication and collaboration.
reviews.pros: It's integrated into several of the Google Workspace tools, so it's easy to collaborate with team members and schedule meetings. It has cross platform abilities (web, Andoid, iOS) so you can access Chat from any device. You're able to chat directly to someone, create group chats or make permanent spaces to chat with people.
reviews.cons: If you do have quite a few active chats, you may lose visibility, so you'll have to pin those that you deem important. The same applies for Spaces. Group chats are mixed in with direct chats so they may get lost amongst all the direct chats.

reviews.title: “Communicate with your team faster and easier”
reviews.text: I like that software in general as it's a simple way to run your tasks with your team.
reviews.pros: I love that I can contact my team anytime easily and get in touch with them.
reviews.cons: If the account is not a business account you can't delete your sent messages.

reviews.title: “Google Chat - a collaboration service with style ”
reviews.text: With Covid forcing the team members of our project to stay at home, we quickly needed a handy tool to communicate around project issues. Google Chat was suggested and put on test on mobiles. The overall experience proved very positive and the solution was adopted for collaboration beyong the initial subject matter.
reviews.pros: Google Chat is open to large discussion groups ; the graphical app launcher is self-explanatory
reviews.cons: Status information is not clearly indicated, preventing to filter out users who are not currently present

reviews.title: “Very helpful tool for quick communication”
reviews.text: As it synchronized with my email id and give a quick notification when I missed any messages.
reviews.pros: This is my go-to tool for communication with clients. It is very easy to set up and already install most of the devices
reviews.cons: Face Trouble while sharing to a larger file.

reviews.title: “Comunicación ágil y al instante ”
reviews.text: MI experiencia ha sido buena, ma ayudado a optimizar mi comunicación con mi equipo.
reviews.pros: Lo que más me gusta es poder enviar y recibir mensajes en tiempo real, además de poder usar google chat desde mi móvil. Con google chat la comunicación con el equipo de trabajo es  más rápida, me permite optimizar mi tiempo. Es muy fácil de usar e implementar. Es un buena opción de comunicación interna.
reviews.cons: Hasta ahora he tenido una buena experiencia de uso, espero que siga así.

reviews.title: “Integrated, Simple, and Still One of the Best”
reviews.text: I've used Google Chat in various capacities since the 2000s, and continue to do so for personal communications. While other software packages have surpassed it for enterprise-wide use, its integration with the rest of the Google suite and its simplicity (not to mention its price) make it a go-to program for small businesses, friend groups, and other use cases.
reviews.pros: The simplicity of Google Chat for both personal and business communications still sits it among the top of text communication software. While it lacks some of the group dynamics and project-based bells and whistles of competitor Slack, this program can still keep your company connected, wherever you are in the world.
reviews.cons: There are better options. For example, at a midsize company -- especially one that might be spread across the country or the world -- Google Chat doesn't quite get the job done like competitors like Slack. It's still an extremely useful tool, but simplicity is a two-sided coin.

reviews.title: “Fine for Personal Use. Not so much for Business”
reviews.pros: This software is totally fine and easy to use on a personal level. It's simple, doesn't have all the bells and whistles but works just fine. You can attach photos, attach docs from your google drive, and all that normal stuff. It's also handy that it shows up in the side view of your gmail account. The app is easy enough to use too. It's just nothing super fancy, and is pretty minimal. You can search for things in Google Chat which is handy and useful for sure.
reviews.cons: I'm sure there is a way to make a group chat, but I just don't see it working nearly as well as Microsoft Teams. I much prefer that for business use. I would only use Google Chat for personal use. There is a desktop app for Google Chat, but I don't think it's nearly as advanced as MS Teams.

reviews.title: “Ol' Faithful”
reviews.text: Overall a positive one. I have been using it for 10+ years and keep coming back.
reviews.pros: Google Chat has been around a long time. It's easy to use, and it does the job. It is tied to your gmail account which makes it especially useful for chatting with contacts in your address box.
reviews.cons: Some of the directions they have been moving G-Chat in aren't great. There are limited options for searching your chats for information you may need from the past, but thankfully google does store all of that information. It might just take a while to find it. I don't particularly like how they are moving away from Hangouts and are instead incorporating the instant messaging on mobile devices into the Gmail app.

reviews.title: “Designed for everyone except business professionals...”
reviews.text: We only use Google Chat over Microsoft Teams because we pay for Google Workplace.
reviews.pros: I like that there is a small learning curve because they built it into Gmail.
reviews.cons: Because they built Google Chat into Gmail, most of my team communicates there rather than with the Google Chat web app (which is superior). Because of this, a lot is lost in translation.

reviews.title: “Simply works”
reviews.pros: Talking to colleagues behind firewalls at their work is made simpler with g-chat. Because Google is getting more ingrained into the business culture, asking for advice or simple corresponding with people outside of my own company's network is that much easier when both parties can use the same chat service instead of passing slower emails back and forth.
reviews.cons: My understanding is that you must utilize chat from within Gmail. This is fine generally speaking, but does make the experience unlike that of using messenger by facebook when you want to interact with many people at once or view past conversations quickly. The searching functionality is also baked into email search which makes it hard to find things that were in chat but not email without looking up specific search filters you wouldn't use elsewhere. So not hard, but annoying at times.

reviews.title: “Fan of google products”
reviews.text: A great experience as with all google products!
reviews.pros: I like the way it simplifies small daily work activities, and also makes something that is usually done exclusively at work become smart.
reviews.cons: We just need to improve the notification system.

reviews.title: “New version of google chat, it seems to be cool, but it is not better than the previus one”

reviews.pros: The new look & feel is very cool,  they  de attached the app from chrome,   the previus version works as a chrome extension, now  it is a self install application that runs independent from chrome.
reviews.cons: As for now, the new version, lacks the ability to notify new messages  as it wont run automatically in background,  you need to execute it and leave it minimized to get  notified when a new message comes in, this is a huge tumb down, as if you close the app then you will get disconnected....

reviews.title: “Organization chat platform”

reviews.pros: The connectivity of google chat with google slides, google sheets and google docs are really good. This chat also support external users and 28 supported languages to communicate inter continental.
reviews.cons: The one thing I didn’t like about google chat is that the google hangout messages are not migrated to google chats. It created some issues at the beginning

reviews.title: “HANGouts”

reviews.cons: I do not see any problems in connection with the work of this program. Maybe the price is exorbitant.

reviews.title: “Available anytime, anywhere with Google Chat.”
reviews.text: I have it added to my Gmail inbox, it is super easy to use. I like to have multiple options for communication and collaboration, and this tool is one of the ones that allows me to interact with teams in an organized, reliable and fast way, with any device.
reviews.pros: I found Google Chat quite useful in creating specific rooms to collaborate on spreadsheets and documents. Chat management is flexible and versatile, with different options for notifications, muting, disabling, blocking, hiding or deleting conversations.
reviews.cons: I like it just the way it is. It is not comparable to other more robust software, but Google Chat is another Workspace tool, so together you can carry out a more complex collaboration.

reviews.title: “It works, very reliable and simple to use”

reviews.cons: There is nothing I dislike, it is quite versatile and stable.

reviews.title: “Google Chat is an Awesome Platform”

reviews.pros: I highly enjoy the simplicity of the Google Chat app, and the desktop version as well. One of the most impressive features to me is the calendar sync, so you know if someone is out of office, or in a meeting before you send them a message.
reviews.cons: To be completely honest, I do not have any complaints about Google Chat. If there was a video call option easy to access from the chat, that would be convenient.

I use it on my phone and on my computer and it’s very quick and efficient. It is also used frequently by our team to do any video conferencing.
reviews.cons: Honestly, I don’t have any cons about this software.  I have never experienced any glitches or problems with it and it always operates smoothly.

reviews.title: “Reliable, Friendly, and Successful Instant Communication Program”

reviews.title: “Happy ”
