reviews.cons: What I don't like is the price that is a bit high for me

reviews.title: “A Simple and Streamlined Communication Tool for Teams”
reviews.text: Overall, Google Chat is a simple and streamlined communication tool that can help teams collaborate more effectively and efficiently, particularly those who are already using Google Workspace.
reviews.pros: Integration with Google Workspace, Streamlined interface, Real-time collaboration, Robust search functionality
reviews.cons: Limited customization option, Limited integrations:, Mobile app limitations and Availability

reviews.title: “Making office communication easier”
reviews.pros: Google Chat is a necessity in the large office I work for. It allows everyone in the room to communicate without the need to physically get up and walk around. The ability to insert screenshots, gifs, and group chats are some functionalities that are included in this program. There is also the option to perform video and audio calls as well. A record of all chats can be found in your Google account - they can be deleted there as well.
reviews.cons: I would like to see the option to attach files to a chat. Instead of emailing the file to a coworker it would be nice to just drag and attach a document. I would also like to have to ability to search through a chat using the CTRL + F command. I usually have to scroll through walls of messages in order to find something that was communicated to me hours or days before.

reviews.title: “Google Chat is Convenient”
reviews.text: My overall experience with Google Chat has been incredibly positive! I would highly recommend using it especially for professional reasons. Every parent of my students owns a Gmail account and it makes communicating with them as well as people in my personal life so easy!
reviews.pros: I like Google Chat because most people these days own a Gmail account, and I am able to chat with them directly from my Gmail homescreen. As an educator in particular, it is very helpful for me to send a parent a message when I see that they are online rather than having to wait for them to reply to an email. This helps me get things done quickly and to give and get feedback in my work. This also applies to my friends and family, many of whom have Gmail in the background. I love utilizing all of Google's tools because everything is so centralized in one area and helps me be efficient and quick. Plus I love that I can start a video call and add people to my conversations!!
reviews.cons: What I like least about Google Chat is that the chatbox is somehow inconveniently placed and I have to constantly minimize it to send an email in the background. It would be helpful if I could move the box to where I need it, or if it could detach and be placed elsewhere on the screen. The only other thing I would say is that not everyone is always on their Gmail so I would not utilize this for the same purposes as Facebook Messenger, for example, but rather to reach people I see online immediately or for communication that I do not require an immediate response from.

reviews.title: “Best for quick messaging ”
reviews.text: My overall experience is fantastic with this software. It saved my time and minimize my communication expenses. Great to get this masterpiece.
reviews.pros: Google Chat is the best platform for quick messaging with teammates. I am using this software for several years and it made me satisfied. Excellent features with user-friendly interfaces have made this masterpiece more enjoyable. If i need to organize a video communication then i can easily use this platform.
reviews.cons: I didn’t face any issue in using it but it should control the pop up massages.

reviews.title: “A chat window every email should have”
reviews.text: It had saved me from time to time, when other chats and text platforms crash I can always rely on it, and since most of my colleagues and employees use Gmail, I can always contact them through the chat really fast. Lately, I've been using it a lot to organize my agendas and making last minute appointments that can be a bit slow through other platform.
reviews.pros: I love the fact that is so light on your computer ram and proccesor, lately many email services are really heavy for the internet explorer you use (safari, google chrome, opera) and having such a light chatbox over your email its a really sweet experience,you can be talking with a friend like you would on any other platform while sending an important business email.
reviews.cons: Maybe t's a bit hard to silence it if you need to focus on your emails, but aside from that is not such a big deal, its really nice and has some really cute emoticons.

reviews.title: “Well designed and easy to use communication service”
reviews.pros: It is very easy to use, it is designed pretty well and I appreciate the integration of Google Calendar and Google Meet into the app.
reviews.cons: The search option is not working great. It does not capture some words that are mentioned in the chat or it is searching more spaces/group chats instead the individual ones.

reviews.title: “Google Chat keeps our team informed”

reviews.pros:
Google Chat (Hangouts) is very easy to use! I am one of seven members of a technical consortium for our local schools and we use a group chat between the seven of us to relay problems and ask questions to one another. I have able to see the Google Chat no matter where I have been. 

Google Chat has become Google Hangouts.  Google Chat only did texting where as now that it is Google Hangouts, we can do video conferencing as well.
reviews.cons: The only complaint I have is that when I am using this for texting  a coworker and they don't have respond. I wish there was a way to send a "buzz" to alert that a message is waiting for a response.

reviews.title: “Google Chat Review”
reviews.pros:
Google Chat is a great Instant MEssaging Software with minimal desgin and extensive usability.
It provides a great way to communicate with peers and share file syncing with other Google platforms such as Drive and Maps.
reviews.cons: Internet connection required for the app to run is quite high and does not work well in remote areas or on field visits.

reviews.title: “Quickly hop from email to instant messaging your contacts”
reviews.text: Google chat has been a great and nifty tool to have available. It allows me to stay in an official mindset while instant messaging my contacts without getting distracted as I easily would if I had to do it through other instant messaging and chat apps like whatsapp or viber. I like how it offers a casual feel to official communications with clients and partners.
reviews.pros: Google chat allows me to maintain high productivity in my communication channels. Instead of staying in long gmail chains to hash things over, I can easily access my google chat and instant message my contact and get things sorted out much faster.
reviews.cons: All the limitations that came with google chat for me were fixed by the introduction of google meet. And I consider them all to be the same product anyway, so I guess I have no complains left.

reviews.title: “Free & Fast group chats available for small companies”
reviews.text:
We have Google G-suite account which help's us to keep everybody on the Google chats platform on internal office communications.
And the App helps to be online all the time.
Have been using this for more than a year, and seems we don't need any paid apps to switch to, Chats has all the required functionalities which we need.
reviews.pros:
- It's by Google and hence no need to create any new accounts :)
- It's fast and the new update on the android app is also amazing.
- it has integration with hangouts which provides free voice and video calls
- Basically it is a competitor to chat apps like slack, Ryver, etc  - and had done quite a decent job and improvising over the time.
- Has options of creating groups called as rooms where we can discuss on particular topic and can be referred anytime in future.
- Recently they activated the edit option which is cool.
reviews.cons:
- Can keep or add a few new features like read recipients
- Also, multiple file upload option is missing
-  Drag and drop option is missing - which I think is a big gap.

reviews.title: “Great! We use it a lot for business organization”

reviews.title: “Google Chat Makes Remote Work Possible”
reviews.text: We began using Google Chat when our team moved to remote work in 2020. We now use it across our entire team to share quick updates, check in, ask questions, and avoid endless calls and meetings. It helps us stay productive, collaborate, and remain in touch while we work remotely.
reviews.pros: We use Google Chat across all of our teams to quickly get information out or to share updates. It drastically cuts down on the calls, emails, texts, and even meetings that are required for our team because we can quickly and effectively communicate on Chat. The history makes it easy to go back in conversations if you forgot something, and it is super intuitive to use overall. I love that it is also easily accessible in mobile without having to download an additional app!
reviews.cons: I wish it was a little more user-friendly in terms of sharing documents - but once we have shown our team how to do it they have all figured it out! I really don't have anything to add as this software is so great for our team.

reviews.title: “Chat, a communication tool made by Google”

I also love the iPhone app for Google Chat. The chat comes right to my phone, which makes working on the go very easy and reliable.
reviews.cons: I don't really think there are any Con's to this software.

reviews.title: “Better than nothing, but not the best”
reviews.text: Chat helps connect me to the rest of my coworkers. We use both Slack and Google Chat throughout the business (largely dependent on what different people are most comfortable using), and it works well as a basic tool for pinging people when needed. It wouldn't be my first choice for a chat application, but it's a great supplement/a great option for businesses that are already invested in G Suite.
reviews.pros: Google Chat is really easy to use, and it sits in your inbox, which makes it easy to stay on top of all your communications in one place. While this isn't the primary concern of users like me, it's also worth noting that Chat comes as a part of G Suite, making it a great deal for small businesses who mostly want the Drive/Email features and don't have any complex chat needs.
reviews.cons: This is about as simple of an app as you're going to find, which means useful features like creating chat channels for large groups, or easily retaining access to your message history with other users (you need to search in Gmail to get the full transcript), aren't supported particularly well. There are other shortcomings, like a poor experience sending and receiving files, that also make this app a little less than the best.

reviews.title: “Great instant messaging platform that works brilliantly for Gmail users”
reviews.text: A very pleasant experience, especially as a user of gmail.
reviews.pros: The fact that  the the google chat feature is inbuilt in to gmail is extremely useful. You don’t have to toggle back and forth between your emails and the chat feature and sits right in the corner of the app,  meaning if you need to contact a member of your team for a quick question that doesn’t necessarily have to be an email, this works great for it. What’s even better is that it allows you to add a quick video chat link  within the chat function and you can instantly connect on google meets through this feature. Again, it is very handy.
reviews.cons: The software could be improved further to enable adding files and document more easily.t This option is there, but when the chat is minimised to its smaller size so as not to interfere with the rest of the screen, these buttons are tricky to find.

reviews.title: “Quickly & Effectively Communicate with Teammates on G-Chat”
reviews.text: I use gchat mostly at work, but I have also used it through my personal email. My company uses Google for email, so I frequently use gchat, sheets, docs, and more.
reviews.pros: I like how I can quickly communicate with teammates in the same window as Gmail. Sometimes the things I need to communicate don't necessarily require an email to be sent. I like that I can ask small/simple questions quickly, and receive responses just as fast.
reviews.cons: Honestly... nothing. I love that I can access it anywhere (phone/computer) and how simple it is to use. My only small suggestion would maybe be a more organized/efficient way to organize and start g-chat group chats. My manager has made group chats before, and for some reason they sometimes don't show up, or I need to go into a separate tab/window to see what was said.

reviews.title: “Google Chats is ok. ”
reviews.pros: I like that the interface is really smooth and easy to look at. One of the features I use the most is setting up instant Google Video Chats with my contacts on my team. You just have to click a link, and if you are part of an organization, then you are able to view individual calendars from inside Google Chats when you need to decide on a future meeting time.
reviews.cons: I don't like how you can't sort your group conversations. While you can set up "channels" / "rooms", I end up using the individuals chats a lot to talk to groups of people when I need to set up a meeting. I don't like how disorganized it is to look at and soft through to find a certain group chat. I always have to end up opening a new group chat, and as a result, clutter my left hand bar even more.

reviews.title: “Google Hangouts Review”
reviews.text: Overall I am very happy with Google Hangouts both professionally and personally. The mobile app makes it easy to take a conversation from my desktop to my phone, and since most people have a gmail address, it's easy to implement across a group.
reviews.pros: Chatting through Google Hangouts is available to anyone with a gmail account, it's free to use, you can utilize it by logging in to your email account or using the mobile or desktop app, and you can use it for virtual meetings. It's also much simpler to implement and teach to new users than Skype or Microsoft Teams.
reviews.cons: If your organization does not use gmail for its email addresses, than users would have to use a personal email to utilize the tool. It also runs best if you utilize Google Chrome, so if that is not your browser of choice, it may run slowly for you.

reviews.title: “After 5 months of using Google Chat we will keep using it.”
reviews.text: We've had a great experience changing to Google Chat and i know well now it's going to stay that way.
reviews.pros: Google Chat is a fantastic messaging platform that I would highly recommend to companies. The ability to create chat rooms for specific topics or projects helps our team to stay organized, and the platform's security features provide peace of mind. Overall, Google Chat is an excellent choice for companies looking for a reliable and secure messaging platform.
reviews.cons: One potential downside is that some features, such as screen sharing, are not available on the mobile version of the app. This could be a limitation for some users who need to share their screens while on-the-go.

reviews.title: “Skip messaging - get on board with Chat!”
reviews.text: It was the missing link in web meetings. I know there is a chat in the meeting but sometimes you need to reach outside the meeting for info. Or, chat on the side with someone IN the meeting.
reviews.pros: Integrated with google the full enterprise suite.
reviews.cons: Not much - it just works really well in my work environment.

reviews.title: “Good App for communication & collaboration”
reviews.text: Good app for communication
reviews.pros:
- Can make communication & collaboration with Google emails.
- Easily to communicate & share files.
- Reliable communication for chat & calls
reviews.cons: - Third party plugins integration is not supported

reviews.title: “Google Hangouts Review”
reviews.text: Overall, Hangouts has been invaluable for our business during COVID. Technical difficulties are rare and if they do happen to pop up, they are easily fixed and never long-lasting. It has been an extremely valuable tool for us.
reviews.pros: Google Hangouts (along with Google Chat) has made it effortless to connect with our teams around the globe and makes video conferencing super easy and efficient. It's ease of use and functionality make it more preferable than Zoom, which has often been glitchy or difficult for some members to use. Especially during COVID, Hangouts makes video conferencing extremely simple and has allowed our team to stay in contact while also allowing us to get facetime with clients who we usually see on a monthly basis. That face-to-face interaction is invaluable to our business and helps us maintain and build relationships despite not being able to meet in person.
reviews.cons: There is little to dislike about Hangouts, but I would like to see more features and functionality to boost the software overall. Since Hangouts is so easy to use, it'd be nice to have a variety of features that are more advanced and integrated into Google's suite of products. For example, if on a Hangout call, users could easily have access to Google Drive, Docs, or Sheets to quickly send files and to share amongst the team in a more seamless fashion.

reviews.title: “Chat, the way it is supposed to be”
reviews.text: As I mentioned before, I've used Chat for quite some time and will continue to do so. It makes work and life easier - which isn't that the point of technology in the first place?
reviews.pros: Where do I even begin? I've been a longtime user of gChat and am a huge fan. It has allowed me to keep in touch with friends and co-workers alike with ease. I'm in my inbox so much during the day that having a quick way to converse with someone is really meaningful. Whether I need an answer to a question or just want to say hi to someone, this tool allows me to do it all.
reviews.cons: I'd love to see bot integration become a bit more simple for the non-developer types. I hate having to rely on other disciplines vs. being able to fix something myself. Maybe it is a better indicator that I need to learn - ha!

reviews.title: “The Efficient Communication.”
reviews.text: It's very positive. As someone who frequently uses other Google Workspace applications, the seamless integration with Chat has made communication and collaboration with team members much more efficient.
reviews.pros: Its seamless integration with other Google Workspace applications. The ability to easily switch between Chat, Gmail, and Google Drive allowed for efficient communication and collaboration with team members.
reviews.cons: For instance the limited ability to customize the platform's appearance. While it offers basic customization options, such as dark mode, it lacks the ability to fully customize the interface like some other chat platforms.

reviews.title: “Review of GoogleChat: Pros, Cons, and Overall Performance”
reviews.text: Overall, GoogleChat is a solid choice for individuals and teams looking for a reliable and user-friendly communication and collaboration platform. Its integration with other Google Workspace applications, as well as third-party tools, can make it a convenient option for those who use multiple tools in their work. However, users should carefully consider their security and privacy needs before using GoogleChat for sensitive communications.
reviews.pros: GoogleChat includes a user-friendly interface, integration with other Google Workspace applications, reliability, and stability. The platform's messaging, video and audio calls, and file-sharing features are also praised by users for their convenience and ease of use. Additionally, GoogleChat's ability to support third-party integrations can enhance its functionality and make it a versatile communication and collaboration tool.
reviews.cons: GoogleChat also has some limitations. For example, it may not be as customizable as some other communication platforms. Some users may find that the interface is too simplistic and lacks certain features that they need. Additionally, GoogleChat may not offer the same level of security and privacy as some other messaging and collaboration platforms.

reviews.title: “Google Hangouts is an amazing platform for communication.”
reviews.text: I use Google Hangouts for group meetings with other members and it makes it easy to exchange ideas without having to meet each other.
reviews.pros:
The accessibility to Google Hangouts is easy as it is available using a smartphone or a computer.
In Google Hangouts there are several features.

 Google Hangouts is a complete tool that allows us to communicate easily with others. 

Moreover, it is free and offers us good quality for video and voice calls.

Using Google Hangouts is easy and straightforward as it is easy to create groups or individual chats.


Google Hangouts ensures a good security of the user's data because all data are protected.

What I like the most about Google Hangouts is the possibility and ease of integration with other Google applications like Google Calendar, Google docs and Google Drive.
reviews.cons:
What I don't like about Google Hangouts is the impossibility to make a video call with a large group of people because the number of participants is limited.

Also, using Google Hangouts for video calls requires a very fast connection for best performance.

reviews.title: “Google chat: simplifying communication and collaboration”
reviews.text: Overall experience is great
reviews.pros: Google chat allows us to have a real time conversation with individual or groups of people, which can help increase productivity and efficiency. It is encrypted in transit and at rest, which helps protect my conversation and data. It also give me control over my data and privacy settings.
reviews.cons: I have been using google chat for past one year I didn't find somthing dislikable.

reviews.title: “Talk with your coworkes across the room with Chat!”
reviews.text: I started using Chat because I work in a different room with my coworker and I basically too lazy to send them email to just letting know them that I want to have a lunch break or other small things. So I start using Google Chat my office Gsuite, and It's perfect. I can send them a quick message or just send them a link of a cute puppy. In conclusion, Google Chat help me to communicate with my coworker in a more efficient way.
reviews.pros: It's just a simple old school messaging app, it doesn't take much effort to send someone a message, I can send them picture, link, and files integrated with Gmail. You don't need to get up from your desk and go to your coworker room located 50 meters away from your desk to ask them if they need a coffee or a cup of water.
reviews.cons: Because like I said it's simple old school messaging app, I can't do many things besides sending a message. It doesn't have any delete message or forward message feature. The notification came way too late especially on desktop app

reviews.title: “A must have feature to stay on contact with everyone.”

reviews.pros: Being able to access it fe any platform whether it's android, io, mac  or windows based and have everything right there at your fingertips.
reviews.cons: The cons of this is more and people are using it and not at the appropriate times  like when driving or when suppose to be working and things aren't getting done that should be and that makes it difficult for employers to maintain good employees

reviews.title: “Google chat ”
reviews.pros:
Google chat is easy to use application for daily connects in office.Files sharing speed is faster as compared to other similar applications. Video calls quality is high defined. 
It's good daily use application.
reviews.cons: Sometimes, once in us moon notifications do not pops ups & got missed. Otherwise good to use.

reviews.title: “Best messaging software for users”
reviews.text: I love the way that anyone in my circle can easily contact me and because it cab be installed on practically everything I never miss a message or contact.
reviews.pros: The best part of this software is the ability to have it in use across multiple platforms.  Cell Phone, Computer, tablet, etc.  one-stop for making sure I am connected to those who need to contact me.
reviews.cons: I have been using this software for a very long time and I honestly have not found anything lacking as far as daily use goes.

reviews.title: “Stay updated all day, every day!”
reviews.text: Chat is a huge bonus to our regular communication. It is a welcome addition to the G Suite of products that we use on a daily and weekly basis. Everyone on our team loves it and I encourage your business to give it a try. I think you'll like it.
reviews.pros: Google Chat allows my team to communicate all day long and stay up to date with each other without having to interrupt each other at their desk. This increases productivity and efficiency by decreasing small talk about various topics that would come up. Also, the mobile app allows you to carry the conversation with you on the go. Chat is a daily product for our team.
reviews.cons: The desktop notifications can be missed easily, and I would like for a better system to ensure I don't miss important conversations without having to constantly check.

reviews.title: “Great tool for team collaboration and communication”

reviews.pros: Team collaboration, text messaging, read receipts, files and photo sharing, shows when someone is typing
reviews.cons: All employees need to have chat features turned on for group chat to work.

reviews.title: “Simple, straightforward little communication and collaboration tool”
reviews.text: It's great. Everyone enjoys using it and even better, they actually do use it.
reviews.pros: Because it's chat, whenever there's a need to get a quick response, this is the way to go!
reviews.cons: Recording feature. I think this used to be an option when we first starting using it, but it's since disappeared.

reviews.title: “Great Team App”
reviews.text: Quite good. Used it out of necessity, but it worked so well we now use it out of choice.
reviews.pros: Being part of the Google suite, Google Chat has really helped us during the pandemic. We've been able to schedule Google Meets on Google Calendar, and share them within Google Chat, keeping communication between the team in a single infrastructure. We started to embrace it more widely during the lock-downs, but enjoyed it so much that it still is being used despite our return to a close proximity office.
reviews.cons: When users are logged in across multiple platforms, the away/online/offline status can get a bit confused.

reviews.title: “Very friendly software”
reviews.text: Very friendly and easy to use.
reviews.pros: The product is super easy to use and understand since the first use, icons are clear and simple, video and audio work great even if you're not connected to a wi-fi net.
reviews.cons: There's really nothing I dislike about google hangouts, I could say that the only thing that could improve and is not a big deal is the resolution for the sharing screen feature.

reviews.title: “Outstanding product! ”
reviews.text: Good chat is amazing overall. Never have had a problem with the software. Very pleased and will continue to use.
reviews.pros: Fantastic product! Easy to use the software on the go or at my computer. Fast, efficient, and very user friendly to chat with clients, friends, and family. Able to send / receive any documents, forms or images that need to be sent to future clients. Never have had a problem and highly recommend.
reviews.cons: There is nothing I don’t like about the product.

reviews.title: “Profesional msng.”
reviews.text: Excellent
reviews.pros: It doesn't use a lot of ram, easy to use.
reviews.cons: User interface can be better. Mostly happy.

reviews.title: “Google Chat for Education”
reviews.text: I use it to connect with other colleagues through Google Workspace.  I can also video conference through Google Meets.
reviews.pros: I like how it is already connected to the Google family of products.  It is one less management system to learn. It is easy to integrate to what you are already using.
reviews.cons: There is nothing enhanced or special about Google Chat.  It is basic and functional

reviews.title: “Google Hangouts - the easiest portal for effective and real time communication”
reviews.text: For any type of business, effective communication is mandatory  for proper actions to be carried out. In my organization, we use this application for instant and real time messaging with the colleagues which ensures access to information in a easier way. Except generating revenues, we could achieve a better team with great collaboration.
reviews.pros: Google Hangouts is extremely easy to use and the availability in handsets and computers make it more convenient. Main features which I like most about Google Hangouts are as follows - instant messaging, focused screen, voice and video calls, file sharing options etc. In addition to these, the customer support is excellent.
reviews.cons: Google Hangouts is an excellent software. I am using this for more than two years & it does not have any improvement area.

reviews.title: “Simple but great chatting app integrated with G-Suite (Now Google Workspace)”
reviews.text: Overall an excellent chatting tool that is simple and serves its purpose. You will quickly find yourself using email less and instead opt to chat your colleagues quick small questions as it is much more efficient. Would definitely recommend
reviews.pros:
- Easy to use, accessible from multiple points. The chatbox interface in Gmail is useful as google chat can be quickly accessed from there, and if you prefer a more immersive experience then chat.google.com works very well too
- Nice features, like bots and creating rooms. I especially like the feature that allows you to individually react to messages, a bit like Discord
- Well integrated into G-suite, so I can message other people in my organisation quickly even if they haven't used Google Chat before as it's quick to learn
reviews.cons:
- I wish that I could change notification settings so I only get a ping if I am @ or I can change the notification tone, it gets a bit annoying if you receive a lot of messages
- I wish the the Chat Rooms were also accessible from Gmail, not only the individual messages, as on Gmail Google chat works through the old Hangouts interface

reviews.title: “The messaging platform I wish my colleagues were using”
reviews.text: Google Chat essentially builds upon Google Hangouts, which is a messaging service I used extensively for many years. I think it's still a great communication platform, and I like the way it's designed, but time will tell if Google can provide the long-term support required for it to gain some real momentum.
reviews.pros: I enjoy the overall design of Google Chat -- it provides a high degree of function without overcomplication. Features like "Spaces" makes group communication and collaboration feel effortless. I like that it is seperate from the larger social media networks like Facebook. This allows Google Chat to be a little more focused, a little more distraction-free, and a little more business-orientated. Its integrations with services such as Gmail and Google Calendar are very welcome.
reviews.cons: Honestly Google have been so all over the place with their messaging apps for years, and I think it has confused and turned off a lot of potential users. Therefore even with its deep connection to Gmail, it can be challenging to bring others into the Google Chat platform, when they may already be ingratiated in platforms like Slack.

reviews.title: “Best Chat Is Google Chat”
reviews.pros:
Boost internal and operational efficiency.
Improve overall decision-making abilities.
Improve the flexibility of your company processes.
Improve customer service/relationships.
reviews.cons:
Text boxes have a vexing habit of resizing themselves.
The discussion list cannot be docked.
Conversations have a tendency to jump around a lot.
Occasionally, searching for specific instances or keywords is ineffective.

reviews.title: “Perfect Daily Communications Toll. ”
reviews.text: Overall experience is too good, inn this pandemic we was in home, we did out all office stuff in my home, as we all are using google and Gmail, so hangout is one of them, we all need to connected our mail, some time need to talk team members so we have a group on this we just drop a call or text on that no problem all together complete package I get from their.
reviews.pros: In pandemic we used video call we can see each of my team member, i can get from there, as we know we are using other social media for communication, but for office work i need a decent software or work and i get it, To be very honest i am too pleased wit this, specially test video call and audio call perfect.
reviews.cons: Great software no double about is but need to focused on this branding consumer need to know how this is work .

reviews.title: “Stable, Friendly and Inexpensive Communications Avenue”
reviews.text: Google Chat provides details that persons require, through direct messaging or audio communications, Google Chat maximize on the use of digital conferencing, where meetings are held online without problems.
reviews.pros:
Google Chat has all form of discussion, from instant texting, direct calls, and even sharing of files and other details.
Besides, Google Chat provides notification, when a message arrives.
The application is interconnected with Google products, hence, there is a sufficient coordination and correlation.
reviews.cons: Google Chat is powerful, flawless, and free from the Google services. Hence, there is progressive way of communications fostered by Google Chat free of charge.

reviews.title: “Useful communication tool”
reviews.text: I use it daily, it works very well both as normal chats and with work groups. It has a task checklist system that is very useful for organizing team tasks
reviews.pros: Integrated within gmail or apart if needed, it works very well, it has integration with third party applications and bots. Allows you to share files and generate Google Meet calls
reviews.cons: The best features are only available for workspace plans

reviews.title: “Great chatting technology for work or personal life”
reviews.pros:
I love this. Who doesn't use this!? I use it at work with my colleagues and in my personal life. I'm old, and it reminds me of the old AIM days, where you log in and see who is online to chat. 
Really though - I almost like it more than slack and all of those more advanced chat tools. This one keeps it simple, but has just enough functionality to make it incredibly useful in a work situation.
reviews.cons: No issues. I feel like it does exactly what it's intended to do.

reviews.title: “Barebones Chat App”
reviews.text: Overall Google Chat is a fine product.  It gets the basics right without adding too many extra features.  If you are looking for a chat app that offers a better mobile experience and can be tailored to your business, I would look elsewhere.
reviews.pros: Google chat gets the job done.  It is a barebones chat app that doesn't bother you with extra features.   Some features I use daily are the ability to tag people in messages, create private and public groups,  use the browser version and chat on your phone.  Integration with gmail is quite nice too.
reviews.cons: Compared to other, more feature packed apps, Google chat is a little lacking.  The desktop app crashes for me at least once per day.  There is little to no customization for notifications.  When you get a desktop notification, you cannot click on it to take you to the app.  Features of the mobile app are split between two different apps (hangouts and chat).

reviews.title: “Simple and easy to use”
reviews.pros: It is a very basic chat system that does what it needs to do well. It is great for sharing files if your company uses google sheets/docs/etc. Searching is easy and chats come up when you search in gmail which is really effective.
reviews.cons:
The bot features aren't always intuitive. Slack is still better for the fun side of chats with gifs and hashtag groups. 
The desktop app sometimes quits unexpectedly and I have to re-download it. This doesn't take long but it is annoying if you don't notice and wonder why no one has sent you a message for the past hour.

reviews.title: “Valuable for remote team work”
reviews.text: I use Google Chat every day to communicate with my team members and its a valuable facet of our informal communication. I like that it keeps the history of our conversations and that you are able to tag people to bring them into the conversation. It is great for large and small teams.
reviews.pros: What I like most about Google Chat is the ability to have larger chat threads with multiple team members, but also have single chats with only one team member. Having these available at simultaneously is so helpful. It helps cut down on extra emails back and forth and lost email threads.
reviews.cons: I would like Google Photos to integrate better with Google Chat. When I insert a photo or image from Google Chat from my Google Photos, my team members are not able to view it. Its takes extra steps to have to download and then attach the image to a message.

reviews.title: “Does what it does... sometimes. ”
reviews.text: It’s alright. If you have a choice or option to pay for another platform, do it. G Hangouts is free and it shows. It doesn’t always work when it needs to, and there are better options out there. If budget is an issue, I’d encourage IT to be aware of potential issues that could cause disconnection or video lag.
reviews.pros: Google hangouts is free and offers some major features that other paid subscription video conferencing platforms have- not all, but some. Virtual backgrounds are nice, synchronization to GCal is flush, and there’s a nice organizational page to view all daily meetings.
reviews.cons: G Hangouts really slows down my computer. It’s clunky, the video refreshes a lot, and it doesn’t play nice with bank’s firewalls. Usually clients prefer another video platform as this one uses a lot of GPU and is not very dependable. I’ve seen crashes, exiting / rejoining scenarios, freezing, and more. Have not contacted support.

reviews.title: “Lags behind other chat offerings”
reviews.text: Lightweight, clean workchat option that's well integrated with Google ecosystem, but lags behind competitors like Slack. Guess at least it doesn't suck as much as Facebook Workplace chat.
reviews.pros: I use Google's chat mostly for side initiatives I work on outside of my big tech co dayjob, out of the fact that it migrates easily over from/integrates with legacy Google Hangouts—which my collaborators and I had been using for years. So I guess there's nostalgia value and purposefully having a lightweight chat option that's good?
reviews.cons: To say the least, Gchat lacks the robustness and network effects of competitors like Slack. There's no vast library of plugins, no preponderance of bots, and no vast emoji library and "fun factor" like Slack.

reviews.title: “The best around”
reviews.text: Overall I love it. It's so easy to use, very convenient, and just works.
reviews.pros: It's so easy to use and links with your G-suite.
reviews.cons: Being linked with your G-suite it can be tricky when interfacing with people who are not Google users.

reviews.title: “Google Hangouts was good, but Google Chat is better”

reviews.cons: The tool was functional, but it had issues deploying the desktop version. I often had to reinstall it to get things working properly.

reviews.title: “Google Chat is where its at”

reviews.pros: Google chat makes communicating in a team fast and easy! It is a great tool for communicating with those in different offices or those who do remote work!
reviews.cons: There are times when my chat would glitch, and I would appear offline when I actually wasn't but other than that it is a great tool!

reviews.cons: The split between individual chats and group spaces doesn't look very clear on the PC version, but it works well on mobile.

reviews.title: “Built-in messenger for the Google ecosystem.”

reviews.pros: The service supports work with different devices, as well as different operating systems Windows, Mac OS, iOS. Convenient to use for group chats. In addition to voice and text communication, there are video calls and desktop sharing. Everything is very intuitively simple and you do not need to additionally understand what and how to set up. Very well suited for online meetings with clegs.
reviews.cons: A rather archaic communication system that has lost the competition in the online conferences market to more convenient and functional services with showing presentations, sending files to participants, etc.

reviews.title: “Easy breezy team collaboration through G Chat”
reviews.text: I always have Google Chat open on my computer as my job involves a lot of teamwork and being up-to-date on the progress of our various projects. Chat is effectively designed, since it does not distract from the actual work but also keeps me on top of any important messages and updates.
reviews.pros: Google Chat is amazing when collaborating and bouncing off ideas with the team members sitting all over the world. The best part is that it is highly integrated with all other Google apps which I most commonly use to run my small business.
reviews.cons: Google Chat is easy to get set up on and there isn't anything which I dislike about the cute chat box which springs up at the corner of the screen, not too distracting but also keeps you up-to-date with messages.

reviews.title: “User Friendly internal Communication Tool”
reviews.text: Over the experience of using Google chat is Extremely good.  Android application is easy to setup and very intuitive . Using on desktop/browser is very much user friendly as well
reviews.pros: Google chat is straightforward and easy to use messaging application. Groups/rooms can be created in an instant based on Gmail users . Apart from rooms, group conversations can be quickly initiated for quick conversations. Integration with all Google products is too good.
reviews.cons: Searching the conversation as per Gmail users/member is a tedious task.  Have to shift through lot of conversation to find the required content of a specific member

reviews.title: “Great Chat Software”

I also aware the circumstances which is going in country or world by daily basis with my colleagues and friends and I can also attache a file or photo too in Google Hangouts.
reviews.cons: I never found yet but I face hanging or stuck problem with this.

reviews.title: “Google Chat”
reviews.text: I have been using Google Chat from quite some time and love it for its simplicity and providing multiple modes of communication with our contacts.
reviews.pros: Google Chat has shown to be quite useful in terms of communication and marketing of products and services. communication with your clients and suppliers becomes simple using Google Chat functionality and features such as Groups, Broadcast Messages, Status Updates, and so on, regardless of how many people are involved as long as they all have it in their phone. Unlike most social communication platforms, where you have to deal with a large number of people you don't know, it let you communicate with selected circle or friends which is more convenient. Also it keeops your communications l encrypted which gives you a sense of security.
reviews.cons: It hasn't gained the deserved popularity and mass adoptation yet because of which it is not possible to find as many of your contacts on it.

reviews.title: “Quick chat function”
reviews.pros: Quick and easy to use chat function to reach out quickly to coworkers
reviews.cons: I sometimes find it difficult to find an old chat that I need to reference. The search function doesn’t work perfectly

reviews.title: “Great communication software that is versatile and great for work environments”
reviews.text: I found Google Chat to be very easy to use and versatile enough to use in work environments or for personal use. The fact that you can use this on your phone with the mobile app also makes it a good option to stay connected and communicate without having to write an email each time.
reviews.pros: Google Chat is great for communicating with team members and other professionals using a Gmail account. There is also a mobile app that makes it very versatile to use between desktop and mobile devices and to stay connected.
reviews.cons: Google Chat does exactly what its supposed to and there are no big cons to this software. With that said, I wish there were more users who would use this to make it easier to communicate with anyone with a Gmail account.

reviews.title: “Just as great as all the other Google products!”
reviews.text: Overall, our team communicates with ease and makes everyone very accessible, even if working remotely. We also love using the video conferencing feature since we don't get a lot of face time when we work in different locations.
reviews.pros: Google Chat is so convenient! You can go from instant messaging to a video conference within seconds, and it even allows multiple participants and screen sharing - features which other companies charge a lot more for. And what's even better, it's already part of our inboxes, so it's constantly within reach (or you can download a separate app if you prefer).
reviews.cons: Nothing! It comes with the Google Suite, is easy to use, has several features, and the quality is superb. What's not to like?!

reviews.title: “There are a google of reasons to use Google Chat”
reviews.pros:
User-friendly, has a vast user base due to gmail, has various options for starting groups, classes, chat rooms.
Offers tram or group meetings in real-time with scheduling notices provided to recipients, images and photos easily uploaded and are posted with clarity and focus.
reviews.cons: There are so many options it is easy to lose track of people, groups etc if multiple pages are in play.

reviews.title: “Google Chat review ”
reviews.text: My experience with them has been good so far. I really enjoy using such a simple program.
reviews.pros: I like that the software is simple to use, you can easily work your way through it without having to worry about online security.
reviews.cons: They could fix a few problems with the video calls and video chats.

reviews.title: “Google Chat”
reviews.pros: The most advantage of google chats is the company behind it and his integration with gmail.
reviews.cons: Not able to send multiple files in same time. Not able to reply to a specific message from channel. Not able to send code file via the app (sometime we just need to quickly send a not tracked file to a collaborator).

reviews.title: “The Google Chatroom”
reviews.text: Overall, I use this software occasionally for group projects. It is good to use when collaborating on other parts of Google software, such as Drive or Sheets. However, this software doesn't do much to stand out compared to other chat software.
reviews.pros: Google Chat is amazing for group projects. With Google Chat, I can communicate with team members easily. Perhaps the most appealing feature is how one can send and collaborate on Google's other programs, Docs, Sheets, and Slides. This is the sole reason Google Chat stands out when compared to other group chat programs, such as GroupMe. It makes it extraordinarily easy to pick up on part of a project you are working on as a group.
reviews.cons: Honestly, Google Chat is not the best group messaging software out there. With so many other options out there, it is hard to stand out. Google did a good job by implementing their collaboration on other Google Products, but in my opinion that is not enough to become a leader in the chat industry. There is just not much that is special about Google Chat compared to others.

reviews.title: “Want simple way to communicate, use Chat by Google!”
reviews.text: Overall, this software is awesome for simple messaging only! It consumes less bandwidth so if you want just to communicate without having audio or video then use this software.
reviews.pros: When it comes to have leading innovation, it is definitely Google! From complex to simple software tool, it is pioneered by Google.  Chat by Google is simple yet innovative way of communicating. I can consider this chatting software as small but really an indispensable software in the sense that by using this you can communicate instantly across the world.  I think it is very useful to use in different establishments like what we our doing in our company.  I can easily get in touch with other caregivers of our company though we are working from home.  We can easily share the information from one another and it does not require high end device where you can install it. If you want simple yet useful software for chatting so it is Chat by Google.
reviews.cons: Chat by Google is designed specifically for chatting. If you are looking for chatting tool that has audio and video features then don't install it. It is basically for text communication only and not for multimedia sharing of information.  This software is definitely designed for basic chatting only!

reviews.title: “Team communications made by Google”
reviews.text: If you already have Google Workspace, then Google Chat is the team messaging tool that I'd suggest you use.
reviews.pros: Very easy to use and cross-platform team communications and direct messaging tool used by Google Workspace users. It allows easy communication between team members and helps to stay connected even with mobile through its apps for Android and iOS. Has all basic functionality, however, no more than that. Integration with other Google services is great.
reviews.cons: Looks like very resource-hungry compared to different messaging systems. Desktop apps are just Electron apps with the website. While Google added many functionalities here, search (extremely critical component) is behind its competitors. It also lacks some of the features from its components.

reviews.title: “Great chat service for your Google account”
reviews.text: This new interface allows many capabilities that the regular chat does not allow. It enhances the communication experience for Google account users.
reviews.pros: Many tools added to this standalone chat application that allow a great communication experience. Chat bots, rooms, groups and individual chats have a great view and allows a smoother experience for users.
reviews.cons: Jumping from that email chat to the Chat feature may be problematic, so you need to make sure that all users are using the same technology.

reviews.title: “Authentic and Simplistic Communications Avenue”
reviews.text:
Google Chat allows conversations to remain secure and efficient, without incurring extra fee or expense. 
Besides, the cloud space from the Google link up with Google Chat, for efficient collaboration.
reviews.pros:
Google Chat has designed a live engagement platform, where messaging is conducted, and the delivery is made instant.
Further, Google Chat has the integration or correlation with various Google products.
The online sharing of files is also competently facilitated by Google Chat.
reviews.cons: Google Chat brings advanced engagement, without any single expense or cost. There is maximum protection and efficiency from Google Chat.

reviews.title: “Handy Chat option when using gmamil”
reviews.text: It helps save time, since we can easily send a chat instead of an email to each other and get a quicker response.
reviews.pros: It is nice that I can send a chat through our email that is gmail, and get immediate response without bogging down a co-workers inbox. We use it all the time! Chats can be searched later to try and find the link or info you sent via chat instead of email, so it is great for looking back when needed
reviews.cons: I don't think I have any cons about this software. It just works great with our current email set up. I think the only thing I can think of is for the users that use outlook with gmail it doesn't work, and you don't know that, without talking to the person.

reviews.title: “Great for use with my business profile ”
reviews.text: It is a nice enhancement for me with my business.  Someone can link to me directly from my Google Business page and it goes right to me (over WiFi and cellular networks).
reviews.pros: Works just like regular text messaging.  I ha rot linked from my Google Phone Number for business use and it also forwards the message to my personal mobile and email, so I never miss out on a piece of communication.
reviews.cons: There are some limits in the type of content (multimedia) that can be sent over the chat platform (could be that I am using the basic version, but iMessage allows it). Would like to be able to also reply using a “reaction” lien regular text messaging allows but again...could be my version level.

reviews.title: “Google Chat is a reliable communication tool”
reviews.text: My experience with Google Chat has been excellent, we can easily communicate as we are using Gmail as our main email provider, Google has demonstrated to be reliable and secure.
reviews.pros: We are using Google Chat in the organization and have found it easy to use, it has a friendly user interface and it's comfortable to use when chatting in rooms. No need to install anything as it's already integrated into the Gmail interface.
reviews.cons: Lack of advanced features, the simplicity of Google Chat is a two-sided coin. Also, the notifications are an issue, when having multiple devices near me, it pops notifications all over the place. I have to open notifications on all devices to make those go away.

reviews.title: “A way to chat over email”
reviews.pros: This feature was my go to chat tool while on my computer with my email open. I believe it has since been changed to Hangouts. My kids used Hangouts on their phones to send me messages which came to my Google chats. I haven't used it since 2017, I began checking, sending and receiving text messages through Hangouts on my phone/tablet. You can see all the people you are linked to or chat with in a box on the left. The contacts and chat box are often beneath the Gmail tabs.
reviews.cons: There was nothing to dislike, you could chat and check your email at the same time. This feature was free, and allowed you to chat with contacts. You can't go wrong.

reviews.title: “Free online chat in real time”
reviews.pros: I like that it is free, that it shows status (active/inactive), and that it offers desktop notifications. Recent features include emojis. Conversations can be archived as well, which is helpful.
reviews.cons: There is a "..." icon that appears when another person is typing, but since they are on their desktop it is likely that they are typing something else and not into the chat box so that can be misleading. I also wish there was a way to acknowledge a message without typing a response similar to the new feature on iphones that allows one party to hover over a text message and send back a thumbs up, thumbs down, "haha", exclamation points, etc.

reviews.title: “Google Chat”
reviews.text: It's a great tool for both in-office and remote employees. The files and search filter is a great tool to use and it allows you to bookmark items that you will need for future use.
reviews.pros: I like that we are able to connect with each other without having to place a call or jump on a meeting. You can keep records of the chat and the search filter allows easy search when you need to find something specific. You are also able to upload files and create tasks for a team to accomplish.
reviews.cons: We have used Google Chat for multiple years and haven't had any trouble. There are times when Google randomly signs you out but I don't think that has to do with Chat but with Google itself.

reviews.title: “Google Chat is a finely integrated feature in an already powerful suite of tools.”
reviews.text: Easy, convenient chat function within G Suite.
reviews.pros: I use Chat almost every day within Gmail. It is an easy way to communicate with friends and colleagues from within my web browser, and since I always have my gmail window open, it is easy to see when I get a new message.  The software is also integrated into mobile as well, so I can still keep the conversation going while away from the computer.
reviews.cons: I am disappointed to learn that Google is discontinuing Hangouts in 2020.  I will still be able to chat within gmail, which is what I primarily use, but with the discontinuation of Hangouts, it will make it difficult to chat outside of the gmail window.

reviews.title: “Easier than Skype”
reviews.text: One of our group does not have a smartphone (hard as that is to imagine nowadays), so chatting with him on a computer is the best way to enjoy face-to-face communication.  We tried Skype, Facebook messages, and Google Hangouts with varying success, but Google Hangouts Chat was the most reliable and by far the easiest to figure out—and it is completely integrated with other G Suite features, so file sharing and accessing contacts is effortless.
reviews.pros: It makes chatting with my writing group very easy—while I'm reading their submissions in my Gmail, I can see if they are online, and I can shoot them a quick message in the moment.  It is already part of the G Suite, so no extra programs need to be installed. At the same time, that means I can communicate with anyone who has emailed me without sharing other contact information. We were able to have three people involved in the conversation easily, and I enjoyed being able to turn off the view of myself.
reviews.cons: Sometimes the video/ sound is intermittent, much the way Skype cuts in and out or a FaceTime call will freeze. I believe the speed of your internet connection and that of your companions plays a critical role.

reviews.title: “google chat is helpful in chating”
reviews.text: i had a good experience with this software
reviews.pros: google chat  software is important in chating experiences
reviews.cons: the developpers can add more chating tools in order to make the softwore better

reviews.title: “Evolved to perfection.”
reviews.pros: I have been using Google Chat for a very long time, and boy has it gone a long way. From just starting out as a simple IM system in emails, it has blown up into its very own app, while retaining the simplicity of its origin. This is great because it's so easy to use, and always will be - while also adding features at my disposal in case I ever need them - and I have.
reviews.cons: Whenever I do decide to test out a new feature, such as the video chat system, file share or etc., I have to do a little bit of research in how I do it but that's a given with any software. The in-app tutorials are a huge help too and don't overcomplicate it.

reviews.title: “Simple but sufficient tool for team communication ”
reviews.text: No complaints, good tool to use among teams. Being from google makes it simple to set up on multiple devices
reviews.pros: It does everything you need, not less not more. Used it with google workspace and have no problems at all. Phone app is also good.
reviews.cons: Nothing in particular to dislike about. Threads option like slack would be useful to keep track of messages

reviews.title: “Google Chats!”
reviews.text: It’s been great so far but I expect more improvements.
reviews.pros: It’s integrated directly into gmail, so you can do everything in one place without jumping around
reviews.cons: Spaces could be better implemented much like Slack’s channels.

reviews.title: “Google chat”
reviews.text: My overall experience with Google chat is awesome
reviews.pros: Everything about the software is perfect arranged
reviews.cons: I like everything about the software.. the collaboration tools and all and with all these it left me with nothing to like least

reviews.title: “Chat house for Single and Team”
reviews.text: Through my journey as an artist,I joined Google meet more than a year ago. I met a lot of people on the platform,different people on my niche. Learned a lot from people. I go live everyday on google meet to learn new things and expand my skills.
reviews.pros: As a musician , I tap in with my fellow singers and songwriters,where we talk about lot of things. Google meet act like a connection between us. People from within and outside the country coming together like a team. We even practice and do freestyle in google meet. Also do interviews
reviews.cons: No cons for me on google meet,it is perfect for a someone like me. I love it

reviews.title: “Efficient real-time communication”
reviews.text: It's been very good and allows me to have a real-time conversation and an internal organization within my work
reviews.pros: Well-designed and easy-to-use tool. Allows both a personal conversation and division into rooms and teams. The function of creating Treads allows you not to get lost in the subject and keep the organization of internal processes
reviews.cons: I had no problem or negative experience using the software.

reviews.title: “Google Chat Review”
reviews.text: when part of the G-Suite for Business, this is a great integration which has made collaboration and file sharing more streamlined and simpler as well as safer than using external tools for each
reviews.pros: Easy to use, a worthwhile messenger tool when you are using Googles other business tools as well, as it integrates nicely like all G-Suite tools do, not sure I would recommend using it as a standalone solution, there are better messengers at better rates for just the chatting part
reviews.cons: this may seem petty, but more often than not, it seems that notigications for new messages are a bit iffy, especially when on a group chat. I know we all want to focus and not be distracted by constant notigications, but I have missed several urgent or time-sensitive infos because sometimes notifications just stop, or the count on the iOS app is not updated

reviews.title: “Better after the update”
reviews.text: Overall I would give 4 out of 5 and the app is trust worthy.
reviews.pros:
The notifications. In old version, I don't used to get proper notifications for calls. The updated version is really good and easy to use.

We don't need to segregate the group chats and personal chats from now. This is one of the good options given by the developers and I love it

The best thing in this app is we can now get the mail ids easily. In older version, it was hard to find a mail id when we get a message from an unknown user and now there is no such problem.

additional option- Pin the conversation this was no there in old version.

Easy to share photos, Gifs and easy to create meetings.

One more best feature is we can easily organize our events in calendars.

The font change option is good.
Slide left to unread and slide right to pin really good.
Overall the new version is very good
reviews.cons:
I would love to see the below options which are currently not available in Google chat.

1. Voice messages
2.Private/Temporary chat option

There is one more problem which the developer team has to look into- video calls. The video calls quality is not really good in this version. I was expecting a changeover but the quality of video calls are still the same.

reviews.title: “Team collaboration and conversing in one place!”
reviews.pros: The Google Suite Chat is pretty handy. It allows our marketing and sales teams to collaborate in real time and converse without using any other IM or chat tools out there. We are primarily GSuite users anyway and we depend on Gmail all day long, so having a centralized place to be able to collaborate and chat is ideal.  We can direct message each other, collaborate, create custom groups, From direct messages to group conversations, Chat helps our teams collaborate easily and efficiently.
reviews.cons: Not much negative to say about the chat feature, perhaps that it might need an aesthetic facelift sometime in the near future.

reviews.title: “Google Hangouts one of my favorite way to keep in touch with family and kids”
reviews.text: Overall I've had great experiences communicating with family and friends, I've used it for over 10 years and seamlessly go from one device to the other on Google Hangouts without any problem.
reviews.pros:
Synchronized between all your devices
Internet VOIP
Live Chat
Instant Messaging
reviews.cons: I never really had problems with Google Hangouts

reviews.title: “Great communication platform for people with google accounts.”
reviews.text: Google Chat has been a great help to keep me and my team connected especially during the pandemic. The program integrates well with other G Suite products, which makes collaborating on projects much easier, especially with everything and everyone being in the same place.
reviews.pros: The whole interface is super easy to navigate and very user-friendly. You can contact people through their gmail, mobile number or even their name! It's so handy, especially if you need to just check something over with someone and overall it saves the hassle of exchanging 50 different emails, which we all hate doing! The chats are saved and searchable, which I really like because I can review or check what was discussed for future reference.
reviews.cons: The program is very simple, but I would say that you are restricted to communicating only between people with Google accounts, but I guess that is not much of an issue since most people have one anyways. Sometimes I also have issues with the notification as well since it doesn’t come through or is delayed for no reason. Sometimes it also shows people as being available even when they are not and therefore it can sometimes cause some confusion! If they fixed these two problems it would be fantastic

reviews.title: “Great for collaboration and comunication.”
reviews.text: Keeping projects going and getting questions answered in real time.
reviews.pros: Easy to get a hold of people you are working with and also start a meeting. Keeps the workflow simply and moving forward.
reviews.cons: I don't like the constant updates. This can be cumbersome to install new items all of the time.

reviews.title: “An environment for direct conversations.”
reviews.text: A formal and serious experience, but very interesting.
reviews.pros: The tool's power is amplified through integration with other Google Workspace applications.
reviews.cons: The few features of gifs and emoticons as there are in other chat apps.

reviews.title: “G Suite Chat is Perfect!”
reviews.text: We have fun conversation as a team and can also ask questions without clogging up the email inbox.  Chat is so helpful for collaboration!
reviews.pros: I love Google Suite's option for Chat.  I love that you can start video or audio connection points right from the chat.  The emojis are fun and the notifications are helpful as I collaborate with teammates.  You can also insert pictures and gifs!  I also love the group creation option so that you can spur on a work team.
reviews.cons: I do wish that the gifs were integrated like other chat options.  That would save time versus having to go to a browser add-on and find a gif and then copy and paste it in the chat.

reviews.title: “Hangouts as a very handy tool for communicating in small teams.”
reviews.text: Google Hangouts is a great tool for communication in small projects. It's super fast to start with a simple chat and then follow up with a Hangouts video call.
reviews.pros: One of the things I like most about Hangouts is that it's available directly on your Google emailbox. When you type a new email, you can still see if you got a new message on Hangouts without the need of closing the new email box.
reviews.cons: I'd like to see some new layouts or functionality improvements to Hangouts. I don't remember when was the last time I saw new features released on Hangouts. There are many applications designed especially for communication on the market and I believe Hangouts is losing with the competition.

reviews.title: “Awesome option to keep in touch with your team.”
reviews.text: I've used it for live chat with my team.
reviews.pros: The ease of deployment this tool has to offer.
reviews.cons: Other options may be a little faster and complete than this tool.

reviews.title: “Simple chat function that is easy to use”
reviews.text:
- Free chat functionality
- Improved collaboration in work and personal communication
- Seamless synchronization of chats across devices
reviews.pros: Google chat comes free with any Google account, which is a huge pro for me. It syncs with all my contacts and makes it easy to find both existing and new contacts. It is also accessible across different platforms and devices, making it even more convenient
reviews.cons: Google chat does not allow attaching of files to chats, unlike other applications such as Skype. But other than that, it is great because it does not need re-installation to devices, only need to log in to your Google account on the device.

reviews.title: “Google Chat - a much needed tool”
reviews.text: Indispensable for collaboration across our teams. Cross-platform apps and access makes it a necessity for our work.
reviews.pros: Allows fast and easy communication across team members. Really easy to also attach and send files if needed.
reviews.cons: The user interface could be better and often it's hard to distinguish workspace rooms and chat.

reviews.title: “Bare-bones business chat”
reviews.text: I advised to adopt or just adopted it from day one, I like most of the features that are in competing products but seriously Chat is free and a chat is just a chat,  you can have your business chat on WhatsApp if you want to!
reviews.pros: G Suite Hangouts Chat is the way to go for business chat if you are a Google's customer, since it brings all the fundamental features of a business chat with no added costs, it's simple enough to be learned quickly and move from competing products in no time.
reviews.cons:
Starting from the confusing name (Hangouts and Hangouts Chat? Really?), Chat is a mixed-feelings product, clearly with a great potential but for same reason kept in a condition of understatement to say the least.
The usability of the apps is not yet great (surprising given it's Google's) and some features are really lacking (deleting a room or disabling link preview should be there, not talking about more complex features that might be important in a business context).

reviews.title: “Use it for smaller chats that email is not necessary for”
reviews.pros: I live for gchat. As a graphic designer I'm constantly sending screen shots to ask small questions about certain things. It's easy to log on chat the person you need and attach files for their review. For those questions that don't need it's own email. Also allows for video chat. Performs well connecting to your google drive and gmail and everything google has to offer!
reviews.cons: I have no cons for this product It is an IM system and it acts exactly as it is supposed too. Some things like Skype take a while for a picture to load, and gchat you throw the picture right in the chat and it shows up!

reviews.title: “I use this daily to instant message staff!”
reviews.text: The chat feature is great for my business to communicate with other employees. It saves on having formal face to face meetings when collaborating on a project. I feel that it is more secure and user-friendly than Whats App.
reviews.pros: I use gmail as my email provider and integrating a chat feature is great!  I use chat to communicate and send files to co-workers when working on a project.  Being able to instant message someone to ask questions is great versus a long email chain. All of the chat's are stored which is a wonderful tool if I need to look back at a conversation.
reviews.cons: All of my needs are met with this chat tool with the exception of knowing if someone actually read my message. I believe this is just a bug however it would be nice if the message stated if the person actually saw the message.

reviews.title: “Google chat review”
reviews.text: I use google chat everyday to communicate with team members. The user interface and is very convenient to use. The features of adding files, pictures, google docs, slides and sending meeting invites is helpful on a daily basis.
reviews.pros: It is very easy and simple to use to communicate with team members. The features of uploading files and sending google meet invites directly from the chat window is really useful and convenient as well. History of previous chat before joining a group is maintained, which helps catch up on any previously missed conversations. We can also set notifications separately for different chats.
reviews.cons: In the web version, there is no option to reply to a specific message, which is required many times.

reviews.title: “Google Chat Cuts Down on Email and Improves Efficiency ”
reviews.text: My boss and I communicate regularly with quick questions using Google chat. It’s wonderful for conversations that don’t need to be saved and require just a quick answer. Nearly all of my friends use Google as well so I chat with them using this feature as well. I like that you can sign out of chat if you want to be unavailable. It is a wonderful tool that has reduced my email inbox!
reviews.pros: I like that Google chat exists in a space where I already spend so much time both personally and professionally. My company uses G suite and I have a personal Gmail account.
reviews.cons: My only complaint is that once in a while google goes down and thus chat is not available. This is rare however.

reviews.title: “Google Chat Review”
reviews.text: I use Google Chat a lot to communicate with my colleagues at work, and ever since I started using it, it has been meeting my everyday social needs. This software is highly recommended.
reviews.pros: Google Chat has always been excellent for me, as I now find it very easy to communicate using my Gmail account. Google has been proving wonderfully well, and the introduction of this software is indeed wonderful.
reviews.cons: I honestly haven't found anything to dislike about this app. Every feature is lovely, and it's even free to use.

reviews.title: “Simple and fast messaging service by Google”
reviews.text: I have been using this for team communication within my organization
reviews.pros: It is fast and efficient in the real-time chat process
reviews.cons: Sometime it feels to use another application as this application has some limitations

reviews.title: “Good chat tool that is provided within GSuite”
reviews.text: Group chat and communication within the team are possible. Sharing of files is possible internally within teams especially by using Groups.
reviews.pros: Group creation is possible and is easily searchable. Can search for keywords within chats that can be drilled based on user. Sharing of video files and images are possible. Chats using threads is possible in groups
reviews.cons: Video calling feature is missing. Chrome extension if enabled would be a good feature instead of having a tab open all times for the same. It chat could be integrated with Google hangouts that could have made things simpler to bring the best in both apps

reviews.title: “Another Google service that saved us money”
reviews.text: Overall we are quite satisfied with the Chat offerings and I am sure they will continue to improve on the service.
reviews.pros: I like the ability to create rooms specific to any necessary topic and to bring in both staff and outsiders to a specific space from which we can collaborate
reviews.cons: We had some issues with the meetings early on but they have been ironed out.  I would also love the ability to choose to not have the "Enter" button be the send option.  All too often a message will be sent out by accident incomplete.

reviews.title: “Connecting people ”
reviews.text: Amazing
reviews.pros: Simple to connect and install, no seperate account required, live status features are available
reviews.cons: Emojis could be better, AI could be introduced

reviews.title: “G Suite Chat Perfect Platform for Quick Messaging ”
reviews.pros: By far the most commonly used online chat platform and is a great tool as it is integrated with gmail. It’s so easy to reach out to people and have quick conversations through Chat. You can chose whether or not you want to be visible to other users when you don’t want to be disturbed and can easily see who else is online should you want to contact another user.
reviews.cons: The only downside of G Suite Chat is that some VPN networks do not allow the use G chat which makes it difficult to connect to your contacts if you are unable to access the platform from your internet server.

reviews.title: “Google Hangouts”
reviews.text: I use Google Hangouts for personal as well as professional needs. It is so simple to meet someone online and have a conversation.
reviews.pros: So easy to use and most people already have Gmail.
reviews.cons: There is nothing to NOT like about the solution.

reviews.title: “Google Chat is Easy to Use”
reviews.text: I use chat multiple times throughout a typical workday.  I find it easy to use per the reasons cited under what I like most about this software.
reviews.pros: Google chat is built in to Gmail, which my company uses as our email system.  Having it built in, makes it easy to access, easy to view who is active at any given time, and easy to enter links and pull others into a conversation.
reviews.cons: There are times where email will show as connected chat will not load.  However, to be fair this seems to only happen when I'm offsite using coffee shop or retail store wireless, so it could be a problem with wireless, not chat.

reviews.title: “Good instant messaging and chat application with simple interface by google.”
reviews.text: Overall google chat is a really helpful tool for instant messaging and communication. But i feel more work need to be done with regard to tools and personalization in the interface and data security and making it a reliable choice.
reviews.pros: The real time chat interface is very minimal and user friendly. The mobile access is also superb. The file sharing is also very very easy. The search filter works very nice and i liked it very much.
reviews.cons: Data import and export can be even more improvised. The alerts and notifications also need better management and less disturbing and repeating alerts.

reviews.title: “Google Hangouts best tool for conferencing with best Audio and video quality”
reviews.text: I am using Google Hangouts for connecting with my team. It is great platform to do video/audio conferencing.
reviews.pros: Google Hangouts is best platform for conferencing. The user interface is very simple and easy to use. This app works with slow internet connection. It provide quick chatting option. The  audio and video quality is excellent. We can add multiple user and make group calls. We can create meeting and share link to join. Screen sharing is super easy.
reviews.cons: Nothing to dislike. Only sometimes its takes more then usual time to share screen. It is the most easiest tool available on the internet.

reviews.title: “Everyone has it, why not me?”
