reviews.pros: Everyone I know has a Gmail account. It only makes sense to open up communication channels wherever available. Gchat serves as a fine backup for more official or robust channels of IM. It is what it is, and it's pretty good at that.
reviews.cons: Google Chat is not as robust as many of its competitors, which might be why it isn't widely adopted in the business world. I enjoy it fine for what it is, but it's not going to replace Skype for Business anytime soon.

reviews.title: “Google Chat is an effective communication tool”
reviews.text: Chat has been great for my needs. In terms of reaching out to individual team members or the team as a whole, Google Chat is a simple and easy form of communication. It is also an added bonus that when I search my Gmail I can also have it search within chat so that all communication on a given subject/project is easy to find in one place.
reviews.pros: Chat is very user friendly. It's simple to use and already integrates with Gmail so all communication can be done in one place.
reviews.cons: Chat is not very robust in terms of features. For simple communication it's fine but if you are looking for a product with any capabilities above simply sending a message you may be better off with other software.

reviews.title: “Google Chat makes quick communication easy!”
reviews.text: Chat is most helpful when I need a quick, concise answer to a simple question that doesn't necessarily require an email. I have also found that it is helpful when I cannot reach someone by phone  - I am simply able to send a quick chat asking for a call back.
reviews.pros: Google Chat is just like sending simple text messages. I am able to communicate with everyone in the organization efficiently and seamlessly!
reviews.cons: I would not say that I least like anything with this software; however, there are a few things that I think Google Chat should be updated with. Most importantly, I would love to be able to attach a file to a Chat window.

reviews.title: “Google Chat - Chat your way with collaboration”
reviews.pros:
Collaboration 
Real time alerts 
Ease of usage
File sharing options
History saved in Gmail
reviews.cons:
None as of now
Interface can be enhanced and some apps can be created fir optional additional features.

reviews.title: “An Easy and Convenient Way to Communicate”
reviews.pros: It's free, it's easy, and it's fast.  It's not super complicated because it doesn't need to be.  If you're looking for something with few more options, I'd suggest looking elsewhere.  If you need an intuitive and speedy way to talk with coworkers? This is your tool.  Most places use the Google Suite so it's really a no-brainer.  Notifications are non-intrusive, is mobile friendly, and makes interaction with other Google Services a breeze.
reviews.cons: Honestly, there's not really anything negative to say about it.  It's an extremely basic tool that does what it says.

reviews.title: “Google Chat is Free & Easy to Yse”
reviews.text: Overall I like Google chat it’s free & easy to use while providing sense of privacy when you use this chat service.,
reviews.pros: I like the fact that Google Chat is free & you also can keep a record of your chat history that is saved to your gmail account that you can always reference.
reviews.cons: I don’t like the fact the spam messages & the fact they are not marked as spam. I constantly received messages from women soliciting the video content & the request comes in like you have a message.

reviews.title: “Chat simple but almost to a flaw. ”
reviews.text: Overall it works, its simple, uncluttered, (WHICH IS NICE), but it needs a little more fidelity.
reviews.pros: Google has a great way of making their products super simple, clean, and modern. Their material design and approach to products is refreshing and helps users focus on the task they need to do at hand. I love the simplicity of the application and services as it does what it says but it's not quite ready for prime time with large teams or business case uses.
reviews.cons: Coming from a chat/messaging services like Slack, Chat is lacking many of the simple features that are sought out from companies like ours as well as small business users. Public messaging and private messaging is a little ambiguous. The application feels like a shell of a browse setup, and overall the branding is a major DISCONNECT for the Google branding and image it normally projects. It would be nice for them to refine the user interface and also make it more robust and connected with applications​ like Google Docs, Sheets, and Slides, including Drive.

reviews.title: “Soluciones a la gestion del mantenimiento”
reviews.text: De manera general mi experiencia ha sido positiva y orientada a la mejora de mis procesos.
reviews.pros: Que me permite estar conectado de manera inmediata con multiples de mis colaboradores, alcanzando asi una aceleracion en la ejecucion de los trabajos, de manera organizada.
reviews.cons: lo qu menos me ha gustado es que en ocasiones se freeza y pierdo la total comunicacion.

reviews.title: “Savvy for 2022”
reviews.text: The overall experience with Google chat is that it is very easy to use, simple and it makes communicating very friendly.
reviews.pros: The features I find most impactful in this software is the ability to keep my employees connected through this communication platform. It is useful and essential for my business to function and operate smoothly. I find this software keep the business grounded and the window to communicate with each other very easy to touch base within the company to organize team meeting and such effectively.
reviews.cons: The least thing I find in this software that I do not like is how similar it can be to other communication software for example Viber, msn chat.  In order for it to not be compare to others in this communication class is the standards of communicating should be different than the others.

reviews.title: “Great tool for being in touch with your teamwork”
reviews.pros: The rapid send of the information and that you can create groups and make video calls
reviews.cons: The limitating of sending media files comparing to other apps

reviews.title: “Google Chat---what a great way to connect!”
reviews.text: Love it! So convenient and easy to use!
reviews.pros: The flexibility to know when my boss or teammates is available or busy or away is so important. If I can "chat" with them in this manner, it saves me from having to track them down or call them. I also like the fact that my boss or myself can answer questions instantly. My boss also meets with me through this app by sending me a link to Google Meet.
reviews.cons: I can't think of anything I don't like about this software

reviews.title: “Simple and Effective”
reviews.text: Its very good experience using Google chat.. can be used on web, desktop application and mobile application.
reviews.pros: Its simple user interface yet strong feature. Easy to use and multiple features likes sharing file, images etc..
reviews.cons: Nothing that is not good in google chat.

reviews.title: “Great Way to Communicate!”
reviews.text: It's so helpful! Easy to use, easy to implement, and has a few different features that are also easy to use.
reviews.pros: I love how easy it is to use! I keep my email up for work all day, so I'd rather use Google Chat than WhatsApp, Zoom, Microsoft Teams, etc. The video and multi-party integration is also easy to use.
reviews.cons: Not much, honestly! I have used it for years and really like it. A few years ago it was a little buggy but now it's great.

reviews.title: “The Seamless Communication Tool At Offices”
reviews.text: Overall the tool is well performer and provides great support. My organisation provides hybrid working and many team members work remotely and this tool helps connecting everyone.
reviews.pros: It Provides the seamless communication with the employees at the organisation.  The design and the features are quite great. It offers the features of creating a groups and room as well as call features. No doubt it saves the loads of emails.
reviews.cons: Group chats looks same as the direct chats and sometimes the notifications does not comes or rings.

reviews.title: “Google Chat experience”
reviews.text: All communication between internal teams in the company depends on the functionality of google
reviews.pros: Easy to use, all google products with only one sign on, it is very intuitive, I can use my personal account and profesional account as the same way
reviews.cons: perhaps have a more modern view, or incorporate avatars to use in conversations

reviews.title: “Review of google chat ”
reviews.text: Overall experience is good and appreciate the experience with google chat
reviews.pros: This app is good because it has attractive design and excellent communication tools so you can chat easily with your contacts
reviews.cons: Notifications sometimes don’t come through it might hang some how

reviews.title: “One of the best tools by Google”
reviews.text: Google chats have become an official communication tool for our company. All formal communications, file sharing, task tracking, etc. are achieved using Google Chat.
reviews.pros: - You can do real-time chat- The app is available for a mobile device as well- You can assign tasks on Google Chat and track them- File sharing is also possible
reviews.cons: Is is a very well designed tool and there are no drawbacks to improve.

reviews.title: “Mi google hangouts review”
reviews.text: En general, muy buena herramienta para tener juntas con nuestros equipos, amigable con todos y facil de accesar
reviews.pros: Lo que más me gustó es que es muy accesible economicamente para nosotros, no lo sentimos tan saturado como zoom, facil de usar, es amigable la experiencia de usuario
reviews.cons: Sentimos que a veces se pierde la conexión facilmente, no se si sea mi internet o sea el portal

reviews.title: “Definitely better than Google Hangouts”
reviews.pros: I like that there is fast connectivity using the app version and that you can share files rather quickly between users.
reviews.cons: Not as user friendly like Google Hangouts and the quality of audio can be improved

reviews.title: “Chatting with Google Chat”
reviews.text: Overall experience with Google chat is really satisfying. Employees can communicate with each other and clients without distractions using Google chat.
reviews.pros: Google chat communication software with very good UI/UX. It gives the user the features they need using a simple user interface. And also Google chat has integration with Gmail and Google meet where you can use google chat while using those mentioned services also. Furthermore, you can create separate chats for various topics and add people to those chats to continue the conversation on a particular matter.
reviews.cons: What I least like about this software is the price of it. Sometimes it can be hard for a small startup to get Google chat for every member of the company because of the price.

reviews.title: “A past time”
reviews.pros: Google Hangouts provided a very simple and easy to use platform to communicate with team members all in a single place. It was light-weight and easy to use and did not require a lot of set-up.
reviews.cons: The light-weight set up also made Google Hangouts less than ideal for setting up large teams working on different projects. Since each one had to be a different chat, many of them would be mixed together.

reviews.title: “A new wave of communication! ”
reviews.text: 10 years of amazing service!
reviews.pros: Google chat is very easy to use! It reminds me of the thrill of MSN messenger and seeing your friends red dots become green and knowing you can instantly reach them! Other than a great personal connection between friends, Google chat has helped me significantly in reaching any co-workers or clients as quick as possible.
reviews.cons: The only limitation is that you must have a Gmail account. As simple as that may seem, it becomes difficult in a professional environment when not everyone has a Gmail account.

reviews.title: “Easy Interoffice communication ”
reviews.pros: I like the ease of communication with my colleagues. “G-Chat”, as we called it, is very easy to use and navigate.
reviews.cons: The only thing that I didn’t like about chat, is that new friends had to be “invited” and messages needed to be approved before they were able to send messages. And even when they would send the invite, sometimes it was hidden. I’m assuming that was a glitch but it was annoying. This would interfere with time sensitive issues, as a result I would have to leave my desk and personally let them know I sent the message and vice versa.

reviews.title: “Everything you would need in chat for personal or professional use”
reviews.text: We used chat to keep our small team connected. We were able to quickly send messages and document back and forth for quick and easy revisions and collaboration.
reviews.pros: It's easy to use. You can log into it with your existing Google​ account and can quickly find contacts to chat with. Sending text, image, links, etc. is all possible. Mobile and browser chat is​ supported, meaning that you never have to miss a message.
reviews.cons: There really isn't much to dislike. It does exactly what you need it to, it's easy to use. I don't see any downside here​ unless you're just against using Google products.

reviews.title: “Makes office gossip easy and is a great way to communicate with your team without interrupting them”
reviews.pros: Google chat is the thing that keeps me sane in the office. It makes office gossip easy (sorry, sometimes you just need to chat about someone who brought tuna for lunch!) but more importantly, it's an easy way for me to ask coworkers questions and/or provide them with information WITHOUT having to interrupt them, as they can check their chat at any time.
reviews.cons: The only thing I don't like is that it can be hard to search and find. I wish that there was a way to pin important things (like a URL or attachment) to the top of the chat for easy finding.

reviews.title: “Google Chat Review”
reviews.pros: Google Chat is very user-friendly, and it is simple to enter. we can chat with our friends from anywhere and share photos and videos with them.
reviews.cons: The chat interface on Google Chat might be improved. Sometimes we won't receive a chat notice.

reviews.title: “Google Chat is a decent way to communicate with clients”
reviews.pros: The seamless merging of Google Chat with other Google products is one of its unique characteristics. People who depend on Google's productivity tools will find it handy that users can quickly switch between Gmail, Google Drive, and other G Suite applications. It is simple to locate previous conversations and crucial information thanks to the platform's powerful search feature. Direct messaging and group conversations are also supported by Google Chat, which can be very helpful for distant teams working together on projects.
reviews.cons: Google messaging is frequently criticized for having fewer sophisticated features than other messaging programs. For those who depend on these features for distant cooperation, the platform's lack of support for video calls or screen sharing, for instance, has been brought up by some users as a source of frustration. In addition, new users, especially those unfamiliar with other Google applications, may find the user experience overwhelming. Last but not least, even though Google Chat is a free feature of G Suite, some users have complained about bugs and malfunctions, especially when using the program on mobile devices.

reviews.title: “Easiest way to keep in touch with friends. ”
reviews.pros: This product is very user friendly and it's conveniently located in either it's own window or right in G-mail which most of my close friends and family have open during the day anyways.
reviews.cons: The biggest thing that bothers me is that using it now on a Mac computer, the hangouts app no longer pulls up and I have to go into gmail first then open a chat from there. Otherwise the only other problem is that I wish there was a search feature right in the app itself so that you could search for either text or previous photos sent back and forth.

reviews.title: “G Suite  Chat”
reviews.text: I Would highly recommend companies especially small companies to purchase G Suite and utilize the chat service that comes with it, we have been benefited to using the service.
reviews.pros: GSuite  Chat is very efficient chat messaging service that comes with the package of G suite. We constantly use google hangouts which is formerly known as G Suite  Chat, we can communicate with my department employees effectively, and the connection is secure and fast. G Suite  Chat enables us to communicate with anyone within the organization or outside of organization, the chat services opens within google browser, we can add people, see who's online, and also most importantly video call via internet, This is probably the most important aspect of communicating via a video call since management folks. G Suite  Chat does not take up much RAM space.
reviews.cons: I have not had any issues using G Suite  Chat recently.

reviews.title: “This is the best software to communicate with my colleagues”
reviews.text: The experience has been great. We started with Google Hangouts, and this transition to Google chat has been excellent. Keeping the software simple and user friendly
reviews.pros: This software is easy to use and creates chat groups for each out our company department. It keeps communications simple, fast, and easy to use. You can not only chat but also have video conferences with your teams
reviews.cons: the video feature has room for improvement, but it has evolved so much I am really happy with this feature.

reviews.title: “Excellent team communication tool”
reviews.text: While not as good visually as Hangouts, Chat has a fantastic search tool, which Hangouts didn't offer.  As this comes with GSuites, it's a smoking deal for small business team communication.
reviews.pros: Google chat is easy to use and just replaced Hangouts.  It is almost similar,  but has some upgrade features, such as search, which we love because important information is always getting lost in the long strand of conversation.
reviews.cons: I really wish that it looked better visually.  Instead of traditional chat boxes, where different people's conversations are in different colored boxes, the new Chat just strings them all together in a line with only a the logo or initial symbol above everyone's message, so it's a little messier to read. I also don't care for the way Chat has a twin in Gmail- redundant and can't figure out how to turn the Gmail side off.

reviews.title: “Your team organized by Google”
reviews.text: The app is designed to be able to collaborate with your team. It has the facility to share documents with each other with other Google tools, such as Meet, and integrate to make video calls instantly which is quite valuable.
reviews.pros: The functionalities and functions available to you by Google tools are organized intuitively for the user. In a very simple way, you will chat and meet for virtual meetings by Google Mecon with your team, besides being able to create groups to follow up on your groups, it is a not-so-common way to use but it is valuable to keep in mind.
reviews.cons: Actually, being a simple instant messaging software, you do not ask for more as it fulfills what you want and adds a plus the fact of having linked your Meet to make calls without having to leave the app, something already common among other Google tools.

reviews.title: “Best tool for daily meetings”
reviews.text: I prefer Google meets over the other similar platforms, I have experience with Zoom and it was very annoying from the beginning, with the time limitation and other problems. Google meet is easy to use, intuitive, best for instant calls.
reviews.pros: It's very easy to use, fast and comfortable. The best thing is you don't have to pay for having longer meetings. Everything is very simple, easy to navigate around, both in web version and mobile app.
reviews.cons: There is not a thing I don't like about google Meet, rather a suggestion to have an option of screen sharing in mobile app. Also, it would be nice to see the history, currently we only see the daily scheduled meetings.  Also having noise cancellation would be great.

reviews.title: “Great software with room for improvement”
reviews.text: Overall Google Chat offers a pleasant experience for me to collaborate with my colleagues. I never had a random bug come up in the years I've used it, and it's super light weight--no complicated add-ons or confusing steps to set it up. Thanks Google Chat!
reviews.pros: I liked the most that Google Chat is light weight solution for the basic needs of team communication. It's easy to install or use directly in Google Chrome, it's reliable, and it offers necessary features such as turning on history of a conversation, sending images, and creating rooms for group conversations.
reviews.cons: I like the least that Google Chat does not offer the level of versatility that its competitor such as Slack offers. I don't think you could add a hyperlink to some text or directly drag and drop a floating screenshot.

reviews.title: “The productive way to pass notes!”
reviews.pros: I love that I can give and receive information without it ruining the flow of the project!
reviews.cons: I really like this product. It helps me stay productive.

reviews.title: “Google Chat”
reviews.pros: Our office uses Gmail so it is great that google chat works so seamlessly and allows for quick and easy communication throughout the office. Some of the newer updates, like the ability to create Spaces, have helped immensely and make it a more useful tool for managing our design teams.
reviews.cons: The user interface could be improved substantially, especially for the Chrome extension.

reviews.title: “Always Reliable ”
reviews.pros: Easiest software in the world to use, can't complain!
reviews.cons: There really aren't any downsides to this software

reviews.title: “Chat is one of the most useful Google tools!”
reviews.text: I love Google Chat, but I do wish there was an app for iPhone!
reviews.pros: I love how Chat is versatile.  I have my contacts set up so that for people I have the telephone number of, I can just push a call button and dial their number. Or I can do a Google Hangout immediately as well. It is streamlined and lacks distracting buttons (like how Facebook Messenger has game links), which makes it better business use.
reviews.cons: I am a iPhone user so I dislike that I can't even access these chats unless I have my browser open on my computer to my Gmail account.

reviews.title: “I Don't Have to Talk to Co-Workers”
reviews.pros: I really like using g-chat because I can ask co-workers questions without ruining their work flow. It also stops them from interrupting me, which is great because I can really focus when I need to. Also, the g-chat conversations are searchable which means that I can look back through conversations to find what I need.
reviews.cons: I wish I could segment conversations. Sometimes I ask the same coworker about multiple projects and wish I could end the conversation, stick it in a folder, and then start the next conversation about that.

reviews.title: “A grown-up AIM”
reviews.text: Google's chat function makes it easy to send short, quick messages to colleagues and friends through your Gmail account. Don't expect any bells and whistles, though.
reviews.pros: I've used Gchat for years and now use it to communicate with people at work who don't want to sign up for Slack. It's easy and straightforward to message someone from your contacts list. You can also attach multimedia. It's a mostly basic, no-frills messaging service integrated into Gmail.
reviews.cons: The emoji symbols drive me crazy. I think they look like clip art. I wish they would get an update/upgrade.

reviews.title: “Google Chat”
reviews.text: Google Chats is a good chat option especially for Android users as it easily incorporates in other Google Apps.
reviews.pros: Google Chat is an excellent software to communicate with friends and fellows. It is seen as a replacement and better version of Google Hangouts by google. It has a very pleasant and simple design. It offers multiple modes of communication like text chatting, audio and video calls. You can also initiate group call or chat among team member to use it as a collaboration tool. Along with chatting, you can also send files of any format with it easily.
reviews.cons: Though technically Google Chat is not less than any of its competitors in any manner, but its smaller user base makes it a little less priority for users.

reviews.title: “The only chat you'll ever need!”
reviews.text: Great experience. Its reliable and that matters a lot when you use something just for business. Easy to use, and easy to teach, and it makes group chats with the employees easier, too.
reviews.pros: It's easy to use and to teach others to use. Add in that it is private, and I trust Google to have my back. I started out using it when I first got my business going, and haven't changed from it. It's how I contact my employees, my customers,  and my suppliers.
reviews.cons: Nothing. I literally have nothing bad to say about it. 5 stars completely.

reviews.title: “An amazing app for daily communication”
reviews.text: With the current work from home setup that we have, using Google Chat allows us to connect to people from different places (locally and internationally), we have been connecting with people in San Francisco and receiving daily updates for the application that needs to be tested or even major company updates.
reviews.pros: Connecting to others was never made this easy. We can easily tap other people and even schedule meetings everyday. We use this app to post updates about app changes, conduct daily meetings, and even talk about our daily updates for day-to-day work. This is a great app!
reviews.cons: I don't think there is any cons for this product. We use this daily and never encountered any issue using it at all.

reviews.title: “Good option for private 1:1 messaging”
reviews.text: Overall, I think Google Chat does an excellent job of serving its purpose, as employees are constantly on email anyway.
reviews.pros: The best feature of using Google Chat within the workplace is the privacy element— conversations can be set to be deleted after a certain amount of time and and past history/ conversation logs are not stored. It's core benefit is 1:1 messaging in real time.
reviews.cons: Google Chat is  quite limited in terms of file sharing or even minor features like adding bullets or emojis to your message. You cannot schedule messages or really do anything beyond messaging in real time.

reviews.title: “Fantastic Software for Instant Chat”
reviews.text: In overall, Google Chat is a great software for collaboration and instant messaging.
reviews.pros: I can easily share files and documents directly within Google Chat conversations. Also, I can collaborate with team members and work easily on group projects.
reviews.cons: Google Chat has fewer customization options. However, I like the design though.

reviews.title: “My Review of Google Hangouts”
reviews.text: My overall experience with Google Hangouts is very good. I use it for my official meetings.
reviews.pros: I like the interface of Google Hangouts. It is very simple and user-friendly. I like the ability to share my screen while meeting others. Also, I like that I can create groups on Google Hangouts with no limit of members.
reviews.cons: I can't choose a virtual background during video calls which is not good especially if I am in an official meeting. Also, Google Hangouts doesn't support using whiteboards during meetings.

reviews.title: “Google Chat -- Streamlining My Work Day”
reviews.text: My personal experience has been great! Instead of calling someone to address a project-related question or issue rather than walk to their desk multiple times per day. I like getting my answers in real time -- and the ability to e-mail myself a chat transcript to refer back to later. I like to have work decisions in writing, and this feature lets me do that.
reviews.pros: What I like best about Google Chat is how it allows me to communicate with my colleagues without having to leave my desk -- a time suck! I can talk with one person or a project-specific group. I like that I can address simple questions and clarifications almost instantly without having to leave my desk. My team can make sure we're on the same page via the group chat function
reviews.cons: There is always the possibility that users will waste time chatting about non-work subjects using the Google Chat feature. I try to treat my staff like adults and trust them to not waste time or abuse the privilege of having Chat on their desktop.

reviews.title: “I use Gchat everyday and love it! Easy drag and drop functionality for sharing files and links.”
reviews.text: Very happy. The seamless integration within  your Gmail makes it the go-to for co-worker communication and status updates.
reviews.pros: Gchat works so well for sharing quick links and files. You can just drag and drop what you want to share into your chat window OR manually by clicking the insert icon. It's easy to minimize your chats at the bottom of your Gmail page and chats are automatically archived and searchable through Google Hangouts.
reviews.cons: Some file formats aren't supported.  Also, the interface is a bit dull and there aren't any animated emoji's.

reviews.title: “Simple and easy to use messaging platform, basic but get the job done!”
reviews.pros: Simple design makes it easy to understand makes it very intuitive and makes a easy to use chat program.  Its integration with gmails makes it a very smooth process to switch back and forth between chat and email clients.  The contacts are already loaded from your gmail client and make it easier to start chatting with those contacts right away.  Also, due to the popularity of gmails, most users have gchat account and can be easily contacting using the gchat client.
reviews.cons: Lack of advance features seen in other chat clients, such as notification on when the receiver of the message has ready the message or not.   Video chat functionality is sometimes poor compared to other video chat clients, especially when the bandwidth is low.  Can't do larger multiple user chat level similar to Zoom. Also, it is not really clear on how to share files or screen share with other users in the same conversation.

reviews.title: “google chat is best for sales communication ”
reviews.text: Using google chat is best it has helped us improve our customer relationship since we are able to communicate to them instantly
reviews.pros: Google chat is best communication tool for sales team, i like it because it provides quick way to share files like videos JPG for products to be sold and even PDF documents
reviews.cons: The application limits number of characters to be shared with team and addition to that there is a lot of pop up messages which keeps coming and this distracts work

reviews.title: “An app to instantly communicate anything”
reviews.pros: What I like about the software it doesn't hang much like other software. You can easily search the communication history as well, which is very important to recover some significant information from the past. And it's more professional to communicate without giving people your personal contact details.
reviews.cons: The integration with other platforms seems to be less, which can be made better to seamlessly communicate.

reviews.title: “Google chat for sales”
reviews.pros: We have google chat because we also use Google email. It is good for instant messaging. I like that it emails people notifications if they are offline.
reviews.cons: We also use slack so it feels redundant to have another messaging platform. Chat does not have as many features/functions as slack

reviews.title: “Google Chat for Self Employed, Small Business”
reviews.text: Our small team has had no issues utilizing Google Chat, and would recommend it to anyone for a quick and effective communication solution!
reviews.pros: The ease of use is by far my favorite quality about Google Chat. We utilize this communication channel every week for our small team, outside of text, email, video call and other means. Google Chat allows our team to quickly communicate while working in the same spaces in the Google Suite - which makes our work that much easier.
reviews.cons: We don't expand our file sharing in Google Chat like we would email, but we utilize other products within the suite for that, so it really isn't necessary.

reviews.title: “For a Free Program It's Good”
reviews.text: We use it for certain clients who are not on zoom or slack.
reviews.pros: It's google so it's trusted name and it's very easy to set up the meetings and chats. It also integrates with Google Cal.
reviews.cons: The video feature is bad! Google Hangouts used to be better. It is hard to share your screen and see what is going on which kinda defeats the purpose of working and sharing presentations.

reviews.title: “Great Tool for Team Communication”
reviews.pros: Software integrated well within the Google Suite of products. Was used primarily to communicate with outside partners that used Google suite of products as well
reviews.cons: Limited functionality outside of instant messaging. Essentially felt like gmail that was given a slightly different UX

reviews.title: “Bringing My Team Together”
reviews.text: Chat's main win for my team, is my ability to let them work remotely more often as I'm confident I'm able to see they're online via Chat.
reviews.pros: The ability for multiple group chats within the organisation helps the various cross-departmental teams stay in constant communication. It allows me to allow my team to work remotely with a greater degree of confidence of them remaining in contact.
reviews.cons: The logging function often gets caught up in Email Search if you're using Gmail as part of Google Suite which can make it tricky to identify chats only.

reviews.title: “Easy to use product for keeping connected”
reviews.text: Decent chat option. I wish there was more functionality but it is free so what are you gonna do? :)
reviews.pros: How easy the product is to use. You login and boom, you are chatting. That in itself is the best part.
reviews.cons: I wish that I could move the chat box from outside my email screen. Then I could minimize my email while still chatting.

reviews.title: “Google Chat”
reviews.text: My overall experience with google chat is been very good.
reviews.pros: What I like the most about google chat is, it is very easy to use easy to install, and very user-friendly.
reviews.cons: There is nothing i can dislike about google chat.

reviews.title: “Google Chat - Real Time Communication of Google”
reviews.text: I get what I need with Google Chat. As I am a fan of Google and its apps, I find this very much aligned with their minimalistic approach. I get real-time chat, I get file sharing, it does what it was tasked to do, so I am fully satisfied.
reviews.pros:
There was a time when Google named this as Hangout, but now they split Hangout into Meet and Chat. Like the usual Google offering, Chat has a minimalistic approach to real-time communication. Since it is Google, it is integrated with all your contacts. How I see it is that it can give you the basics of text chatting and file sharing, but not as advanced as WebEx and MS Teams and similar competitors. 

Having said that, Google Chat is fundamental, although good enough to give you the team collaboration spirit that you need.
reviews.cons: Very limited features, just basic text and file sharing. So if you are used to MS Teams and WebEx or Skype, Google Chat looks very limiting.

reviews.title: “Google chat so very handy!”
reviews.text: I like using google chat daily for work and personal use.  My kids live in different states and I can easily say hey to them using google chat.
reviews.pros: I really like that everyone in my organization has this feature. It makes communicating super easy and fast. Oftentimes I have quick question or need to see a student. I can just chat a teacher and ask for her to send student to see me.
reviews.cons: I don’t believe you can truly delete the chats. You can archive them and remove them from your screen but once you chat that person again it all comes back.

reviews.title: “So easy to chat and monitor email simultaneously”
reviews.text: In all, Chat makes is super easy for me to communicate with and/or "ping" my colleagues. I can't tell you how many errors/disasters I've been able to prevent by sending someone a quick FYI via chat.
reviews.pros: One of the things I love most about Chat is the fact that I can see my messages and respond within the same window as my email, whereas other chat options require me to move from one window or browser to another.
reviews.cons: I'm not a huge fan of the emoji selection and inability to quickly use GIFs, as both of those things are major parts of our company culture.

reviews.title: “I think Gchat is pretty standard and nothing too exciting. It does the job that you need it to do. ”
reviews.pros: I like that you can turn the conversation history off as well as video chat and group chat. Also seeing that the recipient is typing is helpful.
reviews.cons: I would like it to be a standard feature that whenever you invite someone to chat with you on Hangouts, that it notifies them via email. Some of my coworkers barely use Gchat, so they don't see that I would like to initiate a chat with them. If they received an email, they would know to accept my chat and we could have an easier time communicating.

reviews.title: “Google Chat is fun and easy”
reviews.text: I've been using google Chat for years, personally and professionally. I love that it archives the chats in case you need to refer back to something. Using chat helps keep email inboxes under control and is a good solution for quick messages.
reviews.pros: I love Google Chat for quick messages and I love that it archives and saves the chats. It's easy to search if you need to go back to something. I love how all Google products work together.
reviews.cons: I don't really have any complaints about G. chat. It's easy to use and I don't think there's much of a learning curve.

reviews.title: “Google Zoom?”
reviews.text: Overall, I did enjoy Google Hangouts, however, I ended up using Zoom more frequently due to the ease of use and the familiarity my English as a Second Language students already have with the Zoom platform.
reviews.pros: During the height of the pandemic in 2020, I was scheduling video call interviews via Google Calendar and the Google Suite automatically attached a Google Hangout link to each scheduled interview. I had never used Google Hangout prior to this, so I was nervous at first but it was surprisingly simple to use! I was pleased with the push Google made to maintain social distancing and offer alternative meeting methods, this made both me and my customers happy.
reviews.cons: There aren't as many features compared to Zoom, and as the software is from a different company things I am used to are located in different areas of the screen and settings can oftentimes be difficult to get to. I also don't like the connection GoogleHangouts has to my email address, as sometimes I want my personal information to remain anonymous until I have established a further connection with my clientele.

reviews.title: “Google Chat ... Professional and Personal”
reviews.text: Excellent!!! I've been using it forever and love it.
reviews.pros: It's incredibly easy to use. Click the name of the person you want to talk to, and talk. More companies are using Gmail now, over Outlook, especially the more technically saavy companies. Something I find incredibly convenient as well is that you have everything in one place and easy access to it all - your chat for quick contact, email if you want to share documents, etc, the option for group hangouts, and your Google drive. All things I use on a regular basis and having them just a click away, rather than having to open up different programs/apps, is huge and a big reason why I love it. Convenience is key!!
reviews.cons: I don't love when the look of it is updated, but that's just a personal "adverse to change once I know how to use it" preference and you have the option to set it back. So really, this isn't a dislike, just a thought :)

reviews.title: “All your team communication in one place.”
reviews.text: Meetings, presentations, messaging, one on one video chat. These are just some of the things our organization uses g chat for that eliminates the use of other products we used to have to use in conjunction, with this one product
reviews.pros: I just love how fast you can hold a private meeting to just relaying a simple message between your team can be with this product. Even invite people outside of your G suites team to attend any transmission of communication.
reviews.cons: Nothing. No cons experienced yet. A definite upgrade from where the product was a year ago.

reviews.title: “google hangouts : great tool”
reviews.text: Google hangouts solves the most important problem of connecting with the team mates in efficient manner. It is a very helpful tool as the colleagues are sitting at different places in the large organization.
reviews.pros: Google hangouts is a great software for virtual meetings and conferences. It is very easy to use and understand because the interface is simple and clean. The set up is extremely easy and can be done on multiple devices such as laptops, tablets and phones.
reviews.cons: Google hangouts offers a video calling to limited number of participants which cannot be used to address large audiences. Also, Usually every meeting ends with a Minutes of meeting but there is no functionality for the same.

reviews.title: “Google chat review”
reviews.text: As and overall experience, I would recommend the use of google chat for a small medium company environment.
reviews.pros:
The ease of use and the multi access to the application from multiple endpoints (mobile, web and desktop) is one of the big advantages of the application. 
Also the creation of groups for team chat makes it an awesome tool.
reviews.cons: The lack of integration with third party application for notification in a professional environment is one of the big enhancement that google chat should consider in the net updates.

reviews.title: “Proven track record in its field”
reviews.pros:
Excellent synchronizer on different operating systems. 
Offers a very good customer experience 
Instant and flexible messaging
reviews.cons:
No trial version
Not enough features and very limited

reviews.title: “Allowed my Team to easily communicate ”
reviews.text: Chat allowed me to daily speak to my team.  I could easily get the answers I needed within minutes which upped my productivity and close time.
reviews.pros: Chat is an excellent feature to have within G Suite.  I could easily get the answered I needed while giving a presentation without the client event knowing.  A question could be asked about the software that I could easily get the answer for and then show the client.
reviews.cons: Chat is an excellent part of G Suite.  There are no downsides to having this feature built right into gmail.

reviews.title: “A great alternative to Slack!”
reviews.text: We use Google Chat for our internal communication.  We needed a client that is cross-platform and has strong Google Apps integration.  We were using Slack but have now switched to Google Chat as our primary chat client.
reviews.pros: Google Chat allows for individual chats but also chat rooms.  This is great for collaboration.  You can also share different media within the client as well which makes it easier and faster than email.   Google Chat also can be run from all major OS platforms so it is great for companies that have serveral types of devices.  Google Chat also integrates with Google Meet for having video conferences.
reviews.cons: The flow of the chat rooms can take a little getting used to at first.  Chat replies get grouped together so its not always linear in the flow.   However, once you get used to it, it makes it easy to follow a conversation.

reviews.title: “Recommend if you're team is just starting out!”
reviews.text: My team used Chat to communicate with other team members in regards to client tickets, problems, etc. Again, it was a great tool for us when we first started, but we eventually switched over to Slack.
reviews.pros: Google Chat is great because it's integrated with Google and opens up when I'm in Gmail. My team first started using Google chat to communicate with management and also other team members.
reviews.cons: Google Chat is pretty basic and does not have all the bells and whistles that other software, such as Slack, have. I don't believe you can create a group Google Chat that will always stay open. Even if you do have it open, I don't believe you can remove users and will have to create a new chat.

reviews.title: “Amazing Chat for Connecting Teams”
reviews.text:
This chat has been great for our team. SMS group chats are the worst, so this smart messaging system was a solid switch. I wish there were some more chat features that Microsoft Team and Slack has, just need those faster. 

This software is clean and gets the job done.
reviews.pros:
easy to use
Group chats keep you connected on specific topics or areas
You can use GIF's making work convo fun.
Bots for supporting software/automation.
reviews.cons:
Can't delete, turn off, or hide a chat thread.
people can accidentally start a thread, confusing a chat room. 
Need to be able to call from Chat, either Dialpad or Google Voice.
Need chat within Gmail (coming soon)
Better controls on what people can and cannot do within a chat room. 
Maybe some Microsoft teams functionalities.
Better GIF integration

reviews.title: “Easy to message and communicate with no hiccups!”
reviews.text: Good chat tool with no hiccups except adding people to groups.
reviews.pros: Google Chat is an easy way to chat quickly with co-workers. It also allows for quick attachments to be added to chats, especially if the attachments are in G Suite (Google Slides, Google Docs). There are also easy smart watch features, with timely notifications. All round great chat service with no lag for work.
reviews.cons:
Google Chat also syncs with the older Google Hangouts (or the Gmail chat that our firm used to use). Some people find that easier to use. 

Another issue is adding people to a group on Google Chat. I have not been able to find a way to do so unless I create a whole new group!

reviews.title: “A very convenient chat tool”
reviews.pros: This chat tool comes with Gmail so you can use it anywhere and anytime as you want. It allows us to  keep contact with other Gmail members. We can chat, share files and also use Video call with Google Hangout. It also helps us to keep the conversation history forever.
reviews.cons: What I don't like in this chat tool is they don't give us notification when a message comes from a stranger, so I often miss message from people who are not in my Gmail list. I hope they can fix this problem soon.

reviews.title: “Google Chat is critical”
reviews.text: The experience is flawless and critical to my everyday communications with staff. I would be lost without it.
reviews.pros: It is very easy to use and the interface is intuitive.
reviews.cons: I wish this worked more easily with Google Groups I have setu up.

reviews.title: “Practical, efficient, easy to use.... and uninspired ”
reviews.pros: Very easy to set up and use and integrates seamlessly with anything Google related. Seamlessly transitions from desktop, to internet based to mobile usage. Uses very little bandwidth. File sharing is also quick and easy.
reviews.cons: For in-office use, it would be great if there was an easier or more efficient way to create channels for specific topics. There are also no formatting options for the text used. It would also be nice to see them using end to end encryption which is something that their competition already uses.

reviews.title: “Overall, pleasant experience”
reviews.pros: Versatile with being able to call/video call with anyone of any phone type. I like that you can share the conversations across the phone with the app as well as on the computer through gmail without losing parts of the conversation.
reviews.cons: Limited if the people you are talking to don't also have Chat. The main reason I would use this over the regular texting on my phone would be to be able to video call all phone types, but if the other person does not have Chat, it does not work.

reviews.title: “Google Chat”
reviews.text: easy to use and makes communication simple with those you communicate with.  We use daily and it has helped our business and communication tremendously - not having to jumble up inbox with emails.
reviews.pros: Makes communication easy among those you communicate with with gsuite/google.  We use daily for communication and it has streamlined our business
reviews.cons: n/a.  It's easy and love the product.  You can send messages while someone is offline too, but maybe the only con is that it's in the bottom left - sometimes almost off the screen.

reviews.title: “Chat Keeps Our Team Connected ”
reviews.text: Having Chat functionality has changed the game when it comes to productivity and team communication. Being able to drop in documents, live links, video chat links, etc. keeps us moving at a fast pace and makes our team that much more effective.
reviews.pros: This product is super easy to use, works flawlessly, and was incredibly easy to implement. We pushed this product out to our entire team, and use both in the office to replace emails and pointless meetings and it helps keep our remote staff connected to the team as well.
reviews.cons: I literally don't have anything bad to say about this software. I would highly recommend it. It has vastly improved our workflow and communication without any downside.

reviews.title: “Productivity booster”
reviews.pros: Easy to use and minimal design is like patent of any google product and google chat is no different. I like the interface and ease of use.
reviews.cons: Sometimes it fails to load contacts which makes it unusable. I really wish that google address this issue.

reviews.title: “Good alternative to Zoom & Webex”
reviews.pros: Is free to use along with Gmail and very good alternative to Zoom & Webex
reviews.cons: With Microsoft offering MS teams as a free option, there is much competition to Google Chat.

reviews.title: “Simple, elegant and classic chat tool”
reviews.text: Quick and easy communication that does not have to be an email or phone call.
reviews.pros: Available as an application on a phone and on a regular web browser it provides easy chat at work and more. The ability to synch conversations as well as send various types of messages, including picture and video makes it easy to use and hard to beat.
reviews.cons: The application and browser version are not equal in all regards, as some features are present on one but not the other. However these are few and far between.

reviews.title: “Simplicity for chat”
reviews.pros: So easy and clean to use. Use this for small projects and just chatting with friends. Easy to move from mobile to desktop anytime. Not burdened with extra features that you don't need.
reviews.cons: Nothing except that Google is getting rid of it. WHY?!

reviews.title: “Our team always choose Google Chat when it comes to quick meetings!”
reviews.pros: I am a total fan of the Google Suite Apps and Google chat is one of the best apps to utilise from this. The chat option is easy to use and simply integrated with your Gmail account. The call is clear and fast. The mute option is easy to click and you can enable and disable the video without any hassle. Our team prefers this over any other video call tool.
reviews.cons: So far no cons for this product and I highly recommend using this if you are handling a small business agency.

reviews.title: “Google Chat”
reviews.pros: For instant massaging, Google chat is excellent. I am using it for 1-2 years and i am satisfied with this platform. It can be used with any devices like mobile, laptop, tablet etc with great speed. Its very easy to use and set-up is simple.
reviews.cons: It should improve new features and sometimes pop up massages are boring.

reviews.title: “Simple chat option fully integrated with G Suite”
reviews.text: I use Chat for simple communication needs. Whether work related or just for chit chat.
reviews.pros: What's not to like about Chat? I want a platform that I can chat with colleagues/friends inside and outside of my company that has emojis, can send images, videos, GIFs, etc. It does that simply. The fact that it's part of Gmail just sweetens the deal. Can't go wrong.
reviews.cons: All I'd like is to have an integrated GIF search within Chat (a lá Slack). To me, that's literally the only thing that's missing.

reviews.title: “Google Chat is a Powerful Agent for Communications”
reviews.text: Google Chat is  useful approach for quality communications in all aspect and business scope.
reviews.pros: Google Chat has progressively made people easily communicate, and there are reliable file sharing mechanisms. Further, Google Chat has appropriate engagement with different software.
reviews.cons: Google Chat is a quality program with coordinated approach for online communications. The system has maintained flawless features.

reviews.title: “Good Cost Effective Option ”
reviews.text: Overall, Google Chat is a budget friendly cost-effective option to keep your organization communicating in a remote environment, but don't expect a lot of features.
reviews.pros: Chat is a good option for communicating in today's remote environments. It will get the job done for a quick communication tool to keep your business running. The mobile compatibility is a nice feature.
reviews.cons: Chat lacks the robust features you will find in paid or subscription options. There are definitely limitations as to what you can do.

reviews.title: “Greatest chat client outside of Slack”
reviews.text: Great app for chatting and messaging people. I use it more compared to a standard MSM app on my phone.
reviews.pros: Great service that's offered with gmail. Great for chatting with friends and coworkers. Great way to stay off your phone if you just need to send a quick message to someone.
reviews.cons: You can only use this app with data on your phone. There's no SMS option since they removed it. So if you're in spotty service and rely on this app heavily, you'll have to move to your standard SMS app.

reviews.title: “Personal and genuine review of Google chat”
reviews.text: Very good for my meetings and group discussion.
reviews.pros:
Very efficient for meetings and projects
Good quality of video call
Helpful for office use
Better for professional chatting and meetings.
reviews.cons:
Not recommended for Personal use because less people are available who uses Google Chat
Not better for personal chats

reviews.title: “Quick Chat to get Answers Fast”
reviews.text: This helps me quickly contact friends, family and colleagues as well as outsourced creatives.
reviews.pros: I'll be honest - it's so easy to use I didn't even realize Chat was software! I like that I can use it on my computer as well as on my phone and I can get answers fast, whether conversing with a coworker or asking my husband for a favor! I also like that it sort of "blinks" on my screen when someone is contacting me.
reviews.cons: As far as I can tell, there are no cons associated with G Chat.

reviews.title: “The instant communication tool integrated into your email!”
reviews.text: My experience is very good. I've never had problems using it, it's always available and integrated into my email. It's really good.
reviews.pros: It's very good because you can make real-time communication integrated with your email screen. You have it all on a single screen, all integrated, and keep your full focus on the work at hand, without distractions from other tools.
reviews.cons: The tool is excellent, but if it's to point something, it could have more emojis.

reviews.title: “Just like texting, but better! Makes communication in the office, at home, and on the go effortless.”
reviews.pros: Chat is just like texting, but better. You can use it on the computer and on your phone. While working on the computer you can add screenshots and links, and the same goes for when you use your phone. You can group chat or chat individually. I used Chat when I taught, and now I use it in business, and I also use it personally.
reviews.cons: To be honest, I am not sure if I don't not like anything. Everything works well from the computer to the app on my phone.

reviews.title: “Google Chat is a Necessity for Team Communication ”
reviews.text: I use Google Chat every day, many times throughout. Working remotely in a company that has many employees around the country and abroad can be challenging to communicate with. Google Chat allows for us to converse immediately and effectively with all!
reviews.pros: Easy to use, instant messaging amongst the team which is critical when working remotely.
reviews.cons: There is nothing I dislike about this program

reviews.title: “Best video calling site ever”
reviews.text: First time I use another site for call and live meeting. But That site was very slow and video quality was poor. That time I searching for a good site. After that, I find out google chat site. And I really satisfied with this site.
reviews.pros: This is the best software for video call and lives class. I take my all live class with this software. Most of student and friend use this. That's why I can easily connect with them. This is the most useful Software. I love this google chat service vary much.
reviews.cons: There are no major least about this software. But some browser does not support this. But I think this is my computer problem. Overall google chats the best for me.

reviews.title: “No frills messaging service”
reviews.text: Overall, my experience has been positive but I much prefer it for personal use rather than professional use.
reviews.pros: I utilize g chat for both professional and personal use. It is simple and intuitive. If you are logged into gmail, you are logged into gchat. It's great if you are already part of the Google ecosystem.
reviews.cons: There are a few cons that can be bothersome. I've had issues with quality with large images or videos though I am given the option of sending with original quality.

reviews.title: “I use it daily!”
reviews.text: This is a must for healthy and convenient work communication! All teams need to be able to communicate quickly while working from home, but I also used it while working in the office too because it can save so much time when all I need is a quick response.
reviews.pros: I cannot imagine working without access to chat. I rely heavily on this to be able to communicate daily with my coworkers, especially during pandemic life. And it's so easy to turn it into a video or voice call if needed. I also like that I can easily create group chats, take the conversation off the record, or search my email using keywords to see past chats.
reviews.cons: I haven't had it happen as much recently, but there was a period of a few months when I was continually being logged out of chat and had to wait a few hours to successfully log back in. I'm still not sure what the issue was, but thankfully it seems to have resolved itself.

reviews.title: “Google Chat is Where It's At”
reviews.text: This is so easy and convenient as a teacher!
reviews.pros: Google Chat allows me to contact my students while they are independently working on their chromebooks. I am able to provide feedback to work, send reminders to get on task, and motivate them.
reviews.cons: Aside from students overusing it with there peers, no complaints here!

reviews.title: “Google Chat Works Well for Teams”
reviews.text: Google Chat is a great tool for any team/business to use. It is a great desktop application to get messages out or ask questions.
reviews.pros: I like software that is simple to use and Google Chat makes it easy to add users and begin communicating. When I want to contact a team member, I can simply send them a chat message and start a conversation. Google Chat allows you to attach documents and images. You can also chat with your whole team.
reviews.cons: The notifications do not work all that well. The red dot does not always appear when a message comes in. Anytime your internet connection flickers you need to refresh the page or you will not get your chats. I also wish you could format the chats a bit. Once you click enter the message goes instead of allowing a return. So communication may be off.

reviews.title: “Great way to quickly communicate!”
reviews.text: This is another win for the Google Suite tools.  I will continue to use chat as a form of communication to my contacts!
reviews.pros: This is another win for Google.  I have used chat many times versus Facebook or text.  If I see that someone from my contacts is online while using email, we can use chat.  I also like that we have a record of these conversations for future reference if necessary.
reviews.cons: I have had to turn off chat a few times because it's too easy to abuse and can be a time waster.  This is a personal preference, but overall I have no complaints.

reviews.title: “Chat, keeps you communicated all the time”
reviews.text: This application it's simple but very useful. As part of GSuite, you can access it from any page. If you are using docs or sheets, you can have a window where you can see the messages from your contacts. Also, you can use it for communicating during a collaborative session on GSuite apps.
reviews.pros:
- Easy to use (you don't need to configure anything).
- Available in all Google Suite sites.
- Practical and functional.
reviews.cons:
- It's a basic chat, sometimes seems needs more features.
- Don't has advanced tools like other chats.

reviews.title: “Google Chat Review from an Executive Assistant”
reviews.text: My overall experience with Chat is very positive and I recommend it.
reviews.pros: What I like most about Google Chat is the simplicity of it. There are other messaging softwares that may have *too* many options and features. I personally prefer software etc that has few bells and whistles and this is a fantastic basic messaging system.
reviews.cons: I don’t have anything I like least about this software. For my level of professional usage, Google Chat does everything I need it to do.

reviews.title: “The original Hangouts was better. Features are missing.”
reviews.text: If Google would introduce the ease of use and all of the features that the original Hangouts had, this would be a pretty decent product for those companies that have Google. If you have no need for cross-domain collaboration or chats, this product will probably work pretty well for you.
reviews.pros: Easy to use web interface, cross platform support, Gmail inbox integration
reviews.cons: The biggest con for us is that we cannot add external users to groups or rooms like we could in the old Hangouts.  Convoluted rollout of the software has caused us to move from using Hangouts every single day to abandoning Google Chat in favor of Slack.

reviews.title: “Quickest instant message system available...”
reviews.text: The simple, effective tool for instant message.
reviews.pros: It's quick, it's straightforward, it interfaces with anyone using the Google platform, and you have the ability to call & video within the program. Functionality is virtually a win.
reviews.cons: There isn't very much customization that you're able to quickly employ within the product. So, for most users, there are a limited number of typical emojis/communication protocols. Not unsurprising, but still can be limiting.

reviews.title: “Google chat  Review”
reviews.text: Overall it was great having google chat at work :)
reviews.pros: Google chat helps me t collaborate with my team even if we are not together we are still can communicate with each other. Communicating using google chat is not only for me to talk to my workmate but also to my students. Google chat also helps us not to share our social media accounts with our students and when I am using google chat I know that I am at work.
reviews.cons: I just hope that google chat has the reply to a specific message function also :)

reviews.title: “Chat is the first thing I open when I get to the office”
reviews.pros: Chat is the best. Simply put. I open it immediately as I get to my desk and it allows me to stay connected at all times. The universality from when you leave your desk (but are still able to continue conversations from your phone) is amazing.
reviews.cons: Nothing. No complaints. If I had to choose, I would say customization of the sounds played when a message is received (or turning off double sounds if you are on your desktop and phone is nearby).

reviews.title: “Great for Co-Workers but a Nightmare for Teachers.”
reviews.text: Again, Google Chat is great whenever you actually want to use it. If you are professional, it is an amazing professional tool. It just really is a way for people to talk and, if you don't want that happening, it can be a nightmare.
reviews.pros: I am going to try and be as positive as I can be here because, the fact is, this is a great product. The CHAT feature in Google can be extremely helpful and, when it is adults working, the CHAT function can be the difference between life or death in a business meeting. The ability to share work is essential in a good work-application and CHAT does that.
reviews.cons:
And here is where I complain loudly for a minute. I am a teacher and, holy moley, the CHAT feature can be a waking nightmare for me. It is wildly effective in helping people communicate, so good work there, but when people are trying to stop communication from happening? That's when issues arise. 

You made too good of a tool, Google.

reviews.title: “An easy, free messaging tool”
reviews.text: I primarily use it to keep in touch with friends and to message co-workers who don't use Slack. It's easy, convenient and intuitive to use.
reviews.pros: It's a quick way to send messages to your Gmail contacts. It's also integrated with Google Hangouts now, so you can video call contacts and do group messaging.
reviews.cons: It lacks the bells and whistles of the messaging software Slack and I think it could use a design update, but it serves your basic online messaging needs and then some.

reviews.title: “A good, simple, chat feature.”
reviews.pros: It does what it should do well. Chats are easy right from my Gmail inbox and give me the capabilities I need for file transfers, video chats, and group chats.
reviews.cons: Sometimes a multitude of message sessions can be overwhelming, and while this is not a problem of the program, it would be great for this to be a more widespread tool and reduce the monopoly Slack has on messaging. Otherwise, like many Google products, I have few complaints.

reviews.title: “Easy for all the users to use.”
reviews.text: Overall google hangouts is good. The audio and video quality is good and a lot of people know how to use it. I just want my recordings to be private and google doesn't offer that.
reviews.pros: I actually use this for a mastermind group that I am in. It seemed to be the easiest to use and the most amount of people were familiar with how to use it and had a google account of some sort to be able to use it. We do video conferencing over this and the quality of the calls and videos are quite good.
reviews.cons: I really wish google respected our privacy. That's really my only issue with this software. I don't like it that they give the government all kinds of backdoors to listen in on the people of this country.

reviews.title: “My Review on Google Hangouts ”
reviews.text: I have a very good overall experience with google hangouts. I would recommend anyone to use google hangouts if they need a quick and easy way to communicate to other people
reviews.pros: I like most is how easy it is to find a contact and start a conversation, Very good tool to communicate in real-time
reviews.cons: No cons. I find google hangouts a very good tool to communicate with colleges

reviews.title: “Google Chat Review”
reviews.text: First of all, Google chat is a lite and simple messaging tool to collaborate between the members of the team. Its quick and instant while sending messages and files. But the app lacks customer support and the UI should be made user friendly.
reviews.pros: It was a good integrated with Google Workspace, so it becomes the primary communication tool between the team working on Google workspace.
reviews.cons: Less feature and not much option to integrate with third party applications. Apart from team messaging, Google Chat doesn't server any other purpose.

reviews.title: “Instant Messaging App”
reviews.text: Google chat has been so useful in cutting down unnecessary phone calls and online meeting in the workplace. I love that it is instant and easily accessible and it has truly made us become more productive at work.
reviews.pros: The best thing about google chat is that it does what it is meant to do simply without any difficulty. It makes professional chats instant and possible making communication between coworkers fast and secure. It is easy to use and has just enough features to make it useful. I like that you do not  have to download the app so long as you can access Gmail you are good to go.
reviews.cons: I wish they could make text formatting easier but all in all I love the software as it makes instant messaging possible.

reviews.title: “Just like texting”
reviews.pros: I use this product for work and personal. I like that i can continue a conversation I had on the desktop, to my phone by using the app. It’s pretty simple to use.
reviews.cons: This is silly, but I don’t like the emoji choices on the desktop vs the choices on the app. The app emoji choices match those of which my phone has to offer while the desktop version offer generic looking emojis. I rather use the Chat software on my phone overall

reviews.title: “A Review of Google Chat”
reviews.pros: I can communicate with my colleagues without even leaving Google Chrome or even Gmail because it is just one click away.
reviews.cons: I am really not a fan of the thread mode of Google Chat because it could confusing to find certain conversations.

reviews.title: “Sometimes email won’t cut it”
reviews.text: When I first started using it, I didn’t like it at all and didn’t want to continue using it but now I prefer it over slack and use it all day everyday.
reviews.pros: I love that it’s integrated in gmail within the inbox. Sometimes I need to get in touch with someone really quick and I know my email would be buried in their inbox. It’s so efficient
reviews.cons: It’s not as “fun” to use as other services but I don’t think that’s the point of it. It’s very plain but it gets the job done.

reviews.title: “Google Chat - Simple, effective communication”
reviews.text: G Chat streamlines communication among our team members, and is easy to implement with new users right away.
reviews.pros: Google Chat or 'G Chat' helps my team communicate easily within the G Suite environment. Love it because it's simply part of the suite and does not require members to download additional apps in the desktop/laptop version.
reviews.cons: Conversations can sometimes get lost when many are ongoing concurrently, but you simply need to know where to find them.

reviews.title: “One of the most user friendly team communication application.”
reviews.text: Good
reviews.pros: No complicated layout and lags, simple communicating application with a lot of ease to access.
reviews.cons: None as such. Use it almost everyday and its pretty good.

reviews.title: “GChat - Amazing for Gsuite Users”
reviews.pros: Google chat makes it so easy to communicate with other gmail users. If your company is on gmail, chat makes for an easy way to get information, chat, etc. The videochat and calling functionality has continued to get better as well.
reviews.cons: One thing that can really be improved is the group function and also how you see previous chats within your email. Trying to find the right group can be a challenge if you use gchat a lot.

reviews.title: “Group chat with no extra cost if you already pay for G Suite”
reviews.pros: Nice and clean UI. Great search capability. Easy to set up web hooks to notify in specific channels
reviews.cons: Does not allow threading, too few ready made integrations with common working tools, compared to slack

reviews.title: “a google suite chat tool that is best suited for non tech teams”
reviews.text: it is best suited for non teams where they don't want to shell out additional costs for  a premium version of slack and they already have G suite with them.  In our case we had to abandon G Chat and go back to slack as that suited our needs better.
reviews.pros: there is no special set up involved. every user present in gsuite has access to the google chat hangouts. anybody can administrate it and no special knowledge is required.  it has very high reliability and almost zero down time
reviews.cons:
It is poorly designed in many ways. while screensharing the bottom is covered by a gray bar making it nearly annoying and almost impossible to do code sharing or team debugging. 
there is no option to mute others during a video call or an audio conference except by the host which means you are subject to the noises from everybody.  The readability and themes of the chat bar are rather unimpressive too.

reviews.title: “Google Chat Review”
reviews.text: I use GChat to communicate with team members and friends every day.
reviews.pros: Google Chat is very easy to quickly communicate with other teammates or staff members. It is VERY simple and there isn't anything to learn prior to using it. Most people already have a GMail account so it is quick to access.
reviews.cons: There isn't anything that I don't like about the software. I will say it is just a little limited, not as many features as there could be.

reviews.title: “Keeps me InTouch ”
reviews.text: It is great and still is great! I still use it to chat with people and send them pictures.
reviews.pros: That I can keep in contact with my family and have no worries. My iPhone family member owners we have a hard time send each other things through my Samsung that is clear so Google chats really helps
reviews.cons: I really like this software really easy to use. Fast alerts we aren't waiting all day to receive messages.

reviews.title: “Cross-Country Chat Champ”
reviews.text: G Chat has saved many meetings from the laggy, bitmapped doldrums.
reviews.pros: I work with employees across our branches in the US and Canada and haven't found a single better alternative to G Suite Chat. No sign-up, no strings, just a great way to connect.
reviews.cons: The reliability, while it has gotten better over the years, can be a little shaky when it comes to video and audio quality, but I'm happy to chance it because it's a rare occurrence.

reviews.title: “Powerful and highly glorified Business Instant Messaging tool.”
reviews.text:
Enhance great files sharing.
Enahnce great team collaboration and communication.
reviews.pros:
I like ease to chat with my friends,colleagues and customers using instant messages.
It's simple to use.
reviews.cons: This tool is very convenient with business instant messaging hence I lack any to dislike .

reviews.title: “Great Tool for Chatting With Colleagues”
reviews.text: Overall, I think Chat is another great product from Google that I use on a daily basis.
reviews.pros: Google Chat is great because I can keep my email and chat all within one screen, and Gmail is my preferred software as well. I also like the easy accessibility to video chat from the same chat window.
reviews.cons: I would like if you were able to drag and drop images into the chat instead of having to provide a google link to redirect the other user to.

reviews.title: “Chat: A Tool for Personal and Professional Communication”
reviews.text: As a writer who frequently collaborates with others, I find this software to be a helpful tool, especially when using programs within the Google Suite. If I am working in Docs with someone, we’re able to seamlessly edit our work and communicate the changes and the reasons behind them with one another in the moment. Sometimes, work like that can be personal, so it’s great to see someone’s thought process during a creative brainstorming or writing session.
reviews.pros: I love the accessibility of this software. The fact that you can use it on a tablet, phone, or on your desktop is so convenient, especially since many people switch devices as they move around throughout the day.
reviews.cons: I wish it gave more clear-cut notifications that someone has contacted me (though that could be user error on my part). Sometimes I won’t notice that someone has reached out until much later.

reviews.title: “Team chat solution from Google - is it Hangouts?”
reviews.text: If you have used Hangouts then the difference are low. It is a great app for communication for business teams. Sharing files, images, intelligent bots, suggested replies, etc. make this a good solution.
reviews.pros: It is integrated well with business systems and G-suite. You can have intelligent bots. We have bots in the Google Chat which help to automate tasks like managing attendance. You can form groups & rooms. Image sharing is easy, File sharing is included and suggested replies are great.
reviews.cons: Looks unnecessary attempt to get something out of already existing product - Google Hangouts. It is simple looking without good customization ability. Integrated capabilities like playing videos or previewing files inside the Chat application itself, would have made it better.

reviews.title: “Does it job”
reviews.pros: It's very easy to use and integrate into your job, the interface is user friendly
reviews.cons: The problem with this product is that it lacks features that the competition has and you end up opening two tabs with two different programs when you could be using just one

reviews.title: “the impressive software for teams work and buisness environments”
reviews.text: sole a lot of problems specially in team working it makes the communications easy
reviews.pros: what i ally like it in google chat t's provides instant messaging and groups chats to make the communications asy between the others plus realize  projects with simple way
reviews.cons: yes i like this software but soetimes i find some difficults in file sharing specially in team work sometimes not always ,

reviews.title: “Ideal Business Communication Suit”
reviews.text: Chat is ideal, extremely fast, great to have options for separate file storage and backup to check on past communication. Offers easy file sharing, adding additional people to a group, and IT'S FREE!!
