reviews.pros: Very simple, easy to setup, installs across all Windows, Mac, and Linux operating systems without issue, provides minimalist approach to quick communication around the office and around the world. Useful in our small office for getting things shared and keeping customers updated.
reviews.cons: Limited video chat quality, about as good as any other which is disappointing because I'd like to use just one software for all chatting/email/file sharing/video chatting but looks like we're still stuck. Annoyingly Facebook Video Chat works the best but (as we all know) Facebook is the worst thing in the world.

reviews.title: “Could not work without it.”
reviews.text: I love it. Its a great way to communicate with coworkers.
reviews.pros: Google chat has become part of my workflow. It helps me communicate effectively with co-workers in real time. If i have a question or need help i can reach out quickly and get answers.
reviews.cons: I have no complaints, wouldn't change a thing!

reviews.title: “Nice as a built in addition to Gmail, but overall somewhat lacking.”
reviews.text: Chat is used daily at our workplace and does what you expect it to do. Though I feel there's definite room for improvement.
reviews.pros:
+ Being built right into Gmail makes it very convenient to use.
+ Has all the basic features that you expect.
+ Searching for emails also turns up chat messages.
reviews.cons: - It's a hassle to share multiple images at once, needing to paste them separately, as well as open them in separate browser tabs to look at them.

reviews.title: “Sending a message is now easier within the organisation”
reviews.text: Over all the best software to chat within the organisation.
reviews.pros: This software is very much important within the organisation to communication. Now we don't need to send emails every time to communicate. This feature has made communication easy and better.
reviews.cons: As of now, i don't feel what I don't like about this software. This is great software.

reviews.title: “Helps you connect to people of your GSuite”
reviews.text: Makes communication possible without sharing phone numbers, which is very good
reviews.pros: My university uses GSuite, and hence the Chat feature, works really well. I can quickly ping anyone from my university with just their names. It is present within gmail itself, so it helps keep things organized and at one place
reviews.cons: I would have liked the emojis to be better and the chat to optionally support stickers :P it is a little bit basic

reviews.title: “G Chat is very easy to use.”
reviews.pros: I love that G Chat is connected to gmail. It is easy to create groups and organize contacts. Within the message itself, I like that you are able to easily add people to the conversation and start video calls.
reviews.cons: I dont really have a con for this software. I have not really figured out a use for the "draw a message" tool. Other than that, I think GChat is easy to use and is a great value for the price.

reviews.title: “Chit Chat Time”
reviews.text: Overall, my experience with Chat is great and is a much better alternative to just texting.
reviews.pros: I love Google Chat because it helps me easily communicate with my internal team for my business. I can also easily google mail search topics and conversations that include the Chats.
reviews.cons: I don't like the fact that its a bit difficult to copy multiple messages at once within the app. It only let's you copy one "dialogue" box a at time.

reviews.title: “Let's find out”
reviews.text: online communication and passing awareness to clients
reviews.pros: Good and easy to use for one to group messages
reviews.cons: Pop-up texts(messages) can disturb sometimes

reviews.title: “Chat is Clutch”
reviews.text: I'm solving issues minute by minute with Chat! It's super helpful for my team.
reviews.pros: I use Google Chat every day to converse with my co-workers and keep workflows going. The functionality within Gmail is extremely useful, as we can pass along links to Google Drive and other Google software within the chat window.
reviews.cons: Honestly, this software is amazing. I think the thing I like least is that I use it for personal chat as well!

reviews.title: “Google chat for home and work”
reviews.pros: I love the ease of use, the easy deployment of the program, and how widely connected you can be.
reviews.cons: File sharing is practically non-existent.

reviews.title: “Great messaging tool along with Gmail”
reviews.text: As a whole, this a great messaging tool for everyone specially gmail is a well know email server and if you already have one, google chat is one click away.
reviews.pros: When in PC, this can be access along when you access gmail account. I am surprised that this allow to communicate with corporate google account against personal one.
reviews.cons: The outdated UI under mobile application. The effects and other feature is a bit turn off while using the app.

reviews.title: “Better than texting”
reviews.pros: This is my go-to for all communication things. Friends, family, co-workers. It's so much better to communicate through this the Chat program on Google than anywhere else! It's easy, you can customize it pretty well, which I love to do.
reviews.cons: There are some weird glitches here and there. Sometimes what shows up on my phone, won't show up on the computer for a bit. I'll have to restart the program.

reviews.title: “Totally Recommended if you are a Gmail user. ”
reviews.pros:
Its very easy to use.
If you use Gmail for your work then Google chat is very helpful to work with colleagues.
easy access to google meet if want to meeting with colleagues.
reviews.cons: popup at bottom on Gmail was a good option. I could chat while checking emails and other things. I'm really missing it. otherwise everything is good

reviews.title: “The closest thing we have to AIM!”
reviews.text: Excellent way to stay in touch with friends
reviews.pros: Easy and familiar functionality. I love that the chat logs are automatically stored and searchable within my Google inbox when I need to reference things back.
reviews.cons: I wish the conversations could be organized by day, hour, etc or over any sort of time period. The interface can make one long rolling conversation hard to sift through. Just a minor complaint.

reviews.title: “Great software but outdated”
reviews.text: I loved the software but highly think that it was not made for large groups or companies. If you run a small company or group, I would recommend you get this software.
reviews.pros:
1. I like that it integrates with Gmail and Google Calendar. 
2.  compared to other similar soft wares that charge, google hangouts allows Screen sharing for free. 
3. Its great for internal conversation within the company.
4. Its very easy for one to set up and use.
reviews.cons: What i like least about the software is that it requires a very stable and high bandwidth for it to be used, otherwise the quality will be poor.

reviews.title: “Chat is Amazing!”
reviews.text: Great! I am a big fan and recommend it to anyone considering it.
reviews.pros: I love the chat feature through Gmail. It makes it so easy to communicate with other departments or people in the company. Working for a large org like Groupon it is a daily necessity!
reviews.cons: There is nothing I do not like about it. If anything something it is spotty but that is purely based on internet connection and not the feature itself.

reviews.title: “Google Chat During a Virtual Era”
reviews.pros: We had GSuite at my last job and as a marketing team, we worked remotely for a time during the pandemic. We kept in contact easily by utilizing Google Chat. Just popping on and asking a simple question and getting a quick answer back was very crucial.
reviews.cons: No cons on my side! Absolutely love using this software.

reviews.title: “The whole Google Workspace ecosystem works like charm”
reviews.text: Using it as part of the Google Workspace and partners love it. It's just very well thought and implemented. The integrations are phenomenal. Strongly recommend it.
reviews.pros: Integrated in the Google products, user-friendly, robust, great for remote work and tasks, great with Google Spaces, absolutely fantastic integration with Google products, makes life much easier.
reviews.cons: Nothing really, keep up with the great work with this software!

reviews.title: “A Great Chat Solution”
reviews.pros: Google Chat is very easy to use and a nice way to keep up with what other people are doing on your team. I can create groups depending on projects or teams. It's easy to use within email and you can search your chats later too.
reviews.cons: Sometimes I don't notice that I've received a chat message until later. I might just need to change a setting, but I don't feel like I'm always notified.

reviews.title: “I really like Google Hangouts”
reviews.pros: A good tool for any user like Google Hangouts can also be used as a chatting application instead of just web conferencing.
reviews.cons: Nothing much to tell about its cons cause I'm still using Google Hangouts and didn't faced any issues yet.

reviews.title: “Love hangouts but lacks in updates”
reviews.text: Google hangouts is so popular but is behind on modern updates.
reviews.pros: I love this software. My closest friends use it and it's just better than texting to be honest. Maybe it's because we've used it for over 10 years, but it's a great option to chat with your friends while working at the same point and not having to look at my phone.
reviews.cons: Hangouts is great, but it needs updates! It feels like the developers barely update this program and I know SO MANY people use it. First of all, PLEASE let us delete chats if we mistype/mischat. I do this all the time and it's so frustrating. Second, would love to update to where the user has the ability to "love" "like" etc on chats.

reviews.title: “Couldn't work without it”
reviews.pros: It makes it so easy to have quick conversations. I never have issues with it not working or a lost connection.
reviews.cons: There is only one thing I'd change. If you create a group chat, I wish it recognized if you already have a chat open with those same people. It creates a new group and doesn't recognize previous chats. You have to go back to find and click on the chat in your messages.

reviews.title: “Stay Connected with Colleagues!”
reviews.text: Due to not having to set up as many meetings or make phone calls, my work through the day is seamless. I can communicate my progress and ask questions, and those I'm trying to get  ahold of can use this tool like a texting feature and can communicate when it's best for them. If I can't respond back, this tool is not disruptive and I don't feel like I need to put everything down to respond.
reviews.pros: I love that I can be working on several different projects and can instantly communicate with colleagues or teammates about those projects, or ask my supervisors a quick question without picking up the phone. With how quickly everything moves in my office, the ability to connect quickly with those I work with is incredibly necessary. Google Chat/Hangouts makes it easy to not forgot about things and helps me work with fewer meetings/phone calls interrupting the flow.
reviews.cons: I can't think of anything I don't love! I'd say that the group hangout feature could be easy to use but even that's not super hard to figure out.

reviews.title: “A communication product as it's meant to be”
reviews.text: A quick, reliable and easy interface and system to interact with my customers - at a price point that works for me. Can't beat that. As a communication tool/product/service, this is exactly what I was looking for.
reviews.pros: I am about as "technologically challenged" as is possible to be in 2022 and even I found setting this up and using it to be quick and easy.
reviews.cons: Nothing missing that has jumped out at me, but then again, I'm using this as a one person business so I can't speak to any issues that might be relevant to teams or multiple users.

reviews.title: “Can use for quick chat and collaboration on project with client or team members”
reviews.text: Overall an ok software to use to connect for project discussions especially with yoru clients
reviews.pros: It is easy to have a quick chat with your Google contacts to collaborate on a project , or have a quick call with your client to discuss about the project requirements. Easy to use for instant messaging and video conferencing
reviews.cons: The chats are not end to end encrypted which is a big downside. Also soon hangouts will be discontinued and replaced by google meets for chats ad meetings

reviews.title: “Communicate with Ease”
reviews.text: When working remotely it was key to keeping in touch with people in the office in real time.
reviews.pros: Google Chat is a convenient way to quickly and easily communicate with people while continuing to attend a meeting or work.
reviews.cons: Not everyone using the notification setting feature.

reviews.title: “Basic chat with poor extra functionalities”
reviews.text: Easy to use and keep track of your conversations, but with few extra options, like native Gmail integration
reviews.pros: Easy to use and keep track of your conversations, since you're already inside your email, whats make easy to be multi-task
reviews.cons: Besides its accomplish its main objective that is a good chat experience, it could have more options, like better emojis, and maybe a better native integration with Gmail.

reviews.title: “The best platform to send instant messages without leaving one of the most used email services!”
reviews.text: If you're a Gmail user, Chat should undoubtedly be a tool for you!
reviews.pros: The ability for us to be able to write messages, send photos or even files through this tool provided in Gmail is simply extraordinary. The ability to multitask is only claimed by Google with the availability of this service.
reviews.cons: The message reading notifications is one of the few things we can criticize with this service. Also, it would be great if Hangouts could be completely replaced by Chat, without forgetting the APIs and other stuff.

reviews.title: “Gchat at work”
reviews.text: fairly simple, we use it when we need to contact someone quickly. for example, if I am on a phone call with a customer and they are asking a question and I need support on it.
reviews.pros: it works instantly, you know the other person has seen/ been alerted straight away, they don't have to open an email or another app to see it
reviews.cons: I feel like they keep changing the interface, so I'm always trying to figure out how to use it again, it's always simple-ish, but if it's changing, I need to stop and focus and learn it again which can be annoying

reviews.title: “G Chat”
reviews.text: G Chat has allowed me to connect with individuals at any time without bothering them with a phone call or text. Information can be exchanged quickly, including pictures and attachments.
reviews.pros: That I can easily chat with friends and colleagues. The exchanges are quick and I can review past conversations.
reviews.cons: It can be confusing when you request a friend to have a conversation with you if they actually get the invite or not.

reviews.title: “G Chat Is A Great Chat Tool For G Suite Users”
reviews.text: It's been great since there is no real need to install anything. It just works on the web
reviews.pros: We love that G Chat is included as part of G Suite.  All of our users have it and it is easy to access from the web.  No additional software to download
reviews.cons: I wish there was a better notification system.  Something that lived in the status bar up top on the Mac that would tell us if you have unread messages

reviews.title: “Great team intercommunication tool to save email space! ”
reviews.text: Quick and easy chat service for team members.
reviews.pros: Quick, easy chat facility as an added feature to GSuite which allows you to communicate with other team members without need for email.
reviews.cons: It has been known to distract staff with recreational chat which is a pain and obviously decreases efficiency - as long as this is monitored and you can trust staff to keep a minimum not a problem.

reviews.title: “Google Chat : A great way to keep connected in the workplace”
reviews.text: Overall experience is fair, however, Google has more room to improve a number of bits and pieces and make of Google chat an amazing collaboration and chat communication platform.
reviews.pros: Google chat not only integrates with all the google products, you don't have to acquire more skills specific to Google chat, all you need is a device (mobile, desktop or laptop) connecter to internet, and you're good to go.
reviews.cons: What I did not like is that if you have other google IM products, you can get duplicate notifications (ie: google hangouts) Google needed to look into the possiblity of providing one unique notification.

reviews.title: “Perfect for organisations!”
reviews.pros: Easy to use and perfect application for when wanting to stay online on the move. Ability to send all forms of media really good for sending needed documents.
reviews.cons: No integration into other softwares, one downside to application.

reviews.title: “Google Chat keeps us together!”
reviews.text: Business problems have been solved!
reviews.pros: Google Chat keeps my entire team connected the entire day with ease! We love how instant the chat is and how quickly we can respond to urgent requests or GIFs!
reviews.cons: It integrates well with google websites but it a bit tougher when also using Microsoft or Apple products.

reviews.title: “Good  for secular users.”
reviews.pros: Simplicity. Minimum functionality. Good  for secular.
reviews.cons:
I observed some issue's, there was situations when on group some users receive messages with delay.
Not intuitive searching

reviews.title: “Simple messaging software”
reviews.text: Google Hangouts is a messaging app that focuses on simplicity. It can be a decent handy option for messaging through most platforms.
reviews.pros: Google Hangouts works cross-platform, all conversations are cloud synchronized. Calling and chatting in groups/individual conversations are possible through most of the devices. Attachments, stickers/emojis, and other general features make it a decent messaging option. Conversations can be organized with groups and contacts.
reviews.cons: Many advanced features are missing, compared to various other messaging software. Deep customization options, themes, chat wallpapers, contact separation, message editing/replies, message reactions, location/other content sharing, chat group administration functionalities are missing.

reviews.title: “Subpar product”
reviews.text: It was fine to use in a pinch, especially because the cost was included in our google suite already. But it made our team look rag-tag instead of professional, compared to other products.
reviews.pros: It's easy to use and share a link if you are already logged into google suite. One of the easiest features is when integrating with Google Calendar, a Hangout link can be immediately generated within a google calendar invite. So you don't have to go through an additional step or service to set up a link.

reviews.title: “Easy to communicate with ”
reviews.text: I use Gchat to communicate very often and find it very convenient that I can use it both on the laptop and mobile app! That way when I am away from my desk I don't miss a message
reviews.pros: I like that it's easy to use both on the computer and vía mobile app
reviews.cons: I didn't find any problems with Gchat besides that I would like missed messages to be sent via email

reviews.title: “G Chat is great”
reviews.pros: I like being able to chat with office co-workers or anyone outside of the office from my computer.  It allows for ease of flow for quick work-related questions or a side chat that you do not want to announce to the entire office.
reviews.cons: Honestly, there is nothing I can say that I do not like about the software.

reviews.title: “A very simple way to chat”
reviews.pros: A simple way to chat with your google contacts. Actually you can address to your contacts directly from your email page.
reviews.cons: Not very popular. The app is a bit outdated, not too many features.

reviews.title: “Fast and powerful tool for daily Calls & IM”
reviews.pros: The tool is easy to deploy. It is very fast tool even if you add multiple users to conferences, calls or chat groups. It has good options for customizing the look, settings , etc.  It is an advantage that the tools has a mobile version.
reviews.cons: There are sometimes compability issues with the Google Meet tool.

reviews.title: “G-Chat, The Best Way to Communicate!”
reviews.pros: G-chat is the easiest and fastest way to communicate with colleagues across the campus. It is highly effective. I also love the fact that I can hide my availability.
reviews.cons: I personally have not encountered any issues with G-Chat for the past three years that I have been using it as a way of communication.

reviews.title: “Review for Google Hangouts”
reviews.text: I recorded a video on my channel explaining the application and I noticed that in large numbers it asks and repeats the same questions, its interface is not smooth enough, and, God willing, we are waiting for the next developments or updates to be better
reviews.pros: Making groups within the application and at the same time is very useful for making online lessons and explanations, the speed of sending messages, the application supports 2G, 3G, 4G, 5G technology
reviews.cons: The difficulty of urban work, as well as the difficulty of canceling urban work, the application is complex and difficult for ordinary people to use easily, and also the inability to delete messages permanently, in addition to the application lacks development

reviews.title: “Google chat review ”
reviews.text: 10/10 experience and would use again
reviews.pros: How easy it was to connect with other users as well as all the functions within the software.
reviews.cons: Not all messages that came in were alerted so I wasn’t able to receive them in a timely manner.

reviews.title: “Google chat product reviews”
reviews.text: Awesome, just awesome everything works well
reviews.pros: Ease of communication with other team members
reviews.cons: The software is a little complicated and difficult to understand

reviews.title: “Google Hangouts is so great for quick messaging!”
reviews.pros: I love how simple and concise this software is to use. I use it daily within the office to contact my fellow employees if I need a quick answer.
reviews.cons: It is very extremely limited in features as it is more meant for personal use.

reviews.title: “Far below what you would expect from Google”
reviews.pros: There has recently been a stronger integration of Google Chat into the Gmail mobile app, which was sorely needed after a long period of ignoring that issue.
reviews.cons: This was a pain to use in every way at the time it was a regular part of my use. Outside parties defaulted to it because it wasn't social media and it was embedded in Gmail, but it was only easy to use on a desktop or laptop computer. Mobile use was very difficult, and notifications wouldn't always come through. There have been improvements lately, but I have since switched over to WhatsApp for communication.

reviews.title: “Good tool for real time chats”
reviews.text: I use it for real-time conversations with clients, especially when I am working out of the office. It works very well for what I need, meaning mainly instant exchanges of messages.
reviews.pros: It's light and easy to use. Fast to configure and very reliable. It keeps the history of the communications so I always know what I have already shared or written.
reviews.cons: I cannot share some specific kinds of files so experience might be a bit limiting sometimes. However, for working purposes, it's very good

reviews.title: “While working I coordinate with dozens of customers through texting.”
reviews.text: Quick access to a communication platform that allows me to contact dozens of clients within seconds.
reviews.pros: I love that I can easily get a number to for calling and texting for free. It's nice to have a business phone number that I can freely use for business interactions and isolate my personal business from my work. Having the two lives split is very helpful.
reviews.cons: I wish that I could tab between different conversations. Currently I have to manually grab my mouse and then click when I want to switch from one conversation to the next conversation. I would really enjoy being able to switch conversations by simply pressing the tab key.

reviews.title: “Chat to Chat for Business”
reviews.pros: Love that in integrates with our email system and there is an app for it. I can always be online for my team even when I am not physically in the office. Additionally pro is you can choose to record and log chats or turn the transcription off.
reviews.cons: Sometimes it is clunky in my email but overall fine.

reviews.title: “Great Communicator and Collaborative App to Interact with Team Members ”
reviews.text: It is very well experience with Google chat we are having while working and also its features are very useful to getting interaction with members of your group.
reviews.pros: This chat application is very design and easily get interaction with team mates, It is also having very interactive feature to chat and also having fun with work.
reviews.cons: Most annoying feature is it does not show the groups created in hangouts dashboard. Integration of scheduler and calendar similar to other communication platforms.

reviews.title: “Connect with google chat ”
reviews.text: My overall experience about google chat is positive. Like other google apps If we have a  google account we can easily access for it.
reviews.pros: Like other google products Google chat has a user friendly interface. If we want to chat with more than one people we can simply create a room. Also it has ability to share documents and get video calls easily. If we have to  use chat frequently, we can pin it and it saves our time.
reviews.cons: Actually nothing to say about major issues. I’m not happy with their old version because there were some feature limitations. But in the new version some problems were solved. new version is really good than old one.

reviews.title: “Google Chat for Business ”
reviews.text: Overall, we are very happy with this product, and will continue using it.
reviews.pros: We use google chat constantly. It is a great source of communication within our company. Our employees are spread out across ~3 acres so being able to communicate while property is very important. I love that the chat will tell you if the user is active, or the last time they were active. It will also email the receiver if the individual is not at their desk and able to receive chats.
reviews.cons: I think there should be a time out feature. If a user is not actively using their email, the chat should say they are unavailable. We have had individuals leave their emails/chat up for hours, and the chat said they were still active.

reviews.title: “Tool that reduces distance”
reviews.text:
My experience with Hangouts was very smooth. During the pandemic, I held meetings with supervisors through videos and also communicated with my grandparents in the countryside who couldn't leave the house.
I found it to be an easier and more practical tool than Skype.
reviews.pros: As it is a tool already linked to Google and its contacts, it is much easier for everyone to use. Not to mention that it is very simple and intuitive and hardly anyone will not be able to use it. Another good point is that in addition to being free, there are no annoying premium account advertisements, etc.
reviews.cons: I haven't had any issues with Hangouts so far. I've heard that it crashes, but it never happened to me, so I suppose the person must have a basic internet connection.

reviews.title: “Good way to share content/communicate”
reviews.text: Used for collaboration on presentation materials.
reviews.pros: The interface of google chat is probably what I like most about the program. It's an intuitive, clean design, much like the Gmail interface. I appreciate that it's easy to start/set up. It's easy to see which colleagues are online, set up different "teams" and name them to set up different conversations. You can also share visual content/links appear as images much like facebook. The integration with Google sheets/docs etc. make it easier to collaborate and therefore superior to slack.
reviews.cons: The advantages also ironically present disadvantage - the lack of desktop application and the fact that it is so synced up with Google/online account. You might risk sharing your inbox when launching it publically to work on something with a team. It's a relatively minor "con," compared to all the "pros."

reviews.title: “Stable but needs UI improvements and better integration. ”
reviews.text: Overall it works and I’ve never seen it go down. I’ve used multiple other messaging apps and hangouts seems to be the most stable.
reviews.pros: I like how it integrates seamlessly with other google products like google drive and google documents. I also feel like it’s a very stable product.
reviews.cons: The UI and integration is lacking. While hangout has a full app for iPhone it uses a workaround sudo-app for iMac. I would rather see a full stand alone app for Mac. Also, the fact the hangouts runs integrated in browser is fine for most people but for someone who often closes or minimizes the browser I end up losing track of my chats. This is why I opt to using the sudo-app and iPhone app.

reviews.title: “I love all google products”
reviews.text: Every day I solve small and fast work things through it.
reviews.pros: The google products make my daily life a lot easier, especially the chat tool. I can quickly get in touch with my co-workers without losing focus.
reviews.cons: I don't particularly like the interface, especially in the mobile version. I find the elements a bit lost.

reviews.title: “Lightweight Chat Tool”
reviews.pros: I like that on my computer, the app lies within gmail. One less browser tab open. It's easy to use and add people. You can include images. Lightweight chat tool that also runs well on the Android phone app.
reviews.cons: I wish that it had more emojis and shortcuts for finding emojis (or at least a search).

reviews.title: “Easy to communicate way”
reviews.text: Great experience
reviews.pros: I like this system for easy communication which helps for immediate attention from the person you would like to connect in case other ways are hard to reach. You need to simply ping the person and you can add multiple person in the list. Also, you can connect for voice and video call and internationally. Very convenient way to connect with people. Also, you can have it via your phone, laptop and any other type of device.
reviews.cons: The issue I face in case of internet speed whenever it is slow we struggled to connect.

reviews.title: “Free messages, video and voice!”
reviews.text: Easy to use to register. You can do free group video meeting.
reviews.pros: Use hangouts to keep intouch with your friedns and college to doing bussines. And you can do free video call group meeting up to 10 people. Easy to resgister especially for user android by google mail. You can connect across your chat into hangouts apps
reviews.cons: Size of this apps has big size for smartphone that has small RAM. Some other calls might be not free, but call to same hangouts users will be free.

reviews.title: “Faster way to communicate with the team”
reviews.text: Best tool to communicate with the whole team.
reviews.pros: Google Chat is really amazing especially when pandemic hit, our team communicated well and fast using google chat. It is super easy to use and you can create multiple group chats. The best feature is you can turn off the conversation history
reviews.cons: NONE! It's been really amazing tool and I haven't encounter anything that I can complain about.

reviews.title: “Best team chat app”
reviews.text: We use the whole google suite as the business felt if performed better than MS365 suite of cloud products
reviews.pros: The chat rooms are fantastic, easy to navigate between, nicely laid out great with screen sharing better than MS Teams in my opinion.
reviews.cons: If possible the only thing that would improve the product would be a facility to merge separate chats into one rather than sending a new link.  Not sure if this is actually possible though!

reviews.title: “Google Chat is a lifesaver!”
reviews.pros: Google Chat is a lifesaver, and everyone I know uses it all day long at the office.  It's excellent for keeping in touch with people with short, quick messages.
reviews.cons: It'd be nice if there were a few more features, but I can't say that I have too many complaints about a great and useful little tool.

reviews.title: “Could do better. Not the best chat app I've used.”
reviews.text: I feel Google Chat has a lot of room to improve.
reviews.pros: I was introduced to Chat by Google few months back. First impressions: it looked better than the last chat application I was using. It has a beautiful interface. Best feature I would say is it's bots. Google has a well documented articles on how to create bots for Chat as well. Its easy to deploy the code using the Google cloud. You dont even need an editor. You can use the online editor provided by Google. It implores developers like me to delve into developing bots to use perhaps to help teams manage tasks, etc.
reviews.cons: Its when I started using the app I saw it was a bit lackluster. Developing bots was easy but using them felt like spamming in a group chat. Found some bugs. Like when I have the desktop app on. If I have my Gmail open I still get the hangouts chat window popping up. Also had issues where the app crashed when I was updating. It should have better integration with other Google apps like maybe the tasks which shows up on Gmail.

reviews.title: “Google Chat Is Where It's @”
reviews.text: Google Chat came to my rescue when I was travelling through the northern parts of Africa and I didn't have a functioning smart phone to communicate with. I knew that all of the people I wanted to communicate with had Google accounts so from my laptop I was able to reach them in this way and it felt like I was using a sophisticated version of WhatsApp to be quite honest.
reviews.pros: Whether you're doing private messaging or creating a room for a group of people, Google Chat will get your messages across swiftly and safely. With its clean, minimalist  user interface and its easy to use approach to everything you interact with, I always wonder why more people aren't using it
reviews.cons: The only con I can think of is that "smart compose" function that sums up what I want to reply back to the person I'm talking to. I feel as though it's dumbing down my conversation with its "summary reply" that is usually no longer than 4 words.

reviews.title: “Great Chat Service”
reviews.text: It's a useful tool as long as you don't need power features.
reviews.pros: It integrates directly into our gmail so when our employees need to chat with each other they don't need to open up anything else.
reviews.cons: It lacks some features that more powerful services like slack and discord have like task sharing and read receipts.

reviews.title: “Excelente”
reviews.text: Me gusta contactar con clientes de otros países a través de Google Hangouts, de hecho son ellos los que prefieren esta forma de comunicación ya que es por medio del gmail por donde me contactan, generalmente. Es una excelente herramienta de trabajo para mi, fácil y sencilla.
reviews.pros: Me gusta mucho porque está enlazado con el gmail y no necesito compartir mi número de teléfono. No solo tengo acceso a través de una PC sino que también tiene una aplicación para teléfonos inteligentes muy sencilla y fácil de usar.  Se pueden hacer videollamadas y enviar invitaciones a través de un enlace y compartirlo por correo electrónico.
reviews.cons: No hay nada que no me guste o me guste menos, creo que cumple con lo que promete.

reviews.title: “If you don't have slack you need to be using G chat”
reviews.text: Really like the platform and that it reduces the amount of internal email at the org.
reviews.pros: Great for constant contact with coworkers and is embedded in Gmail where I work for most of my day. Reduces internal emails significantly.
reviews.cons: Nothing wrong with the platform or anything I dislike. Quick and easy communication.

reviews.title: “A perfect solution for small to large businesses”
reviews.pros: I love the simplicity of use, the fact that it's synced to your Google account and everything is searchable from Gmail
reviews.cons: Lacks pro features threading and commenting on messages

reviews.title: “Perfect ”
reviews.pros: I have always used chat to ask general questions, but since working from home it is a life saver for keeping in contact with colleagues
reviews.cons: only con is sometime it doesn't notify of a new chat unless you can see the persons name is highlighted in white

reviews.title: “Google nail it again!”
reviews.text: Fun, quick, easy - would recommend to all businesses
reviews.pros: Chat from G Suite makes it so quick and easy to chat to colleagues - forget clunky emails when you just need to ask a simple message!
reviews.cons: There is no downside to this at all, maybe only that it can be slightly distracting at times, but otherwise great.

reviews.title: “Stay Connected With All Your Google Contacts”
reviews.text: It is good to have one on your monitor always, to stay connected with your colleagues for instant chats.
reviews.pros:
1. Simple and easy to Use interface. 
2. Easy access via Gmail also. 
3. Connectivity is good and real time chat. 
4. Good internet speed is not required. 
5. Options like spaces- create or browse
6. Shows online status.
7. Importing or exporting files is easy.
reviews.cons: Notifications are irritating sometimes. Unable to dock chats.

reviews.title: “Google Chat is one of the team collaboration Chat based Application”
reviews.text: Overall Google Chat is a powerful tool but it needs some revamp to add value to users as user like more comfort and flexiblity.
reviews.pros: Google Chat is provided directly by google so it has a good google ecosystem attached to it and it is powerful in terms of usability and not as expensive as we can get it with the google workspace package.
reviews.cons: Google Chat's downsides are its usability - it is not so user-friendly and it's not even available as an offline application which is a major reason I switched to another app.

reviews.title: “Simple, aesthetically-pleasing chat tool”
reviews.text: I use this every day to chat with coworkers and freelance clients. It's easy and always accessible.
reviews.pros: I love how simple it is and that it can be used on its own or when you have your email open. Having it readily accessible in so many spaces is really awesome to me.
reviews.cons: For whatever reason, sometimes I miss the notifications that I have a message if I'm using it just in my email. I think there should be a more prominent notification/ reminder of a missed message.

reviews.title: “great for friends not for team communication ”
reviews.pros: This is a great option to have for friends, group chats etc, but when working I would prefer something that is a bit more organized.
reviews.cons: They could improve the way that the chats flow, organization.

reviews.title: “Google Chat”
reviews.text: Overall Google Chat is efficient and makes it easy to quickly communicate.
reviews.pros: I like that Google Chat is integrated with Gmail making it easy to chat with colleagues throughout the day.
reviews.cons: It can be easy to miss a chat message if  one doesn't initially see the message come in. Search can also be challenging.

reviews.title: “I love Google Chat!”
reviews.pros: It's very easy to use as it's visible with my gmail as well. Me and my team (of about 12) utilize G chat all day every day and enjoy it very much! I like that you can see the other person has read your message and can see who is typing in response in both DMs and the group chat.
reviews.cons: I don't love how on the Gmail app the group chats and DMs are separated. I liked before when you can see both group chats and direct messages in the same queue rather than switching back and forth.

reviews.title: “Simpe but great messaging tool for teams and individuals”
reviews.pros: Its seamless integration with other Google products like Google Drive and Google Documents is something I appreciate. It seems to me to be a fairly stable product as well.
reviews.cons: For the conversation to be even more entertaining, there ought to be more shortcuts. Another significant issue with this is the file upload size limit.

reviews.title: “Simple yet Essential”
reviews.pros: I appreciate the simplicity and ease of use. I appreciate the email reminds for messages not "read"
reviews.cons: There used to be a feature to be able to pop out the chat screen out of the browser/whole webpage, but that feature is now gone. Please bring that back. It was nice to be able to keep a small chat thread in the corner of my workspace to easily chat. Now I have to find the webpage and it's not as convenient.

reviews.title: “Great messaging software”
reviews.text: I'm able to efficiently communicate with the people on my team.
reviews.pros: Use on a daily basis for quickly communicating with my employees about team updates or to ask them questions about their numbers.
reviews.cons: Sometimes takes a long time to load after already being signed into my Gmail account for several minutes.

reviews.title: “Keep track of everyone in one place”
reviews.pros: With all the different chat apps out ther, google chat is great for keeping everyone in the loop. User friendly design allows for teams and service providers to always be on the same page
reviews.cons: Having to invite people to chat, can mean waiting a bit for the initial conversation to start.

reviews.title: “googlechat”
reviews.pros: love using google chat. I dont want to share my personal chat (Facebook) with business associates so this is perfect
reviews.cons: cant attach videos or large photos and i send them

reviews.title: “Great for team communication”
reviews.pros: I communicate with my team and other departments through chat more than any other outlet. Makes it easy to stay connected and know when someone is online
reviews.cons: I really don’t like how it will only send you notifications on one device at a time. Sometimes I like to gmail open on multiple computers but it will only send me  notifications on one desktop at a time

reviews.title: “Easiest to use if you have Android, Super Cute emojis”
reviews.text: Overall my experience has been positive. It's helpful and useful.
reviews.pros: What I like the most about G-Chat is that it's completely integrated within the whole Google suite and you can very easily drag and send files that are already part of the Google cloud. Most people have a Gmail account these days so this is sometimes the best way to get hold of someone if they happen to use Gmail as their preferred way of being in contact.  Also, I love the classic limited set of emojis---it's simple and cute.
reviews.cons: I don't think enough people use it---especially women. There's something about the design of g-chat that gives off a "tech bro-vibe" and I feel can deter/intimidate people from using.

reviews.title: “Review for Google Chat”
reviews.pros: Google Chat is my favorite tool to have daily communications with my colleagues. I have been using it for almost a year now and I am fully satisfied with its functionality. There are so many things that I love about the software. The thing that I love most about the software is its simplicity. I cannot imagine a simpler chat tool than Google Chat. It only takes you a few seconds to create an account if you already have a google account. The main reason why I prefer Chat to its alternatives is that it never slows you down even when you have multiple apps run in background. It always runs smoothly and saves you a lot of time unlike its alternatives out there.
reviews.cons: The only thing that I dislike about the tool is that sometimes it shows some of your contacts as "available/online" even though they are not. Therefore, you might stay in front of your computer waiting for an answer from your colleague because the tool shows them as available even though they are offline.

reviews.title: “Easy Chat Anywhere”
reviews.text: My overall experience has been great with this software easy to use and can be used on multiple devices at home & on the go perfect for any business.
reviews.pros: I can use this software on my phone or PC this is great dude I'm always on the go.
reviews.cons: I can't say nothing bad I use this software for personal and business it's awesome.

reviews.title: “Best chat on the market”
reviews.text: The chat helped in the organization of the company's internal processes quickly and efficiently and the main one in an organized way.
reviews.pros: User-friendly product and easy to implement. All of the team get used to it quickly.
reviews.cons: The only aspect missing from the product is the ability to send multiple files at the same time.

reviews.title: “Perfect and familiar”
reviews.pros: I love Chat/Hangouts; it's by far my first "go-to" app for chatting with family, friends, and colleagues. Hope Google doesn't retire it because it's the easiest and most familiar way to keep in touch with people.
reviews.cons: Really, nothing. It does absolutely everything it's supposed to.

reviews.title: “Many areas of opportunity. Better look elsewhere ”
reviews.pros: Google suite integration is what I liked the most about this software.
reviews.cons: The threads functionality is almost non existent. Very hard to find chats and pinning messages just does not work

reviews.title: “Very interesting and easy to use software”
reviews.pros:
I use this product every day in our company.
It is a simple product to use, and offers a lot of features.
It allows you to easily get in touch with your internal employees.
What I like most is the ability to edit a message, even if it's already sent.
reviews.cons:
I have no problem with this product. It is very easy to use, simplifies things, and is easy to use on all devices.
In addition to that, it can be sync with Hangout, Meet and Gmail

reviews.title: “Google Chatters”
reviews.pros: Utilized the same software application like iMessages.
reviews.cons: Some applications were not is use or were slow to utilize.

reviews.title: “Just Like the Good Old Days”
reviews.pros: Google's chat function takes you way back to the good old days of AOL Instant Messenger, where you are able to chat with others in your network directly from your email inbox. It is a useful way to communicate electronically in real time with colleagues, though generally formal communication is still conducted over email. From the chat, you can also directly audio or video call through Google.
reviews.cons: Google maintains a running history of your conversation (though there is a way to turn that off) and chats stay in your sidebar forever unless you archive them. There's no way to print or save individual conversations. This is really a casual communication tool.

reviews.title: “Perfect instant messenger”
reviews.pros:
I use this on a daily basis with my colleagues. This is easiest tool I've ever used
features integration to add the files, meeting links.. makes it more easier to use
reviews.cons: NO cons. Few years ago there were no features to add the images, attachments. NOW they were taken care of.

reviews.title: “Great For Chat and Video!”
reviews.text: I use Google chat for conversations with friends. I love the video feature as well.
reviews.pros: Almost everyone uses Google so this is a great option to do a quick chat and video. Highly recommended for Android users as an alternative to FaceTime.
reviews.cons: It would be great if you could delete individual messages.

reviews.title: “Google Chat for Advertising Agency”
reviews.text: We use this as a way to communicate across agencies when not everyone has access to Skype or other chat services
reviews.pros: Easy to use, short onboarding time, very intuitive platform that most people are already aware of
reviews.cons: Updates can occasionally throw off my personal configuration but otherwise it's great.

reviews.title: “Great for working from home ”
reviews.pros: Easy to use, easy to navigate, easy to turn on/off notifications, safe, no data security issues, messages save to gmail
reviews.cons: I really enjoyed hangouts so it’s definitely an adjustment. Doesn’t have all of the Easter eggs that hangouts had

reviews.title: “Google review”
reviews.text: Have been using this app for 2 or more now have no issue with it about community standard or none of that stuff it's a good app 👍
reviews.pros: The fact that when I send pictures the quality still remains the same it a 10/10 not like some other apps
reviews.cons: They should work on the video and voice call it should be at very top of each chats and also you can't delete already sent messages

reviews.title: “Good team chat application”
reviews.pros: If you work using Google applications, this is your perfect chat application. GSuite Chat allows you to share and create discussions with Docs, Sheets, and Slides. The application is available in Windows, Mac, Android and iOS. Has an easy integration with Google applications as Google Drive and Hangouts Meet.
reviews.cons: If your work environment is different than the Google file editors, I recommend to look for another application.

reviews.title: “Easily accessible to even the least tech-savvy users”
reviews.pros: If your office is like ours and relies heavily on the google suite, GChat has become an essential tool for daily communication. It's easy to use and options like group hangouts are just a simple click away.
reviews.cons: It would be helpful to allow attachments to be sent via GChat.

reviews.title: “Easy to use, simple and effective”
reviews.pros: it works straight from my browser, so Its one less alt+tab that I often need to do
reviews.cons: It doesnt have advanced features like zoom, its good for a basic call

reviews.title: “Google Chat Good Product”
reviews.text: Great experience overall! Good for both personal and business needs.
reviews.pros: I need to use Gmail for my work and chat is fully engrained with Gmail.
reviews.cons: Nothing.  It's been able to do everything I need - view others who are online, send links, change size of chat window, see chat history, etc...

reviews.title: “No frills chat”
reviews.pros: The biggest (and maybe only?) pro for the new Google Chat is the ability to add the Google Docs bot. Anytime someone sends you a google doc or requests access to one that you're the owner of, the bot will send you a message. It's nice for those of us that don't waste time checking their email every few minutes.
reviews.cons: The biggest con besides needing your email open to receive messages is that since changing from hangouts, the new chat windows show all text in the same color. This makes it harder to find the last time you sent a message so you know where to start reading. Another pain point is not being able to drag pictures into the chat window to send them anymore. Screenshotting something and then dragging it from the preview to the chat was something I did quite often in Hangouts but can't do here.

reviews.title: “review for google chat”
reviews.text: Its a great tool and it gets the job done. on top of that its free to use
reviews.pros: its really easy to setup and use. Once you have a google account you are good to go
reviews.cons: The fact that its limited to only google accounts. the user interface also does not seem to be stylish enough for a tech giant

reviews.title: “New Google CHAT for Gsuite ”
reviews.text: Early adoption participation is key.  Without it, its just a simple internal chat.  That works for some companies, but not most.  The tool itself is clean and the layout is easy to use.  Just waiting for Google to loosen the noose and allow other chat users that aren't on Google to participate in chats.
reviews.pros: Be an early adopter for updates and features.  This allows external chat, which is always a desired feature by end users.
reviews.cons: It only allows you to chat with other Gmail/Gsuite users.  Google is too restrictive on chat participants, which leaves people using other tools like RAMBOX to manage their chats and use accounts outside of the organization.

reviews.title: “One of the best options!”
reviews.text: I have used it sometimes years ago, but since 2020 I have to work on it many times, and now that I more familiar I really appreciate this Google chat, is awesome!
reviews.pros: It has almost everything, and is easy to understand.
reviews.cons: Customer service can improve. Sometimes they don't help you at all.

reviews.title: “Perfect Messaging Tool For Business”
reviews.text: My organization use Google chat to communicate with each other. Google chat allows us to great Groups for each department. Also from Google Chat we are able to view My Meetings and also create new Meetings
reviews.pros: Google chat is a very simple and easy to use chat service, Its available on all platform. With google chat you can reach your contact via Text, Voice or Video. With it desktop version you are able to change your notification tone and even set a different tone for Groups or individual
reviews.cons: There is nothing about Google Chat that i dont like

reviews.title: “Love all the additional features that make if feel just like texting ”
reviews.pros: I love the fun emojis and add on stickers. I use this on my computer and the message pops up when I receive it which makes sure I respond promptly.
reviews.cons: Everything is also saved in email format which is fine for my needs but not necessarily something I want or need?

reviews.title: “Chat is best internal communication messenger”
reviews.text: Overall best light weight software  for inter team communication, easy to install and use cost effective one.
reviews.pros: Google chat is very light weight and easy to use for all internal communications in teams.It makes team to be closer and helps in virtual meetings group chats and status check of Team progress.
reviews.cons: Google chat is very good communication tool, but sometime status will not impact sooner after logoff still will be shown as available.

reviews.title: “Part of the Google products this one is a real must”
reviews.text: Using it as part of the Google access through which the mailboxes are read and operated. It's really helping and super robust. I cannot imagine not using it together with other Google products.
reviews.pros: Connectedness with all Google products, very easy to use, excellent for remote work, excellent for teams, excellent for tasks and deadlines.
reviews.cons: Absolutely nothing. This software is a real gem!

reviews.title: “Google Hangouts”
reviews.text: It has a good interface that is integrated within your gmail which makes it easy to use for quick chatting and meeting purposes.
reviews.pros: I very much like to interface for scheduling quick meetings and communications.
reviews.cons: I have been using it for so long but I don't think it lacks any important feature.

reviews.title: “google chat”
reviews.text: Solid platform for chatting; no real complaints. Would just love some additions.
reviews.pros: I love the ease of use and how straightforward it is. I also like that you can talk to people outside of your organization if you want to. I also like how seamlessly u can go from mobile to desktop and back.
reviews.cons: I think it is missing a few functions for the group chat function. It would be nice to be able to @ someone like on slack or search for gifs.

reviews.title: “Convenient Team messaging tool”
reviews.text: We use this for all our internal communication with internal and external employees.
reviews.pros: Since our business is already using Gmail as our main means of sending emails, using Google Chat is easy and has no setup 'costs'. The mobile app is easy to use and the automatic integration with things liks Hangouts is very convenient.
reviews.cons: The only downside to this free-to-use chat integration is the fact that new messages are not displayed very prominently in Gmail. Often times I will send some chat messages to co-workers, that results in them not noticing it in Gmail unless they explicitly look.

reviews.title: “G chat is useful in the workplace”
reviews.text: My overall experience was a good one and I would say it is a good application to use in a business setting.
reviews.pros: G chat was very functional and useful when sending information to coworkers. It has an effective user interface and it is easy to send messages and see when you have received messages.
reviews.cons: The only problem I ran into was that it was hard to send pictures and screenshots sometimes which is something we do often in our line of work.

reviews.title: “Great Program for Work and Professional Development ”
reviews.text: Overall, a very positive experience. The app should be advertised better.
reviews.pros:
I use this program every day to collaborate with my team. It is easy to use and cost effective. 
I love the separate app that I downloaded on my phone. I turn notifications on and off depending on my office hours. 

The app is right in my email, so I can read emails and follow along in drafts while chatting.
reviews.cons:
I have trouble sending attachments on the chat and sending screen shots.  Many people don't know about or don't prefer to use this chat which is a shame because it really is easy to use. 

Please make it possible to write and see video calls as well (like the Appearin app).

reviews.title: “Google Chat Review”
reviews.pros: Google Chat is very User friendly and easy to log in to; we can chat with our friends from anywhere and on any mobile.
reviews.cons: The chat interface on Google Chat can be improved. Not all texts are sent every time. There won't be a chat notification for us.

reviews.title: “Video quality is not good”
reviews.text: Google hangouts is good for casual use cases and some work use cases.
reviews.pros:
* UI is better than zoom
* Backed by Google security
* Mobile support is great
* Also works for personal use case
reviews.cons:
* video quality is not good
* Was missing features like virtual backgrounds until recently
* Confusion between hangouts and meet

reviews.title: “Google Chat Review”
reviews.text: Great! Allows me to chat and video chat wherever and whenever.
reviews.pros: It allows me to connect quickly with my teammate.
reviews.cons: This software has no flaws that I have come across. It is very easy to navigate.

reviews.title: “Works great across multiple platforms!”
reviews.pros: This chat feature lets me stay connected with everyone on any device I'm on.  It works well on pc, mac, android, android wear and even with android auto.
reviews.cons: Only on occasion it does not let me know that I have a new message unless I open the app or window.

reviews.title: “Simple to use but can be confusing”
reviews.pros: I like that there are spaces inside of google chat. Compared to other messaging tools it seems like it is much better to use for those who are looking for a more organized chat box.
reviews.cons: I don't like that when reacting to a message I have to click on the message then click "Add reaction" before I am presented with ALL the emoji's. It should only be a few options and should appear as soon as I click on the message.

reviews.title: “Convenient social hangout at work”
reviews.pros: I like how convenient it is to use the software because I'm always logged into my Gmail account, checking emails. I can check who's online and offline without having to message them to find out. When I'm stuck in the office by myself, it also keeps me company and not let me feel so alone.
reviews.cons: Businesses don't use Google Chat as their main communication channel during work hours. This software is meant for friends and social gatherings, not really coworkers. I have not been using this software during work but I do use it when I get off work. It's not considered a very professional software to use.

reviews.title: “Google Chat Review”
reviews.text: Personally have a good experience with Google Chat.
reviews.pros: One of the best software for messaging in a collaborative environment.
reviews.cons: This software is flexible to use but sometimes may feel that the UI is not pleasing.

reviews.title: “Google Chat is a great feature that I enjoy using. ”
reviews.text: Love G chat
reviews.pros: I really like how easy it is to have a conversation via this tool. It enhances my day and makes it better.
reviews.cons: I don't like that it can be hard to add users and people sometimes do not know what I'm referring to when I mention Chat within Google.

reviews.title: “G Suite Chat allow me to stay connected to all of my friends and business contacts”
reviews.text: I am able to easily connect with my friends and professional contacts without the hassle of going through an email.
reviews.pros: G Suite is easy to use and allows me to seamlessly stay connected to my friends and professional contacts.
reviews.cons: I would like G Suite to integrate my iPhone contacts.

reviews.title: “Chat for That”
reviews.pros: We use Google Chat on a daily basis. It is quicker and more convenient than drafting an email and waiting for a response. The chat feature usually gets a quicker response.
reviews.cons: I use the web version of Google Chat but many people use the app. The web version does not have a notification like the app version.

reviews.title: “Not as good as slack for teams”
reviews.pros: If you're in the Google Business/Suite, you've already got it.
reviews.cons: It's not as good as something like Slack for teams and businesses.

reviews.title: “Google Chat”
reviews.text: Google Chat has been awesome in many ways and we all love it. I've been using it for just over a year and never had a problem.
reviews.pros: Google Chat is one of my favorite things as it is easy to talk to my colleagues and pass along information.
reviews.cons: No dislikes about this software. You can use it for your phone and computer.

reviews.title: “Cada actualización solo empeora...”
reviews.text: No llegan notificaciones, las columnas de grupos y chats son difíciles de usar.
reviews.pros: Vuelvan a orígenes...La simpleza de lo mejor...
reviews.cons: Era mucho mas fácil y simple el uso cuando era TALK, fácil de entender y comunicar las cosas

reviews.title: “Friendly UI and nice UX with Chat”
reviews.text: Overall, it is comfortable to use Chat for business or personal use with clear UI. Group chat with friends & family, and enjoy the great time.
reviews.pros: Able to add different reactions for people's messages. Add Google Drive link will connect to it directly without any problem. Drag and drop is very convenient for files upload.
reviews.cons: If we have a function that mute members in the meeting by the meeting organizer that would be great, the meeting won't get interrupted and delay the schedule. Hope Chat can improve their GIPHY, it shows the gif randomly and some gif are not appropriate for coworker to view. Drag and drop many files but it only allows to submit one file.

reviews.title: “Simple Messenger Service”
reviews.text: I use Hangouts daily as a sidekick to Microsoft Teams. I use it when I have to communicate quickly with team members and managers.
reviews.pros: Hangouts is extremely nimble and quick. There is never a delay or slowdown. The interface is minimal on purpose and the display is sparse. Despite the slim look it still offers the ability to add attachments or display an image or gif. There is also a palette of emojis.
reviews.cons: The emoji palette could be bigger. Add a search option for gifs and images. They can be attached right now but add a search function for them to be added while in the convo.

reviews.title: “Chat program”
reviews.pros: It is free and very easy to learn and use.
reviews.cons: I have not received any complains from users yet.

reviews.title: “Great tool for video chatting with friends and coworkers.”
reviews.text: I use Hangouts for a business that I am involved with outside of my main job. We use it for all of our meetings, including our weekly check-ins, and it always works well for us.
reviews.pros: Hangouts is very easy to use. Whenever I want to send an invite through Google calendar, I can easily add a Hangouts link as well as phone numbers for those who are not on a computer or laptop. The connection is also usually good and the ability to mute yourself and others in a nice touch.
reviews.cons: Apparently, Google Hangouts is not as secure as other video conference platforms like MS Teams. Because of this, my current workplace does not allow its use.

reviews.title: “The best chat app I ever worked with”
reviews.pros: Group chat is the functionality I like most.Installation and user interface are that simple.Best app for beginners too. The functionality of syncing with Gmail contacts is a great function.
reviews.cons: Pricing can be monthly rather than per user.Theme and color selection can be improved.

reviews.title: “Simple and straightforward”
reviews.text: Easy to use for chat, great and simple option to video chat and share screens built in as well
reviews.pros: Simple to use and connect with existing contacts
reviews.cons: Currently use in association with Google Chrome which can easily slow down other programs due to high memory demand

reviews.title: “Google Hangout is our new hangout place!”
reviews.text: Allows me to catch up with my friends through online! We use this when we do video call! This is all free so we maximize the use of it! Amazing sofware!
reviews.pros: Me and my friends use this when we want to to group video call! We also created a group chat where we can send photos and exchange convos! We use this because it sends notifications on our gmail when it is time for our hangout so no one forgets our scheduled time for video calling. This is a great software and make us feel professional in a way because everything is organized and formal!
reviews.cons: I do not have any complain about this software. It is all good and free!!!!

reviews.title: “Hangouts in Google chat”
reviews.pros: It features a great messaging platform where we can easily connect with our connections and history saving method was quite commendable, we can use stickers, GIF while sending a chat etc ., So we are in love with Google chat.
reviews.cons: It's user interface could be improved, And it should be having more notification tones.

reviews.title: “Great tool for promoting flexible team communication!”
reviews.text: I used Google Chat for quite a while, and I am happy to say I didn't have any issues with it. It's always been easy to use, doesn't crash, and connects me with my contacts quickly.
reviews.pros: One of my favorite things about Google Chat is that it's really easy to use. I was using another chat software before, and it was taking me hours to figure out how to switch between my conversations. With Google Chat, all you have to do is click on the conversation and the entire conversation appears on the screen. It's great!
reviews.cons: I have used a lot of chat programs in the past and I have to say Google Chat is one of my favorites. I like the way it integrates with all my other Google apps, not just chatting. The cons for me are that it's a bit slow on older phones and the fact that there is no draft folder when chatting with friends.

reviews.title: “Great video conferencing tool”
reviews.pros: It allows for easy collaboration on documents and projects as well as doing presentations virtually.
reviews.cons: It would be great to see a video share option to share a video or play a video and have the sound played to everyone in the meeting.

reviews.title: “Easiest communications tool”
reviews.text: Overall a good experience not to complicated
reviews.pros:
Easy set-up on device
Create different spaces for different teams
Clear split between individuals and groups
reviews.cons:
Split between individuals and groups not clear
Accidentally messages send

reviews.title: “Excellent product, lacks management features”
reviews.text: We cut down the amount of emails, giving the ability to collaborate from mobile too
reviews.pros: Chatrooms and bots are the real sh*t here! It helps cutting our email traffic and is a very nice way to communicate.
reviews.cons: From the Admin Console, we can't manage company's chatrooms, so everybody keeps creating new chatrooms. One-way messaging (like Telegram's Channels) would be appreciated for quick and urgent notifications.

reviews.title: “Hangouts ”
reviews.text: Excellent except the add user function which needs to.be updated.
reviews.pros: Another awesome software from Google that allows users to connect with one another...however it is difficult to add contacts.
reviews.cons: Adding a user is is hard, it really got on my nerves.

reviews.title: “Chat and Spaces are great for team communication”
reviews.pros: Recently started using the tasks feature within Spaces, and it's been great for our team.
reviews.cons: A way to organise chats would be really useful. For myself, grouping chats for developers, designers, social teams, would come in handy.

reviews.title: “The application lacks features that are readily available in peer apps.”
reviews.text: My overall experience is average with this application because of the above mentioned limitations.
reviews.pros: I have been using this application for quite sometime now. It is equipped with video and audio calling, and has the facility to make multiple person conference calls. The application UI looks clean.
reviews.cons: The app has few bugs. Audio / video calls sometimes do not show up (notifications appear later). Names of users seem to appear again even after moving their contact information into the blocked list. The notification of a person being online/offline is sometimes not updated with correct timestamps.

reviews.title: “Super user friendly!!”
reviews.pros: This software makes talking to people super easy! I love that you can add it as an extension to your browser and dont actually have to be in gmail to use it.
reviews.cons: When I open chrome, this software opens instead of an actual webpage.

reviews.title: “Easy way to communicate”
reviews.pros: I like the agility to start a conversation simply selecting the destinatary name and typing a message more fastly than in an e-mail. Ilike very much the possibility to send attachments, too.
reviews.cons: It should be there the option to see a button to not show your visualization

reviews.title: “Great for Quick Chats”
reviews.pros: It's quick and easy to use and probably one of the most efficient chat apps that exists. It's made by Google so it's very reliable.
reviews.cons: It's a little light on features, kind of a one trick pony, but does that one trick pretty well.

reviews.title: “Basic Chat”
reviews.text: You have to be signed onto gmail in order to use the chat and it auto-fills the people list with contacts from your Google account. There are helpful icons that relate the status of someone and I do like that the browser title tab flashes with a preview of the conversation like on a mobile device.
reviews.pros: It doesn't take up much screen real estate. You can easily insert pictures or screenshots without the program giving the receiver extra steps or clicks to see it. There are icons and emoji options that are fun and easy to use.
reviews.cons: The UI is a little too basic. I wish there were some spellcheck function to auto correct capitalization and common misspellings like in Outlook or Gmail.

reviews.title: “Very Easy and Convenient!”
reviews.text: My overall experience with G-Suite Chat has been really great. It has helped me connect with fellow employees at my previous jobs and it has also helped me connect with students that I worked with on school projects. It was very easy to use and to figure out. I like that there are other features and options that users can use, such as video chatting.
reviews.pros: I love that G-Suite chat is very convenient for teams and groups who all have Google accounts to use. There is also the option besides regular chat to do a video chat via Google Hangouts. I've used G-Suite chat a little bit in a workplace environment, but mostly for working with other students on school projects. It made it very easy for all of us on a team to connect with each other and have group meetings while we were all living in other parts of the country.
reviews.cons: There is really nothing negative to say about this software. I guess I would say it would be nice to somehow be able to use it also without needing to have a Google account/Gmail.

reviews.title: “Basic chat application with very less features”
reviews.text: If you are looking for a primitive chat application then Google Hangouts Chat is a good solution. Hangouts Chat is included in the GSuite bundle, thus we don't have to pay extra for it.
reviews.pros:
- Ease of use
- Minimal features(if your purpose is just to chat)
- User can edit the sent messages
reviews.cons:
- Very few customization options
- Users cannot forward the chat messages or files.
- Files, when downloaded, will change the name automatically. This makes it difficult to track important documents
- No option to delete the sent message
- No In-App video/audio conference option

reviews.title: “Chat Made Easy”
reviews.text: We use G Suite Chat all the time in the office. It is a nice, quick way to connect with a colleague.
reviews.pros: G Suite Chat is an incredibly simple way to chat with friends or colleagues. It is easy and efficient.
reviews.cons: In Chat it can be hard to find other users.

reviews.title: “Decent Chat System for Companies”
reviews.pros: It is already built in to Google Workspace.  This is handy for those that are already heavily invested with Google.  It is easy to start a chat with a co-worker or group of coworkers.  As an admin, the settings are also easy to enable as required.
reviews.cons: It is hard to compare this to Slack.  Slack seems to be easier.  Our end users prefer it.  The main reasons stem from the interface.  They find the Google Chat interface to be clunky and less intuitive.

reviews.title: “Free and easy to use chat for your office”
reviews.pros: Gchat is easy to use. If you have it set up for your company, easily find people with the directory by typing in their name and connect and start chatting.
reviews.cons: A lot of companies are looking for more robust tooling like slack.

reviews.title: “Unintuitive Screensharing makes this a pass”
reviews.text: 5/10 -- gets the job done, but not as good as Zoom in my opinion. Google really missed the ball on this one.
reviews.pros:
-Easy Integration with google calendar
-Not too hard to send meeting links and invite members
-Video background blur functionality is great
reviews.cons: When screensharing, there's no way to see people's faces  -- Google Hangouts desparately needs a mac app or some functionality so that I'm not asking "can you see my screen"

reviews.title: “Super seamless connection with team members on multiple screens”
reviews.pros:
It allows continue the same chat session across multiple platforms and devices.
The chat history is backed up and group chats are super easy.
reviews.cons: The desktop version UI is almost too simple. Larger text and buttons would help.

reviews.title: “ An excellent tool for communication and collaborative work”
reviews.text: In the company where I work we have clients from different countries so communication is a key factor and this program allows me to provide technical support to clients despite the distance and schedule events, tests, in addition to satisfying their concerns.
reviews.pros: What I like most about this software is its integration with the rest of the google products, which is an excellent feature, and you can use it with just one gmail account, which a lot of people have. This is an excellent tool to communicate with people from all over the world and encourage collaborative work allowing different people to share files and information and modify them simultaneously in real time.
reviews.cons: So far this program has fulfilled all my expectations and needs and I have no comments or criticism about it.

reviews.title: “Google Chat Review”
reviews.pros: Google Chat is very easy to use, and it is simple to login we can login through our email id and we can chat with our friends from anywhere
reviews.cons: Google chat interface could be better. Sometimes messages will not get delivered. We will not get a chat notification

reviews.title: “Interoffice communication without disruptive noise or phone calls.”
reviews.text: Overall as with most software we use this makes it much simpler to be a more communicative team that you can rely on as everyone can get the info that is needed from other on the team in a timely manner.
reviews.pros: How easy it is for everyone to use. We have several older members on my team and even they can use it. Mkaes for better overall communication which makes teamwork all the more effective.
reviews.cons: I guess I worry about the privacy of data with Google but then again most software like this runs the risk of it being hacked and information that is private can be sent out possibly.

reviews.title: “Works well for Workspace communication”
reviews.pros: Google Chat has been around for a while, most noticeably tucked away inside Gmail. They keep renaming and rebranding this chat product, not sure why. Chatting between contacts is pretty straightforward, just select a contact and chat away. The interface is barebones and that's fine for me. The integration inside Google Workspace products is quite nice and the performance is excellent. Overall it's a functional yet occasionally necessary feature for Google Workspace.
reviews.cons: Searching through chats is somewhat difficult and tedious. While I appreciate that Google wants to do everything SaaS, perhaps having a standalone client with more advanced features could help it become more of a business messaging tool (i.e. Slack). While there are some emojis which can be used, the ability to customize and augment messages is quite limited.

reviews.title: “Google Chat is Useful”
reviews.text: I've had great overall experience, it's nice to keep in contact with people while also keeping working on whatever I may be in the middle of.
reviews.pros: I enjoy having chat right next to my gmail, this makes keeping communication easier, especially if there are a few ongoing projects or discussions at the same time.  It's also wonderful to have multiple ways to communicate other than using the phone, which is really time intensive
reviews.cons: I'm not entirely thrilled with the placement within gmail, it seems like the placement manages to both require being searched for as well as blocking things that are needed.

reviews.title: “easy to use”
