reviews.pros: Google chat is just amazing to use, I am using this during work and its very useful communicating with my team mates regarding the task everyday and also updating our managers when it comes to performance. I never experience difficulty using this software unlike other platforms there is a lot of restrictions. But this is very useful for team meetings and messaging.
reviews.cons: So far I don't have anything to say about things I don't like with this software

reviews.title: “Jenn’s Review ”
reviews.pros: Love to use at work. Super simple for quick questions instead of phone calls!
reviews.cons: Nothing honestly, I absolutely love it for what I use it for!

reviews.title: “G Chat”
reviews.pros: I use google chat daily. it easily integrates with the iphone app as well and makes it easy to connect with people quickly rather than waiting for a reply over email
reviews.cons: nothing; there is nothing wrong with this product!

reviews.title: “Gchat - streamlining communications left and right”
reviews.text: This is a quick, easy form of communication for our team that isn't disruptive.
reviews.pros: I love that Gchat is integrated within Gmail's website so I don't have to have another window open. It's also great that in Chrome, the top bar will flash with a notification when you've received a message if you're on another webpage/tab. This software is great when you need a quick answer or are worried that someone might've missed an email that's important.
reviews.cons: I wish there was a feature that you could "like" or "dislike" a comment. Sometimes a comment doesn't warrant a full response, but a simple acknowledgment option would be nice.

reviews.title: “Easily stay in contact with team members wherever they are”
reviews.pros: Often times, you need to get in contact quickly with a co-worker, but an e-mail seems too formal, and a phone call may not be practical. G Chat allows you to quickly see if a co-worker is available, and instantly send them a quick message, making communication a breeze.
reviews.cons: If you are in a different window in your browser, it's way too easy to miss a G Chat notification.

reviews.title: “Good for chatting”
reviews.text: Great experience inside my company, it made easier the collaboration system
reviews.pros: Performance and speed make it a very useful tool
reviews.cons: Now it's integrated with gmail, that's good, but now you cannot use the app, its only available inside gmail

reviews.title: “A great group chat feature integrated with G Suite”
reviews.text: Chat has proved effective at connecting large groups across the organization in a familiar Google environment that plays nicely with other G Suite products.
reviews.pros: The ability to connect with a large group via Google Chat makes collaboration and document sharing easy by leveraging this tool found as part of G Suite. Much like any Google product it's simple, intuitive and has a marvellous UI. Great connectivity between other G Suite products like Gmail, Google Drive, etc.
reviews.cons: Google is constantly changing and pivoting from products so it's hard to keep up with all the changes and redesigns. Google Hangouts seemed to work perfectly fine and I'm not sure that the switch to Chat was really necessary as the core functionalities didn't change a whole lot.

reviews.title: “Nice addition to Google business”
reviews.text: It does the job, It has nice integration with other google services like google meet (can create instant meet room), google docs (can preview documents side by side instantly)
reviews.pros: comes with Google business package, no need 3rd party software and additional subsription.
reviews.cons: lack of features , commands and less integrations

reviews.title: “Easy to use messaging app”
reviews.text: I like the ease of use and the compatibility and interoperability it has within other Google platforms. Overall, I love Google Chat.
reviews.pros: Google Chat is an awesome feature to use within my day-to-day life. I use it to quickly get in touch with people in my organization instead of driving to another building, or waiting for them to answer the phone. Google Chat has proven effective in the age of remote learning, too.
reviews.cons: I don’t like that in Google Admin, Google Chat and Google Hangouts are not separate. If I want to turn off Google Chat, I have to also turn off Google Hangouts. It’s just an inconvenience from an admin prospective.

reviews.title: “Easy to use Communication App”
reviews.text: It was a good experience; we still use Google chat but not as our main communication channel. It's really helpful when you have all the other Google services.
reviews.pros: It linked with Gmail, and as it is our mail platform it was really great having it all in one place. Also, it allows separating your phone number from work activities
reviews.cons: Sharing files is not too intuitive or easy. Also, they didn't have voice message sharing which was a real disadvantage.

reviews.title: “Love Google chat ”
reviews.text: I can contact all my people
reviews.pros: It's on all phones with google most people have it
reviews.cons: Nothing  I have never had a issue where it was bad

reviews.title: “Just works”
reviews.pros: I've used gChat for years.  While it doesn't have a ton of bells and whistles, it just works great
reviews.cons: Google keeps trying to move away from chat and make new solutions.  Just leave it alone and let me have my gChat

reviews.title: “Quick  and easy”
reviews.text: love it,saves me time and is quick and easy to use
reviews.pros: saves me time and make it easy to chat with people in real time
reviews.cons: nothing, love the software- is it easy to use and so helpful

reviews.title: “Convenient and fast messenger ”
reviews.text: What was proposed, answered perfectly. The union with other Google tools is certainly a differential.
reviews.pros: Another Google ally. With Hangouts we have a very practical and fast messenger within a tool that has already been implemented as a work tool.
reviews.cons: The simplicity of Hangouts is evident, however, it meets what was proposed very well. And it is already integrated with other company tools.

reviews.title: “Video/Audio Calling”
reviews.pros: You can get connected to people around the globe easily. Easy to use and it automatically connects you to your google account.
reviews.cons: There are similar other options too that provide you better funtions and features

reviews.title: “Daily User”
reviews.pros: That I am able to message and send pictures with ease. I am able to communicate with people at a quickly and efficiently. I am able to see when they are online & you are able to choice to save the conversation or have it delete within 24 hours which its a plus.
reviews.cons: That at times it lags, but just closing and reopening helps.

reviews.title: “Google chat review ”
reviews.pros: It’s fast and very easy to use for anyone
reviews.cons: The freeze sometimes it freezes because of the internet

reviews.title: “G Suite Chat is good/cool”
reviews.text: Good program. Cloud Link, over the air. Optimism understood.
reviews.pros: Quick chat, in line with anti-hack of the past, new facebook, new linkedin, etc., so to speak.
reviews.cons: More app. perfection, app. fluidity, UI grace, social grace, etc.

reviews.title: “G chat is a simple way to stay connected!”
reviews.pros: We use this for communicating across  4 states. Its convenient and simple to use. Functionality is awesome.
reviews.cons: I wish I had more information on its functionality and use. I feel we leave a lot on the table.

reviews.title: “Hangouts pt. 2”
reviews.pros: Those familiar with Google Hangouts will find the transition to Google Chat as easy as I did. The upside is that the new app also comes with a neater space for organizing/naming team chats than Hangouts did, and giving them their own separate spaces is a brilliant interface move that keeps me from accidentally messaging the wrong chat when I meant it to be private!
reviews.cons: For me, I haven't been able to figure out how to get push notifications on my phone for Google Chat. The app does show an icon when there are unread messages, but even after resetting my notifications and putting my preferences in, I still don't get push notifications on my iPhone. Not a deal breaker, though -- I'm on the app often enough that I usually don't miss too much.

reviews.title: “Light and handy alternative.”
reviews.text: I've used it for team comms and multitasking.
reviews.pros: It's a light and usable alternative for team comms.
reviews.cons: May not be the most complete alternative.

reviews.title: “Communication is KEY”
reviews.pros: We use google chat to keep in contact with employees in our business. Google chat is easy and quick. All the messages are kept in  the same location as all the other other company information (G SUITE)
reviews.cons: Now that texting and other messaging services are available, google chat isn't as necessary, but it is nice to have all business information in one system.

reviews.title: “My Review”
reviews.text: Been so cool and easy to use
reviews.pros: It easy to use and been using it for ever
reviews.cons: its just perfect and I use it everyday .

reviews.title: “Senseless app”
reviews.pros: It improves and changes rapidly as Google tries to meet the expectations of many demanding users
reviews.cons: I don't quite see a reason to create another communicator by Google. Comparing to other similar software, features of Chat and ease of use is disappointing. Even mobile app looks like beta version - e.g. sometimes it notifies about messages from a week ago...

reviews.title: “Interactúa con tus contactos a través de Google Chat”
reviews.text: La utilizo especialmente para entablar conversaciones con compañeros de trabajo que solo manejan la información de mi correo electrónico, es rápida y fácil de utilizar al momento en que te acostumbras a ella. Al ser un software que puedo utilizar desde mi correo electrónico de gmail, me ha ayudado a separar las tareas laborales y personales.
reviews.pros:
Es una opción de Google que ayuda bastante al encontrarse directamente vinculada con los correos electrónicos de los usuarios. Me gusta que dentro de la misma bandeja de entrada se puedan crear grupos de chat para interactuar y conversar con más de una persona a la vez, incluyendo la posibilidad de crear nuevas reuniones vinculadas a Google Meet.
Ayuda a que las personas que solo poseen el correo electrónico de otro usuario, puedan conversar con este sin la necesidad de contactarlo a través de una red social personal.
reviews.cons: Es un software que no se destaca entre las opciones que presente Google y aveces era confusa la entrega de notificaciones, ya que estas aparecían en la bandeja de entrada del correo electrónico sin entender que se trataban de notificaciones de Google Chat.

reviews.title: “Try something different”
reviews.pros: It's different then all the other programs like it. I love this Google because I use a Google phone. I hundred percent support Google products.
reviews.cons: Sometimes it glitches out or on my phone it closes out.

reviews.title: “extremely satisfied”
reviews.pros: ease of use and that it links to your gmail
reviews.cons: the notifications don't work so well, and the file sharing could be upgraded to handle more than 1 file at a time

reviews.title: “Good for what it is”
reviews.text: There are better products out there, but if you don't mind going through gmail and not having an app for it on the phone then it's a good product. It's reliable and we've experienced almost no downtime with it.
reviews.pros: It's easy to use, straightforward and reliable for communication with others.
reviews.cons: The way it's accessed. Would be nice to go back to having an app for it instead of using gmail to access it on the phone and computer. It's a pain to have to go to gmail to get to it.

reviews.title: “Perfect if you are a Google Workspace organization”
reviews.pros: If you are already using Google Workspace, Chat is a no brainer. Its so heavily integrated into the ecosystem that it just works. We were able to get rid of other communication products when this became more full featured.
reviews.cons: Spaces needs a bit of work. Being able to modify spaces, specifically use both threaded replies and regular, would be nice. Also, being able to group message with users outside of the org would be helpful.

reviews.title: “Leaves Something to be Desired”
reviews.text: Google hangouts helps very much for education purposes. The functionality works very well for large groups of students. It helps when they need to communicate amongst each other for projects.
reviews.pros: This is likely one of the most simple messaging and calling tools available. Very easy access.
reviews.cons: When making calls on hangouts, the sound quality is often more poor than other messaging softwares. This was surprising to me. I now avoid making calls from there as much as possible.

reviews.title: “Easy communication tool ”
reviews.pros: I love that you have options as to how you see the G-chat tab on your screen
reviews.cons: I wish there was a way to not hide the notifications when in a different window

reviews.title: “Google Hangouts is great, especially for being free.”
reviews.text: I have loved using Google Hangouts. Nothing will change my mind about that.
reviews.pros: It is very easy to use and is super easy to integrate into your work practices. The mobile app is great, it's fast and easy to use and the messaging speed is superior to other platforms.
reviews.cons: I don't think there's anything that I don't particularly like about Google Hangouts. But if I had to choose something, probably that it's not 100% compatible with all devices, but I've never had any problems with that.

reviews.title: “Where is Chat?”
reviews.text: It works fine.  It's free.  It has most functionality that you would need.  It certainly could be more feature-rich and intuitive, and especially more logical in its location.
reviews.pros: It is an easy enough platform for intra-office communication.  Chat by Google is fairly intuitive and seems to have all the functionality that you would need.  Obviously, you can chat instantly, and often (only often) without leaving the current browser.  This part is good.
reviews.cons: However, it doesn't give you all of the functionality that you might want.  There could be more integration with the entire G Suite itself.  And probably the biggest negative of this software is the location.  It is a cumbersome feature when supposedly embedded in Gmail.  It would be nicer (and more functional) if Chat were more accessible, maybe as its own piece of software...rather than being almost embedded in Gmail (though there is also a 'chat' feature for Hangouts).

reviews.title: “Great way to keep team engaged”
reviews.text: Overall experience with google chat has been great, use it throughout the day for several interactions with members of the company.
reviews.pros: The best part of Google Chat is it is in the same place as inbox - and throughout the course of the day- its easier to keep connecting with the team members without flipping through multiple tabs. Mobile app also helps be connected while we are away. Easy to find and connect with anyone in the company.
reviews.cons:
Would be great if we have the possibility of adding attachements in the chat.
Also, for searching through previous messages- would be great to have a search bar in the app.

reviews.title: “G Chat Review”
reviews.text: It's an effective and quick communication tool between teammates.
reviews.pros: Ease of use. Easy to integrate with other apps if needed. Effective messaging tool for low priority communications. Can send links, emojis, and other misc items in a message.
reviews.cons: Only status options are active or inactive.

reviews.title: “Very good to keep in touch with people and coworkers.”
reviews.pros: It's great to quickly message someone instead of emailing them.
reviews.cons: The *bing* alert to let you know that someone messaging you can be a bit startling if you have headphones in or sound volume up.

reviews.title: “The easiest way to stay in touch via chat”
reviews.text: I use it a lot, it's an easy way to stay in touch
reviews.pros: It is extremely easy to use and google is a trusted source for things like thid
reviews.cons: There is not a lot in the way of true functionality other than just chat

reviews.title: “Google Chat ”
reviews.pros: What I like the most is video chat in real time.
reviews.cons: I did not see any features I didn't like.

reviews.title: “Good, simple but too simple communicator”
reviews.text: A very good communication tool, but no advanced options such as file sharing or better text formatting (e.g. code, markup coloring in the IT industry)
reviews.pros: Good integration with Google, mainly with Gmail (can be displayed as a widget)
reviews.cons: Files (PDF, CSV etc.) cannot be transferred between users

reviews.title: “A Good Basic Meeting Tool w Google Intregration”
reviews.text: Its okay for short basic meetings with low number of attendees. I use it for my coaching sessions because when i set an appointment, it sends a general meeting link automatically when you choose it as an option which makes it pretty cool if you are a big Google products fan like I am.
reviews.pros: The fact that it integrates with my Google suite of products so it made it easier to be able to access it.
reviews.cons: Its kind of limited in its capabilities from what I have seen. Its not as robust as say Zoom

reviews.title: “Hangouts is Basic But Works”
reviews.pros: It is very easy to use. It did not take much time to learn.
reviews.cons: It’s features are limited but include what is generally needed for messaging and online calls.

reviews.title: “Simple Chat Application”
reviews.text: Google Chat is quick and easy and gets the job done within Google Hangouts. No issues and works consistently.
reviews.pros: Google Chat is an IM (or instant messaging) program built into Google Hangouts that is integrated with the rest of the G Suite. It is fast, simple and gets the job. It allows you to quickly communicate text-based information with your team who is inside the hangout.
reviews.cons: It is not a stand-alone program or application. It is a part of Google Hangouts and thus dependent on that software to work. It is lacking in some advanced chat functions as well.

reviews.title: “Google Chat is the Best Way to Stay in Touch”
reviews.text: Google Chat has made staying in touch with my coworkers easier while working at home.
reviews.pros: Being able to quickly stay in touch with coworkers and collaborators is made easy from home and on the road.
reviews.cons: Sometimes the notifications are not received right away.

reviews.title: “Flexible chat app”
reviews.text: Hangouts is a good collaboration tool, and it significantly reduces the need for emails, as people can quickly have a conversation rather than start an email thread.
reviews.pros: Google Hangouts is a simple but intuitive app for chatting and collaborating with colleagues. It can be used for group and individual chat and it includes a simple option to add video to a conversation for impromptu meetings.
reviews.cons: It can sometimes be difficult to find specific conversations in a thread, so it's best for things that are only relevant in the moment.

reviews.title: “Google does it again”
reviews.pros: It is an inexpensive way to communicate with others personally and professionally.  Being able to send messages without having to worry about paying for expensive plans, extra data, or prepaid limits.
reviews.cons: Nothing that the app did not fulfill when I needed it.

reviews.title: “Started off as the leader but now needs to improve functionality”
reviews.pros: Very easy to setup and easy to use . Data sharing is also good.
reviews.cons: Would be nice to have slack like functionality to directly quote discussion/threads and threaded conversations.

reviews.title: “Use this Everyday out of Necessity not Preference”
reviews.pros: Love that this is free and integrated into my email for seamless realtime commuication
reviews.cons: Sometimes it disappears and I can't find the chat or notifications aren't always clear.

reviews.title: “Teamwork Booster”
reviews.text: Fulfilled and satisfied
reviews.pros: Everything makes sense with Google Chat, it has foster teamwork and quelled excuses.
reviews.cons: Nothing is wrong , nothing has gone not good to warrant ant complain

reviews.title: “Super helpful for short/real-time comms needs ”
reviews.text: Overall it's a help to my team. We are all remote so sometimes a quick back and forth of thoughts, ideas, jokes, comments, etc. is needed.
reviews.pros: I love that it saves on email. Also love using it to communicate with team members (we all work remote) in real time on conference calls with outside ppl - It allows us ask each other questions we may have without clients hearing.
reviews.cons: Nothing much to NOT like about it. It's a simple messaging tool that is useful in many instances - when you need an answer in real time, when you want to have a quick back and forth and not send a million emails, etc.

reviews.title: “Google Chat Has Gotten Better”
reviews.pros: Easily integrates as a desktop app or can use directly in Gmail interface.  Chat has enhanced over the years and now supports rooms.
reviews.cons: From an administrative standpoint, there are little APIs for integrations and management for things like chat rooms.

reviews.title: “Google just keeps making my life easier!”
reviews.pros: G Chat keeps me in touch with my team all day. Quickly chat with an individual or a group of people from my computer, phone, tablet. It goes where I go and I rely on it to keep in touch while in and out of the office.
reviews.cons: Software keeps getting better and better. Love the app and the Chrome extension to keep it on my desktop.

reviews.title: “Clearly not a priority for Google”
reviews.text: Underwhelming, underdeveloped experience with limited features
reviews.pros: It's nice to have such convenient access to chat within Gmail but that's all the positive praise I can give it
reviews.cons: Given the vast array of chat and instant messaging apps out there, for personal and business use, Google Chat clearly doesn't believe it can compete. Despite tools like Slack which claim to send email back to the dark ages, I still use Gmail every single day but I wouldn't dream of using Google Chat over Slack. It's also dreadful at alerting anyone to their being a message or a Hangout request.

reviews.title: “Love It”
reviews.text: It's very easy to use and I use it just about every day.
reviews.pros: I use chat all the time and like how easy and accessible it is for touching base with someone quickly.  Even things like dragging a photo or something into your chat window to send is super simple.  It's nice too that it's just connected to your email so it's not a separate thing to keep track of.
reviews.cons: Not much bad to say about it.  I don't use the emojis/stickers often, but when I do, it's sometimes a little glitchy to where it adds a second one and I'm not sure why it does it that way.  Super minor though.

reviews.title: “Chat for any time”
reviews.text: In general it is an application that greatly facilitates daily communication between the team, in times of home office it is helping the data transfer, agile communication and zero cost in the operation.
reviews.pros: It's a lightweight app, doesn't take up a lot of space on your computer or cell phone. It has very simple and easy to use and learn resources for anyone.
reviews.cons: The search engine for previous issues is bad. You cannot search for one person only (filters) the room system is a bit confusing with the various conversations created.

reviews.title: “Google Chat review JZ”
reviews.text: I enjoy this product and will continue to use it in my future careers and I hope to show others how to use it to make communication in the office more effecient when needed.
reviews.pros: I like this product because it makes communication easier. I like how it connects right to your email. I am on my Gmail account and email quite frequently so seeing it pop up right where I already am. I also like how you can see if others who have the another Gmail account are online. It is very easy to use and does not take up the whole screen. It also promotes focus for me because then I don't have to keep checking my phone or using my phone during work. It is also less formal than an email.
reviews.cons: I don't like how you only can have a certain number of chats activated on the side of your email. It also isn't well known to many people I work with so sometimes they forget to respond communication starts to slack. It is quick but only when the other person is aware.

reviews.title: “G-Chat gets the job done!”
reviews.pros: I like that it's easy to use and convenient for communicating with co-workers.
reviews.cons: This seems trivial, but I think they can continue to improve their emoji options/quality.

reviews.title: “What we used to work with”
reviews.text: It was fine but we found that we needed to pay a little more to get better service.
reviews.pros: Google was flexible and easy to work with in an office setting. It being free also made it a handy tool for communication across different departments.
reviews.cons: Probably, what I liked least about the software, was that it was difficult to share certain types of messages, like extensive amounts of code.

reviews.title: “Awesome Chat software”
reviews.pros: I love this chat software because it lives online and allows for easy communication.
reviews.cons: Some of the functions of this software don't meet all of my needs on a daily basis.

reviews.title: “Simple and Clean”
reviews.text: I like having chat available, and it's so much nicer to have it right there in the Gmail instead of Skype popping up and binging constantly.
reviews.pros: It's very easy to use, and it seems like they struck a good balance between adding features and keeping it simple; for example having different chats with different groups you create.
reviews.cons: I don't have many cons for what the product promises and delivers. It used to have occassional bugs but recently I haven't had issues with that. Honestly that could easily have been a formerly shoddy internet connection.

reviews.title: “The New Old”
reviews.pros:
Accessibility - as any other Google app, the Google Chat can be accessed fast with the gmail account. If I want to communicate with someone quickly I use the chat, faster than e-mail.
I like the screen sharing feature, very important for me.
It's clean, easy to use and the quality of Video is good.
reviews.cons:
I don't see any big cons for now. What I dislike is the constant name changing. It was called a 'chat' before, then Hangouts, and now Google Chat again.
For anyone wondering. Google Hangouts is being discontinued.

reviews.title: “Quick communication ”
reviews.text: Overall I love having this feature right in my inbox!
reviews.pros: Easy to use, quick access, notifies me on my phone when I am away from my laptop.
reviews.cons: The notifications on my phone could have a better UI

reviews.title: “Expanding Feature”
reviews.pros: With Google Suite expanding into a chat function will help integrate our company more and more into the google infrastructure. It acts as an instant messaging tool where we can use for quick responses instead of e-mails.
reviews.cons: Sometimes we may miss the notification that Google Chat offers to show that there is a new message.

reviews.title: “Free and Reliable Chat Tool”
reviews.text: I have using google chat from last 5 years. I have continuously using for the chat and video calling.
reviews.pros: It is completely free and very easy to use.
reviews.cons: It has less functionalities and features.

reviews.title: “Tried and true, and built into the suite.”
reviews.text: It's great for personal and business use, and easy to integrate the two. It's always been reliable and integrated into my email, which makes me want to use it more.
reviews.pros: I've always loved Gchat for the fact that it's integrated with email. No additional apps or tabs to open - the record of chat is integrated with email.
reviews.cons: It just doesn't have the group chat functionality that slack does. It's great for one-on-one chats, but its benefit comes from being part of the Google suite. Also, Slack is more fun to use with groups.

reviews.title: “Google Chat for an easier way to communicate”
reviews.pros: It's immediate, it's easy to use, it has a lot of tools to share documents, files and to organize meets and calls with friends and colluegues.
reviews.cons:
Actually there is nothing I dislike.
It would be great to have some tools to do research in the chat.
If I have to search for some information I had shared, there is no research bar.
I think it would be great to have some research tool for the chats.

reviews.title: “It simply get things done”
reviews.text: It's good, works like a charm.
reviews.pros: A simple tool with a simple interface that merges beautifully with Gmail, it's small but packs a punch, my biggest challenge so far are my colleagues not letting go of Skype.
reviews.cons: My colleagues not letting go of Skype, and wasting time and resources on another tool that is not required any longer.

reviews.title: “Gchat”
reviews.pros: I have used this in my last two jobs to talk to other employees and ask questions. Its great and easy to use.
reviews.cons: Im not sure there really is any cons for this chat.

reviews.title: “G-Chat is so helpful”
reviews.text: I think that G-Chat is fantastic and is an overall easy to use and time saving application associated with the Google Suite.
reviews.pros: This product has made it possible for the company I work for to have an instant messaging tool automatically installed as we are a G-Suite organization that uses Google mail. We have multiple buildings on our site and it makes it so much easier and more efficient to communicate quickly.
reviews.cons: It really isn't a con, but I find that the notifications don't always go away. If I read the message, but don't click on it to reply right away it shows as new.

reviews.title: “RIP Hangouts, welcome Meet!”
reviews.pros: It was the faster software for chating with friends, family and work.
reviews.cons: It was not user friendly: to create a chat you had to go through a lot of clicks and menus.

reviews.title: “Google Hangouts is not the place to be”
reviews.pros: I like that this software is free and easy for other to access. There is an app to allows you to access it on the mobile device.
reviews.cons: Hangouts did not allow for fluid conversations during "larger" meetings. I'm using other software now that really does this much better. Many users had difficulty connecting and staying connected, screens would freeze, and the chat would not always come through quickly. The layout of Hangouts is also more cumbersome to navigate than other software. It's free, but that does come at a "cost."

reviews.title: “Hang out ”
reviews.text: Good and consumer friendly
reviews.pros: Customer information protection and security
reviews.cons: Difficult to use on the field where network is bad

reviews.title: “prático  e intuitivo”
reviews.text: uso todos os dias, tanto para mensagem individuais como em grupo.Super prático e didático
reviews.pros: fácil utilização, não precisa de grandes parametrizações
reviews.cons: nenhum, me adaptei muito rápido a ferramenta

reviews.title: “Chat is a Great Option”
reviews.text: Overall, I like to use it while I'm at work or on trips working.
reviews.pros: I like that Google Chat has basically made it feel just like regular messaging or texting from your phone.
reviews.cons: At the end of the day, until something is 100% synced/embedded into your phone's messaging, you are always wishing that is was possible. It's close though!

reviews.title: “I have been using this for years! ”
reviews.text: I love that I can see who's online.
reviews.pros: It's way easy to use and I can access it on my mobile
reviews.cons: There is nothing about the software that I don't like

reviews.title: “A Must For Communication ”
reviews.pros: The app/having chats pop up on the sidebar of my email makes sure you do not miss a notification.
reviews.cons: I wish I could mute certain user notifications in a group chat. Some people overuse the chat and I get too many notifications but it is in a group chat so I cannot mute it.

reviews.title: “Google Hangouts Review”
reviews.text: Overall experience with Google Hangouts is being good but other social media apps are better equipped and more convenient.
reviews.pros: The features I like the most are its data privacy, data encryption, and safety. Moreover, we can chat while using emails. A great feature to make video and voice calls. Video quality is better than before.
reviews.cons: The least I like about this social media software is its inability to delete or recall messages. The video quality needs improvement. Spam callers should be banned.

reviews.title: “A free tool we liked even if it is a little bit vintage nowadays”
reviews.pros: FREE software, easy to use and setup even by my grand parents.
reviews.cons: Not the most ergonomic tool sometimes. Calls with many people are not the easiest to manage.

reviews.title: “Not a happy switch from Hangout”
reviews.text: I liked hangout better than chat. Overall experience is satisfactory but not great.
reviews.pros: Option to add a separate group as a room, sharing files directly from the computer and drive made easy.
reviews.cons: Hangout had an option to name group chats. Here there is a need to create a separate room for any group, else Chat cannot be named which is a bit annoying.

reviews.title: “Google Hangouts for Team and Client Meetings”
reviews.text: I have been a bit disappointed with Hangouts. Coming from Google, I expected his tool to be flawless. Other rival tools such as Zoom and Teams offer a much superior experience. The biggest advantage that Hangouts has is that it integrates seamlessly with other google workplace apps. However, for pretty much everything else, other tools are better.
reviews.pros:
- Ease of use 
- Easy setup and intuitive controls 
- Great ecosystem provided by google
reviews.cons:
- You need a google account to participate
- Audio quality is sometimes choppy
- dialing-in is a hassle

reviews.title: “Google Chat Rocks!”
reviews.text: Amazing product, it regularly receives updates and will make your team more collaborative
reviews.pros: I love gsuite and google chat, the product is amazing for collaboration and works great with google drive.
reviews.cons: I do not like when people ignore the threading functionality -- please add predictive feeeback to tell people when to use new threads!!!

reviews.title: “G Suite Chat makes my office communication easy! ”
reviews.pros: I love that G Suite keeps my workday organized (Sheets, Docs, Drive, Calendar, etc) and Chat is just an easy built-in way to communicate with my co-workers within this whole system.
reviews.cons: Chat is still in competition with Slack, so I have both. I wish I could streamline my communication down to one chat method.

reviews.title: “Google does what Google does!”
reviews.text: Chat by Google in itself is a great chat application and with integration in to Gmail, it's become better.
reviews.pros: Chat by Google is extremely easy to use and is connected with all the other Google apps, which makes it easier
reviews.cons: Chat by Google is now integrated with the Google mail so it can improve the way it displays mail and chat together.

reviews.title: “ Let's chat”
reviews.text: t brought a lot of practicality and agility to the daily routine of my company! For them we can resolve issues quickly and whenever necessary we can consult issues already addressed, the fact that it is very multi-platform provides incredible mobility.
reviews.pros: Incredible tool that is already linked to your gmail. It allows you to keep in touch with your contacts in a very simple and agile way. Save conversations so they can be viewed later if necessary. great for corporate customers.
reviews.cons: It has a somewhat different form of notification, coming out of the ordinary, but it is just a matter of adaptation.

reviews.title: “Allows you to communicate quickly!”
reviews.pros: It's easy to use and allows me to message a co-worker quicker than sending an email
reviews.cons: Nothing bad to say. I've never had an experience other than great.

reviews.title: “A good app to chat”
reviews.text: I use Chat on a daily basis and in general it meets my expectations and I am satisfied.
reviews.pros: What I like most about Chat is the ease and convenience of communicating with my team via messages.
reviews.cons: What I like least about Chat is that it sometimes crashes, in addition to offering more tools and integration with other applications.

reviews.title: “Chat”
reviews.text: I've had nothing but a great experience.
reviews.pros: I liked that I can easily chit chat with family and friends
reviews.cons: There is nothing that I dislike about the product so far.

reviews.title: “Great for teach chats”
reviews.text: We use google chat for all our teams communications
reviews.pros:
Easy to chat, make video calls directly, share files.
Groups and Rooms are an amazing feature and now allows external users as well
Easy to create your own bot
reviews.cons:
Cant pin conversation threads
very few existing bots
should have more integrations with other software

reviews.title: “Functional chat as a part of G Suite”
reviews.text: It's our internal chat tool. We don't use anything else. It's functional.
reviews.pros: It's built right into our G Suite, which makes it about as easy to use as possible. No extra apps or windows. It's just right there.
reviews.cons: It may be shallow, but a lack of GIFs for sure. It's one of the more fun parts of internal chats and I miss it!

reviews.title: “Excellent for big files”
reviews.text: I am happy with it. it is very reliable and user friendly.
reviews.pros: We used WeTransfer a whole lot more in previous years. It was and it still is the perfect took to transfer big files. We have moved away from it now because we are trying to keep all of our documents in one place but we still have a licences for it in case we need to transfer a big file.
reviews.cons: I cannot think of any complaints. It is not something we used everyday but when we do there are generally no complaints.

reviews.title: “So easy you take it for granted”
reviews.text: - Simple to use and widespread across my business sector makes this a great, convenient communication tool.
reviews.pros:
- Integration with gMail makes it convenient and easy to access.
- Ability to mark status (present/away/etc) makes status checks for teamwork easy.
- Ability to spontaneously make a video call without having to create a calendar event is great.
reviews.cons: - Would like gChat to appear as a sidebar function (like it is in gMail) while using other Google functions like gCal or gDrive. That way I don't have to click on a separate tab to respond to a message.

reviews.title: “Awesome”
reviews.pros: The Google Chat gives my coworkers and I the chance to "text" one another from our computers through Google and it saves a lot of time if needing an immediate answer. This is better than emails in the sense that you can see when the person is typing and there is no lag time in the conversation. It updates in real time.....
reviews.cons: I wish there was a print feature within the chat so that threads can be sent to a printer for a nice printout of the information

reviews.title: “Must for Office Communications”
reviews.pros: Google is migrating to Chat instead of Hangout. The UX is a lot like Slack, where you can create groups, file messages, etc. And there is a search function.
reviews.cons: Google Chat and Google Hangout are integrated. It can get confusing because they sync yet some functionality only shows on Chat, not Hangout.

reviews.title: “Great resource! ”
reviews.pros: I love using Google chat with colleagues at work--- it's a great way to stay in touch during the day.
reviews.cons: The messages are automcatically archived.

reviews.title: “Hangoust is the best!”
reviews.text: I use it in my day-to-day life and it is a complete and important service at work
reviews.pros: Hangouts is not just a communication tool, it covers all fields of messaging and work scheduling.
reviews.cons: The lack of integration capacity with other services such as Amazon or Microsoft

reviews.title: “Solving Communication Issues With Google Chat”
reviews.pros: This software solves communication issues between our team and office. It keeps us from having to yell across the office, and everything is in writing.
reviews.cons: I don't really have anything that I can say I do not like about it.

reviews.title: “Fast communication”
reviews.pros: Google chat is very useful to a fast online communication.
reviews.cons: It is more useful when all the team is online.

reviews.title: “Good for Quick Messages”
reviews.pros: It is just on the side of gmail, which is always open. It's convenient to use and gets the job done.
reviews.cons: Since the switch, using it on a mobile phone is more difficult as you have to go into gmail and then find your chats.

reviews.title: “Great way to chat between friends and collegues”
reviews.pros: Easy to set up and use and keep in contact with everyone
reviews.cons: Nothing really, all in all a nice application.

reviews.title: “One of the most neglected utility from Google”
reviews.text: Need to start a campaign with popular content management systems wherein users get to integrate Google Chat widget as part of their websites.
reviews.pros: Although Google Chat is one of the best ways to leverage the most of GSuite, not sure why it is neglected. We are used to using messenger, instant chat by one of its social media competitors.
reviews.cons: They need to make access to Google Chat more widespread. While its competitors from CRM to social media platforms are pushing their chat widget to be integrated with user websites/blogs, not sure what is holding Google back.

reviews.title: “Better tools out there”
reviews.text: Overall, Hangouts can do 90% of what it's meant to do. Not only can it host video but the messaging side is fun and intuitive.
reviews.pros: Hangouts is a fine tool, allowing you to accomplish the basics of collaborating virtually. You're equipped with virtual backgrounds, snappy UI, and quick controls. In addition, a powerful chat function lives here as well.
reviews.cons: While the tool is helpful, the screensharing abilities are somewhat clunky. In addition, the call quality is inferior to other platforms in the market (reliability).

reviews.title: “Good free tool to communicate ”
reviews.pros: A great way to connect with your friends or co-workers.
reviews.cons: Basic features and ugly user interface. There's better-looking software out there.

reviews.title: “Better than Hangouts, but...”
reviews.text: An improvement from Hangouts in many ways, but also lacks features I have come to love. If you came from FB Messenger, Chat feels very similar, but lacks distinctiveness that makes it stand out.
reviews.pros: The best advantages of Chat over Hangouts are the better integration with Gmail and the ability to drag and drop content. Just for that I switched. But I also do miss the way I can monitor my chats in one quick glance in Hangouts and not have to click multiple times to see new messages.
reviews.cons: The "one glance" message monitoring and no multiple clicking is something that I miss from Hangouts. Google Chat also feels like it's trying to copy Facebook Messenger, which just makes the fact that Messenger is better feel more pronounced.

reviews.title: “I love it and use it all the time.”
reviews.pros: You can send so many links to things quickly without having to send an email.
reviews.cons: Sometimes your chats don't go through for some odd reason.

reviews.title: “Snappy!”
reviews.pros: It's very handy while we are away from our computer. You can send the file needed in a snap from the mobile. This makes the team communications more easy.
reviews.cons: Not much cons as of now, I suggest to add any new features.

reviews.title: “easy to connect”
reviews.text: I am very happy to use it in office set up as well as personal needs.
reviews.pros: Since so many mid to economical range cell phone has Android apps, it has become a easy way to connect to people. It can send big files efficiently. In office set up , I have used it since gmail emailing solution is the most popular for small size office team. It can connect with all g suite applications easily.
reviews.cons: Interoperability with other apps.  Nowadays so many collaboration app is there in market so it becomes duplicate.

reviews.title: “Chat ”
reviews.pros:
1. ease of use of the software. 
2. people can add each other through gmail i.d 
3. ios and android apps are available. it can be used through browser. 
4. its quite fast 
5. there is not much lag when it comes to google chat 
6. its safe and secure.
reviews.cons:
1. Google chat does not offer to change the font style and size. 
2. Users cant send audio notes in google chat. 
3. the emoji's are not so good looking

reviews.title: “Chat Across The Office”
reviews.text: We love it!
reviews.pros: We love being able to handle business while on conference calls.
reviews.cons: No issues so far.  It is an excellent program for all offices.

reviews.title: “human chat with google chat”
reviews.pros: There is a good communication option for this software. Anyone can use this tool.  I find it very easy to use this Google chat.
reviews.cons: Nothing everything is fine. Compared to other chat this chat is better.

reviews.title: “Keep track of everyone at work. ”
reviews.pros: Stay up to date with work friends on what they are working on with easy chat
reviews.cons: Nothing. It’s a great product. You can send attachments.

reviews.title: “Really Easy”
reviews.pros: How easy it is to connect and talk to other people
reviews.cons: Sometimes it has some video issues but its not a major issue which cannot be solved

reviews.title: “Stay in contact with ease”
reviews.text: Google Chat provides my team with the ability to instantly ask/answer questions throughout the work day
reviews.pros: Like the ability Google Chat provides me to ask a question to several team members at one time and receive the answer needed. It is convenient to talk to multiple team members at one time so that everyone is kept on the same page regarding projects and their status. It is easy to use and seems to remain up to date
reviews.cons: The one thing I do not like is at random times the software seems to "time-out" and not allow us to use it. This can be very frustrating and causes ineffeciency

reviews.title: “Google Chat is very convenient, but it could better”
reviews.text: Google Chat makes it easy to connect and chat with vendors nationwide or internationally with no fees. The ease of use it very beneficial because practically anyone with minimum technical skills can utilize Google Chat. Thanks Google Chat!
reviews.pros: What I like the most about Google Chat is the fact it is very convenient. It is easily accessible being right on the left pane of your Gmail account as soon as you log into Gmail. I also like the fact the you it will keep track of all of you chats for you. You can turn that feature off if you prefer that the software does not keep copies of your chats. You can easily chat with your Gmail contacts. You can tell if someone is on chat or not.
reviews.cons: Google chat does have some technical issues that pop up now and then. Sometimes there is an error stating that something went wrong and you cannot connect right now. That can be annoying. It seems like it could be a bug in the software.

reviews.title: “A Nice Chat And Audio And Video Call Software”
reviews.pros:
chats are faster
can be used within your Gmail web login so do not need to login on a separate web app like whats app
consumes less internet data
no need to use phone number, just login with your Google account.
reviews.cons:
sending and accepting friend request does not work very well
it can take time to receive someone`s request and vice versa.

reviews.title: “Google chat is very helpful for communicating with our team members”
reviews.pros:
1. I have been using this for the past 6months and it is very easy to use and also user friendly application.
2. We can create group and send our message so that everyone in the group will get the message and no need to send separately to everyone.
reviews.cons: They can allow the user to keep some customized background themes so that it will look good and they can add some features to backup all the messages in cloud so that the users can get it.

reviews.title: “Easy to use and immediate contact ”
reviews.text: Easy feature for communicating
reviews.pros: I can use this on my laptop or phone to be connected with my team as needed
reviews.cons: No issues with this software so cannot rate

reviews.title: “Would Recommend ”
reviews.text: Absolutely love it!!
reviews.pros: I love being able to use a messaging app as opposed to sending 100 emails or trying to call everyone over something silly. This allows me to get in touch with someone fairly quickly and they're more likely to respond with a quick message than waiting for a phone call or someone needing to call me back. No more cluttering up my emails when that is already a high traffic zone for other communications!!! I LOVE that!!
reviews.cons: I'm not really sure that I have a con about this product! Waiting for someone to confirm your chat request I guess may be the only bummer, but at the same time, I appreciate accepting someone before anyone just hops into your chat!

reviews.title: “A solid communication service”
reviews.pros: I love how easy it is to instantly communicate with people and it can be fun to add images, gifs, or icons to your messages. It is also great to utilize the 'spaces' feature for projects. It is also great to video chat from the pop up!
reviews.cons: The latest update of the software made things a bit confusing and clunkier. The original design and desktop plug in made it so much easier to keep track of chats.

reviews.title: “Katie's Google Chat Review”
reviews.text: My overall experience has been great! I feel like it's helped my team a lot.
reviews.pros: I most like the ability to instantly chat with my colleagues. Whenever there is an issue, I know that I will be able to get help or clarity instantly.
reviews.cons: I think the product could definitely use a better way to chat when you are also doing other tasks on your computer. Maybe a better structure visually.

reviews.title: “Office game changer! ”
reviews.text: Overall I have had a positive experience with Chats and will continue to use it.
reviews.pros: I love chats! It is what we use everyday in the office. It is so nice to be able to send a quick IM vs an email.
reviews.cons: I don’t like how you can’t see group chats when you’re in the google chat app. That is my only complaint.

reviews.title: “Google Chat Experience”
reviews.text: The Google Chat software allows for you to send a message in the chat instead of email.
reviews.pros: I love this Google Chat software. It is so easy to use and allows for you to connect in a timely manner with other co-workers with meetings. You type in what you want to say and hit the send button, everyone that who the message is sent too gets it.
reviews.cons: One con with using the google chat feature is that if you have the volume turned up and someone pings you multiple times, it can be distracting when you are working on a high priority project.

reviews.title: “Great for Quick Communication”
reviews.pros: I use Google Chat every day to talk with my coworkers. It's an easy way to ask a quick question or drop a quick note rather than sending a email that can get lost in an inbox.
reviews.cons: I don't love using Chat on my phone. I don't like that there's an app but also Chat in the Gmail app, so I get double notifications and sometimes can't find who sent me a message.

reviews.title: “Google Chat - Simple & Easy”
reviews.text: As part of G Suite, Chat is very easy to use and requires no learning curve. It keep all of our team members in  touch with each other at all times. Instead of sharing phone numbers we're all a click away thanks to Chat.
reviews.pros:
Requires no learning curve
Simple to Use
Drag and drop documents
reviews.cons: Nothing, it serves the exact purpose we need

reviews.title: “Clean, Organized Messenger”
reviews.text: Overall, Hangouts is useful when trying to keep tabs on a number of conversations with Google.  It isn't the flashiest tool, but it certainly gets the job done.
reviews.pros: This product is certainly easy to use.  Users will get what they expect, a simple way to communicate with other Google users.  It's incredibly easy to begin and continue conversation, and there are a number of tools available during a conversation (attachments, video chat, etc.) that add to its functionality.  In the end, it's a simple, clean tool for holding conversations, both with one individual or with a group.
reviews.cons: Keeping tabs on where each conversation is is a bit of a challenge.  Hangouts sorts all discussions in a long, scrolling list.  Conversations can be found by typing into the search bar by using group members' names, but this leaves much to be desired since there is no way to organize and prioritize conversations.

reviews.title: “Save money and use this”
reviews.pros: Has everything all the other big name video conferencing products have that are actually critical to running a business virtually. They are always making updates and from what i've seen I haven't been disappointed.
reviews.cons: Nothing I can think of. Maybe just easier access to knowing how to raise hand and other functions like that for first time users. Maybe a tutorial ability but i'm nit picking.

reviews.title: “Great for Office Chit Chat, Not So Great for Work Related Stuff”
reviews.pros: I really like Google Chat because it's like instant messaging. I'm able to message any of my coworkers about a variety of things. When I'm chatting with someone about where to go for lunch or what snacks are in the break room, it works great.
reviews.cons: However, whenever I message someone about something work related, I hate that I can't save/ file away that part of the chat! If someone sends me a link I need and then we discuss other things, I have to scroll back past the entire conversation just to find the link.

reviews.title: “Google Hangout”
reviews.pros: Very easy to communicate with colleagues directly in Gmail interface.
reviews.cons: Miss some advance feature like settings active hours.

reviews.title: “great for inter team messaging”
reviews.text: good quick alternative to skype
reviews.pros: really easy to use between gsuite users.
reviews.cons: doesnt always show who is online but that maybe the network

reviews.title: “Google Chat Review”
reviews.text: It facilitates the communication in many companies. It is fast and saves time.
reviews.pros: Google Chat has changed how professionals,friends and workmates communicate in their daily businesses. I use the product to share official information with my colleagues when I am in office. It keeps the history of previous chats enabling me to track any information shared.
reviews.cons: This is a great product from Google. I am yet to encounter any problem while using Google chat.

reviews.title: “Chat Review”
reviews.pros: The ability to talk to multiple people at all times.
reviews.cons: Notifications are inconsistent from the computer to the mobile device.

reviews.title: “Good tool to keep the comuinication going ”
reviews.text: It really helped me that I don't have a phone line at the office when some clients had issues we talk by hangout
reviews.pros: It is integrated with the Google office tools such as Gmail. This makes it more accessible.
reviews.cons: Sometimes I had issues whit the audio and the interphase of entry hardware is a bit complicated.

reviews.title: “This is much easier to use than Skype and more reliable too”
reviews.text: This chat program has allowed continuous communication for work and personal life too.   It is so easy to start a chat or a group chat and doesn't require a lot of experience to use.  Having the google platform set up on all your devices makes things more organized for sure.
reviews.pros: This program has a simple design, it's quite intuitive, and makes online chatting enjoyable and lots of fun. Being able to access pre-loaded contacts from my gmail email account saves a lot of time!  We absolutely love this program.
reviews.cons: It would be great if this program included a notification of whether a receiver has read a message or not.  Also, this program tends to lag at times if you don't have high speed internet but otherwise works great.

reviews.title: “Great for communication among teammembers”
reviews.pros: One of the few chat options that works well with voice software.
reviews.cons: Sadly this does not have the prettiest user interface.

reviews.title: “Good chat tool, but not as robust as others. ”
reviews.pros: Google Chat is great for direct messaging and sharing files. It's an added bonus that it is included with Google Suite.
reviews.cons: While I found it great for one on one messaging, the group collaboration feels a little busy. In large team chats it can be easy to get lost in the convo. When a thread is created within the team chat, it populates for everyone to see, rather than being hidden until you click in. This may just be personal preference, or take getting used to. However I prefer the UI of Slack.

reviews.title: “Google Chat Review”
reviews.text: It has less strange issues than Skype, but some things need to be polished.
reviews.pros: It provides all the features we need from a tool for communication between remote team: Chat, call, video, share screen, the possibility to make groups of people, etc.
reviews.cons: To make a simple call with a colleague, instead of a simple click on the colleague, I need to click on an icon for video call, click enter to send that call to a colleague, click on the icon of the call to go into call room, turn off camera (since we don't use it for every call), and click join at the end. And this needs to be done for every call again.

reviews.title: “Hangouts Review”
reviews.pros: It has some good features, like file uploading, message sending and sending meeting invite.
reviews.cons: It should have a direct calling feature within the organization.

reviews.title: “Google Hangouts ”
reviews.pros: User friendly.  Easy to instruct employees on set up, implement, and communicate between the office in real time!
reviews.cons: Less technical savvy users will need a bit more training on how to know where to look for notifications and may need assistance with the settings, in my ext.

reviews.title: “Chat: User review”
reviews.text: My family and I use this software on a daily basis for work and virtual school.
reviews.pros: The simplicity with which this software can be installed and used on a daily basis is astounding. A child could do it all without any guidance at all. Well done!
reviews.cons: The software tends to hang up and also tends to repeat the same chat message twice on some occasions. However, these instances are few and far between so overall no major negative impact on performance.

reviews.title: “Not lifechanging, but a nice feature”
reviews.text: Overall Chat makes it really easy to communicate with colleagues quickly without having an email chain for matters that aren't necessarily work related, or work related matters that are more urgent. Definitely not necessary to have but comes in handy that it's available.
reviews.pros: Integrated seamlessly into the rest of G Suite making it easy to communicate with colleagues.
reviews.cons: Having to invite people to chat can be annoying but I see why this is a nice feature to block random people or spam messages. Nothing to dislike about G Chat.

reviews.title: “Basic Alternative to Skype”
reviews.text: Google Chat provides a simple addition to Gmail that allows for quick chats with your contacts.
reviews.pros: Integration with other Google tools, including Gmail, makes it simple to implement. I like the ability to start chats and video calls straight from Gmail and to manage contacts across both, as well as see your contact list straight from the gmail homepage.
reviews.cons: Its features are pretty basic when it comes to video calling, sharing attachments, or anything that more complex chat tools provide.

reviews.title: “Chat with Google”
reviews.pros: It is used mainly for team and work communication. Files can be sent and does not destroy quality of images.
reviews.cons: It takes time to find and reply to an individual message even if it is in a thread.

reviews.title: “A good free chat application... But can be better”
reviews.pros: Can chat but also upload certain documents and files all for free.
reviews.cons: Not properly integrated with other G suite apps.

reviews.title: “Easy Way to Communicate with Coworkers ”
reviews.text: Overall experience with this is a good one. After 14 years in the classroom this is definitely a very easy way to communicate with others, and make sure that you are not interrupting their class time with questions or needing to get a hold of them.
reviews.pros: So simple to use and leave open in your Google account at any time. I often have chats up with my coworkers or students throughout the day for correspondence instead of email.
reviews.cons: I really don't have any cons about this product. It's super easy to use, keeps things simplified, and is easy to use on all devices.

reviews.title: “Easy messaging - used by everyone!”
reviews.text: While Googe Hangouts has been around for some time, we've really started using it more since COVID-19.
reviews.pros: Google Hangouts truly simplifies our team's inner office communication. With easy integration to all our everyday use of Google docs and calendars, it has simply become a communication tool of choice for our dispersed (remote) teams. We use Hangouts both for messaging as well as group video calls.
reviews.cons: I feel as with many things Google, that user interface and design can be improved.

reviews.title: “Google Chat Review ”
reviews.pros: This program is very easy to use and it is straightforward. You are easily able to talk to people outside of the organization which is great because I have run into issues with other programs where this was not an option. I also love how easy it is to use Hangouts, Gmail, and Drive.
reviews.cons: When using the video call option, it is more often than not, pretty laggy and when using the texting feature, there is a character limit which can get annoying. That is really the only con I can give this program.

reviews.title: “Keeps our school safe and alert”
reviews.text: FREE!  Easy to use, and instant.
reviews.pros: Using this schoolwide, I can immediately send a message out to the entire team asking a question, or receive updates about a fire drill, etc. It doesn't require I check an email or send a text message, but it allows me to stay connected to the school. Furthermore, I can go back and read them anytime, serving as a form of documentation.
reviews.cons: I haven't determined how to print the conversations when I need them, other than screenshots. There may be an easier way that I missed.

reviews.title: “Prefer it to Zoom”
reviews.pros: The convenience is unbeatable. To have my email and chat in the same window is great. I like the simplicity and quality as well as the ease with which I can use it for calls.
reviews.cons: It's great until they make an update and now that they want to replace google hangouts with google chat, I keep on not receiving messages and things don't seem to translate between my desktop and computer.

reviews.title: “Chat is great for marketers!”
reviews.pros: It is a great way to communicate efficiently with colleagues.
reviews.cons: I wish you did not have to use Gmail for the chat.

reviews.title: “Practical”
reviews.text: Easy to use, practical, and if I need to say something fast to the person it saves my time as I get a faster response in the chat
reviews.pros: allows to maintain the interaction without problems, it is instantaneous
reviews.cons: sometimes the tool to chat with people presents an error

reviews.title: “Google keeps changing chat functions!”
reviews.text: I use it because it's free, but would look for another option if I had one.
reviews.pros: I like that it is free! This is the best thing about it, and why we use it.
reviews.cons: Google keeps changing their chatting platform. It has been hangouts... it has been gChat, and now just chat. It's hard to keep up with all the updates and the new features. I wish Google would just choose one and focus on the individual features.

reviews.title: “Google Chat Keeps People Connected”
reviews.pros: I love Google Chat! Most of my online life is spent using Google products, so the chat is ever-present and ready when needed. I love the integration with your contacts so you can connect with those you want to when you want to.
reviews.cons: There really aren't any cons. It's a simple chat feature that connects you when you want to and disconnects you when you don't want to. Use it while you're already using other Google products to make your experience even better!

reviews.title: “It's Like a Slack Light”
reviews.text: Slack Light. Not bad if your company uses GSuite as integration works well.
reviews.pros: Can insert gifs, and videos easily. Can make rooms or topics similar to Slack or Discord. Notifications and mobile app work well. Use it everyday at work.
reviews.cons: Search functionality needs to be vastly improved. Also the default notification settings for the mobile app are very annoying as it defaults to alert on every message. Wish the mobile app had a dark mode.

reviews.title: “Somewhat lacking”
reviews.text: We tried to switch from Microsoft Teams, because Teams is awful, but we won't stick with Google Chat either.
reviews.pros: Good if you access via Gmail, very userfriendly and easy to implement,  but that's it.
reviews.cons: Lacking in every other aspect, there are tons of other options out there. Found some bugs and laggy features. Expensive.

reviews.title: “Hangout”
reviews.text: Overall i have a great time using this service. It's helped me build better chemistry with my bosses an coworkers especially that we all work remotely. The heavy work load is made easy when tackling it as a team and this tool helps connecting everyone.
reviews.pros: This helps get a message across way faster than a formal email in large companies where a lot of information is relayed in a timely fashion. It helps save a lot of time by making the idea go from one point to another pretty fast.
reviews.cons: The design could significantly be improved which would make the process flow better. The color charts or color-coding( however you would like to refer to them) could be improved in a manner that would attract more people.

reviews.title: “Good communication tool with a few glitches”
reviews.pros: quick, easy, and simple to use. It's built into my gmail.
reviews.cons: Sometimes I am not alerted when I have a new message. It's also confusing to figure out who is speaking if you have a conversation with multiple people. It can also be hard to find the correct window if you have multiple group chats open.

reviews.title: “Great Tool for Google Workspace Users”
reviews.text: Effortless.  Everything works as described; it was a simple transition from Slack and the browser chat takes much less system resources than Slack.
reviews.pros: Having Google Chat integrated with Google Mail is very nice.  I like that it just works, and when they roll out an update, it's a simple F5-Refresh away.
reviews.cons: I really wish there was a way to create a task from a chat but at the moment that doesn't seem to be available.  I have put a request in for that feature, however.

reviews.title: “Love Google Hangouts”
reviews.pros: I love Google Hangouts! I know zoom is the popular one, but... I don't see a reason to use it! It's free and works great.
reviews.cons:
The only thing that bugs me is that about once / month, it requires me to re-give permissions on my mac that I've already given like 5 times, LOL.

Other than that, I love it!

reviews.title: “Easy to use ”
reviews.text: We have kept costs down by utilizing Hangouts, there was a time when the company was looking at a video conferencing phone system.   Hangouts has ensured that we do not spend a lot of money.
reviews.pros: The software is set up for basic computer experienced individuals.   All functions are laid out in a manner that there is no searching for the feature.   Even the dread screen sharing is rather simple to utilize.
reviews.cons: The only downfall of the software (like some of its competitors) is once there are too many individuals on, there is a lag time.

reviews.title: “Simple chat tool”
reviews.text: We eliminated the use of email for interoffice chat
reviews.pros: We used to use Gchat for inter-office communication. It makes it easy to chat with coworkers without sending emails
reviews.cons: Google chat is very simple to use but lacks some essential features like Channels, Gif sending, & polls

reviews.title: “It seems like they havent updated it in ages”
reviews.pros: Very well integrated with the google suite
reviews.cons: I wish if had kept up with the times and be more feature rich

reviews.title: “Good enough”
reviews.text: Overall, it's good enough.
reviews.pros: It's as good as other messenger like text, Facebook messenger, and Whats up.
reviews.cons: Hope it has undo feature. I sometimes want to unsend or delete a message that has been delivered already.

reviews.title: “Same familiar experience as Hangouts, tailored for teams”
reviews.text: Love that Chat is built into our GSuite subscription - we use it whenever we need to quickly tag-up on an item.
reviews.pros: Google Chat is very easy to use - perfect for coordinating on small tasks and large projects with team members, and very similar to the consumer Hangouts product.
reviews.cons: I'd love to see some organization features - in addition to being able to search across chats, having the options to highlight/save/tag specific chats sort of like starring in Slack would be helpful!

reviews.title: “Seamless Communication.”
reviews.text: I have really enjoyed using Google Chat. Its simple user face makes communicating stress-free, especially for users on the receiving end. Not everyone is tech-savvy and needs complications. My overall experience has been good!
reviews.pros: Google Chat enables me to communicate in real-time. Easy to navigate and use. Cheap without fluff and confusion.
reviews.cons: Although it is cheap and user friendly it boasts basic features which I can't say is a con for persons who need just that.

reviews.title: “Google Chat Review”
reviews.pros: Google Chat is great for communicating with other people quickly. it implements well with if you are using all that  Google has to offer with it's other software.
reviews.cons: If you are not using all of Google's other software, then Google Chat might not be for you.

reviews.title: “best chat option ”
reviews.pros: this is the best chat option, also works well in sharing files, or internet data, it is instant, notifies other users. never had any issue so do not know how customer service works. i recommend this to my kids as well, it is a great reminder too also
reviews.cons: there is nothing wrong for what i use this too for, team communication and chat

reviews.title: “Good communication tools”
reviews.text: We use it sometimes, but it just isn't comfortable for me
reviews.pros: Perfect for communicating in the office. You can create groups of people. A quick way to talk about anything
reviews.cons: The interface is a bit ugly and archaic. I just don't like it. It has limit for shared documents.

reviews.title: “Great way to communicate throughout the day!”
reviews.pros: The ease of use and how the group feature works allows for both personal and more professional communication ease
reviews.cons: I wish there was an easier way to sort through chat history

reviews.title: “My experience of Google chat”
reviews.pros: Help me to connect with my friends and team members, keep track of our work and conversation, and we can easily share our data like files here without any inconvenience!
reviews.cons: Some it's interface get stuck and don't allow to keep up the conversation unless we close the application, don't know what's the problem please try to fix it!

reviews.title: “Use it all the time!”
reviews.pros: It is easy to use to chat with coworkers or even friends during the workday if you just need to communicate a quick message.
reviews.cons: I wish there were a way to search within the chat for a keyword if you need to go back and find something that was discussed.

reviews.title: “Loads of Productivity Under One Roof”
reviews.pros: Ease of use, loads faster, more productive.
reviews.cons: Everything seems fine here no complaints at all.

reviews.title: “We use Google Chat to communicate through the office quickly and easily.”
reviews.text: Easy office communication. Helps get in contact with employees without giving out cell phone numbers
reviews.pros: Google Chat allows us to communicate throughout our office when phones are not an option. During conference calls, people away from their desk, etc. This mixed with hangouts makes communcation very simple.
reviews.cons: Very basic features, however this can be considered a good thing because that makes it lightweight. Not all users are willing to install the app, so we have to resort to other methods for some.

reviews.title: “Great easy chat”
reviews.pros: Free easy to use chat that's the new "AIM"
reviews.cons: Not quite as robust as Slack but hey, it's free!

reviews.title: “A free multi user vieo conferencing tool”
reviews.text: I still love google hangouts for users that don't want to purchase a product for multi user video conferencing. It is easy to use and built right into google.
reviews.pros: Google hangouts is free and allows multiple users without having to pay for Skype for business or zoom.
reviews.cons: The transmission quality needs some work as sometimes the video and sound is off time or blurry.

reviews.title: “I am a Google chat addict! ”
reviews.pros: I've been using it for over a year now and I have to say, this app has done wonders for my productivity. It's not only saved me time but also improved the way I work. I love how we can communicate so easily using Gmail as our main email provider. My experience has been excellent!!
reviews.cons: google need to work on its UI and also they need to work on privacy controls.

reviews.title: “Easy way to communicate with teams asap”
reviews.pros:
- Team communication made easy, because we no need to open Google chat as a seperate application, it is integrated with Gmail
- Since it integrate with Gmail we can easily see the message in office hours
- Mobile application also available for easy of access
reviews.cons: - Document attachment is very worst process in the Google chat

reviews.title: “Google Chat”
reviews.pros: I enjoy how easy it is to send an invite to another person through email or text.
reviews.cons: Sometimes photos and videos fail to load which can be annoying.

reviews.title: “Good chat service from google”
reviews.text: I like the quick and reliable chat service from google. I like it a bit more than some competition as well.
reviews.pros: I like being able to chat with work related and personal chats in a quicker fashion than writing an email. I like the instant part of the messaging as well and seeing if colleagues are online as well.
reviews.cons: I don't know all the aspects to the service yet so it's hard to say what I don't like yet.  I will have to learn more functions to see if any drawbacks.

reviews.title: “Best Way of Running Several Different Chat Groups”
reviews.text: I use Chat in my personal life, specifically in keeping up with friends who live in different parts of the country. I use it almost daily for sending messages, photos and videos, and for doing video calls when we want to chat or play a game together. It's very easy to create and use different chat groups and keep those chat threads separate and organized.
reviews.pros: Very easy to use for messaging, sending pictures and videos, and for doing video calls. It's easy to create and manage several different chat threads.
reviews.cons: I have not had any issues in my time using Chat.

reviews.title: “Chat is better!”
reviews.pros: Clean and easy to use. Perfect way to connect with co workers and be able to see if they are o line or away.
reviews.cons: Not able to see how long someone has been inactive in the app.

reviews.title: “A Helpful Google Tool”
reviews.pros: I like to use Google Chat when at the office for quick and easy replies between coworkers. It is great for those little questions or bits of information that do not need a full email for.
reviews.cons: There is nothing that I do not like about Google Chat.

reviews.title: “Easiest way to chat”
reviews.text: I don't use it much anymore because texting is so easy and I need fewer distractions, but it's still the best chat around. Remember AIM???
reviews.pros: It's nice to have your chat right there in your email, so as you're going about other tasks you can check in on your chats with friends. You  don't have to pick up your phone to text, it's just right there on your computer screen.
reviews.cons: It's hard to figure out how to not be visible to everyone in your contacts, but only to certain people you actually want to chat with.

reviews.title: “Simple, great chat. Works near perfectly. ”
reviews.pros: Google Chat is great. It's integrated well into Gmail, runs smoothly, and rarely has any problems. Does a simple job well without over complicating things.
reviews.cons: Not much to dislike to be honest. It does its job very well and doesn't try to get fancy or loaded with superfluous features. One thing that could be improved is how chats are archived and how they show up in search results in Gmail. Could definitely be smoother/more logical in terms of the execution/organization

reviews.title: “Google Hangouts communication software ”
reviews.pros: Very easy to communicate with other people via chat or calls. Respond very quickly.
reviews.cons: Not enough smart features and integration with other apps.

reviews.title: “The Ultimate Company Communication Tool!”
reviews.text: Chat is really the best way to communicate information company wide, big or small and keep it there for reference or viewing at a later time. It keeps things very organized and in categories, designed to your specific needs.
reviews.pros: This changes the face of your companies ability to communicate and have access to that communication, small and large groups within your organization. Posting is simple and user friendly, notifications are multifaceted, via email and on the app.  Super easy to organize the groups and super easy to maintain.
