reviews.cons: If you are like me and you hate notifications on your apps, on your phone, its a bit of a pain to get these to go away.  I think of it as a fishing expedition, even when I select unread, I can't always get all notifications to go away, that makes me a little crazy, but not enough to dislike Chat.

reviews.title: “G Chat”
reviews.text: It is a great alternative to email. It allows for more informal conversations, and sometimes address immediate needs that cannot wait for the person you are conversing with to open that email.
reviews.pros: I like that you are able to both talk to individuals, groups, or "rooms". It is a good alternative to email that allows for a little more informal conversation.
reviews.cons: The sidebar of the chat options in gmail takes up far too much room when open. I would prefer that it was always hidden so that the email folders were priority.

reviews.title: “Easy daily team communication”
reviews.pros: We use it daily for our internal team communication and video calls. It is totally free and you can have it set up on your desktop and phone. Their interface is user friendly and you can easily create new chat rooms. Google Hangouts integrates well with other Google products.
reviews.cons: You must have high speed internet to use it because a slow speed internet will make it hard to use. The sound and video quality could be better. Not great for enterprise and client meetings.

reviews.title: “Gchat/Hangouts has seen better days”
reviews.text: Chat was good when it was a burgeoning standard, but has been surpassed by competitors in the business field.
reviews.pros: It was really effective for the beginning of inter-office instant messages. Providing a perk overlooked by outlook, but has failed to keep up with changing employee dynamics
reviews.cons: Things we now see standard in slack - ease of an ability to make channels and groups. Lack of customizable screens, and multiple conversations being in multiple popouts

reviews.title: “G Suite for Business Chat”
reviews.text: I am using G suite chat to carryout simple convocations with my Gmail contacts. Simple things i miss or I want to explain, I do with this facility after an email.
reviews.pros: Well google is providing the facility to chat with my friends and business partners through my gmail account for sometime now. Chat can include sharing of documents through drive and word,spreadsheets,pdfs and many more can be shared with a higher security. Entire facility is free and available for any Gmail user which is amazing.
reviews.cons: Chat platform is not interesting as famous social media apps. Service is not provided for mobile apps. Less popular yet. Available only among Gmail contacts.

reviews.title: “Awesome platform”
reviews.pros: It helps us a lot for daily communication with the team and is easy to use.
reviews.cons: There are limits to features and options to make the useability more exciting.

reviews.title: “Greate Communication Software”
reviews.pros:
It is fast and has a lot of features, like integrations with Jira.
It also has integration with Google Meet and it's easy to make video call ASAP.
It's very cheap, comparing to other top level chat applications, like Slack.
reviews.cons:
It lack some of integrations, comparing to Slack.
Design can be a little bit better, for me. It lacks colors and overall looks a lit bit rough.
Chat which is at Gmail page is not always synchronized and it creates some miscommunication.

reviews.title: “Google Hangout”
reviews.pros: Easy and quick conversations, provides multiple options  like googlemeet
reviews.cons: Does not support large video files and sometimes video take more time to load

reviews.title: “Great for work and play”
reviews.pros: I like the functionality of the application and that fact that I can set it up like texting on the phone on the go or on my desktop screen. Another great feature is that it’s link to my work email and all my contacts carry over to the chat from emails!
reviews.cons: It will need internet connection to work unlike texting or calling.

reviews.title: “Great Product”
reviews.pros: As with all Google products, I like that it makes sense and is easy to use. I use Google products for so many things and this is no different. They make it very easy to communicate with friends, family, and co-workers when needed.
reviews.cons: I haven't used the mobile version but I have heard a few negative things about it. I only use it when I am on my laptop. I personally haven't had any issues or problems with the software.

reviews.title: “A convenient messaging software”
reviews.text: My overall experience has been very good. Hangouts is a really convenient software.
reviews.pros: Google Hangouts is free and is super easy to use. It is very reliable and I love that I can conduct interviews and meetings on it easily due to its group chat function.
reviews.cons: When compared to other messaging software, I feel that Hangouts has some limited features. It does not allow users to select a message and reply to it or edit messages after sending them.

reviews.title: “Review About Google Chat”
reviews.text: Overall my experience with google chat is aweasome. I mostly use it to get in touch with my friends and family. I also use it for business meetings and it very easy to use and with a nice GUI. You can schedule your meeting or set a reminder for anything (good for me because i forget everything without a reminder).
reviews.pros:
Pros Using Google Chat:
1. Easy To use, User Friendly
2. Perfect Integration with GSuite, You can use it with Google Drive, hangout, and Gmail.
3. Easy to schedule anything (You can set reminder for meeting)
4. You can use it for both business as well as for personal use, You can enjoy group chat with your family and friends.
reviews.cons:
Cons Using Google Chat:
1. it's hard to find any reason for dislike, old version was a little clunky but with the recent update, the problem is solved.
2. Frequent Updates (With no Actual Changes)

reviews.title: “Good for some circumstances”
reviews.pros: I like how it is integrated into Google which makes it easy to access
reviews.cons: You do not know when someone messaged you

reviews.title: “Frequent user”
reviews.text: Awesome overall user experience.
reviews.pros: Ease of use, real time delivery of messages, basic user interface, there was an option to see who is online.
reviews.cons: We can’t integrate Project Management or To -Do Lists.

reviews.title: “I use Chat in the office and for personal communication!”
reviews.pros: I  keep my gmail account open all day at work. That is the main means of communication between coworkers. It is very convenient and easy to navigate.
reviews.cons: Sometimes Chat does not work for a minute or two when it is first opened.

reviews.title: “Nice tool for internal chatting”
reviews.text: We utilize Chat for 1-1 and group communications within our organization, for more efficient conversations than email threads.
reviews.pros: I like how easy it is to start a chat, group chat, or room in Hangouts to quickly contact internal users of the same google suite.
reviews.cons: I don't like how this tool is integrated with the gmail inbox view - it is cumbersome and bad UI to view multiple chat windows on top of emails and drafts. And the standalone view of Chats is not as organized as other tools like Slack in terms of organizing rooms and group conversations.

reviews.title: “Simply the Best”
reviews.text: Simply the BEST. UX is perfect, the app is handy to use on my iPhone and I will continue to implement wherever I find myself.
reviews.pros: After using the majority of chat software, I can honestly say Google Chat is simply the best. It's the easiest to use, keeps me in touch with my colleagues, and is so easy to manage. The app is also perfect for staying in communication during long projects!
reviews.cons: I wish there were a giphy function, but that's literally it! Google Chat rocks and I love using it!!

reviews.title: “Excellent application for co-operate level. ”
reviews.text:
- First of all, I am giving real review because I am using this app in my company since 2019 and we are happy to use it.
- If you want to use for conversation in collaboration then this is best for it.
reviews.pros:
-  It is reliable and data privacy and secure application so it is most of choice for me.
- Easy to use.
-All the features are available in one application.
- Not much configuration is required to use it.
- The Google product is always the best.
- The UI is attractive.
reviews.cons:
- While using the desktop version, I noticed that sometimes sync is not working properly(
late conversation).
- More internet data consumption.

reviews.title: “Have been using Google Chat since ages!”
reviews.text: I'm very happy using Google chat uptil now. Have been using this since my college days.
reviews.pros: Extremely user friendly app and easy to use. Just love the way how easily we can interact with people using Google chat. The best thing is we can access this through phone as well as a laptop or computer
reviews.cons: Nothing to dislike as such. May be they can upgrade the user interface and can make it more interesting.

reviews.title: “It works, but it is no Slack”
reviews.pros: It gets the job done for chatting with co-workers. You can send messages and received them. You can have groups and announcements. Since it comes for free with G suite, My employer keeps using it.
reviews.cons: It isn't Slack. I like Slack better. I think it is a better user experience. Messages get read. Things are less likely to get missed. If you have the cash, go with Slack here.

reviews.title: “Great Communicator”
reviews.text: Surely, anyday i will prefer to use gchat over others. I would highly recommend using it.
reviews.pros: If someone is looking for the best option for chatting, gChat should the best among all. And the extend at which chat is adding features it great to use for chatting, calling, video, etc.
reviews.cons: Least to love about the chat is the integrations, so its doesn't provide any integration with other platform to integrate in gchat and use gchat to use it a default medium for communication.

reviews.title: “Easy and convenient choice for communication”
reviews.pros: Everything Google is in sync and you can find all your contacts easily. It's free and convenient to use.
reviews.cons: As of the current version, there is no lack or defect I can think of on desktop and mobile versions of this app.

reviews.title: “Easy Chat for Company-Wide Communication”
reviews.text: Overall we love utilizing the product and use it daily!
reviews.pros: What we like most about the G Chat feature is that the entire company can utilize it and it is integrated in to the entire GSuite - making it a perfect choice for a group utilizing GMail.
reviews.cons: What we like least is you have to "accept" the ability to chat with someone else.  This makes instant communication with new folks just a little less timely.  Only the first time however, so it is a minor difficulty.

reviews.title: “Ok software”
reviews.pros: I like having another form of communication really good for texting communication
reviews.cons: Uploading videos and sometimes pictures but especially videos take forever for me to fully send

reviews.title: “A Real time Hangout for your Team”
reviews.pros: It's very easy and it helps us to communicate within the team at your workplace.
reviews.cons: It doesn't pop up the audio calling option on your phone.

reviews.title: “Used to be great...but then removed SMS integration”
reviews.pros: Hangouts used to be fantastic with the ability to switch between mobile app and desktop interface and the mobile app used to have sms integration. That version of the software was a great tool to have. All messages (hangouts and SMS) in one place.
reviews.cons: When google removed SMS integration, Hangouts ceased being a useful tool for us.

reviews.title: “Great for Quick Chats!”
reviews.text: Overall, Google Hangouts is a great tool that I will be using for years to come.
reviews.pros: Google Hangouts is a great tool when you need to connect with your coworkers quickly and efficiently.
reviews.cons: Since Google rolled out their new "Chat Rooms", it's annoying to have to open a different tab up to chat with a bigger group of people. I liked just the chats better.

reviews.title: “Keeping me connected through the years ”
reviews.text: Love Google Chat! I don't know how else I could keep up with my grandparents on a biweekly basis!!
reviews.pros: Since I was in high school (~ 10 years ago), I have utilized Google Chat to stay connected with friends and distant family. It has provided me with an exceptional platform to continue keeping up with long distance friends/relatives throughout the COVID pandemic and throughout the years.
reviews.cons: N/A. It is easy to use and user-friendy.

reviews.title: “Google Hangouts”
reviews.pros: That you don't have to pay for it's service and it is saved to Google account. You can sign in years later, and still have messages from a different time.
reviews.cons: Constantly had crappy video quality. And no customization.

reviews.title: “Google chat is z easiest way for comunication”
reviews.pros: Easy to use , fast , secured , you can used it in a group chat to facilitate work
reviews.cons: You can use it  any time from any device disk top , lap top , phone

reviews.title: “Google hangouts is Awesome”
reviews.text: It's a great way to keep in touch with colleagues while working.
reviews.pros: Easy way to chat with the team or individual about work and drag and drop is a piece of cake.
reviews.cons: Changing features often loses something I liked.

reviews.title: “Get feedback quick”
reviews.text: I use Google Chats on a daily basis. Between connecting with my colleagues to getting quick feedback, it does a great job.
reviews.pros: I love that Google Chat connects me to all of my colleagues instantly. If I am in need of feedback, I can send a couple of chats and get a couple of responses quickly.
reviews.cons: Google Chat is a wonderful tool. It is simple to use and it should be. However, I really wish it had a search feature. It would be nice to be able to reference past chats easily.

reviews.title: “It’s my go-to for video chat”
reviews.text: Using it either with my mobile device or my laptop is equally convenient.
reviews.pros: Google chat is by far the easiest to use out of all of the video conferencing software that I have used. Since our team all uses Gmail, google docs, and other tools, it is perfectly positioned for integration with our stack.
reviews.cons: What I really am looking for in a video product is the background, the virtual background, as an option. I cannot say how nice zoom is because they offer this feature. Sometimes if I have to run out for an errand but take a video call from the car or from… anywhere, it’s nice that it looks as if I am at my desk.

reviews.title: “Google Chat/"Hangouts"”
reviews.text: I am very satisfied with Hangouts or Google Chat. I know what the app is and I know what kind of conversation and things to exchange on a chat app.
reviews.pros: This software is simple to use. You can download the app on mobile or pc and it is also available in your gmail. If a A client could use it and not share their home or personal mobile. Simple fast and safe if you are not into sharing phone numbers and such.
reviews.cons: I am not sure about sending sensitive information over this service. I would probably use something else if I was dealing with a ssn or anything of that nature that you may have to get or give out, maybe do that in person.

reviews.title: “Works well if you miss AOL chatting! ”
reviews.pros: It's easy to use and fairly brainless...updates quickly and connects you to friends! I also like that you can quickly jump to a hang, add a calendar update...that it's "smart" and prompts the next step automatically.
reviews.cons: That I just don't really chat anymore, and when I do, it's through FB. I don't leave Google chat logged in...I guess texting has kind of taken its place! Still, can be handy when I know I'm having a "hang" ahead of time.

reviews.title: “Every company should use this to communicate”
reviews.pros: Love how easy it makes it to communicate with co-workers. Love having different groups and being able to use emojis and gifs to light the mood as the day progresses.
reviews.cons: Google Chat and Google Hangouts I feel like are the same thing but I dont know why there are two different apps but I get duplicated notifications for each when I receive messages. Don't get it.

reviews.title: “Simplest instant messaging application”
reviews.pros:
I. User friendly
II. Instant messaging application
III. Audio and video calling with conferencing facility
IV. Status setting option
reviews.cons: Additional pop up doesnt come up if one notification is not seen/observed.

reviews.title: “G Suite Chat”
reviews.text: I chat both professionally and with my family. It has very easy access and compatibility, so it's easy for me to leave it open at all times.
reviews.pros: So many of my friends are are on this chat that I find it very convenient to use. I have it open all the time both at home and at work.
reviews.cons: It works differently on my computer than it does on my phone. I wish it was the same for both my Mac and my iPhone.

reviews.title: “G Suite Chat”
reviews.text: I work from home but like everyone else, there are times when I'm just not able to be at home. This product allows me to take calls/chats wherever I am with my cell phone. I love it!!
reviews.pros: I love the fact that I can take it anywhere! I work as an online reviewer and I get calls/chats from my clients all the time. It's nice when I'm away from my desk that it's also on my phone. I can talk to my clients from my car, when I'm out running errands and even while I'm at a restaurant! It is so easy to use and the customer service is amazing. I would recommend it to everyone that has  needs the convenience that sometimes needs their " Office "  to be wherever they need to be!
reviews.cons: I haven't found anything that I don't like about it! It's an Amazing product!

reviews.title: “Easy to connect with contacts through the Gsuite”
reviews.text: I enjoy staying connected with my contacts and can easily do so with the G Suite Chat
reviews.pros: I use this function daily to chat with my friends and family while logged into my computer at work. G Suite Chat is easy to have up to respond to people seamlessly.
reviews.cons: Sometimes my alert doesn't go off when someone chats me but I am sure that is just a user error with what web pages I have up.

reviews.title: “Stay in touch with your team”
reviews.text: I worked at a design agency and we used this to communicate instead of email.
reviews.pros: Easy to use and a great way to stay in touch wherever your team is
reviews.cons: Not many cons I can think of. This is a simple program that does what it says

reviews.title: “Google Chat as an alternative to Slack”
reviews.text: We moved from slack, mainly motivated by pricing, my company is in Brazil, so the currency exchange from dollar get us really hard . It made sense for us as we already were using G Suite tools
reviews.pros: Easy implementation and integration for GSuite Users, quick Google Meet button, easy for beginners, thread-based conversations.
reviews.cons: Since they left the native app to go with a Chrome based app, my experience – at least on MacOS – got much much worse. A better native app would certainly improve the experience. The app also could have more integrations with third party apps.

reviews.title: “Simple to connect”
reviews.text: Overall i am really satisfied with the product and i think it is really helpful to relieve your stress level.
reviews.pros: The most i like about Hangouts is easy of use. It is been definitely a stress reliever. It is easy to connect during video chats and easy to make chats. Also with file sending option, you can both make your meetings and send files.
reviews.cons: I am overall really satisfied about this software. They can make more progress though. It is not still on Skype level.

reviews.title: “Google Chat”
reviews.pros: Its a very simple platform to communicate with peers and direct reports. Makes it really simple to talk to other members of the organization also.
reviews.cons: There are many features that google chat is missing. I know some of my reports have been asking to move to Slack because of this,.

reviews.title: “Feeling Chatty”
reviews.text: I use Chat all the time. This is a great way to be able to stay in contact with clients and partners at the click of a button.
reviews.pros: I like how easily and quickly I can contact anyone in my google contacts with Google Chat. I hope this program never goes away!
reviews.cons: Nothing! I use this software all the time, and never have any problems with it. Makes keeping in touch with people very easy, especially those outside of my organization

reviews.title: “It's an OK option”
reviews.text: We have used it minimally as we were testing out options - we chose to go a different direction. That doesn't mean our choice is the best for others.
reviews.pros: There are plenty of chat tools to choose from. If you are committed exclusively to GSuite, then you will probably be very happy with this Chat software.
reviews.cons: There are other options better suited to the needs of our organization.  To each their own - this might be a perfect solution for you. It's worth giving it a try!

reviews.title: “Easy to Use”
reviews.text: overall good experience and would highly recommend.
reviews.pros: Google Chat is very easy to used compared to other chat services like skype, etc. I would recommend to use for business.
reviews.cons: Not as many features for customization like other platforms like skype etc where you can make it more personable.

reviews.title: “Superb chat”
reviews.text: I've used Google chat since my college years, and trough out my working career, for social and business.  It had help me a lot when my phone was broken. Keep up the good work.
reviews.pros: What I like most about the Google chat, is that allows you to make calls within your contacts.
reviews.cons: What I like least about the software are  the emojis, I believe they need a revamp.

reviews.title: “Perfect tools for Meeting and presentation ”
reviews.pros:
Reason for using Hangouts are listed below:
- Lightweight and easy 
- Needed features are available (video call, screen sharing audio call and etc.)
- Usability 
- Free
reviews.cons:
It would be better if some features are update: some of list are listed below:
- Require good internet (Poor video quality and blur screen sharing)
- It show in call emo even all meets is end
- It would be better if there was option to unsend mistake messages

reviews.title: “Love this instant messaging software!”
reviews.text: This software overall is great! It’s an awesome instant messaging platform that is free and easy to use with many good features like seeing read messages, when someone is typing, easily searching contacts and even messsaging yourself to take notes!
reviews.pros: This software is free! It works wonderfully and the messages are instant. We use this to keep in contact at work and it works great. You can easily search for anyone in the company you need to reach and send them a message. You can see when people have read your messages in one on one conversation and also when they are typing
reviews.cons: Nothing to dislike with Google Chats! Overall a great software

reviews.title: “Google chat”
reviews.text: Google Chat is a much more advanced and efficient than Google Hangouts and works very well.
reviews.pros: Google Chat is an excellent communication app intended for both personal and group chatting. You can send text, share screen or send files easily to a group or a person. Being a Google product, it easily integrates with other Google applications.
reviews.cons: It is not as popular as its competitors and has hence a smaller userbase currently. Also it lacks some basic features like sending Gifs in text chat.

reviews.title: “Google Chat”
reviews.text: I have had a great experience overall with Chat.  It saves a lot of time and has opened up a lot of communication within my organization.
reviews.pros: I like the opportunity to be able to connect quickly and efficiently with my colleagues.  It is often times way easier to send a quick message than to write out an email.
reviews.cons: There isn't the same kind of paper trail you have with an email.  If you need something in writing to reference later, chat is not the best option.

reviews.title: “Amazing messaging alternative ”
reviews.text: Would recommend
reviews.pros: Importing all my messages without having to do anything extra
reviews.cons: It white and very bland. Not much variety or customized options

reviews.title: “Ims”
reviews.pros: Instant messaging is easy to use syncs everything easy
reviews.cons: Nothing much is wrong with the program everything is good on it

reviews.title: “Pretty Good Chat Service”
reviews.pros: It's easy to sign up for if you have an existing google account
reviews.cons: It could notify me a bit better than it currently does

reviews.title: “Underwhelming for the Google Brand”
reviews.text: I wish Google Hangouts were more impressive, because I'm a huge lifelong fan of the other Google products.
reviews.pros: Being that it's a Google product, it's seamlessly integrated with the entire Google world, most notably Google Calendar and Gmail. It is nice when you create a meeting on G Calendar that the Hangouts link is automatically attached and easily viewable.
reviews.cons: The lack of features makes this a bit of a disappointment. I use this product only every so often -- when clients require it -- so I am constantly comparing it to other video conference software and wishing it had more power. A lot of the features you need to run a successful online meeting are difficult to locate such as screensharing, chat, and private messaging.

reviews.title: “We love chat!”
reviews.pros: Google Chat is amazing for office use. We use it during the day to save long emails or phone calls.
reviews.cons: I can't think of any cons of chat. It makes communication in the office much more diligent.

reviews.title: “Ever changing hangouts (or was it google voice? or hangouts?)”
reviews.text: Free calling for those rare cases when the other party does not have Whatsapp, Zoom, Skype
reviews.pros:
Free, integrated in other google products
Mobile option works OK on Android
Integration with Google Voice allowing free calls to US/Canada phone numbers
reviews.cons:
Unfriendly UI
Unclear and finicky setup of HW resources (mic, speakers)
Google snooping on you

reviews.title: “The Slack alternative”
reviews.text: We switched from slack to chat after some time and never looked back. It's a robust IM solution that's backd by the largest tech company in the world and that's fully integrated with G-Suite. What's not to love
reviews.pros:
It's integrated into the G-suite suite of tools
It's feature to search thru any and all conversations and groups is really useful
Webhooks and bots are supported
reviews.cons:
Would like to see more bots implemented
Lacks the more "cool" features of Slack, like custom emojis

reviews.title: “Keeping in touch with gmail users across the country”
reviews.text: just a way to communicate and stay in touch with my google/gmail contacts across the country.
reviews.pros: I believe that this currently goes by google hangouts but it's a great way to keep in touch with any of your gmail contacts and I like how it can stay inside a browser so it's kind of discreet when you're talking.
reviews.cons: No standalone application so you need to have a web browser opened to use it. There might be third party apps that can fix this issue.

reviews.title: “Have a nice quick chat”
reviews.text: All conversations are saved so having a digital paper trail of communication can be helpful.
reviews.pros: GChat is build right into Gmail. Every  feature has an option including snooze, busy, online/offline, pop out window and many more.
reviews.cons: If your contact list is not managed well, a person can have an extensive list of contact and you can also find yourself on the receiving end of a message of someone you do not know.

reviews.title: “A No-Brainer for G-Suite Users”
reviews.text: I can't imagine wanting to switch to a different instant messaging feature at this point. Navigating away from my email inbox seems pointless now that this software exists, and ease of use is the perfect partner to convenience.
reviews.pros: G-Chat is blissfully simple. If you use Gmail, it's right at your fingertips and you don't have to navigate away from everyday tasks to a different website altogether. Sending a message is even easier than email, and receiving one is eye-catching and difficult to miss. I often use this to ask important, urgent questions and ensure a timely response.
reviews.cons: The emoji options are quite ugly, and I haven't been able to figure out a way around them. With an increasingly younger workforce, emojis are a common way to express emotion quickly and having ones of better quality as options would be nice.

reviews.title: “A Lovely program to chat”
reviews.text: A satisfying experience when you are looking for a way to communicate with friends in the absence of other chat apps
reviews.pros:
IT departments has prohibited most chat apps however this one was not prohibited which allowed me communicate with different friends at different companies easily.
Privacy is guaranteed because the messages are encrypted and hence no one can spy on the messages
reviews.cons:
It is not widely spread as other chat programs like Whatsapp, Viber & Facebook messanger
Emojis are not the best in this app.

reviews.title: “Keeps us connected”
reviews.pros: We use this with our Google Workspace. This makes it very easy to use to chat, see emails, and calendars all in one.
reviews.cons: We do not have any cons. Some of my team members use it more than others.

reviews.title: “Awesome communication tool for audio and video conferencing”
reviews.text: Quite satisfied with its reliability and flexibility in daily communication for free
reviews.pros:
1. Reliable and secure communication tool
2. Can do group chat which is an important feature
3. Awesome tool to communicate with friends and for meetings and interviews
4. Great integrations with Google products
reviews.cons: 1. Doesn't support virtual background feature yet which is very important especially with wfh in Covid

reviews.title: “Gchat Review”
reviews.text: My overall experience is positive with Chat given its ease of use on multiple platforms.
reviews.pros: I like how it functions like a text message on your computer but on your phone it comes through as a text as well.
reviews.cons: Overall it is easy to use and is helpful for communicating with colleagues. However, sometimes the application on my phone closes out quickly for no reason.

reviews.title: “Easy & Reliable”
reviews.text: Overall, it's a great product that's free. It does all the essential functions and is particularly easy if you're used to the G-Suite.
reviews.pros: Easy to use and no setup required. It works well on desktop and mobile, and allows you to send attachments easily.
reviews.cons: On mobile, it doesn't seem to save my preferences around browser (I use Safari and it always prompts me to download Chrome, even though I've tried to set it so that it doesn't keep asking about it).

reviews.title: “Good in a pinch”
reviews.text: I like using chat in a pinch when I need to ask a quick question; it's perfect for that!
reviews.pros: Google's Chat feature is pretty seamless and helpful for those quick messages to coworkers who may not look at their email as often. The alerts are pretty hard to ignore.
reviews.cons: The chat feature tends to go offline a good bit, which is not only annoying when try to send a message, but also it looks bad from a design standpoint in your Google account.

reviews.title: “Professional Messaging Tool Withing the Organization”
reviews.text: Professional Messaging Apps, Group Video & Audio call, Safe and Secure in Terms of Privacy
reviews.pros: mobile Free Messaging Tool within the Organization, Specially People Working on Mail Platform, Easy Setup Time , Group Formation is Easy, Can Connect across the Country, Easily Add Drives Files
reviews.cons: Video and Audio Quality is Less as Compare to Other Social App, Labling of User is not Possible Need Advance feature Like Polls, Audio Sending etc

reviews.title: “About Google Chat”
reviews.text: It's just awesome.. I loved everything..
reviews.pros: I liked most about in Google Chat filters...
reviews.cons: It's very good moment in my life when I'm used that

reviews.title: “Excellent”
reviews.text: My overall experience has been great since i am using it.
reviews.pros: Google chat is really convenient software for team communication and collaboration. It is very smooth and a nice way of formally hosting a meeting.
reviews.cons: Everything is good theres nothing that one will actually dislike.

reviews.title: “Great product, but doesn't support calls anymore”
reviews.text: Nice product, I used to use it daily, but now it is being discontinued, and I had to switch to the Google Voice, which is, basically, a less table version of Hangouts.
reviews.pros: This used to be a great product with calls and texts made from a Google phone number. Super convenient, especially when there are several different businesses in different areas.
reviews.cons: Only one problem - it is not possible to make calls through Hangouts. I had to migrate to Google Voice.

reviews.title: “Get In Touch Quickly”
reviews.text: If your coworker has a bad habit of not paying attention to their text messages, send them a message on Google Chat.
reviews.pros: Easily integrates into your GMail inbox, so you can chat and write e-mails at the same time. Easy to start a video call from GChat as well. GChat conversations can also be automatically archived for later.
reviews.cons: No major complaints about Google Chat. Sometimes there is a lag when sending an image or video through the chat.

reviews.title: “A great business tool”
reviews.text: It just helps us work with our team more efficiently!
reviews.pros: It's incredibly handy to have a chat application built right into our email suite. It's an incredibly simplified way of communicating with the team in real time.
reviews.cons: On rare occasions, the chat list will stop displaying active users for a few minutes, which means we can't see who's newly on, who just went off… It can delay things and make us grab for the phone instead.

reviews.title: “I use Google Chat at work daily to communicate with co-workers”
reviews.text: I use google chat daily for work and it does the job seamlessly and easily. I'd recommend it to anyone
reviews.pros:
What I like most about this software is how easy it is to communicate with many different people. I use Google Chat daily to speak to my co-workers, supervisors, managers, and more. 

I also like that its easily integrated into my google account.
reviews.cons: The only thing I don't like about Google Chat is the thread feature in group chats.

reviews.title: “Overall good product, easy to use, some things would be desirable ”
reviews.pros: easy to use, intuitive, reliable for sending messages in groups
reviews.cons: takes long time to download and send photos and videos, other message apps are ahead of it in these areas

reviews.title: “Great app!!”

reviews.cons: Not so much a difficulty with the software itself, but to make sure you don't join / have to many chats with different teams or employee's.

reviews.title: “Google Hangouts is great for connecting remote”
reviews.pros: Google hangouts makes it easy to connect with people who are not nearby. The chat feature (even after the meeting is ended) is fantastic
reviews.cons: Google hangouts is more glitchy than alternatives, and doesn't offer as many integration or customization options

reviews.title: “Unfortunately, google does everything well except for social media”
reviews.text: The pricing also caps storage, and you have to pay more for more features which doesn’t really seem to make any sense when there are better apps out there for free.
reviews.pros: It’s a lot like Slack with the functionality of google, but for some reason just doesn’t work as well. It was an old instant messaging service that fell off, so google tried to revamp with something relevant but it just is a bit short of what it could be.
reviews.cons: You have to pay for google suite, which seems ridiuclous considering a hard majority of pretty much everything else google makes is free. Why would I want to pay for this?

reviews.title: “Google Chat”

reviews.pros: I love the ease of using Chat when we are in a lockdown practice drill and teachers chat me to let me know what they need, how many kids they have, who might be missing ,etc.
reviews.cons: You need your device with you to utilize it and often times, that may not be possible to do especially in a drill.

reviews.cons: it doesn't have too many functions and it's very simple maybe it's a disadvantage it doesn't send attachments only photos so you can't send pdf files

reviews.title: “Thank Heavens!”
reviews.pros: I love the ability to instantly connect with my co-workers.  No matter where they are in the building working. I am able to get a response.  I also love the fact that I can get a record of the interaction.
reviews.cons: We did struggle with students misusing this system.  But we were able to turn off that feature on their computers.

reviews.title: “Quick Interaction ”
reviews.pros: What I liked most about this software is definitely that this is available through the e-mail to begin with. G-mail is such a big, popular platform so having this chat program in it makes is just as much more convenient. Very easy to use with chatting with clients when they are available right away rather than waiting thru e-mails themselves.
reviews.cons: It get's interrupted with connection problems even when you know for a fact that you have fast, reliable internet where you are working. After a few minutes, the grey re-connecting tab comes up on the top of the chat so aren't sure if the chat went thru or not. This makes it inconvenient while chatting with customers.

reviews.title: “Love it. ”
reviews.text: I'll always use this, frustrations or not.
reviews.pros: Google chat is fantastic. An easy way to keep up with contacts and plan meetings.  You can do this with business or with family.  I especially like the video chat option.  It's often more effective and convenient than facetime or skype due to the fact that you sign into your google account to use it, along with all of their other integrated services.
reviews.cons: Occasionally I'm frustrated when doing group video chat.  When on person talks they are brought to the forefront of the video.  But if someone else makes a noise like "mm hmm" then they are suddenly brought to the forefront.  If the audio was a little smarter in how it worked I think video chat would be more seamless.

reviews.title: “Good for communication”

reviews.title: “Google Chat - Great Product”

reviews.cons: Upon adding GIF function, some of the normal facial/item icon options were decreased.

reviews.title: “Easy to use and onboard gmail users if they don't use alternative communicative software. ”

reviews.title: “Great for Communicating with Team”
reviews.text: The business problems that we solved with Chat was being able to increase our communication with each other in our team and we have definitely been able to accomplish this!
reviews.pros: What I really like about G Suite Chat is how easy it makes it to communicate with the rest of our team. This makes us more quicker to respond to each other rather than how we are when we email each other. I highly recommend this for making communication more seamless!
reviews.cons: What I like the least about this software is that now that there are many softwares like this, like Slack, there's nothing that makes G Suite Chat more convenient than others. I really hope future updates has more features that differentiate this program more.

reviews.title: “Great tool to get started with basic team communication ”

reviews.title: “Chat in Google”
reviews.pros: I love that Google Chat lets me communicate with my teammates. We can simply talk about work tasks and receive emails when we haven’t opened or replied to the last message in the thread.
reviews.cons: Nothing is wrong with Google chat so far

reviews.title: “Simple but works great.”

reviews.cons: The only negative is that not everyone I know is on G Suite chat, so I a few other chat services I use.

reviews.title: “I use it daily!”
reviews.text: GChat is great for daily communication with anyone in your life.

reviews.cons: GChat is so easy to use that it can be a little distracting, and if there is a way to set up a do not disturb feature, I haven't found it yet.

reviews.cons: no issues great integration and easy to-use messaging app

reviews.title: “Google Chat is the standard!”
reviews.text: I love using Google Chat at work. I trust it and know everyone will receive my messages. 10/10 I highly reccomend!
reviews.pros: I like how easy it is to use. It’s almost a classic standard at this point. One of my favorites to use!
reviews.cons: There’s not much I don’t like. Customer service can be a little slow at times.

reviews.title: “Removes email clutter”
reviews.text: Perfect for quick messages and conveniently located in Gmail. It's my preferred method of communication to free up my inbox from multiple email threads.
reviews.pros: Google Chat is integrated into Gmail so it's quick to send messages to other coworkers through the product versus sending an email. Eliminates the back and forth of email and all chats are archived so you can easily return to old messages if needed. You can also chat with multiple people, launch video meetings and paste images directly in the chat box.
reviews.cons: Google Chat has a function that allows users to see if a person has read a message or not. Personally, I don't like that as I don't have an immediate response, but don't want the person to know I have read their message.

reviews.title: “Impressive ”
reviews.text: I love google chat!
reviews.pros: I love the speed of google chat. I also like how you can tell if someone has read it. It is quicker than a text message!
reviews.cons: there is nothing that i dislike, the speed is phenomenal.

reviews.title: “My everyday communication”
reviews.pros: We use google chat at work everyday. Not only is it convenient to use on your computer and phone but it's easy to go back and track any conversations.
reviews.cons: I just wish more people would use, it would make communication so much easier.

reviews.title: “No-frills chat”
reviews.text: Provided you're both using Google products, Chat is a supremely to the point form of quick messaging - either to a remote colleague or when they're on the phone, for example.
reviews.pros: Absolutely straightforward & intuitive chat service, embedded into Gmail for rapid messages that wouldn't merit an email.
reviews.cons: Flipside of its straightforwardness is its lack of frills - you can't attach a file, for example, though you can add graphics.

reviews.title: “Easy chat feature integrated with gmail”
reviews.pros: Google Chat has been very easy to use for everyone in our office, and super helpful for those working remotely.
reviews.cons: It's easy to miss a message because it can be hard to spot on the gmail interface.

reviews.title: “Google Hangouts connects our work team everyday”
reviews.text: Overall I'm very happy with the features and functionality of Google Hangouts.
reviews.pros: Great software to stay connected with various co-workers or teams.  Lots of versatility and features like video chats.
reviews.cons: Sometimes the reminders get crazy if you're connected on a mobile phone and on a laptop.  My phone dings the same time my laptop, lol.  The video call feature can be glitchy to simply answer and hang up.

reviews.title: “perfect for team communication”
reviews.pros: I love being able to be in touch with my team and synch up to my calendar's availability.
reviews.cons: It can be a bit of a learning curve for your team members who operated in a legacy computing environment to notice the notification blips.

reviews.title: “Best chat function”
reviews.text: No problems experienced so far, so we are satisfied.
reviews.pros: Integrated in Google Workspace, and easy to use
reviews.cons: Not all employees use it. It is very handy for Work-From-Home.

reviews.title: “Great way of keeping in touch with teams”

reviews.title: “A lifesaver”

reviews.cons: Can’t really say anything negative about it. It doesn’t it’s supposed to. The price is right. I don’t think I would use anything else.

reviews.title: “Chat is the best client for hangouts”

reviews.cons: Google Hangouts has too many clients.  It took a long time to discover Chat as a way of using hangouts.

reviews.title: “Difficult for teachers ”
