reviews.cons: For our board, students also have access to this so it’s difficult to ensure your status is available only to other colleagues. Potentially thousands of students could contact you when you are just trying to connect with a teacher.

reviews.title: “Easy to use”
reviews.pros: What I like the most about this software is I'm easily able to get in touch with anyone who has a gmail
reviews.cons: What I like the least about this software is that the chats delete after 24 hours

reviews.title: “Google Chat review”
reviews.text: With Google Chat, I can easily communicate with all of my clients, and set up specific, 1:1 chatrooms with them. I can easily navigate these chatrooms and can organize all of my chats easily.
reviews.pros: What I liked most about this software was its simplicity. I could organize all my chats for each of my clients, and could navigate the software easily.
reviews.cons: What I liked least about this software was a specific issue that I ran into, although small. When I'd try to reply to a chat sometimes, I would instead create a new thread within the chatroom. Or, when I'd try to create a new thread in the chat, I would instead reply to a previous post. However, this issue only was encountered a few times, when I was rushing to reply to my clients.

reviews.title: “Great way to keep in touch”
reviews.pros: This product is very easy to use.   You can personalize how you would like to receive notifications and mute if you need to be left alone.
reviews.cons: I can't think of anything it is missing.  It does exactly what you need it to do.

reviews.title: “Google Chat almost hits the mark”
reviews.text: It is really great to communicate with others you work with and this style of "Chatting" is the new way to be efficient and get things done at the workplace. It works best when collaborating and needed to communicate on the go.
reviews.pros: The best part about Google Chat is how well it integrates with the other Google Suite Apps. If you are using Google Suite than it is a solid option.
reviews.cons: The biggest downside to Google Chat is it feels like it is half baked. Compared to the other options out there I am not sure why you would use this. There aren't near as many integrations and for the most part no one is using it. Google Chat was late to the game and everyone has been using something else. The WORST part is that it doesn't run in the background and therefore you have to have the window open for it to work. It doesn't open when you log in and unless the window is there you don't get notified.

reviews.title: “Chat is Useful for the Everyday User”
reviews.text: If I need to get in touch with someone quickly, it's a breeze, especially if texting isn't an option.
reviews.pros: It's integration into Mail makes it super useful. While there are plenty of communication tools on the market today, Chat can be simple and easy.
reviews.cons: Sometimes it's a little annoying and a third party app helps the usability. But in the end, it gets the job done.

reviews.title: “Google hangouts could have been great”
reviews.text: Good tool with chat and voice calls but no one to use it with
reviews.pros: If you use it right, it’s a powerful tool that brings people together to collaborate and share ideas. It has a chat feature and a call feature.
reviews.cons: Not a lot of people use this platform so there isnt a lot of people to chat or call from the program. There was also some concern about privacy.

reviews.title: “Not the best out there”
reviews.pros: This is a tool that google has just to be able to say that they have it, so in that sense, it is an adequate complement to the rest of the google suite
reviews.cons: It's limited in it's ability to be helpful because people have so many other options that they actually use

reviews.title: “Keep on Chattin'”
reviews.pros: Simple. Transitioning from MSN Messenger, back in the day, was easy and simple.
reviews.cons: Needs a stand alone app, that connects to other applications.

reviews.title: “Chat Review ”
reviews.pros: It is easy to communicate with anyone in your company and outside of your company.
reviews.cons: I wish the app had more option of  gifs and customization

reviews.title: “Not my favorite video calling software ”
reviews.text: Not great, I’ve had the window unexpectedly close on various occasions
reviews.pros: I’ve used many different services for virtual meetings, etc, Google hangouts are good in the sense you can log in from online and don’t need to install software to your computer
reviews.cons: I always have issues with this software, it closed suddenly when I had a client interview call, my camera sometimes won’t connect, it drops out and the audio can be hard to hear.

reviews.title: “Good Chatter”
reviews.text: It’s fine by me whatever they’ve got but I know they’re gonna make it even better each moment they can get.
reviews.pros: This product and feature is very much needed in this day and age. This has helped during Covid so very very much that I cannot even explain to you. Chat is very good for the Shy or quieter kids that don’t want to say things in front of the class.
reviews.cons: Well since I teach kindergarten, the kids don’t always know how to spell words correctly so it would be nice if they had some kind of recording device for kids like that to have their chats typed.

reviews.title: “Great features, low cost; easy to maintain”
reviews.text: Overall, this is simple, easy to use, and has a great product that is professional.
reviews.pros: You can easily use this software to talk with your co-workers. Want to chat with a coworker who is upstairs? No problem. If your company uses Gsuite, it's easy. I love that it's built in the Google app and doesn't rely on another processing thing that you're forced to do. I like that it is easy - and free - to obtain messages in a simple manner.
reviews.cons: I wish you could delete sent messages; or edit them if you made a mistake.

reviews.title: “Some Great Features; Some Lacking Features”
reviews.text: We decided not to stick with Google Chat, simply because there are better tools out there. We were very hopeful because of the tight integration between all of Google's tools, but the advantages to Google Chat don't seem to outweigh the features that are lacking.
reviews.pros: Google's Chat platform is pretty user friendly and has a clean interface. You can chat around topics (Slack concept) so our team had a unique chat room for each of our project as well as separate rooms for chatting about bookkeeping, HR, misc, etc. You can turn off notifications for a particular chat room and only receive notifications when you are @mentioned. You can also leave and rejoin conversations. Google Chat also integrates with Asana, though I will say that we didn't end up finding much benefit from integrating the two. My favorite feature is the ability to search Google Chats in Gmail, filed under the Chats label.
reviews.cons: The notifications have been a big buggy... sometimes the second message in a conversation doesn't come through. Our company has used several platforms, our favorite so far being What's App. Compared to What's App, Google Chat is lacking. In Google Chat, you cannot respond directly to a past comment which makes things harder to follow, and you cannot add a conversation icon, so in the list of all of the chat rooms you are a part of, nothing stands out; it's harder to quickly navigate.  There are no read receipts or the ability to see when someone is typing a response.

reviews.title: “Delivers exactly as described”
reviews.text: I don't ever think of Google chat as my first choice, but I appreciate that it's available and am not upset about using it when the other party suggests it. Perfectly serviceable!
reviews.pros: Google's Chat function is perfect for a video or chat conversation when you do have your contact's gmail email, and not their other info like their phone number or Facebook profile. I've never had significant connection or lag issues.
reviews.cons: Just that, as far as I know, it requires both parties to have gmail and be using that particular contact. For video chat I'd rather be using Facebook or Skype and for texting I'd rather be using text messaging (phones) or Facebook messenger, but sometimes those others aren't options, in which case Google chat fills in the gap perfectly.

reviews.title: “ok, good alternative to zopom”
reviews.text: its good overall, also gets the job done for school, clubs etc.,
reviews.pros: Its good for basic meeting functions where you don't need to chat a lot or do too much switching. I think its easy to create meetings and sync with the calendar is good
reviews.cons: Still lags in UI/UX design + usability compared to zoom not as user friendly. Sometimes the hangouts does not work on my iPad and support is lacking

reviews.title: “Ease of communication with your team”
reviews.pros: It is a straightforward communication tool in a business environment because it uses other Google platforms, such as g-mail. I quickly converse with my Gmail contacts through him, with notification resources and plugin-s.
reviews.cons: I believe that more features for messages could be developed, such as replying to single messages, among other tools that facilitate communication.

reviews.title: “Google Hangouts”
reviews.text: The tool is great if you are using the rest of the Google Suite.
reviews.pros: The best feature is that it integrates with the entire Google Suite, so it makes sharing and collaboration much easier.
reviews.cons: The functionality in terms of being a communication tool is pretty basic. Other chat tools have a wider array of options.

reviews.title: “Bring back GChat”
reviews.text: Nothing really. I just kept the contacts.
reviews.pros: The old Google chat was friendlier to use and one of my favorite features was updating daily status with a quirky one liner that would show when you posed the pointer over the photo.
reviews.cons: I am less in touch with colleagues and associates with this and more with Whatsapp groups. Google dropped the ball when they stopped supporting Gchat.

reviews.title: “Beware Those Who Look For More From A Basic Chat Application”
reviews.pros: What can be easier to use than Chat? That baby toy where you insert the different shaped blocks into the appropriate hole. Also, it's by Google and that's all you really need to know.
reviews.cons: It's a little too rudimentary for me that I've dabbled with other chat software in order to get my point across in a more complex visual manner.

reviews.title: “Good team chat app from google”
reviews.pros: We all know how much easy and time saving google apps are. One such app is chat from google. You can message text, picture, any rich text content seamlessly with chat. I find it really engaging in workplace as well as in personal use.
reviews.cons: If there is a feature to send a reminder for a text message you send so that it indicated the recipient to reply that would be cool.

reviews.title: “We love GChat at our office!”
reviews.pros: GChat is a fun and easy way for us to quickly communicate across the office. It makes it super simple to send little messages and get ahold of each other from the comfort of our email inboxes.
reviews.cons: Sometimes it's hard to sort GChat messages and keep track of everything you've received with the independent windows, but on the whole it's a really valuable option to have.

reviews.title: “Much better than skype!”
reviews.pros: This tool makes so much easier to communicate with clients and remote colleagues, since Skype doesn't work that well. Also, it offers right in the browser, some features like video sharing and private room links without charging for it.
reviews.cons: Can't complain about this service, it's really good and works really well for our company.

reviews.title: “Wait...this is still a thing?!”
reviews.text: No matter how easy it is to initiate and integrate...if people don't have the slightest awareness of its existence...they're not going to use it.   Also, location, location, location...with poor advertising and low customer/clientele basis, will wreck even the most comprehensive and beautifully written software.
reviews.pros: Google chat is seamlessly integrated in to the entire Google family platform with your contacts, photos, drive, and so forth...making the initial set up nonexistent and convenience and ease high on the list of pros.  Nobody likes having to look up contacts when your newly upgraded line doensn't  have your most recently imported contacts--Google chat takes the worry out of communication partners and implementation.
reviews.cons: What Google fails to do with their communication "chat" software is include functionality, features, oh and I don't know maybe it's OWN app/platform out side of mushed next to your gmail inbox where privacy and security of your mail contents is out on display and where it has to remain that way, tabbed and open, for any new notifications to make it to you.

reviews.title: “Chatting in the Office”
reviews.text: It is super helpful, and in the workplace it just seemed to make a lot of sense to utilize.
reviews.pros: The informal tone of this application allows for casual conversations between employees in the office regarding work, but without the stiff tone needed that emails usually carry. When doing work on my computer, I wouldn't want to interrupt my groove and pick up my phone to ask a coworker not near me a question, so I would simply message them using Chat.
reviews.cons: I dislike that my Chats would disappear after 24 hours, especially if we were exchanging information that I may need a following day, but using other features in GSuite I began keeping note of such things.

reviews.title: “OG of productivity”
reviews.text: Life gets organized with google. gChat slots into that perfectly
reviews.pros: In a world that seems to add more "productivity" software each month, gChat is still the most straight-forward way to gather a group for text or video meetings, sharing documents quickly, and keeping in touch.
reviews.cons: Only downside is if people you are working with don't have google for some reason. Otherwise works great

reviews.title: “Allows for easy collaboration”
reviews.pros: This software makes it easy to collaborate with my team. I can easily message anyone at any time if I need anything. Love how intuitive it is and connects with all my other Google products. Really like the UX as well.
reviews.cons: That it's paid, there's a lot of other free chat software out there.

reviews.title: “Great”
reviews.text: Overall this is great and I would highly recommend it to anyone who is looking for a place to chat!
reviews.pros: I love how easy this is to use. You can use it on any device and be able to connect with people from all around the world.
reviews.cons: There was not anything I did not like about this except sometimes you do not get notified when someone sends you a message.

reviews.title: “Nothing special, but gets the job done”
reviews.pros: The best part about Google Chat is that it links to your Google cloud account and you can search text and read through your chat messages later on.
reviews.cons: The features are very minimal, you can't really do anything special besides type.  Having the ability to personalize fonts would be a good feature that it is currently missing.

reviews.title: “Chating and Messaging at its best”
reviews.text: My overall working in this application is fine, I definitely suggests my colleagues and friends to do your daily business affairs at this best Google Enterprise "Google Hangouts".
reviews.pros: This application is the amalgamated application where the user messages and also for the video messaging and short video as well. It is also a good to make social networking trends. Voice call quality is best in this application.
reviews.cons: I did not find any flows in this application, except during this Pandemic situation it is rather more helpful.

reviews.title: “A great alternative for Slack”
reviews.text: We use Google GSuite chat every day for communications between our teams.
reviews.pros: The Chat in Google GSuite is a great tool for team communication in our company. We tried Slack but the integration with Google Suite bring us to this previous Hangout.
reviews.cons: I think that Google needs to add some tools to chat, like the possibility to create public channels, threads and why not, custom emojis.

reviews.title: “Don't tell professors but this is the best thing that happened to law students”
reviews.pros: Law School can be quite stressful. Professors call on you anf you have to brief cases. Well, sometimes you are not always prepared for every class and you dont want to be embarassed when called on. Google chat to the rescue! We did not cheat as our morals are better than that, but we did utilize it to beg students to volunteer. By doing this, we along with Google Chat saved hundreds of law students' self esteems. Very easy to use and very easy to add members to group chats.
reviews.cons: I really cannot find any criticisms. Every experience was a positive one.

reviews.title: “It's good for being free”
reviews.text: It's good and works very easily for being free and is great for being included with Gmail.
reviews.pros: It's very simple and straightforward plus it automatically integrates with Gmail.
reviews.cons: It's easy to miss messages and never is very clear if someone is online or off. Messages can go missed and with competitors out there like Slack with much more functionality Chat is somewhat of a bare minimum.

reviews.title: “Important Part of My Day”
reviews.text: This solves an immediacy issue, especially with virtual and off-site employees.
reviews.pros: I like the immediacy of Google Chat. Often times I can't stop, grab my phone and call my coworkes for assistance. It's nice to pull up a chat and get a quick answer.
reviews.cons: It can be somewhat distracting and obviously, users need to be professional and aware that this is a business tool and not abuse it.

reviews.title: “Google Chat does an excellent job of integrating with other Google services”
reviews.text: Google Chat is an integrated experience for users who use other Google products, and it is very cheap.
reviews.pros: I really like how Google Chat integrates with other Google services such as Gmail, and provides a cohesive experience across the services.
reviews.cons: There is nothing in particular that I dislike.  The software is free to use and is very user friendly.

reviews.title: “Just another typical IM app”
reviews.pros: It's developed by Google, so Google Chat is readily available, and all the notifications can be quickly accessed from my Gmail. The GUI is clean and highly intuitive.
reviews.cons: This is not exactly a criticism, but I'm simply not convinced to use Google Chat more often, even though I'm a heavy user of other products of the Google Suite. Like any other IM platform, it's highly subject to the network effect, and most of my connections do not utilize Google Chat for their IM needs. There are just too many competing products out there and it just doesn't make much sense to utilize an IM platform which most of your friends are not on.

reviews.title: “Excellent Business Chat Tool”
reviews.text: Excellent overall experience and very helpful tool, definitely recommend
reviews.pros: Ease of use and integration with G suite, very user friendly chat format with excellent app support so can always stay connected.
reviews.cons: Wish there were more ways to manage the different rooms and chats, can get cluttered after a while and not easy to categorize things

reviews.title: “Google Chat has some room for improvement”
reviews.text: I love Google and their G Suite of products, but this is one of the products we never truly adopted or brought into any organization. It has been something that we wanted to use but never made sense to implement. Hopefully, Google can continue to improve on this opportunity.
reviews.pros: Google Chat has a nice integration in Gmail in the lower left-hand corner that is very minimal but large enough to see notifications. Anyone who has recently contacted the account is listed in that block clearly and visibly.
reviews.cons: Adoption across the organization has been relatively slow and there is some confusion around how to use it. Getting the team to adopt it was tough and they opted for better solutions like Slack or even just email within Gmail.

reviews.title: “Google Chat does what it’s supposed to...”
reviews.text: Acceptable.
reviews.pros: Google Chat does what it’s supposed to...
reviews.cons: but it isn’t the best messaging app. I often don’t receive alerts, even when I have new messages. It also does not integrate with the touchscreen in my car.

reviews.title: “Simple option for instant messaging”
reviews.text: Is a good option if you already have more google suite products.
reviews.pros: It is super easy to start using it. The learning curve is almost instant.
reviews.cons: It's so easy to use it because its a kind of mvp product. It has the least it can to be a instant messaging tool.

reviews.title: “Perfect place to Video Chat ”
reviews.text: I think Hangouts is great for Business meetings that are online with customers. Great service.
reviews.pros: This is a great app for Business Video chats without having a membership. I use this to contact online customers and have video conferences.
reviews.cons: I dislike the complexity of trying to get everything running at times.

reviews.title: “Great for direct messaging or group chats”
reviews.pros: What I like most about Google Chat is that it's great for quick and instant communication with team members, whether one-on-one or group interactions.  I love that you can share files within messages as well.
reviews.cons: What I lease like about Google Chat is that the message boxes sometimes resize by themselves.  Other than that, it's a great communication tool.

reviews.title: “Google chat is an oldy but goodie”
reviews.text: I have been chatting with international friends for years on gchat. It's always open and always on so rather useful I'd say.
reviews.pros: I like that it's integrated into Gmail. Almost everyone has a gmail account so it's pretty easy to find people you know on gchat.
reviews.cons: I guess it could be updated to include more emojis and maybe even avatars and animojis. Still for what it is, it is functional.

reviews.title: “The superior chat platform”
reviews.text: Overall I highly recommend Google Chat and it is my preferred method of communication.
reviews.pros: Google Chat is by far my most used software - it offers an extremely quick and intuitive way to chat with other AND it's free, can't get much better.
reviews.cons: Nothing I dislike about Google Chat - sometimes the video chat quality can be better but that may also be because of the Wifi on my end.

reviews.title: “Free and easy ”
reviews.text: It’s an easy way to chat with close contacts.
reviews.pros: Free and quick way to make quick contact.
reviews.cons: Phone app is kinda slow on my iPhone 7 Plus

reviews.title: “Not good for larger businesses”
reviews.text: We ended our use after 6 months. We were not overly impressed and are much happier on Teams.
reviews.pros: This is a simple internal chat software that works, but more mostly basic things.
reviews.cons: Google is really not great for anything more than a small business. It does not sync well with other programs, and is very far off from comparing to Teams.

reviews.title: “Simple Chat Program”
reviews.text: Great, simple product to use alongside your other Google Tools.
reviews.pros:
-Simple 
-Easy to Use 
-Integration with Google Accounts, etc. 
-Transcripts 
-Apps for Mobile
reviews.cons:
- Goes Down sometimes
-Note as many options as other chat platforms 
-Not many people use it

reviews.title: “Great Communication tool”
reviews.text: Great overall communication business tool.
reviews.pros: Our most used features are file sharing and overall communication, the app is great with those.
reviews.cons: None at this time, we`ll continue using it and update review.

reviews.title: “Chat, chat, chat!!”
reviews.text: It's pretty great. Super easy to use and free, free!!
reviews.pros: So many people use google and when you find a friend you can chat for days. Who needs a phone when you have google chat.
reviews.cons: What is there to complain about? Nothing. Freaking love it. I guess there is one downside you need Wifi/compatible. Friends need to have google too.

reviews.title: “Could do more but its nice”
reviews.pros: Being able to message co-workers when they may be too busy to take a phone call without having to send a formal email
reviews.cons: I feel like sending images like screenshots would be a good implementation.

reviews.title: “Great way for chatting, but not much more than that. ”
reviews.pros: It's very easy to get going. I mean, the chat functionality is basic, intuitive and easy to use. Also, it's connecter to everything with Gmail, Google Cal etc.
reviews.cons: The interface is rather boring, and I'm missing certain features that e.g. Slack is providing when it comes to communication channels, plugins etc.

reviews.title: “ Google Chat Review”
reviews.pros: Easy to use, very basic. Comes with google products, so that you can chat with gmail email contacts and that helps to speed up process in order to receive quick answer from your contact or ping about your sent email.
reviews.cons: Cannot share big size documents or pdf format files.

reviews.title: “Simple online chat system”
reviews.text: I've used G-Chat for years based in Gmail, and now use it to communicate with team members regarding GSuite files.
reviews.pros: Easy to communicate with users within a linked system/our G-Suite. Can share comments across various platforms within G-Suite.
reviews.cons: Difficult to add non G-Suite users. Wish there was an option to add/remove non-Google-based users within G-Suite and Chat at large.

reviews.title: “Google chat is good, it could be best”
reviews.text: Good, but it could see some improvements. Last seen is a bit too elaborative, can be improvised..
reviews.pros: Online statuses, last seen are all very good features.
reviews.cons: Privacy is bit of a concern in Google chat, compared to Teams.

reviews.title: “Google Chat is Here to Stay”
reviews.pros: Google Chat is a great tool to add to Google Suite. You are able to keep in contact with other users easily with the chat feature without having to email everyone.
reviews.cons: People still prefer email and it's hard to break routine and have them switch over to the chat feature.

reviews.title: “Easy Communication”
reviews.text: We are running a global non-profit and this keeps us productive.
reviews.pros: We use this every single day!! Rather than emailing back and forth, the chat is an easy and effective way to talk between staff, send photos and links. TIME SAVER FOR SURE!
reviews.cons: It's a little hard to download the photos we send through chat but otherwise, I don't have a lot of negative feedback.

reviews.title: “Great way to communicate ”
reviews.text: It keeps us all communicating about patients with ease.
reviews.pros: I love the functionality of this chat. It keeps us all communicating easily at the office.
reviews.cons: I wish you didn’t have to make a link to do video calls

reviews.title: “Easy way to collaborate with colleages.”
reviews.text: We use Chat platform to efficiently collaborate with our office colleages which is the main communication method inside our organization.
reviews.pros: With the Chat platform, we can easily communicate with anyone.If we have a Gmail account, we can have ability to access Chat platform within few clicks.It is very easy to setup and setup process is carried out from a simple wizard process.We can have group conversations with our colleages and we can create a message bot.We can share files or documents via the Chat platform.
reviews.cons: Platform is depend on strength of the internet network connection and it will be great if have some improvements user interfaces.

reviews.title: “It's a good Chat but can improve!”
reviews.pros: You can access the chat from everywhere and It's really easy to use, even from the people that never have used before. The group conversation it's amazing!
reviews.cons: I hate when that chat don't allowed to send more than one document at time. I can't not select a folder also.

reviews.title: “Another great Google product”
reviews.text: My experience is good. It helps me along my work day to communicate easily.
reviews.pros: The best parte about Chat is the ease to use it without have to get a training to understand the platform.
reviews.cons: I think that it would be good to have more integration with others google products to use it better.

reviews.title: “Outdated, Surpassed by Slack”
reviews.text: I have used Chat to quickly connect with coworkers or contacts about things that don't need a whole email. It made it possible to get quick answers and saved time, plus added an informal way to communicate when email felt too formal.
reviews.pros: Chat makes it easy to quickly connect with coworkers or contacts without having to send a formal email. It allows you to do quick check ins or pings with anyone on G Suite, and the fact that it's built into the tools you're already using makes it more efficient.
reviews.cons: Chat has been surpassed by Slack. While it still works for 1:1 messaging, it doesn't have the capabilities of Slack for group messaging and various channels. It would be cumbersome to have some messages in Chat and others in Slack, so I've used Chat less and less since joining Slack.

reviews.title: “Google Chat now called Hangouts - great for communicating within Google contacts.”
reviews.pros: Very easy to use with its minimalist design. I usually use this for a fast chat with a client that is using gmail. Anyone with your email can invite you to chat, call, or video call with them. It's 100% free!
reviews.cons: Unlike Skype, there is no way to edit a sent message, or delete selected messages. Other than that, it's a good communication tool.

reviews.title: “Quick, Fast and Easy Messaging! Great for teams too!”
reviews.text: Great tool and software overall!
reviews.pros: I like that it's free to use! The message also sends super fast and I love that you can download images/files really quickly as well. I use it quite a lot when communicating with my colleagues, especially if it's an urgent matter.
reviews.cons: I think I'd like it if the avatars of people I was talking with would be bigger. A lot of our colleagues have a similar headshot image so if I'm communicating with multiple people, it's a lot easier if I'm able to recognize them quickly.

reviews.title: “Great value”
reviews.text: Great
reviews.pros: Universal access for everyone, so not compatibility issues
reviews.cons: A little bit limited and so simple sometimes

reviews.title: “Chat”
reviews.text: I am able to handle big professional cases and it's very simple I would recommend this to any creative in the field.
reviews.pros: What I like most about this program is that its super easy to use and sign up, It allowed me to connect to all the people I needed to privately. I was signed up in a few minutes and was chating with professional clients very easily.
reviews.cons: Not much wrong wit the program, I was able to navigate and chat with professionals in only a few minutes, that's really necessary especially as a freelance animator today.

reviews.title: “Perfect Work Day Chat”
reviews.text: overall an easy software to use for daily messaging.
reviews.pros: I like how easy it is to set up an account and message friends and coworkers.
reviews.cons: I wish it was easier to keep track of notifications better. i feel like i would miss them half the time.

reviews.title: “"Best experience with GOOGLE CHAT application."”
reviews.text: Google chat have more features. And it is safe to use and low data is required for using the application.
reviews.pros: I like the privacy policy of this application. The application is more user friendly  compared to other applications.
reviews.cons: I can't find any demerits for this application.

reviews.title: “Great, Easy Chat Solution”
reviews.text: Overall, Chat has been a good experience for easy, simple communication.
reviews.pros: Chat has been a very easy tool for workplace collaboration. Especially using the G Suite already, this has been seamlessly integrated into our workflow.
reviews.cons: There are definitely some features that would be desirable on Chat, for instance Read Receipts and the ability to be used off-Wifi.

reviews.title: “Chat review”
reviews.text: Great application, I have nothing but good things to say about it.  So easy to use too.
reviews.pros: This is the perfect chat software to keep in contact with anyone that has G suite.  It works perfect among droid phones as well.
reviews.cons: There is only one problem with this app, and this is if you don't have an android phone it may have issues pushing messages through seamlessly.

reviews.title: “Google Chat”
reviews.pros: I think that Google chat is really easy to use to communicate with team members.
reviews.cons: I have had issues figuring out how to turn off notifications. They are very loud and can be disruptive.

reviews.title: “great tool for online meetings”
reviews.text: Very good. It has an option to divide teams intro breakout rooms and to make questionnaires.
reviews.pros: Super easy to use, especially when you use gmail and gsuite.
reviews.cons: Nothing, the tool got better with time when you can see more people during the call and make questionnaires.

reviews.title: “Google Chat”
reviews.text: Overall, I love G-Chat. I'm very happy with the quality of service.
reviews.pros: I just love Google and the products that it offers. My organization uses Gmail as our prime source of communication between colleagues, departments, offices, etc. so to have G-Chat as an extension of an already wonderful product that we have utilized is very helpful in an office setting. Specifically, for me because many of my colleagues and my manager work in other towns. It's great to stay in touch.
reviews.cons: There isn't anything that I dislike about the software, but I can see it not being useful for an office or organization that doesn't also use G-Mail.

reviews.title: “Perfect solution for Team Communication”
reviews.pros: Chatting with team mates and individuals is very easy. Video call feature is very fine and quality is good.
reviews.cons: Nothing as such but yes the installed app takes too much space in my phone.

reviews.title: “A Decent Replacement for Hangouts”
reviews.pros: Google Chat is basically as straightforward to use as it gets, and it offers a seamless, simple interface for the end user. The fact that it's connected with Gmail means that it functions well as both an 'immediate chat' medium and a 'traditional email provider'. I use it to talk to friends and colleagues alike, though I get the sense that texting, Slack, and other platforms seem more popular.
reviews.cons:
What makes "the chat of g's" wonderful is also what makes it a bit tired: it's somewhat outmoded and outperformed by other alternatives, particularly in a business setting. But even more than that: it's just a supersaturated market, and it's not always clear what the relative benefits to Google Chat are. 

The fact that Google has a 300 gb dossier on every global internet user - now in both a personal and professional setting - can leave a bad taste in one's mouth as well...

reviews.title: “Google Chat: an Oldie, but a Goodie”
reviews.text: Chat lets me ask a client a question easily and confidentially. It even keeps track of our record, if I want it, which can be useful when needing to recall a client's requests or needs. Ten out of ten from me!
reviews.pros: Google Chat is a simple, comprehensive way to keep in touch with friends and colleagues. It's easier than picking up the phone, and more confidential. For a free piece of software, you couldn't really ask more for a chat platform, and smaller companies may find it a more economic solution than Slack or Basecamp.
reviews.cons: Chat isn't the sleekest platform if your organization doesn't use gmail as its primary email client. Luckily, that isn't most of us, as gmail is pretty much ubiquitous.

reviews.title: “Meetins made easy”
reviews.text: Easy and simple. Working with a remote team can be messy, but Hangouts makes it really simple.
reviews.pros: Embeded in the Google Suite I really find Hangouts an interesting tool to keep in touch with all the team.
reviews.cons: Doesn't have a lot of funtionalities, but if you're looking only for a chat and calls software is more than enough. Other Google products already cover that.

reviews.title: “Exactly what you'd expect”
reviews.text: Great way to quickly communicate without having to bother to send an entire e-mail for trivial matters. Saves time.
reviews.pros: Easy to use, no-frills chat software that comes with Gmail. Great way to communicate with friends, family and coworkers.
reviews.cons: It isn't missing any features that you'd expect and seems to run pretty flawlessly so it's hard to find anything to dislike.

reviews.title: “Google Chat review”
reviews.text: Google Chat is an expensive tool that I would recommend only if the security requirements are high as well the integration with the rest of Google services.
reviews.pros: Google Chat is one the simplest tools for communicating with colleagues. It has perfect support and integration in the Google ecosystem which saves time to the team,
reviews.cons: The only disadvantage is that it does not have free trial. It can be a deal breaker for small companies of students on a budget when there are free alternatives.

reviews.title: “Google Chat makes inner office communication more efficient!”

reviews.cons: I haven't noticed anything that I don't like about this software.  We love it!

reviews.title: “Good app from ttusted source”

Google hangout with help of google meet is used to do day to day activities. And is helpful in covid times as no one needs to go to office and can work remotely from their home.
This helps the company in saving there 70% office expenses.
reviews.pros:

There are many features loaded into app like video calling, messaging.etc
reviews.cons:
Previously app was working fine but now google is adking to move to other apps like Google meet.
Suppose you want to do video call it will automatically shift to google meet.
The mute and end key is also placed very near to each other leading to confusion and insted phone gets cut.
It also only works with google account.

reviews.title: “Google Chat”

reviews.title: “A fast, simple way to communicate with my team!”
reviews.text: No complaints! It serves me and my team well when we are having issues with our other, most prominent communication software. The file-sharing issue makes it difficult to sustain our use for a long time, but it is perfectly adequate as a messaging service if you're okay with a no-frills design and interface.
reviews.pros: It's fast, simple and easy to use, and it offers several modes of conversation. Easy to set up either direct chats or group chats. My team at work has used Google Chat for communication when our other communication systems have failed. So it is not our go-to, but it is definitely sufficient in a pinch. The chat features themselves aren't fancy, but it gets the job done of keeping in touch as a team. I appreciate how simple it is to create a chat as well as the audible notifications so that I'll never miss a message.
reviews.cons: The app can be a bit laggy at times, and it's not very easy to share files, which is essential at my workplace. It's not a very sophisticated interface, but it gets the job done if that doesn't bother you.

reviews.cons: At times have issues connecting to Video chat. Window will sit loading for a bit then disconnect.

reviews.title: “Very easy on the eyes”
reviews.pros: Most simple and easy to use chat service i've used. It's very easy on the eyes. Very easy to transfer links from the phone to your laptop.
reviews.cons: Can't think of anything negative at this point.

reviews.title: “Easy way to keep chats within Gmail”
reviews.text: Chat is an alternate option for communicating with team members other than emails or phone calls
reviews.pros: Chat is easy to use and access through your Gmail account.
reviews.cons: There are many different software tools that offer the same features. Chat, however, keeps all Google communication in one place.

reviews.title: “Very useful tool”
reviews.text: As I have described it above google g  suite should be worth of money since is offering so many options and helps the team to get the job done.
reviews.pros: Google G suite is an awesome software with many tools which has helped me and my team to have more easier and productive work. Google g suite to me looks very secure and also allows you to log in from many devices. This software allows me and my team to do edits at the same time like google sheets, google cal, google doc and that's awesome.
reviews.cons: Google g suit is a great software and has all the tools and it should be good product since its part of the giant google. I can't remember for now any Cons.

reviews.title: “Great Software”
reviews.text: It helps cut down my communication time and frees me up for more important topics.
reviews.pros:
I use this software every day.
It helps me stay in touch with the dispatchers for my loads.
Without this program I would be lost
reviews.cons:
One of the downsides is the capacity size.
I wish I could store more information for a longer period of time.

reviews.title: “Google's Worst App”
reviews.text: nightmare
reviews.pros: Nothing! My company is using text as a mean of communication. Using chats, when I receive a message I have to scroll up / down to get the latest message.
reviews.cons: I liked that Hangsout listed chats by  recent time/date. Chat does not have that option. I have searched for it in the settings but nothing!

reviews.title: “Google Chat for Quick Communications”
reviews.text: I have been using Google Chat for almost a decade - I can't imagine work life or personal life without it!
reviews.pros: Google Chat allows me to talk to multiple people at once, discussing multiple topics, either through individual chats or group chats.  I love the ease of use and the ability to have real-time discussions on my computer.
reviews.cons: When a person is inactive on Google Chat, sometimes they won't see a message for a long time - it would be nice if there was an email notification feature when someone doesn't read a message.

reviews.title: “A Perfect Communicating software”
reviews.text: The overall experience is great. Google Chat is very intuitive tool to communicate with my team.
reviews.pros: Google Chat is an interesting and easy communicating software. I can quickly interact with my team remotely as well as I can send important messages to my team members instantly.
reviews.cons: I personally feel that a lot of other similar software that are better when it comes to audio and video calls. Google should work on its audio and video quality.

reviews.title: “Really good chat tool for team communication”
reviews.pros: It syncs with gmail and Gsuite and is great and easy to use tool/medium for team communication and collaboration
reviews.cons: I am not sure i have any cons in regards to Gchat besides overall dislike of google user tracking which is company policy and not specific to Gchat

reviews.title: “Google chat in healthcare”
reviews.pros: I am sometimes a health unit secretary. I use google chat to communicate with the companys IT department for IT issues with equipment. I always get a fast response and never have to wait long for a response from a question i ask. I also will get emails to notify me when a work ticket has been placed along with an incident number. I also receive an email when the incident has been resolved.
reviews.cons: I have noticed most of the people i have chatted with are not native english speakers so there is a communication barrier.

reviews.title: “Great chat program”
reviews.text: Great for communication for social or professional purposes.
reviews.pros: Chats send quickly and also are received quickly. Communication can occur in real time!
reviews.cons: Issues have occurred with notifications not appearing in both mobile and laptop (browser) access.

reviews.title: “Best form of communication”
reviews.text: Overall I really enjoy using this chat software and so does my team. It makes communicating so much easier for us all.
reviews.pros: Love how easy and fast this is. Makes it so easy to communicate with team members while working from home as well as while in the office. Rarely ever have any issues or experience a delay.
reviews.cons: Wish there was a way to use reactions or specifically @ a team member when communicating in a group chat to save time. Other than that I find the software to be perfect.

reviews.title: “G Suite Chat is incredibly easy to use for anyone new to a computer”
reviews.pros: I like that the interface is easy to use. I am positive my 92 year old grandma could figure out how to use chat in under 5 minutes
reviews.cons: There is not much I dont like about chat. I think if anything, they could change the way the notifications are given to users

reviews.title: “Google Chat Review”
reviews.pros: It's right on the side of your inbox, so you can check your email and still communicate without logging out.
reviews.cons: The appearance could be updated a bit, but it's not the biggest issue.

reviews.title: “Quick and Easy Communication”
reviews.text: I use chat at work to quickly communicate to my Administrative team.  Chat saves us a lot of time.
reviews.pros: Chat is so convenient and easy to use.  It gives you instant alerts that someone has messaged you.   You can use emojis and insert documents and videos as well.
reviews.cons: I do not have have any complaints about this software.

reviews.title: “Are smart phones making Chat a thing of the past?”
reviews.text: Thank you for creating a way to stay in touch with others. I like that you can tell when someone in active and able to chat :)
reviews.pros: Before the days of everyone having a smart phone, I would use google chats multiple times a day to stay in contact with friends/coworkers/family
reviews.cons: Not as many folks use it to stay in touch these days

reviews.title: “quick and easy communication ”

reviews.pros: I love how easy Google Chat allows me to both write and receive messages about my work, which is perfect for me!
reviews.cons: I personally don’t have anything I dislike about this software

reviews.title: “Google Chat gets the job done, for free.”
reviews.text: Overall experience has been great. Since most people are familiar with the Google Suite of products, it's been easy to integrate it into my business.
reviews.pros: It's free, intuitive, easy to invite people to collaborate, and friendly across all devices. When it comes to a chat program that's needed on the fly, it's always been up to the task
reviews.cons: Occasionally, I've found it hard to invite people to the platform who haven't used it before, but that's rare.

reviews.title: “Great everyday tool”
reviews.pros: I like that it's simple to use and the separation of chats from rooms. Also like that you can quickly insert a meeting, share files, and tasks.
reviews.cons: I do miss the old version (messenger) because it was a bit simpler. I wish you could set up an auto-message or even prevent people from messaging.

reviews.title: “It’s a nice application for chat. ”
reviews.text: It’s very good because whenever I need something I got it thru it.
reviews.pros: It’s very good because you can talk with your co workers or officers thru it. So it’s very easy to do it at the time of work too.
reviews.cons: Sometimes you will get lots of notifications when you stuck in your work on that time it’s like hell to use.

reviews.title: “Straight forward chat widget for anyone using Google products”
reviews.text: If you are already using Gmail then it's a no brainer to use Gchat alongside it. Makes it simple to get in touch quickly.
reviews.pros: We use Gmail for our company email and G-chat makes it extremely easy to communicate instantly when you're in the same inbox you use all the time.
reviews.cons: G-chat is extremely simple which can be good but also can pose some problems. The notifications don't always work so I find myself missing chats. It's also hard to search for specific chats in the past.

reviews.title: “Remember the Good Old Days?”
reviews.text: This is a nice way to communicate in a pinch while in G-Suite.
reviews.pros: This is a tried, true, and highly simple platform for--you guessed it--chatting.  It's reliable and quite unobtrusive.
reviews.cons: This platform is incredibly simple and almost primitive in design and scope.  It is a bit uninspiring but gets the job done.

reviews.title: “Quick chat and team collaboration ”
reviews.pros: Google chat is the best instant messaging, team collaboration and business meeting software. I am able to create rooms and send invite and schedule meetings through Google chat.
reviews.cons: None but the notifications can be given a different color theme and style

reviews.title: “Great video chat service”
reviews.text: I've had a great experience with Chat, and it's been free to use. Can't ask for more! It has made working remotely from my team much easier.
reviews.pros: I like how simple it is to start and share a video chat with people. And if you use other Google products, like Google calendar, Google Chat is integrated right onto that platform. You can schedule a meeting with a chat, and your notification has the link in it, just click and join!
reviews.cons: I do not have anything bad to say about my experience with Google Chat. It is easy to use, free, secure. It's great.

reviews.title: “Freeand easy to use chat application”
reviews.text: Overall I am satisfied with the software.
reviews.pros: I like the simplicity of the app as well as the ease of being able to connect with it.
reviews.cons: Limited features to have a better experience in the app

reviews.title: “Inter Organisation Chat made easy”

reviews.cons: The inability to look for the job title of a person in mobile app had me send messages to some other person with the same name.

reviews.title: “I Love G Chat ”

reviews.pros: It's so easy to use g chat, and it's easy to collaborate with co-workers and friends in this feature.

reviews.title: “CHAT”

reviews.title: “G Chat is how our team keeps in touch”

reviews.title: “Google chat”
reviews.text: Overall it is good, nice features,  easy to use and sent messages.
reviews.pros: Easy to use and it is free. I can make calls free of cost, all the features are nice, I chat for hours!

reviews.title: “Convenient messaging while in Gmail”
reviews.text: Allows effortless and quick communication on important matters, great way to interact with someone when the emails get buried in the inbox.
reviews.pros: I like that it can be used in the same screen as gmail - that saves time of not having to switch back and forth to another tab checking a different chat app.
reviews.cons: It does not allow to select and attach multiple files to be sent out. That is pretty inconvenient, I wish you could at least attach up to 5 images at the same time.

reviews.title: “Nice ”

reviews.title: “Satisfied user”

reviews.title: “Google Hangouts is Fantastic”
reviews.text: Google Hangouts solved a huge problem for us while the staff was working remotely.  It kept employees and supervisors connected, and allowed for the team environment when working away from the office or other employees.
reviews.pros: Instant messaging and video chats were a lifeline during the pandemic when our team was working from home.  With a quick message or a video chat, you could stay connected, meet with fellow employees and get information that was important to keep moving forward in the job from a remote location.
reviews.cons: Sometimes staff didn't realize they had received a message.

reviews.title: “Connect with Students ”
reviews.text: My students are able to contact me in a safe and easy way.  I am thankful for that ability.
reviews.pros: I like Google Chat because I don't have to give out my personal phone number to my students and they are still able to get a hold of me.  It also works with students who don't have phones.  It has been so helpful students are online.
reviews.cons: I do not have much trouble with this program.

reviews.title: “Google Chat review.”
reviews.pros: It's great to quickly message while working in home, I use it when I'm doing homework with my schoolmates and it is really useful.
reviews.cons: I don't usually like the aspect of some of the Google services or products but it's something personal because I just don't think it looks good

reviews.title: “Google Chat - Useful”

Connectivity between your desktop and mobile phone if you're synced,
Desktop pop up option,
Browser-only notification option,
Ease of speaking with coworkers,
Group chat is helpful for teams or coordinating lunch
reviews.cons: If you want to use an emoji, you have to click the icon twice.

reviews.title: “Great tool for businesses to use to be able to quickly and conveniently message employees ”

reviews.pros: I love its ease of use and the different ways you offer to connect.  You can use it right within Gmail in your browser, you can download it as its own app and you can have it with you where ever you go on your mobile phone.
reviews.cons: Sometimes it's glitchy when using the app and you have to restart it. I also wish that the emojis were more the colon style and not the blob looking ones.

reviews.title: “The Ease of Hangouts”
reviews.pros: How to chat with friends and family. In this day in age that’s important.
reviews.cons: It can be buggy at certain times. It might get stuck or take awhile to get started.

reviews.title: “Easiest way to chat with others”
reviews.pros: I used this software at a hospital based setting. I was positioned in a remote location that was not in the actual hospital but I needed to be able to communicate directly with other coworkers at the hospital. This made it so simple. All I had to do was login and locate their user id. Ten out of ten recommend
reviews.cons: I didn't like that it was a lag when sending files to each other, but that really doesn't have much to do with the software as much as it depends on the internet connection the software works on

reviews.title: “Easy to Use GChat”
reviews.text: Easy communication with teammates.
reviews.pros: Gchat is super easy to use! Once you're part of a team you can easily chat with anyone. Also, the app for phones makes it easy to stay connected even while you're away from you computer.
reviews.cons: You are not able to chat under groups for specific topics.

reviews.title: “Google Chat Review”
reviews.text: Overall, I really like google chat and enjoy that I can message anyone at any time and they have the option to respond immediately or days later.
reviews.pros: Google Chat is great that users can choose to show if they are online or not. This way you can message someone and it allows them time to respond if they are not online at that moment.
reviews.cons: I deleted a few old conversations in my account. I was then unable to retrieve my text when I needed to look at old conversations.

reviews.title: “Love the mobile app use of it!”
reviews.pros: I love that I am able to communicate fast with clients. I have the app downloaded on my phone, so it works quick like a text message. Then, another bonus is that if I need to find something within the message communications you can type in the search bar and it will be located within all of your messages.
reviews.cons: I wish I discovered the search feature of it faster, but once I did discover it that became one of my favorite features!

reviews.title: “Easy communication with colleagues”
reviews.pros: I use Google Chat to speak/correspond with colleagues without having to call them or get up from my desk to find them. This also makes things super easy during meetings, because we can pow-wow on our comments before we chime in.
reviews.cons: That we're forced to keep it in the browser.

reviews.title: “The overall ecosystem of google works well when you use the google chat.”
reviews.text: my experience till now is very good and i will use this feature in future also.
reviews.pros: One of the standout features of Google Chat is its integration with other Google Workspace apps. Users can easily access and share files from Google Drive, collaborate on documents in real-time, and schedule meetings through Google Calendar.
reviews.cons: latency and jitters that are faced during the use.

reviews.title: “Another great addition to G-suite...”
reviews.text: A chat program is invaluable to any team to keep everyone connected throughout the day/week. Integration with Google Suite is also a plus! Integrations like this help save us precious time during the day and keep our team moving forward on various projects.
reviews.pros: The best thing about G-chat is the integration with all of the other fantastic Google products. Google Drive and the Google suite of products are invaluable to our team and G-chat simply helps keep us all on the same page throughout the day.
reviews.cons: It's a fairly simple program with a few features and options. There's not much else there but not necessarily not much needed. It's a simple Chat program that gets the job done.

reviews.title: “Chat: The Online Version of Text”
reviews.text: Overall G-Chat is a very good messaging tool, but should only be used in appropriate situations for informal conversations.
reviews.pros: G-Chat is pretty widely used and quite intuitive. It's a great way to send a quick message without having to pick up the phone or send an email.
reviews.cons: G-Chat, similar to text messages, seems to imply that an immediate response is required. Unlike email, where you can unplug and respond at your leisure, G-Chats seemingly demand a response right away, which can distract you from doing actual work. It's too easy to communicate with someone, which makes it an inefficient communication tool.

reviews.title: “So good”

reviews.title: “Decent chat app”

reviews.pros: It's pretty easy to use just to chat on person. It's very simple to use.
reviews.cons: Group chats are tricky, people gchat you at all hours of the day, and you can't do things like gifs or fun emojis.

reviews.title: “My honest review aboutGoogle Hangouts”
reviews.text: It is a very good free solution, a little limited but useful for the basic needs
reviews.pros: This is the best free option to handle free video conference and meetings, it does the basic jobs and had been improved over the time.
reviews.cons:
Its not easy to share your screen and see chats, its a little laggy and slow, it can drop your call with ease
No all people knos how to use it

reviews.title: “Google chat is my fave.”
reviews.text: Love it!
reviews.pros: I love how easy it is to chat with my coworkers and friends without having to start a new email message.
reviews.cons: I don't like how sometimes when you don't open the message and respond back, it keeps notifying you.

reviews.title: “Easy chat to navigate”
reviews.pros: I really like how easy this software is to use. I like how it's linked with my google account to easily send a message.
reviews.cons: I think it's great and always improving which I like.

reviews.title: “Hangout replacement”
reviews.pros: It's shiny and new and is integrated nicely with the rest of the google suite
reviews.cons: Confusing as to what this product does more than hangout, is in complementaty of a new product?

reviews.title: “Gets the job done”
reviews.pros: The best thing about this software is how simple it is. it's very straightforward and it's hard to get lost or confused with it. Nothing flashy, but still enough function for just about any kind of chat (i.e. chatting with a friend, or sending a message to your boss).
reviews.cons: Largely due to the simplicity, the chats feel a little bit restrictive. The main thing I don't like is that you can either have the chat in a little box on the page which sometimes gets in the way of reading emails or whatever else is on screen, or you can make it a separate 'pop-out' window which is also not very convenient.

reviews.title: “Chat review”
reviews.pros: The most impactful features of this software would be search engine, quick conversation with a teammate, and comfortableness of just using the software. It is also very easy to set up the reminders which was very useful in my case.
reviews.cons: The least thing about this software would be that it has only some basic features unlike some of its paid competitors. Sometimes one might feel this software is clunky.

reviews.title: “Very easy, no performance issues.”
reviews.pros:
I have had to use G Suite Chat when working with various clients.
It is always very smooth, good quality, easy and fast to load.
Offers most of the same features of other conference platforms.
reviews.cons: Not much to make it stand out from the other similar products, but there isn't much about them to make them stand out either. They all seem to have very similar features.

reviews.title: “Great alternative to slack”
reviews.pros: We came from slack, and found nothing missing, and didnt have to pay the extra bucks that slack required.
reviews.cons: At times, the online/offline status seems to become incosistent.

reviews.title: “Gets the job done ”
reviews.pros: It’s easy to use like any other chat app
reviews.cons: Features and everything work fine so no cons at all

reviews.title: “Great experience”
reviews.pros: Absolutely incredible tool. Best instant messaging service currently available. Will not use any others.
reviews.cons: No current complaints with GChat. It's just great at what I need it to be great at. Nothing to improve.

reviews.title: “Software used for better communication with team”
reviews.pros: I like the most about the software is that it has so many features integrated within it that all kinds of communication become easy with Google chat. You can schedule a meeting within seconds , call instantly, share you screen, use emojis , integrate jira links for sharing and much more.
reviews.cons: Sometimes the software gets hanged alot and the processing becomes slow. The status of people are reflected incorrectly due to which misunderstanding occurs questioning their availability.

reviews.title: “Why do I get notifications from this, Hangouts and Gmail?!”
reviews.text: I use Google chat to communicate with my team daily, however the frustrations of notifications is driving me up the wall.
reviews.pros: Very lightweight software that never fails to send my messages to my colleagues. Keeps track of activity.
reviews.cons: I get notifications from Hangouts, Chrome, Gmail and Google Chat all at the same time, despite only one being open at once.

reviews.title: “Fast, agile and seamless”
reviews.pros: It is very snappy and quick compared to other platforms
reviews.cons: Sharing large files is a challenge. Can't integrate with third-party apps

reviews.title: “Easily Chat with Coworkers and Friends”
reviews.text: I get the chance to stay in touch with people and get my questions answered!
reviews.pros: It's so easy to use! I can talk to friends, coworkers, without leaving my desk. I mean, yeah it's great to have an in person conversations, but if I just need something quick, then it's at my finger tips. Also I can chat with my friends when I'm super bored.
reviews.cons: I sometimes miss notifications when people message me. I wish there was a better, more reliable notification system.

reviews.title: “OK for a free chat software, still in beta - hence more bugs than features”
reviews.pros: We've worked with Slack but since my company is a small one, we were looking into some cheaper option and decided to try Google Chat. The benefit to Slack is that it remembers all messages for free unlike Slack's free option. However, this is the only PRO I can think of ...
reviews.cons: Maybe it is still being developed but it is not very easy to use, there are a lot of bugs which for the past 6 months haven't been fixed at all, when you create a group message and forget to write a comment, it gets deleted and you need to start adding everybody once again; no option to add a reaction or emoji to a comment - you can only add a reply; no option to add your own emojis like in Slack... in general it's a pretty simple, straightforward and boring chat.

reviews.title: “Easy Chat System for Quick Exchanges”
reviews.text: It's a great little addition that makes Google's Suite even sweeter/suite ;) ah ah, see what I did there?
reviews.pros: If you so happen to catch someone online at the same time as you this is a much easier way to communicatt than by email. It's a pretty straight forward messaging system that I've used on a handful of occasions to chat while on computer when calling is not an appropriate option.
reviews.cons: I don't know a lot of people who use it, but when I ask someone to jump on really quick it's a very easy process to pick up and to be utilized. Some would just text. . . but when you can type on a computer faster why not use it?

reviews.title: “The only way to chat with family, friends and coworkers!”
reviews.pros: What I love most about google chat is that I can be working on something on my desktop and I get a notification that someone wants to chat with me.  I can go from work to chat in a split second and its convenient.
reviews.cons: There isn't anything I don't like about using google chat.  It's quick, easy and convenient.

reviews.title: “Great for interwork chat”
reviews.pros: I love using google chat for interwork chat. it allows just simple communication instead of using emails. Love that it pops up on th email screen.
reviews.cons: Not much. It is a great program for anyone to utilize.

reviews.title: “Functional and Helpful!”
reviews.pros: As a teacher, it is nice to be able to send a quick note to other teachers in the building and the response is fast. Google Chat is a great resource in that way.
reviews.cons: Sometimes I feel like the notification failed, but it's still a great resource.

reviews.title: “Google Chat Review”
reviews.pros: As a result of the new norm in which we work from due to COVID-19 measures, I use Google Chat on a daily basis to communicate with my Team Members. What I like most about the software is the ability to create group chats with my team member allowing us to communicate effectively.
reviews.cons: What I like least about this software is the fact that the messages from regular chat are deleted after 24 hours.

reviews.title: “My favorite video chat tool”
reviews.text: My overall experience is very positive. I use Google Hangouts for video chat whenever possible.
reviews.pros: It's easy to use, very fast and glitch-free.I really like the interface as well. I never run into issues when I use Hangouts.
reviews.cons: Nothing really, it's a very well working tool.

reviews.title: “Easy to use chat software”
reviews.pros: This is a great software that we use in my day to day work. Great interface and super simple to use.
reviews.cons: The app on iOS isn't the best. I'd recommend upgrading that.

reviews.title: “One of The Original Instant Messaging Softwares”

reviews.cons: When using with clients, it can be a bit difficult. Most are used to Zoom or other options and so there's some coaching involved to help people with using the features.

reviews.title: “Google Hangouts Ties Our Daily Job Squad”
reviews.text: Group meetings or organizational coordinating meetings are often held easily and reliably through Google Hangouts, and foreign calling is often possible at a very low cost and at a high standard in all countries. I liked the app, but I don't believe it was intended for big businesses or organizations. I discovered a problem with call quality while one is in an area where network quality is low.
reviews.pros: Great app to remain with friends and relatives both domestically and overseas. You can send texts and chat with the call feature, or you can do a video call with the individual you're calling. The fact that it uses data to achieve all this is brilliant. It's also feasible for you to give each other pictures, which is amazing.
reviews.cons: I do like the app. However, there is one flaw: it's fantastic but for one detail. There is no voice messaging alternative, unlike WhatsApp. Typing each letter, particularly long messages with at least seven or nine words, is extremely difficult.

reviews.title: “Univserity Student Google Chat Review ”
reviews.text: Chat was great to touch base with team members for group projects and as a student helped us stay o nthe same page and finish assignments on time

reviews.title: “Google Chat ”

reviews.cons: Not as "cool" as Slack. But overall functionality is on par.

reviews.title: “Infrequent Chat user”
reviews.text: Overall, I like Chat. It allows me to communicate with others seamlessly and in a way that feels like professional than some other modalities like Jabber or Slack.
reviews.pros: I like that Google Chat is a really commonly used software that professionals use, most often for social chats. I like that individuals have photos and that you can see when others are typing. I like that you can also create hangouts and do groups.
reviews.cons: One thing that Google Chat doesn't have that I wish it had is the ability to "like" or "love" someone else's message, which is something you can do in iMessages as well as WhatsApp. I think it is helpful and we have sort of become normalized to having the ability to do that with instant communication.

reviews.title: “Easy program to chat on!”

I don't get why my friends and co-workers want to use other things, so I have like 3 different programs open that do essentially the same thing.  Some have slightly different features available.  But to just chat, this sure does the job.

reviews.title: “The best video call app for business (Google Meet)”
reviews.text: I've done hundreds of interviews and Google Meet made it so much easier. Starting from the set up and until the end.
reviews.pros:
a. Easy to use and make (just write meet.new and a new room will be made)
b. It’s free
c. Videos can be shown up to 49 people
d. Quick jamboard maker
e. Virtual background
reviews.cons: There are no things that I could think of as a con for Google Meet. The most restriction it has is the maximum limit of 100 people. If you want to have a meeting for 100 people or more, you could consider other platform. But if it's less than that, Google meet is the best app to use.
