reviews.title: “Chat Chat Chat, anywhere and anytime ”
reviews.text: exceptional
reviews.pros: Instant messaging and communication with colleagues and even family members. Sometimes its hard to connect over a call during working hours and meetings. Thus google chat comes handy.
reviews.cons: no complaints so far.  very good experience

reviews.title: “Simple, Efficient Communications Tool.”
reviews.text: For our team, google chat goes a long way to provide us with much-needed communication for collaboration. it is a simple communications tool like no other, always giving out the best performance.
reviews.pros: Ideal software to use for communication, easy to use, has a user-friendly interface. We use it for internal communications in our organization, it works very well for our team helping us to easily collaborate. It has some nice features.
reviews.cons: I could not point out anything I disliked it simply is doing the job to the expected standard. I love this software.

reviews.title: “Good for Communication”
reviews.text: Overall this was okay but obviously Google can do a better job in making updates
reviews.pros: Within Google ecosystem, Google Chat is effective in doing the basics of communicating over text. It is dependable
reviews.cons: Features compared to other similar tools are much more basic. Notifications are not effective. The UI was not updated for a long time.

reviews.title: “Google Hangouts Helped with Distance Learning ”
reviews.text: This was instrumental in helping our school create a safe and collaborative space for students to chat and work on projects together.
reviews.pros: It is easy to setup. Students were able to "meet" or hangout virtually, work on projects collaboratively, and made distance learning a little bit more fun when you can connect outside of school.
reviews.cons: I didn't know how or if we could monitor hangouts when students joined on personal computers. It is not easy to use for younger students (K-2)

reviews.title: “Google Hangouts”
reviews.text: My overall experience with Hangouts is amazing since I have been able to communicate with people and connect with clients here.
reviews.pros: Google Hangouts is great because so many people use gmail, and therefore also have accounts with google hangouts, making it easy to talk to lots of people. It allows you to seamlessly send texts, images and videos for people and to make large groupchats.
reviews.cons: I did not like that it can be hard to find messages and photos that you sent some time ago as there is no easy search bar to search for past messages.

reviews.title: “Great product ”
reviews.pros: I really like how you can have different group chats going at one time.
reviews.cons: There aren’t really any cons to this product

reviews.title: “Just Works”
reviews.pros: It is simple to use and I can access it on any device.
reviews.cons: Nothing that I can think of in the time I have been using it.

reviews.title: “Google Chat helps ”
reviews.text: I love this program, it is so helpful to keep work tuning smooth.
reviews.pros: This provides a quick and easy method to communicate with co-workers throughout the busy day.
reviews.cons: I really do not have anything negative to say.

reviews.title: “how do you office gossip if not on google chats looool”
reviews.text: it has been amazing
reviews.pros: i can literally ping colleagues,  tell them stuff quickly and also it helps me know if my colleague is ignoring me i.e. if they are away or online,. loool i like google chats
reviews.cons: no negatives at all, I love when it got introduced., I jumped on it immediately.

reviews.title: “Great Program for Chatting”
reviews.text: Overall I am very satisfied with this program and I look forward to my teachers using it with their students.  This will allow a face-to-face interaction since we all need people to contact.  Out students will be able to see their teachers face, hear their voice tone and view their facial expressions which are very powerful.
reviews.pros: I have really enjoyed this software since Covid 19 hit our world.  It has allowed me to stay connected with my staff by hosting virtual meetings.  I appreciate the meetings are added to my calendar and how we can share files and work on them as a team.  It has allowed my teachers to co-plan, co-create and co-moderate lessons and student work.  This has taken there teaching to the next level and enhancing our student's experiences during Distant Learning.   I feel that our documents are secure and protected.
reviews.cons: I sometimes find the speed quality is lagging despite having high-speed internet.

reviews.title: “Adults in College Study Aid”
reviews.text: Overall, as stated before, life, work and school balance is a huge deal. With Google Suites I seldom miss a group project meeting.
reviews.pros: Google Suites makes my life as an over 40 college student, who works, simple. I cannot often make are required team project meetings. This software allows me to attend from home or work.
reviews.cons: As of today I have no bad words to say about this software. It is free to use and makes school, work, and life balance easier. Depending on your internet connection, there tends to be a bit slower lag with a fair connection. That can be any software.

reviews.title: “Use it almost every day”
reviews.text: It does sometimes have what appears to be downtime and lag, but overall it's a great option for quick and easy communication
reviews.pros: I use google chat almost every single day. It's simplicity combined with function - a super easy way to keep in contact with coworkers and friends
reviews.cons: I believe google is no longer adding features to or optimizing chat, which is definitely disappointing

reviews.title: “Google Hangouts Review ”
reviews.pros: I liked how accessible Google Hangouts was during the pandemic. It was what I used to make sure that my students learned during this time.
reviews.cons: I did not like the quality and the moving of the screens when using Google Hangouts. A lot of the features were hidden and were challenging to find because I had to hover over them. I also noticed that the quality was not too strong.

reviews.title: “Under-respected Piece of Software!”
reviews.pros: It is so easy to communicate with coworkers without having to send an email or have to walk across the office. Having the ability to communicate with your boss while you type an email for him is a great bonus as well!
reviews.cons: It's a bit simple in what you can actually do with the software but Google offers other software for that (IE: Google Meet).

reviews.title: “gChat review”
reviews.pros: Google Chat is extremely useful for team communication within a hybrid in-person/remote work flow. Some team members are not in the office, and it makes it easy to connect. I also like the integration of google meet for ease of getting on a video call.
reviews.cons: There is nothing I don't like about google chat.

reviews.title: “Google hangouts works well for Instant Messaging and setting up meetings”
reviews.text: We are solving the need to continue speaking and speaking in real time, but doing so while socially distanced.
reviews.pros: The most impactful features are those allowing us to instantly communicate. In a COVID-19 world, we no longer meet in person as much or have face-to-face conversations as often. This allows us to replicate that feeling.
reviews.cons: I wish the chat feature was a little more intuitive sometimes and that Google would stop tweaking it and changing features. Once you use something a lot, you grow to expect some constancy.

reviews.title: “Great software”
reviews.pros: It is really nice tool for chat. I like its medium and chat space.
reviews.cons: I think some features can be added to this software to make it more attractive.

reviews.title: “Chat better options not the best”
reviews.text: We really couldn't get people on board with using it.
reviews.pros: There really isn't much to like about chat other that it's free.
reviews.cons: I don't really like chat. It was hard to get our team to use it. Also not everyone having Android devices made it harder to use. No one really used it so we moved on to better communication tools.

reviews.title: “Our go-to communication tool”
reviews.text:
We switched from Slack to Chat and while there was some friction at first, I think Chat has given us more options and made us more productive in the long run.
The seamless integration with G Suite alone is worth a try.
reviews.pros:
The ability to add bots and use webhooks
As expected, integration with the rest of the G suite suite of  apps
reviews.cons:
Sometimes if you have many Google accounts logged in, it will use an account to open Chat that you may not want it to use. Quick relogging of the accounts usually fixes the problem.
Would love to see custom emojis.

reviews.title: “amazing”
reviews.pros: everything you require at one spot and with versatility
reviews.cons: so far nothing, no glitches and any other hiccups

reviews.title: “An awesome way to stay in touch”
reviews.pros: It is easy to use and keeps me in touch with my coworkers
reviews.cons: Not the best in terms of tracking conversations.

reviews.title: “Chat google review”
reviews.pros: Its easy to use and its agile . It allows me to get in contact in a better way than email.
reviews.cons: It still lacks some functionalities thar whatsapp has.

reviews.title: “Everyone has Chat”
reviews.text: I love it and wouldnt change!
reviews.pros: When my friends are at work, in a place other than where I am, we always use Chat to connect
reviews.cons: The one downside is not being able to see when they were last active

reviews.title: “Simple and good tool for dairy chat”
reviews.pros: In this difficult situation due to COVID19, it is important to keep social distance. You can easily chat with people with Google Chat. It is very easy to use.
reviews.cons: Google Chat is not suitable for highly personal information.

reviews.title: “LOVE Chat!”
reviews.text: Overall its a great product that I would suggest to anyone wanting to communicate internally.
reviews.pros: I like the convenience factor and how easy it is to communicate with coworkers.  It is pretty easy to navigate and train.
reviews.cons: Sometimes the message times out but overall it is fine. I have had messages missed due to this but am usually reached out to by that person.

reviews.title: “Chat makes it easy for my team to meet remotely”
reviews.text: Easy to schedule video chat that others can join via links, invites, or other methods.
reviews.pros: I use Chat for the Video Conferencing functionality. Because it is baked in with Google's Calendar Application, I can invite team-members to a video chat and a calendar event in one go. I still prefer Slack over the Instant Messenger features Chat offers, but as far as video conferencing goes, there is no better option.
reviews.cons: A lot of people do not know it exists! Messengers are great, but only if your friends use them. Without other people to chat with, this service becomes useless. Most people have used the videochat portion of it, though, so I have no trouble using that :)

reviews.title: “Google Chat is Outdated”
reviews.text: Google Chat is fine for what it is.  But, if you really want a high-functioning chat tool, there are so many better options out there.
reviews.pros: Google Chat is a reliable chat tool.  It's rarely down and lives inside my GMail inbox, which is always open, so it's very accessible.
reviews.cons: Chat is just outdated.  There are far better softwares out there that drastically outperform Google Chat.  If you've ever used Slack, you won't go back to G-Chat.  I have even started to get spammed through Google Chat, which is just unacceptable.

reviews.title: “Easy to use”
reviews.text: Overall this is a great and easy chat to use. The features make it more competitive with other chats I use.
reviews.pros: This chat is easy to use and recently had some great new features added. The ability to edit a message that was already sent is AMAZING. Also, the ability to "react" to someone's message is nice.
reviews.cons: The app on my phone always shows one active notification even tho I have no new messages. This is annoying for me as someone who likes to keep their notifications clean.

reviews.title: “GCHAT ”
reviews.text: Love using this tool to communicate with co workers.
reviews.pros: Easy communication tool to be used in the workplace. Ease of access & user friendly.
reviews.cons: No option to look back at shared photos in the chat.

reviews.title: “Simple and widespread chat tool ”
reviews.pros: Google Chat is a pretty basic chat tool, but it's ubiquitous and very easy to use. Most people these days have Gmail, so Google Chat makes it really easy to quickly communicate with them.
reviews.cons: At my office we use a combination of Slack and Google Chat. Not everyone in the company has access to Slack, but everyone has Google Chat. I feel Slack is more robust, but Google Chat is more ubiquitous. I haven't tried to send many files or images via Google Chat since Slack seems to have more storage and searchability functionality.

reviews.title: “Google Chat ”
reviews.pros: It's extremely easy to use. It was integral to a company I worked for - we used it to communicate between offices.
reviews.cons: Not as easy to send links/documents between people and groups.

reviews.title: “Great Free Instant Messenger ”
reviews.pros: Everyone can get access to the tool, which makes it great for volunteers.
reviews.cons: It would be great to be able to appear online to only a limited number of users during business hours.

reviews.title: “Google Chat Regular Usage Review”
reviews.text: My overall experience with Google chat was OK, it did what it is meant to do
reviews.pros: The exclusiveness about it is what i like the most, meaning; when you are in one you know that you're apart of the exclusive part of  a team
reviews.cons: I am not a fan of how you get to the chat in an option in the Gmail app nor how you are able to open the messages; this may be an effect of the other well known messaging platforms that we are all used to example: Whatsapp, telegram, etc, but this is just very different. The notifications need to be normal like WhatsApp etc as well.

reviews.title: “Easy chat option within Google”
reviews.pros: Easy to use and nice viewing options in the corner of screen or as its own window
reviews.cons: Nothing I can think of at the moment - just what I need

reviews.title: “Google Chat Review”
reviews.text: Great software to use when you are having trouble communicating throughout your office.
reviews.pros: I really like this software! It makes communicating throughout the office super easy. I love being able to get quick replies on questions using this software, rather than sending an e-mail.
reviews.cons: The only con about this software is I don't know how secure it is. We personally deal with a lot of information that needs to be secure, and we can't use this service to communicate about somethings that need to be private.

reviews.title: “My Google Chat Experience”
reviews.text: It's not good one bit. A lot of modifications and upgrades need to be done
reviews.pros: I like the fact that the app is very light and loads faster than my previous one. Also the fact that it syncs my Gmail contacts.
reviews.cons: It doesn't import my contacts, I cannot record voice or video.

reviews.title: “Convenient tool for remote work”
reviews.pros: I like how you can use a chat feature and share your screen through Google Hangouts. You also have the ability to choose a background before you join the meeting.
reviews.cons: There isn’t anything I disliked about the software but it would be nice if it was easier to see everyone’s faces on the screen. When there are too many people, some show up on the screen and some don’t.

reviews.title: “Great for Communication”
reviews.text: It's great to be able to ask quick questions and collaborate among teammates rather than sending out an email.
reviews.pros: It's easy to ping a colleague and you can set your status.  You can also see other's status and it's right there in email.  You can create groups and the dashboard makes sense.  You can also share your google calendar with people in your chat groups.
reviews.cons: You can't really share documents in a way that is searchable later.  You can share photos and links but it may not be searchable down the road.

reviews.title: “Another great chat software”

it's free

it can be time consuming

reviews.title: “Real time conversations”
reviews.pros: I love this program. I use it more to create rooms so we have a place to converse on topics that we are working on. We are in two buildings and have different schedules so this makes it easier to connect.
reviews.cons: Some of our colleagues do not use google but a different platform which is harder for them to be a part of the group. I am not sure if we still can connect them. I am new so the more I learn about it, that may not be an issue anymore.

reviews.title: “Google Chat is a great communication tool!”
reviews.pros: I love Google Chat!  It's a quick, efficient and free tool that my entire office uses for an inter-office communication tool.
reviews.cons: At this time, I don't have any cons to list.

reviews.title: “Google Hangout Review”
reviews.pros: Easy to use, easy to find people right from the email address, easy to store and find history
reviews.cons: Maybe too less function to choose from and can only chat with gmail account.

reviews.title: “Useful office messaging tool”
reviews.text: My overall experience with Chat has been great since we have been able to implement it across the office with ease via Google Suites.
reviews.pros: I like how this software provides us around the office with an efficient way to communicate with one another besides email. A less professional but more instantaneous way to exchange messages.
reviews.cons: I would like to see the implementation of stickers, for instance, that might make the communication among co-workers more "loose", if you will.

reviews.title: “Compared to slack it is incredibly weak”
reviews.text: Compared to slack, it is a poor alternative. It might be worthwhile in the future but Google has a long way to go before it catches up to the competitors.
reviews.pros: Integrated with your gSuite account, which is nice. You get google search by default which is awesome.
reviews.cons:
There is no way to create a thread off of comments. You can't invite people who aren't part of your organization. There is no integrations for anything other than Google Drive. 

It only supports one account a time.

reviews.title: “Chat for Google”
reviews.text: I am able to converse with my customers and deal with their concerns at that moment. The Chat software is a asset to my company because my customers can have their issue addressed at that particular moment.
reviews.pros: I like the Chat option with Google it gives me real time interaction with Clients, Family, and Friends. The Chat helps me deal with an issue immediately versus having to deal with voice mail or missed calls. Working in real time to resolve issues.
reviews.cons: I have yet to have any serious issues with this software at this time.

reviews.title: “Great Communication Tool!”
reviews.pros: Google Suite Chat is a great communication tool for the business.  It allows for users to stay connected to one another and I really like the way it notifies you when you have new messages.
reviews.cons: I believe Chat does everything expected of a chat platform.  I haven't experienced any issues.

reviews.title: “My Google Hangouts Review ”
reviews.pros: That it’s really easy to use and it’s a good way to connect with friends and family.
reviews.cons: I haven’t used it that much, so it’s really nothing I liked about Google Hangouts.

reviews.title: “Let's chat, Google!”
reviews.pros: I love how easy it is to be online OR invisible. It's easy to access and absolutely free!

reviews.title: “Google Chat”

reviews.title: “Best Chat App For Communication ”

reviews.pros:
Easy to use,

One of my favorite we can delete and edit wrongly send message,
Easy to track all incoming message's,

reviews.title: “A great solution for teams that don't like Slack”
reviews.pros: I like the fact that it is integrated into Gmail. It's very lightweight and you have the ability to start video calls from within the G Chat.
reviews.cons: I don't like the fact that file sharing isn't done easily within chat. Slack is certainly superior to Chat for a team communication tool.

reviews.title: “This is one service I always recommend to clients”
reviews.text: I installed this to many clients and also use it myself on every computer and even my cell phone, I think it's great.
reviews.pros: The implementation of this chat service is of key importance for the digital transformation of a company. In a short time the different areas begin to communicate differently and share files and tasks in a much more effective way.
reviews.cons: It lacks the possibility of responding to a previous chat message, as this can be a bit confusing in some cases.

reviews.title: “Mailbox chat”
reviews.pros: Easy to use, can be used on computer and on smartphone
reviews.cons: Gchat sometimes disconnects even though I'm still connected to Internet

reviews.title: “Great way to connect when working remotely”
reviews.text: Love it!
reviews.pros: Ease of use and ability to chat with co-workers while working remotely.
reviews.cons: Trouble using with slow internet connections.

reviews.title: “Chat: Better improvement to Hangouts”
reviews.text: My overall experience with Chat is great, simple to use and powerful.
reviews.pros: Chat has got very good improvements from Hangouts chat. All messages sent on Hangouts is received in chat. Drag and drop option of images makes it easy.
reviews.cons: Not really I could think of but could have more feature improvements and integration to other google software

reviews.title: “Using Chat for elearning”
reviews.text: Overall, using Chat has allowed me to make a daily "face to face" contact with my students during this period of elearning. Students love our Chat sessions and look forward to them daily. Without this application, I would not be able to check in with my students in real time to see how they are learning. Also, thanks to the option to present in Chat, I've had sessions with parents to teach them how to use our distance learning page. So helpful!
reviews.pros: It is very easy to create a new Chat session and share the link with others to join. I like that I can present content to my students while in a Chat session and students can interact with what I'm presenting. I like I can mute participants so everyone can hear my instruction.
reviews.cons: I feel like the presentation window is small and it can be difficult for my students to view content when I present to them. There can also be moments of lag or frozen screen when presenting.

reviews.title: “Go back to Hangouts”
reviews.text: I have been using chat to test my experience for the IT team at my firm as we prepare to decide if we want to switch from Hangouts to Chat or use another tool. After my experience, my vote would be to use another tool like Slack or Zoom.
reviews.pros: The rooms feature that allows you to create different threads is probably the only advantage that I have identified on Chats when compared to Hangouts
reviews.cons: I am unable to start chats with contacts outside of my company network. This is a huge problem for me, as I was able to do that easily in Hangouts.

reviews.title: “Good for internal communication ”
reviews.pros: This is a good way to communicate internally with teammates. The instant messaging capability is super helpful.
reviews.cons: The notifications are sometimes easy to miss.

reviews.title: “Works great!”
reviews.text: I love it. I use it all the time. If the most negative thing I can say about the chat is the stickers/emojis, I'd say it's a pretty great chat feature.
reviews.pros: It's a pretty simple chat, easy to use.
reviews.cons: The stickers are cute, some of them a little more horrifying. I want to be able to remove the chat from a Gmail window, and haven't been able to figure that out yet or if it's even possible.

reviews.title: “Not Just Messaging but Handles Sms as well”
reviews.text: Google Hangouts as been a great platform for me and it helps me by handling my sms making it easy for me to use it.
reviews.pros: Google Hangouts is a user friendly, easy to use and comes with good feats like  video chat, instant messaging,  it also grants users with a web and application-based well automatically synchronized conversation.
reviews.cons: It makes it hard to  reply to a specific messages in the situation where the user receives different message, if the user does not have a google account it makes it hard for they to enjoy this platform.

reviews.title: “Best tool for team communication”

reviews.cons: Not a great deal else you can do past just message and video call, if there is, it's not very apparent.

reviews.title: “Easy to use, tough competition ”
reviews.pros: Simple interface, syncs contacts in address book.
reviews.cons: Nothing bad to say here. Just with so many chat options out there it doesn't make for a tough competitor.

reviews.title: “G Suite Chat”
reviews.pros: The chat makes it easier to communicate with staff quickly.
reviews.cons: When you generate a group chat, you should be able to add people to an already existing chat.

reviews.title: “The New Google Chat is the worst user experience I have ever had”
reviews.text: I hate having to use it.  I hate that I constantly have to resize it to see messages.  I hate that it is no longer useful on the side of my screen.  I hate that they tried to stick it in my email and renamed it a "workspace" as if I need more visual clutter there.   I hate the way video is embedded.  I have to drag the damn thing half way across my screen so I can access all the controls.   It looks like a damn glorified web page that is USELESS as a desktop app.   It is the WORST user experience I have ever had with either a personal tech or work tech product.
reviews.pros: Nothing.  It is a glorified web page that is clunky and terrible
reviews.cons: I hate that I can't click on a name and have the chat come up.  I hate the interface.  I hate the space it takes up.  I hate every single thing about the update.  It looks, and acts, badly.

reviews.title: “A great add on to reduce needless email”
reviews.text: Quick, simple and efficient. Works on all our platforms
reviews.pros: We encouraged our staff to reduce email traffic and lengthy internal calls, this is a quick and easy way to communicate wit an individual or a team
reviews.cons: Googles' re-branding of established products can be tiresome, but with each ineration there tends to be improvements

reviews.title: “Super easy way to stay connected”

reviews.title: “Excellent service ”
reviews.pros: Easy to sign in and user friendly. Importing and exporting data is simply easy to do .
reviews.cons: Nothing that I can recall at the moment .

reviews.title: “The chat's next level.”
reviews.text: Overall my experience using Chat have been great! I love the new tool from Google.
reviews.pros: What I like the most about Chat is the simplicity of it. The interface is quite plain and easy to read.
reviews.cons: What I like the least about Chat is the lack of picture profile on the left panel. Also that you don't know when others reads your message.

reviews.title: “Google Hangouts review”
reviews.text: Experience has been excellent.  Google Hangouts  is really a powerful tool that is not resource intensive.  It has exceptional integration with the entire Google suite such as documents, sheets and the calendar. It was a pleasure to use the software in Google classrooms
reviews.pros: It was used by my daughter during school in the pandemic.  The integration with the rest of the Google Suite is really powerful especially with Google classroom.  The tool is light on resources and easy to use.  The user interface was really easy for children to adopt and use immediately
reviews.cons: It will be useful to have an ability to conference especially across a number of geographies or countries. Having dial in numbers ensures we don't have to depend on the link and can dial into the call using a cell phone as well

reviews.title: “GChat needs work, but remains connected to Gmail”
reviews.pros: Connected to Gmail, Easy to use, Free and includes video/phone calls

reviews.title: “Review for Google Hangouts”

reviews.cons: Notifications will be duplicated if you have both the Gmail and Google Chat apps, and it is difficult to find a way to just get notifications of new chats once. Also, the different chat threads can get cluttered - we find it most useful to create different boards for different tasks.

reviews.title: “Decent Chat Application ”
reviews.text: Overall I like where Google is heading and am trusting the journey. But for the user it takes a bit to get used to.
reviews.pros: I have been a lifelong user of Google Hangouts which I loved. We recently made the switch to Google Chat for business. Overall it has been a good experience and the functionality is solid. I like that I can collaborate in teams or individuals. I like the team chat better than hangouts.
reviews.cons: It seems like you need multiple apps instead of one to manage instant messaging and video calls. Maybe it is because I am a newer user.

reviews.title: “Google Chat”
reviews.text: This platform is excellent to communicate with colleagues while at work, I really enjoy being to reach out and talk with another person to resolve issues in a timely manner.
reviews.pros: I am able to immediately connect with  other employees in the company to communicate issues that arise while on duty daily.
reviews.cons: I have not found anything about this platform to dislike, it continues to go above my expectations.  I don't have any issues at this time.

reviews.title: “review for chat”
reviews.text: Overall, will recommend it anyone interested in using it.
reviews.pros: Ive used it couple of times while working on a research project with my colleagues. Its easy to use but for whatever reason unknown to me, its not popular like whatsapp. High quality video and audio calls
reviews.cons: The major con has to do with notification -- sometimes i receive messages but dont get any notification. Makes communication with others a bit slow. I also received lots of messages from people that i am not connected with.

reviews.title: “best for business user”
reviews.text: I like to use this chat features. we can store and share files in the cloud.  The most important thing is that we secure data and devices.
reviews.pros: In this Software, people can use very ease. It is convenience for people and everything runs in the cloud. Also, it has plenty of cloud storage and free version available.
reviews.cons: As per my thinking, I don't think it has not bad quality.  It is the best.

reviews.title: “It's good but not the best”
reviews.text: It's good if you need a basic platform to coverage your communication needs.
reviews.pros: The great thing about Google Chat is that it's free and has the basic functionality needed for anyone that has to deal with lot's of conversations.
reviews.cons: It lacks some useful features such as channel creation (so you can separate in topics the different chats) which are found in other message products.

reviews.title: “You're already using gmail, why not chat while you're at it?”
reviews.text: We all use gmail and have it open all of the time anyway. It's way easier to shoot a quick couple of chat messages back and forth rather than emailing.
reviews.pros: I love that Google Chat is fully integrated into the Google Mail suite. Not only is it easily accessible since I already have the a gmail tab open most of the time, it is also stored in my gmail archives in case I need to reference something later.
reviews.cons: It is yet another way in which you are immediately accessible by someone expecting an immediate response.

reviews.title: “Quick and simple”
reviews.text: Overall, Chat has been great for quick messages during work and streamlines communication.
reviews.pros: I like how when I am answering emails related to work but need to ask a quick question to my coworker, I can just shoot them a quick message without cluttering up their inbox.
reviews.cons: There isn't really anything I don't like about it! Maybe if anything, the notification noise could be better?

reviews.title: “A great alternative to email/text!”
reviews.text: I just recently started a new job in which Chat is used often, which was not the case at my previous job, even though both had access to it. I've been impressed with how great it's been and making communication easy.
reviews.pros: I like that it provides a quicker and easier way to communicate with other city employees rather than using email or texting. You can look up any city employee and begin a conversation with them. It allow me to communicate with my supervisor whose office is away from the lab. It's also allowed me and my coworkers to have conversations as well!
reviews.cons: There doesn't appear to be anything really unique about it that separates it from other chat/IM programs.  It's definitely functional and great as it is, but nothing too special about it.

reviews.title: “nice aplication”
reviews.pros: good fiture and make me so easy to use...
reviews.cons: need update version to good performing ...

reviews.title: “Google messaging app”
reviews.text: Good. I have been able to connect with friends from all over the world. Chat, video call, share videos and pictures using their Gmail address
reviews.pros: On the desktop computer I can access hangouts via my Gmail. I just chat up contact using their Gmail address. What is more easier than that. I just love the sound of the notification bell when a message arrives. Voice calls, video call are all available
reviews.cons: None that I have observed so far. I'm just enjoying Google hangouts

reviews.title: “Chat”
reviews.text: I have heard that Chat may be replacing Hangouts in the future.  It is essentially the same, but lacks the ability to be viewed within Gmail. Until that feature is added, I will be using Hangouts instead.
reviews.pros: This is a cloud messaging system that is tied to your Google account.  It makes messaging coworkers and video chats easy to do.
reviews.cons: This seems to be almost exactly like Google hangouts but this app requires you to have a separate window open to view. I prefer Hangouts because it can be minimized within your gmail screen.

reviews.title: “Better than Skype ”
reviews.pros: I like that you can send fun drawings to your friends. I also like that during group video chats the screen displays the individual who is currently talking.
reviews.cons: I don't like how I have to have the entire window open in order to use this software. I wish I could pop out the chat so that it can be smaller on my screen while I am working on other tasks.

reviews.title: “G Chat - The Best Way To Communicate?”
reviews.text: It's certainly a way to communicate within an organization, but likely not the best route given its limitations.
reviews.pros: It's a way to privately communicate with one of more people within your organization. It's like instant messaging for businesses.
reviews.cons: There's a limit to how many people you can add to one specific chat, which is a downside to the tool. It enable communication between small groups of people, but does not provide visibility into these conversations for those not originally included.

reviews.title: “Use this everyday!”
reviews.pros: I use this software everyday to chat with colleagues as well as personal use. Its a great way to keep in touch while having your email open and not having to switch back and forth to screens.
reviews.cons: Nothing that comes to mind at this time.

reviews.title: “Great program”
reviews.text: Overall, there are a lot more features than what we were using previously.
reviews.pros: Integrates with Basecamp! Can start several chats in one room.
reviews.cons: If there are too many chats in a room and I'm offline for 2 days, it can be challenging to make sure I don't miss something.

reviews.title: “Minimal User interface for a messaging application but lacks many features.”
reviews.text: google hangouts is suitable for people who likes minimal and clean. But it lacks many key features that are part of most other messaging apps. Overall the experience is a mixed bag.
reviews.pros: It is easy to use and doesn't require any additional download to use. We can use hangouts from any browser. Logging is easy and chats are secure and private. Clean and Minimal UI which is easy to use. Easily syncs with gsuite applications.
reviews.cons: UI is very bland and not intuitive. It doesn't have GIF support. No dark mode and doesn't have recall message feature. Chat window is very narrow which makes hard to read messages for few people.

reviews.title: “Fast and Easy to Use”
reviews.pros: It very easy to use and has a very friendly user interface. It's quick and has a lot of nice features.
reviews.cons: It can be slow and outdated sometimes needs updating to keep up with other chat softwares

reviews.title: “Easy to Use”
reviews.pros: Google Chat is easy to use and a great alternative to traditional texting.
reviews.cons: My staff were hesitant to implement this rather than just traditional texting.

reviews.title: “Easy to use! ”
reviews.pros: I love the ease of use! It is so great to send a message to a coworker
reviews.cons: Implementing it in the workplace is hard! I guess people don’t seem to notice how easy it is versus calling each other

reviews.title: “great tool for communicating ”
reviews.text: its a great place to have work related discussion on the daily
reviews.pros: i like that i can use this tool to chat with colleagues everyday. It's great that you can create chat "rooms" and send files through it. Sending gifs easily is also a bonus.
reviews.cons: it was difficult figuring out the different between chat and google hangouts, and which was better to use. It's also unclear why google even has two options.

reviews.title: “Great Communication app”
reviews.text: Google chat is an easy to use chat feature woven into chrome that makes it convenient chat solution
reviews.pros: This is a simple chat solution for small to medium business that doesn't complicate the user experience
reviews.cons: I have not run into any problems that affect my user experience

reviews.title: “Very smooth video call experience”
reviews.pros: The video quality is the best feature for hangouts
reviews.cons: It could work on adding more features to stay in the league

reviews.title: “Communicator built in your e-mail”
reviews.pros: My favorite thing about Google Chat is that it is not a standalone site and that it is built into Gmail. I like having all my conversations in one place both chats and email
reviews.cons: Google Chat is an improvement over Google Hangout by introducing features such as file transfer, but it still lacks many things compared to its direct competitors, such as editing recent messages

reviews.title: “Best chat app ever”
reviews.pros: I can chat with my employees and my family and friends
reviews.cons: There are no cons to this app it's great I. Every way

reviews.title: “Reasonable communication product”
reviews.pros: We have tested and trialed this product for our environment. It is extremely easy to start using and integrate with other products. The software is basic which is great for new users to the product.
reviews.cons: The pricing was not as great as some of the others on the market, and the features were not as well developed. Preferred Slack and Hive.

reviews.title: “Easiest way to communicate with staff”
reviews.pros: My organization loves this way of communication - Google Chat helps eliminate unnecessary emails by allowing us to communicate rapidly and efficiently with each other. The chat has all the basic necessities as way as a very simple and easy to understand interface.
reviews.cons: Sometimes I wish a few other more robust features were included in the chat, but that might reduce simplicity.

reviews.title: “Fast online chat”
reviews.pros: An easy way to communicate instantly with contacts without ussing email provider or cellphone.
reviews.cons: Lack of security associated to google solutions.

reviews.title: “Easy tool to communicate with the team”
reviews.pros: Great quality whether we use it on phone or laptop
reviews.cons: Limitation to the number of characters in a message

reviews.title: “Handy but watch”
reviews.text: Its very handy to have because its populars in business meeting but also a tool scammers use alot so beware. But very useful to have around for a businesswoman
reviews.pros: That a lot of people use it and know of it
reviews.cons: That it has a lot of scammers on it and that use it

reviews.title: “Makes communicating quicker and easier”
reviews.text: When collaborating with another publicist Google Chat came in handy. Especially when we were working on the same documents in Google docs. We were able to chat as if we were texting and the exchange was quick and easy.
reviews.pros: The opportunity to converse in real time without the hassle of the email process or having to use another device outside of the G Suite to talk.
reviews.cons: It’s not used often enough. I have so many contacts I could chat with but more often than not I receive emails as opposed to the chat.

reviews.title: “Google Chat!”
reviews.text: I have benefited highly from google chat, it’s made me keep connections from family across the United States.
reviews.pros: Love Chat, very easy to work. I highly recommend you try google chat, we’ll worth it!
reviews.cons: I love this product nothing I would change!

reviews.title: “Chatting Away ”
reviews.text: I utilize the program to video conference with my team on a daily basis. It’s very proficient and secured. I highly recommend every business to utilize this software.
reviews.pros: The software is easy to maneuver to contact and video conferencing with my team and my family. The software is easy to use and doesn’t require in-depth training.
reviews.cons: The program is extremely easy to utilize therefore I have no issues with it.

reviews.title: “Software to Chat”
reviews.pros: Google Chat is built right into the other features in all that Google has to offer cloud-based these days. It is a great addition where you are able to instantly chat with others about projects going on.
reviews.cons: The one con I have with Google Chat is not everyone can see when you invite them to a chat so they may not accept the invite.

reviews.title: “I love Google chat! ”
reviews.text: Excellent!
reviews.pros: Google chat makes it so easy to communicate!
reviews.cons: I can’t think of anything that needs changed

reviews.title: “So Convenient”
reviews.pros: I love how easy it is to chat with my colleagues in other parts of the office. It is quicker than sending an email and I usually get a quicker response.
reviews.cons: Everything is great with Chat. There is nothing to change.

reviews.title: “Great Evolving Product”
reviews.text: It's had its ups and downs, but overall its been great. Gaining and losing the ability to make phone calls, uniting and forking different names along the way, but the core communication functionality has always been solid.
reviews.pros: It works for all the basics of communication with many advanced features, like image sharing.
reviews.cons: The product is changing all the time, which can mean some getting used to. Google sometimes can't make up its mind what to even call chat.

reviews.title: “Great way to communicate at work”
reviews.pros: Easily contact coworkers to ask quick questions and chat with family. Great way to connect with people.
reviews.cons: I have no complaints about the software, I will continue to use it.

reviews.title: “Best Manageable Chat”
reviews.text: Very easy to use and easy to see who on your team is online. The Group Chat feature is extremely helpful and can be used in place of scheduling a meeting
reviews.pros: Its part of the Google Suite, so its connected right to your Gmail. It makes it easier to visibly see your email and chat in the same window. It also allows for Group Chats
reviews.cons: Its not that user friendly when it comes to sharing files. It allows for basic files like .jpgs and SOME links

reviews.title: “Chat review by non-profit food distribution organization”
reviews.text: Chat is a convenient helpful tool that best of all saves in gmail so I have a record of conversations  even from years back
reviews.pros: Chat is a great resource for easily connecting with my coworkers. When people are working they tend to be on email and they  pay attention to the chats right away
reviews.cons: It's annoying that you first have to connect with the person before beginning to chat. I wish it was enough that you have their email address.

reviews.title: “Google Chat”
reviews.pros: This makes it easy for my students to reach out to me with questions.
reviews.cons: I'm yet to find something that I haven't liked about it.

reviews.title: “Awesome Chat Features ”
reviews.text: My overall experience with the chat would be a good experience. It got the job done with my department. We were able to communicate efficiently with this option.
reviews.pros: This chat was particularly helpful to the large company that I work for. It helps us communicate with ease, and helps us stay connected with important people to get things done efficiently.
reviews.cons: I would love to see more customization of that chat, and more group chat options.

reviews.title: “You can keep records for a long time!”
reviews.pros: I really like the fact that I can access to really old conversations in case I need to double check information
reviews.cons: There should be other features like more complete profiles and the capability to access them

reviews.title: “Good for remote teams”
reviews.text: Great! It's fast and convenient and works well on desktop and mobile!
reviews.pros: As a remote employee, this is a fast and reliable way to contact my coworkers. I like the web and mobile apps.
reviews.cons: Honestly, nothing. I have no complaints when it comes to sending quick messages. If you need something more than quick communication - this isn't the tool for you - but that isn't really a con.

reviews.title: “Could be better”
reviews.text: Whenever I have used it it has been good but again it's got limited features and Google does not seem to put an emphasis on it which makes it difficult to promote within our organization.
reviews.pros: Google Chat is very easy to use and available for all Google users in our organizations.
reviews.cons: Google Chat despite being very simple to use does not seem to be well known by Google users in general which means we often have to use other program to chat instead. But also its got limited features.

reviews.title: “Google Chat Review”
reviews.text: If you are looking to keep all communication in one platform, Google suite; Gmail, Chat, Meet, Hangouts, Drive, Docs, Calendar, Contacts, Slides, and Sheets will meet your needs.
reviews.pros: Googe Chat is integrated with other Google products.
reviews.cons: There is no way to reply or refer to a previous chat message. Adding links to all chat messages would be awesome for reference.

reviews.title: “The Outdated Zoom”
reviews.text: Google hangouts used to be one of the ways me and coworkers connected but I haven't used it in years.
reviews.pros: Google Hangouts is integrated with the rest of my google account which is great and it is easy to jump into a call from many Google applications.
reviews.cons: Hangouts is just so behind every other video call software. It is lacking in so many features that both Zoom and Microsoft Teams both have. Google would really need to overhaul this in order for it to be used.

reviews.title: “Great for the pandemic.”
reviews.text: Super helpful when the pandemic hits and in person meetings were limited.
reviews.pros: You can have a meeting in an instant with an easy access to your list of mails in gmail.
reviews.cons: You need a good wifi signal to have the best experience.

reviews.title: “ Corporate team communication is simplified  along with follow-up functionality  ”
reviews.text: Good messaging application recommended for corporate chatting usage.
reviews.pros: Creating and managing the corporate team chat groups, with respect to task along with follow option will help to keep update on the task.
reviews.cons: There is file size limitation for sharing, need to depend to Google Drive for sharing the files, not suitable for personal chat, User Interface is not attractive.

reviews.title: “Review hangout”
reviews.text: I think this application really helps me stay connected with my team and also my clients,
reviews.pros: this application is very good, it really helps me stay connected with my team, and the feature I like the most is the dile-share feature which I think is very good
reviews.cons: I think all the features are running well and are complete

reviews.title: “Only makes sense if your company is all Google”
reviews.text: Overall I appreciate Google Chat for what it is but don't use it for more than short one-off conversations.
reviews.pros: I like that I can do chat right inside my email browser. I think that is a convenient feature and makes a quick chat easy.
reviews.cons: Unless everyone in your company is using Google I don't think Chat from Google is a good solution because it can cause fragmentation of discussion.

reviews.title: “Easy and quick”
reviews.text: I am happy with its features and quality.
reviews.pros: It helps to connect faster and works smoothly.
reviews.cons: I have not seen any cons while I was using.

reviews.title: “This software works well on phones and computers, and is relatively easy to use. ”
reviews.pros: What I enjoyed the most about Google Chat is how easy it is to use and the convenience it can provide. You are able to message anyone as long as you have their email, which can provide the convenience of texting without having to given anyone your phone number.
reviews.cons: The features that I did not like about this software was the noise it would make whenever a chat was sent or received because it could be disruptive during a meeting or lecture. While it is not difficult to turn the notification off, I think that there could be a better way for the user to be notified of a new message.

reviews.title: “Good product with potential to be a great everyday use product”
reviews.pros: Ability to communicate with friends from the Gmail browser window. Easy to use interface.
reviews.cons: You would only get notifications if thr browser window was open. You cannot add people with their phone numbers. No standalone mobile/desktop version of the app.

reviews.title: “Convenient Chat”
reviews.text: Chat has been consistent for me and overall reliable. I like how it integrates into my calendar and email, and has been generally sturdy for as long as I've used it.
reviews.pros: I like that Chat integrates seamlessly with all my other google apps, calendars, and emails. It makes scheduling meetings and reminders very easy.
reviews.cons: Chat gets a lot of lag when multiple people in the chat are speaking at once. It tends to freeze up, and lose audio and video quality. I also wish that it did picture in picture better, so I could see the whole party on my phone at once, rather than only the speaker.

reviews.title: “Great Service”
reviews.pros: This service is free, easy to use, and doesn't lose data randomly like other chat services.
reviews.cons: The notifications from G Chat that appear at the bottom of my screen are easy to accidentally click on, bringing me off the track of my work.

reviews.title: “Great for non-Outlook users”
reviews.text: It's great for less established organizations with money constraints
reviews.pros: It is a completely free service, so there's no budget to worry about
reviews.cons: The interface is clunky, and it's hard to track chat history

reviews.title: “Helps connect people!”

Chat is a good software which can be used for chatting with friends or colleagues or relatives. Its a good medium to stay connected to other persons. 

It has easy installation. The tranfer & sharing of files and folders is also easy.
reviews.cons: It hangs a bit when the network signal a low but that is understandable.

reviews.title: “Google chat okay”

This chat functionality is also helpful when using Google Hangouts (for example, it lets you share text links while video chatting).
reviews.cons: We don't really use Google Chat unless directly using another Google tool first (like Google Hangouts). Chat doesn't work quite as well as our team's main way to instantly communicate.
