reviews.pros: Instant messages can be communicated both in groups and individually at same time.
reviews.cons: No cons till date, multiple chatting is a umique feature.

reviews.title: “Used this as video conference solution and chat application”
reviews.pros: This is some pretty high-quality software for cheap.  Google knows how to create a good chat app and the video conferencing features are great.  Everything is simple to understand and easy to use. It does a great job at what it's made to do, which is being an easy to use chat application.
reviews.cons: It can be a bit sluggish at times, but really for the money, it's not bad at all. I wouldn't use it to send files, and searching for previous conversations isn't as easy as other apps I've used.

reviews.title: “Does the Job”
reviews.text: Chat is okay. It really only reaches it's full potential when everyone in your organization uses google and g-suite apps for everything.
reviews.pros: This software (obviously) integrates perfectly with the g-suite applications (drive, slides, sheets, etc). It can be useful for talking to team members about projects, scheduling meetings, and sending documents.
reviews.cons: Since it is in the G-suite, it doesn't really integrate well with anything else. In other words, if you don't use google for everything, you will just find it to be an ill-equipped messaging application.

reviews.title: “Excellent tool, Easy and advance tool to use”
reviews.text: Overall experience with Google Chat is excellent as it is easy to use as compare to other messaging app.
reviews.pros: Google Chat comes with excellent user friendly interface. it is easy to use. we can use this while checking mails on Gmail.
reviews.cons: Little difficult to create Groups and chat within it. sometime it pop up duplicate chat. Notification keep coming every time.

reviews.title: “Able to Chat Fast”
reviews.pros: Google Chat expands on Google’s other features and allows for the use of fast chatting with groups of people. This is a better option than emailing and allows for faster response times.
reviews.cons: Still seems like it could add additional features to make more users wanting to switch to a Google Chat.

reviews.title: “Communication Perfection”
reviews.pros: Chat is a more professional and great alternative to texting. Conversations are archival and make attaching documents from my computer easy.
reviews.cons: With Hangouts leaving soon, I worry Chat will turn into something else.

reviews.title: “Great Product”
reviews.pros: Use this everyday to keep in touch with family and friends.  Allow one to talk to people on their phones via computer.  Easier to chat and worldwide.  Use everyday
reviews.cons: Took off remote desktop option which was great .

reviews.title: “Easy to use and Free!”
reviews.pros: You will get a good chat program with this software and it's free.  Many people have Google accounts these days so you can chat with anyone who has one.  It's easy and intuitive to use and can be used within most other Google programs (like G-Mail, Sheets, etc.).
reviews.cons: It's not the most functional chat program out there; you can't send files over the chat, for example.

reviews.title: “Google Chat has a long way to go to be a competitor of any chat applications”
reviews.pros: It's connected to your email, google hangouts, and more so it's very connected.
reviews.cons: It's such a simple chat with little to no "cool" features. When I say "cool," I mean that there isn't a "wow" factor (besides basic integrations) that would make you want to leverage Google Chat as your primary source of communication for a team.

reviews.title: “Great for internal communication”
reviews.text: It's very similar to Google Hangouts, but it is missing some features. Overall I still enjoy using Google Chat for internal communication
reviews.pros: Google Chat makes it very easy to chat with your coworkers. You can also assign tasks, share files and respond to messages with an emoji instead of text.
reviews.cons: Google Chat does not support sharing GIF's within their text messaging. Also in group chats you can not see whether a person has read the message or not.

reviews.title: “Hangouts Chat is a suitable replacement for email”
reviews.text: We've been trying to replace email, yet keep chat still running all the time. We found
reviews.pros: It integrates with the G suite platform. So if your team already uses G suite for email, it works well. All integrations work with Drive etc. It was also nice to have both iOS and Android mobile apps. It's free with G suite.
reviews.cons: Lack of integrations and apps to go along with it. There are chat apps with loads of native integrations that seem to be a lot more scaleable. Although those apps cost a bit more too.

reviews.title: “Google Chat is good for simple chats”
reviews.text: Google Chat has been around a long time embedded inside Gmail.  It has not changed much during that time.  It works well for what it does, simple chatting.
reviews.pros: It’s simplicity - if you just want to chat back and forth with someone on a Google platform, it works very well.
reviews.cons: It is tied to a Google account.  You must be signed in with a Google account to use it.

reviews.title: “Easy to use”
reviews.pros: Google chat is super easy to use and intuitive.
reviews.cons: It's not always easy to follow the various threads in a group chat. Threading UI is pretty basic and hard to navigate.

reviews.title: “Google Hangouts”
reviews.text: I truely enjoy using Google Hangouts, and makes it easy to interact with team members and clients.
reviews.pros:
Google Hangouts is very user friendly.. It always me to stay in touch with team menbers & clients.
instant messaging and video make connecting a breeze.
reviews.cons:
I have not had any issues usig Google Hangouts. My team uses it daily as well as our clients.
Its a excellent tool for connecting.

reviews.title: “Don't Buy G Suite For Chat”
reviews.text: Just don't buy G Suite to use Chat. You'll hardly ever use it anyways.
reviews.pros: Instant messaging inside of your work email (mostly internal) is really the only pro for Google Chat.
reviews.cons: So far behind slack or other instant work messaging platforms and is really only useful for inside your organization whereas most of my clients do not use G Suite.

reviews.title: “Fine”
reviews.pros: Seems easy to use, but I have had limited use with it.
reviews.cons: Seems like it's not as good as FaceTime or Skype or FB Messager.  I don't think of Google when needing a chat.

reviews.title: “Great for inter-office communication”
reviews.pros: It's great for employees from several different locations to communicate quickly and efficiently without wasting time on calling.
reviews.cons: The chat is great, but the calls are not the best and clearest quality.

reviews.title: “Google Hangouts = Dumpster Fire”
reviews.text: It was not the best.  We ended up moving to GoToMeeting
reviews.pros: The software was easy to access as it sits inside your email.  We use google for our company email so it was easy to set up a meeting
reviews.cons: The software was slow, buggy and not user friendly.  We tried to use it in our building and it would drop team members from calls all the time

reviews.title: “GChat”
reviews.pros: The way of using it, I can communicate may friends family through this software.
reviews.cons: Nothing to be unlike , cause it will help me to chat , message and make voice call

reviews.title: “Easy to use to communicate ”
reviews.text: Its easy to communicate with people in the office quickly and efficiently.
reviews.pros: Easy to shoot off  a quick message to coworkers that will pop right up on their screen instead of having to have them filter through emails.
reviews.cons: I do not have anything bad to say about this software. I have not used it that long but it seems to work fine for us.

reviews.title: “Google Chat great for inner office communication”
reviews.pros: It is a great inner office communication tool.  We do not waste time going from office to office or on phone calls that take too long.
reviews.cons: I do not have any concerns.  This product meets our expectations.

reviews.title: “Where did Hangouts go?”
reviews.text: Two thumbs up for our free phone service back 15 years ago lol 😆
reviews.pros: This was the thing back when the internet wasn’t as big as it is now!
reviews.cons: I can’t say I have any problems or negativity about Hangouts except for so long…

reviews.title: “Easy intergration for gSuite”
reviews.text: Overall Chat has been a good addition to our gSuite set up
reviews.pros: It was easy to intergrate into our already set up gSuite environment. The chat is available across all of gSuite
reviews.cons: There was some connectivity issues. If someone was not on a google page for a few minutes they would go idle or offline.

reviews.title: “Gchat for quick office communication”
reviews.text: It's great and I will continue to use with coworkers and friends.
reviews.pros: My coworkers and I use Gchat to send quick messages. Although we use a different software for all our collaborative projects, Chat is great for quick notes to specific individuals.
reviews.cons: Sometimes the call feature does not work as well (or as quickly) as it does through hangouts. The lag time is a bit longer.

reviews.title: “Chat is Solid ”
reviews.pros: Like other G Suite products chat is solid, and great working tool. You can rely on it, and if you are a Google shop, it integrates will with other systems.
reviews.cons: There are so many different enterprise chat software options available. The switching costs for teams can be difficult.

reviews.title: “accessible anywhere”
reviews.text: chatting with friends and family
reviews.pros: Can be used anywhere and easy to communicate with anyone and everyone.
reviews.cons: It can improve its emoji offerings and other interactive features.

reviews.title: “Easy Communication”
reviews.pros: Allows for easy communication between folks when someone could be remote. Quick and fast responses that feel like it’s real time. Nice instant chat option for quick simple questions.
reviews.cons: Can cause distractions for people who need to be focusing on work instead of chit chatting.

reviews.title: “Perfect for quick texting through the computer”
reviews.text: I have used it for a number of years for different work-related conversations and it has been helpful.
reviews.pros: It makes it easy to instant message other people that have google email addresses. Great for busy work environments and those were a phone is not always usable or possible.
reviews.cons: I don't have any complaints other than sometimes I wouldn't know if someone messaged me, but I would be conditioned to look every so often.

reviews.title: “Google Chat another way to stay connected, on any device”
reviews.text: Google chat has been a great find.  It is just another way for me to connect with people.  It doesn't care whether you have iPhone ios 12 or 13 +, or Samsung, or Windows 8 or 10 and being on different devices.  Since it is created by Google, it is always improving.  Next to my regular texting , Google chat is my preference
reviews.pros: I love that Google chat can be used anywhere on any device.  It doesn't need a certain operating system and it doesn't have to be downloaded.   Just logging on to Google gets you into Google chat.  It is exactly like any other chat/messaging system.
reviews.cons: I haven't found anything that I don't like.

reviews.title: “Google Encroaches on Slack”
reviews.pros: I really like the chat "rooms" or chat groups. Implementing this for our teams allows everyone to communicate to the right people always.
reviews.cons: I think there is a lot of room to grow for Google Chat. More integrations, and the "bots" are pretty useless at the moment. It's easier just to launch the software, like Zendesk, than it is to talk to the "bot".

reviews.title: “Cuts out the noise”
reviews.pros: I like that it's built into the email browser so you can collaborate with people without having to open another tab.
reviews.cons: Would be nice to see an easier way to share files with people over Google chat.

reviews.title: “A New Way to Communicate”
reviews.text: Overall I have enjoyed using Chat and watching them listen and improve.
reviews.pros: Chat by Google is a simple, great new way to communicate within one place with coworkers and friends and family alike. They listen to suggestions and work to improve.
reviews.cons: I did not like that Chat would come through more like an email than a messager service. This is something they've been changing.

reviews.title: “Basic but Simple and Useful”
reviews.pros: The platform is pretty straightforward and simple to use
reviews.cons: Not a lot of functionality. Pretty much limited to messages

reviews.title: “It’s been very easy to use”
reviews.pros: I love how the chat option is easy to use. It saves all our old chat history for me to look at where we left off and pick up again. It’s tied with your email. The emojis are unique. The app is easy to use as well. I actually wished more of my friends are on gchat.
reviews.cons: N/a cause I tend to use the most basic stuff for chat to make the most of my use.

reviews.title: “One of the best app for real time chat”
reviews.pros: It has been my go-to app for real-time chat since a decade
reviews.cons: There is nothing that I did not like about this software

reviews.title: “Internet Chat”
reviews.text: Very easy to use
reviews.pros: I like chatting with a person opposed to using automated services.
reviews.cons: I like everything about chatting.  It is helpful when needing information.

reviews.title: “Best way to stay in touch”
reviews.pros: It's free to use and if you learn how to use it it's basically a phone plan
reviews.cons: can be very confusing at first, had to ask my husband for help a few times

reviews.title: “Review for Gsuite”
reviews.text: it has helped me do my text and other editing more faster
reviews.pros: the fact that all the google product for text editing is housed in one component and this makes it easy to interchange between them.
reviews.cons: that in one product there wasn't any icons for me to switch  back and forth to a new software and that made me felt me awful.

reviews.title: “G-Chat, Review”
reviews.text: Overall it's effective, looks nice and is very easy to access/use.
reviews.pros: I like that it's easy to access from your email and that the notification when you recieve a message isn't obnoxious.
reviews.cons: There's nothing that stands out but If I had to pick something I guess the aesthetics/look of G-suite could be more young/innovative.

reviews.title: “Great company wide communication tool”
reviews.pros: Included in G Suite Business/Enterprise.  Great IM tool with built in group messaging and video chat on demand.  Allows you to set up rooms/groups for easy collab.
reviews.cons: I'd call it in beta+, constantly pushing updates which is great to see but can interrupt current conversations/vid chats.  Would be nice to have an auto update off hours feature.

reviews.title: “G Suite Chat Review”
reviews.pros: This tool gets the job done, you are able to easily chat with your team and co-workers.
reviews.cons: It could have better interaction and features.  Right now, if you want to use gifs you have to go through the Giphy bot which means you never know what your gif is going to be.

reviews.title: “Great chat option”
reviews.pros: Really great for chat and file sharing. Great interface
reviews.cons: No real cons. Just an easy to use, basic chat option.

reviews.title: “Nice way to communicate using CHAT”
reviews.pros: Excellent and simple option for communication there is better a newer options but this works fine in my point of view
reviews.cons: I miss some options i find in hangout so maybe they could add some of the features of hangout or just leave this aside and just use google hangout

reviews.title: “An alternative in the age of Zoom”
reviews.text: I occasionally use Hangouts if I need to quickly chat with a colleague.  While it isn't in my daily rotation of software, I appreciate having it as an option.
reviews.pros: I like that I can launch it from both Gmail and the Hangouts app itself.  It's fairly easy to use, and being backed by Google carries some weight as well.  It's also quite a bit quicker to launch a Hangouts call than it is to get your Zoom link over to someone.
reviews.cons: While it works, it isn't quite as fully fleshed out as something like Zoom which I feel is the superior online meeting software.  I'd put it on par with something like Slack's call feature

reviews.title: “Ability to communicate”
reviews.text: Wonderful product for dady to day communicating with partners.
reviews.pros: This product gives us the ability to communicate with partners and staff easily when needed for discussion making.
reviews.cons: Can run slow if you have alot of people using it as in any program. Can be dificult to get set up some times depending on user settings.

reviews.title: “Chat Review”
reviews.pros: Cross-platform compatibility, most importantly the ability for it to be used in the browser
reviews.cons: Nothing really. I have never had any issues using Chat

reviews.title: “Chatting”
reviews.pros: I enjoy using this software to chat with Family and Friends when they're not on Face Book
reviews.cons: There was nothing that I didn't like about using this software, it was easy to set up and use

reviews.title: “Great”
reviews.pros: It has much of the same functionality of iMessage and FaceTime.
reviews.cons: It can be a little glitchy sometimes. Also, the video quality is not the best.

reviews.title: “Chat world”
reviews.text: Pretty good I do like it and have had nothing bad to report.
reviews.pros: The ease of use is great! I have no issues with this software program. I use it often as it is so very user friendly. I wish everyone used it so we can all be utilizing the same thing.
reviews.cons: Nothing really I have not had any trouble with it and am happy using it. I have kept it for many years.

reviews.title: “GChat is the best chat software”
reviews.text: My experience has been great. I had never useed it previously and just jumped right in
reviews.pros: Everything. My team communicates through it all day. We post sales, comments, keeps everyone motivated and it's beyond simple to use.
reviews.cons: There's really nothing that I dislike about gchat. It's great. We have alot fun during the day

reviews.title: “Handy when at phones are not allowable at worm.”
reviews.pros: Its availability when using laptop at work. We used it when my husband was working and phones are not allowed during working hours.
reviews.cons: It's graphic design is too simple and plain.

reviews.title: “Google Chat ”
reviews.text: Great!!  Ease of use and convenience is awesome!
reviews.pros: I love the Chat feature - I am able to communicate with Teammates promptly and efficiently while in and out of office.  Having the ability to have the app on my phone is a huge plus!
reviews.cons: Honestly, I have not found a negative about the software as of yet.

reviews.title: “Google chat”
reviews.text: I am able to connect with anyone at the Company directly and quickly. The green dot lets me Know who is online.
reviews.pros: Very easy to use, great for an office setting. Enables the user to share in quick informal conversation in lieu of a formal email.
reviews.cons: No cons at the moment, good product.  Can send chats and pics with ease

reviews.title: “It now feels more appropriate for businesses”
reviews.pros: Transitioning from Hangouts, the overall UI is now much cleaner and professional than previous IM/video options.
reviews.cons: Duplicate notifications are still an issue in a mobile option but they do give an option to stop this now, but online, it works flawlessly. Easy to set up group calls without putting an invite in your calendar too.

reviews.title: “Quick Chat”
reviews.pros: I like that you can text and do video chat. You can see when the person is typing.
reviews.cons: I wish you could access old conversations easier.

reviews.title: “Casual Communication”
reviews.text: Overall experience has been good. I like how simple it is to use.
reviews.pros: Chat is good for casual communication, I think. Clean and simple design. A nice alternative to Slack.
reviews.cons: It's for G-suite customers only I think, so it sounds like you have to pay for it. But maybe businesses would find the tool worth it.

reviews.title: “Professional Chat”
reviews.text: It is easy to use, it is professional and it keeps work communication registered within my work email. I strongly recommend it.
reviews.pros: I like using Google Chat because it accessible from gmail and it does not require opening a new window in my browser. It also allows me to connect with the people  who work in my company and save me time.
reviews.cons: I cannot think of anything I do not like about Google Chat.

reviews.title: “Built-in chat functionality”
reviews.pros: I love that this tool is built into your Google account. You can access all your contacts in the same account as your email, and it's easy to use on desktop and mobile, as well as with other Google platforms.
reviews.cons: The chat functionality is fairly basic, and it isn't as robust as other chat platforms with more integrated features.

reviews.title: “A great way to communicate with partners”
reviews.text: My classmates and I are using g suite chat for projects in class
reviews.pros:
Ability to upload stuff from your google drive from the go
There are video chat meetings (as long as everyone has a webcam!)
Notifications when there are comments on the drive
The Meet bot finds the best time from everyone's schedule in order to do a meet
reviews.cons: The only thing I did not like about the program was it wasn't free, there's only a 14 day trial but that's it, otherwise the features are much better than what you're paying for

reviews.title: “Chat”
reviews.pros: This is a great app to use to talk with my coworkers, either to show them a picture of what I am working on or ask a question.  Then I don't have to get up and walk across the parking lot to ask a question. Saves time and is way more efficient.
reviews.cons: Sometimes when I am trying to send a picture with a large attachment over a slow connection, the connection can time out, leaving the message unsent in my outbox. My workplace does have issues with wifi so this could be the issue.

reviews.title: “Google Chat Review”
reviews.pros: We use GChat daily at our company and it is a great tool to easily communicate with coworkers without having to send a formal email. Would highly recommend
reviews.cons: Sometime it is often difficult to understand who you are talking to in a large group setting. I wish that GChat specified better

reviews.title: “Effective for Team Communication”
reviews.text: At the time of its initial use, the intention was to be able to communicate under the radar, without alerting the boss. So yes, it did just that
reviews.pros: Google hangouts was effective when we had to communicate with different team members in different locations and even within the same room without distractions. All that was required was a Gmail account. You can easily attach documents and send
reviews.cons: So far, Google Hangouts is as advertised. It's quick chat feature is a great feature for discussing with a particular team mate or with the entire team at once.

reviews.title: “Keeps me connected to the team”
reviews.pros: I like that with just 1 click I can talk to anyone on my team.
reviews.cons: It only works for people with gmail and not everyone is on gmail.

reviews.title: “GChat PC interface”
reviews.pros: This software is incredibly quick, easy, correct, and simple.  It does the job and still does not get in the way, or become distracting.
reviews.cons: I wish there were a way to "hide" a conversation from desktop email view other than archive/delete.  When I have many conversations there are some that I would prefer to be at the top.

reviews.title: “It's fine”
reviews.text: We need a way for our technicians to connect with our office, and this can accomplish that, but not necessarily any better than just a group text or email. And, people are more likely to just check their texts than their Google chat
reviews.pros: It's free, it's easy to navigate, and we can add everybody on our team onto one chat
reviews.cons: It doesn't serve us any better than simply a text or email

reviews.title: “Great for instant communication within team”
reviews.pros: Google Chat is very easy to use. Sending emails can be time consuming, but thankfully I have GC to instantly communicate with my colleagues (even faster than texting)
reviews.cons: I don't know if it's just me, but I don't use Google Chat very often. I think it just needs a little more promotion.  Then more people will be using it.

reviews.title: “Easy and quick”
reviews.text: I enjoy google chat, its quick and simple to use.
reviews.pros: I enjoy the ability to send a quick message to a team member without having to write out an email.
reviews.cons: IF the other person does not use, the message will not go though.

reviews.title: “Easy, Quick, and Constant Contact”
reviews.text: Overall, Chat is a great and unobtrusive addition to gmail, allowing for easy and constant contact with colleagues and friends.
reviews.pros: G chat is the perfect venue to contact and keep in touch with colleagues (and friends) who spend a large amount of time on their computer. Its ease of access on the gmail page is unobtrusive and convenient.
reviews.cons: Though it is largely great, and there are few real complaints to be had with it, there are some issues with connectivity that will lead to delayed or missed messages.

reviews.title: “Best hangout with colleagues, family and friends - messages and calls just a click away”
reviews.pros:
- The clarity of video calls is awesome
- Audio is clear without noise breaks
- Can text friends and colleagues at workplace any time
- Sharing of files is easy and smooth
- Can create group and hangout with buddies and family
- Quick and easy to apply for gmail users as it is inbuilt
reviews.cons:
- The caller should be in the contact list
- High speed internet connection for good quality group video calls

reviews.title: “Convenience is key!”
reviews.pros: I don't have to call, text, or email other employees. Respond quickly and efficiently with Google chat.
reviews.cons: They are CONSTANTLY updating the app. Which isn't a bad thing, per se. But when it has to update almost every day, it's a bit frustrating.

reviews.title: “I love google chat! ”
reviews.text: Love it.
reviews.pros: We use google chat for internal communication at my company, and I love it! So functional and easy to use.
reviews.cons: I feel like I've to update my software a bit more often than I'd like to. But I realize every upgrade brings new fun features too, so it's worth it in the long run.

reviews.title: “Chat”
reviews.text: group or individual chats for co workers and teams.
reviews.pros: This makes chatting with co-workers very easy. You can chat with them individually or as a group, which is nice.
reviews.cons: I am not sure I have ever been able to find a way to remove a user from a group chat. which could be a user error, i suppose.

reviews.title: “Google Chat Review”
reviews.pros: Being able to use it within Gmail for quick and efficient team communication.
reviews.cons: Google has confused people by adjusting different applications similar to this one.

reviews.title: “So helpful!”
reviews.pros: It's so nice to be able to quickly chat someone from your Gmail when you already have Google Suite pulled it. Great to keep all your communication streamline.
reviews.cons: Wish it had more features, like more similar to iMessage, where you can add animation, search music, gif/memes, etc.

reviews.title: “An O.K. Software”
reviews.pros: This software is okay. It does what is is designed to do, although there are a few faults.
reviews.cons: Image sharing is not the best. You can only share one at a time, which gets frustrating when you are trying to send 20+ pictures. The notifications do not work despite me triple checking that my notifications are turned on.

reviews.title: “Communicate with Other Google Users in a Snap”
reviews.pros: A highly practical and functional tool for messaging and talking to other google users. Accessible through e-mail, Hangouts, desktop, android and other applicable platforms.  Talk in real time without interrupting your browsing, workflow or other tasks.
reviews.cons: It can be difficult to remove users from contact list that you no longer need to communicate with.

reviews.title: “Google chat works awesome”
reviews.text: Great tool for free  -  easy to use, fast with a gmail account
reviews.pros: I think this chat tool is super easy to use, and surprised me that it had as many features as are included.
reviews.cons: I don't have any complaints, but I do have some privacy concerns about Google terms and conditions, but c'est la vie.

reviews.title: “Google Chat Review”
reviews.pros:
-Extremely easy to use with people who also use the program
-No learning curve whatsoever
-Do not have to pay anything to use it
reviews.cons: -Other people need to use the program to chat with you, but it was not tough to convince anyone to use it

reviews.title: “A good chat room ”
reviews.text: Communicating with collaborators, making video and audio calls. Image transfer.
reviews.pros: It facilitates communication with other people, possibility of multi-person chat.
reviews.cons: Poor audio and video connection, too small avatars

reviews.title: “A basic option”
reviews.text: Chat is fine, but it wouldn't be my first choice. I would prefer Slack.
reviews.pros: My new employer uses Chat, so I've had to start using this. It is a pretty basic chat platform from what I can tell. I have used it for individual conversations and group chats, and it is fairly easy to use.
reviews.cons: I used Slack at my old company and I miss it. Maybe it's just what I am used to, but Google Chat feels clunky.

reviews.title: “Review for Google Chat”
reviews.pros: Easy to use. Great to use for communication with community members.
reviews.cons: Improvements on video group would be most useful

reviews.title: “Primitive free chat well integrated with your Google Account”
reviews.pros: It's easy to use and setup since all you need to do is have a Google Account. I love having my chats accessible on the same screen as my email.
reviews.cons: Sharing options are really limited and for my Developers sharing code or screenshots and other attachments is REALLY annoying and we still email each other for that.

reviews.title: “Great Chat Sofware”
reviews.pros: Chat is a very straight forward and simple chatting solution which brings in the function you needs but doesn't overwhelm.
reviews.cons: There are a few functions that would be nice to see added for improved integration but it's still very solid.

reviews.title: “Easiest communication program I have ever used.”
reviews.pros: Excellent platform for communication, great communication quality. Also the Integration with gmail is great.
reviews.cons: I experienced an error after the update in my device.  Other than that I dot see a thing that I do not like about this app.

reviews.title: “Gchat”
reviews.text: gchat is a simple way to communicate, but lacks features

reviews.title: “A must have for any small business!!!”

reviews.cons: There is nothing that I dislike about google messaging. It makes communicating with clients very easy and fast.

reviews.cons: There isn't anything new when it comes to features. It doesn't have a desktop version so you can't easily chat when you are working on your desktop. If I'm in hangouts already then I'll use it otherwise it's not really important to me.

reviews.title: “Google Hangouts Helps People Stay Connected”
reviews.text: My overall experience is good. Not problems with it so far, the app works well with my cell phone and hasn't glitched or anything concerning. I feel like I can rely on Google Hangouts for this reason.
reviews.pros: I like that it is really easy to use and it seems like most people use it, which is great. I personally use it for grad school and connecting with my Dad.
reviews.cons: I have not yet had any issues with Google Hangouts. I like everything so far, and since it is Google I feel like it is familiar and safe.

reviews.title: “Great if you're a G Suite or Google products user”
reviews.text: This is a simple way for the team to stay connected, especially when collaborating on other Google products.  No reason to switch to another Chat service.
reviews.pros: Chat for G Suite is just a really simple and friendly way to communicate with everyone on your team.  If you are regular G Suite and Google products user then this is a seamless integration into team communication. Pulling it up and using it is a breeze and uncomplicated.
reviews.cons: Connection issues can be a problem sometimes, but lately it's gotten even better and the software seems to operate well regardless of how fast a users connectivity is during a meeting.  Works great generally.

reviews.title: “A great communication platform”
reviews.text: Overall, Google Chat is efficient and a great communication platform. It has many features allowing you to customize your conversation. It's easy to use and collaborate on and allows business communications to flow unrestrained.
reviews.pros: G Suite's Chat gives you the ease of quick efficient communication. It allows you to reach out to contacts in a way that isn't restricted like emails but encourages collaboration. You can easily share ideas and information.
reviews.cons: Of all the Google resources, it is not the most common or well known one. But once used, it's hard to see why not given the ease and security of communications.

reviews.title: “Fair communication app”

reviews.cons: Video calls are sometimes troublesome, one of the more major drawbacks. There can be improvements

reviews.title: “Excellent communication software”
reviews.pros: User friendly, easy to use, communication techniques are excellent
reviews.cons: Nothing negative to say about software, works great for what I need

reviews.title: “Google Chat Review”
reviews.pros: What I like most is that I can easily contact buyers and also my coworkers through chat.
reviews.cons: I don't necessarily dislike this software but I feel like they should improve a few bugs such as saying there is no internet connection when I have excellent wifi

reviews.title: “Easy to connect with colleagues!”
reviews.text: I have been able to easily reach out to colleagues and friends with google chat! Overall so great!
reviews.pros: What I like most about this software is that I can easily chat my colleagues and friends! It is so simple to use.
reviews.cons: I don't think there is anything that I don't like about this software. I've been using it for years!

reviews.title: “Great Way to Quickly Communicate!”
reviews.text: Overall I enjoyed my experience with Chat. It is a quick and simple tool to communicate with group members. It is a close second to having an in-person conversation. Highly recommend!
reviews.pros: Allowed for quick back and forth while working on a shared document with more than one person.
reviews.cons: Had occasional technical glitches, where people were forced to leave temporarily or it gave the appearance that people were still in the chat even though they had left.

reviews.title: “Inexpensive tool to have handy”
reviews.text: I've had a generally good experience using Google Chat.
reviews.pros: The main advantage of Google Chat is that it's a feature of the Google ecosystem. Most people use Gmail in one way or another, and the ease of connecting with your clients via Google Chat is a real plus. It's a free tool to use, and the fact that it mimics the chat interface of major messaging software makes it cool, with the added advantage of as a "formal" chatting tool.
reviews.cons: I can't think of "cons" per se. All I can say is that Google Chat has its limitations and is by no means a substitute for other major chatting tools like Messenger, Whatsapp among others. It has a formal vibe to it.

reviews.title: “A fair basic chat application”
reviews.text: If you are just looking to send a message, chats works but you can also find that feature on other messaging applications.
reviews.pros: Google Chat is good at sending messages if that is all you are looking for an application to do for you.
reviews.cons: Out side of sending a message, chat is stripped down of all other features like searching your chats and organization of chats.

reviews.title: “Chat is easy for chating”
reviews.pros:
- It is easy to use
- No need of creating a new account if you already have a google account
- Capable of creating a group chat called "room"
reviews.cons:
- You can't attach a file like other chatting apps
- Doesn't tell you if somebody read your message or not

reviews.title: “I love this product”
reviews.text: What I love the most about Chat is that it makes it simple to track progress and follow up tasks.
reviews.pros: Chat helped me and my coworkers a lot to get our work done in one place, easily and efficiently.
reviews.cons: There is not much I did not like it. Chat made it super easy to communicate and get my work done while at home.

reviews.title: “Super easy and effective!”
reviews.text: I am able to join meetings on the go with the same clarity and features as on my laptop.
reviews.pros: I use the Chat app on my iPhone on a regular basis.  The calls are clear,  video is crisp, and the overall quality is better than other apps I have used.  Inviting other is as easy as sending the link as a text message.
reviews.cons: The one drawback is not being able to invite others via email or username from a list and dial them into the call.  Now they are invited via link and they must click the URL to join.

reviews.title: “Easy team communication! ”
reviews.pros: Since our team uses the Google platform for nearly everything, Google Chat is easily integrated and boosts our team communication! I like how easy it is to message fellow team members and keep communications organized!
reviews.cons: There's nothing in particular that I dislike about Google Chat!

reviews.title: “It's Google so it's just there and works”

reviews.cons: harder to make this work if you want to work with people not in the google eco-system. More work on their side that may result in it just not happening.

reviews.title: “Helpful Platform”

reviews.title: “Very Reliable”

reviews.pros: Being allowed to keep in contact with both personal and business partners.
reviews.cons: I have not had any bad experience with the software.

reviews.cons: Sometimes I find that chat screen is very, very small

reviews.title: “Excellent Software”

User friendly.

Great features and functionalities.
Syncs conversation across any device.
reviews.cons: Limited numbers of people that can be involve in a group video call.

reviews.title: “Good to send or recieve messages”

reviews.pros:
This product allows me to send or recieve instant messages to anyone. I can also send videos, photos and multimedia messages with the help of Chat app.
It is similar like instant messages in iphone message. If both are using Android phone then you dont need to send inbox messaging, just sent message on Chat by using of WiFi or cellular data.
reviews.cons:
Need to connect with internet or WiFi while using this app. 
And also both have Android phones while communication.

reviews.title: “Good as a Slack Back-up”
reviews.text: Chat works fine as our company back-up for when Slack has an outage. It's included in our G-Suite account, so it just makes sense to take advantage of. This tool is a work in progress but I can see the potential.
reviews.pros:
- It's integration with Google
- It's similar look to Slack
- It's general ease of use
reviews.cons:
- Lacks the channel features that Slack provides
- The notification method can be a hit or miss. If the recipient of the instant message isn't viewing the chat window, the sender has to wait for them to view the message in an email which is basically the same speed as sending a regular email

reviews.title: “Does anyone still use this?”

reviews.pros: You are able to talk to people without having their phone numbers. It is useful for those who doesn’t have a cellphone.
reviews.cons: It has become obsolete. Almost nobody uses this and honestly there are several better option than Google Hangouts m.

reviews.pros: What I like most about this product is that its super convenient. You can schedule meetings, create tasks, and get updates from your team within the chat . You can manage all of your work in just one feature. I mainly used it for my university class to communicate with my team members and it never failed us.
reviews.cons: There really wasn't anything bad about this feature. I got a lot of good feedback from this product .

reviews.title: “Good For Office / Enterprise Use”

reviews.cons: The user interface of the desktop apps can be improved. There are also some great group features in other chat apps (like Slack) that make it a compelling draw away from Chat.

reviews.title: “Almost all the features”
reviews.pros: It works more seamlessly between desktop and mobile than our last instant messaging platform (Jabber).
reviews.cons: I don't know if it's available but we haven't implemented it yet, but we're unable to use screen sharing which we had with Jabber.

reviews.title: “Leaves things to be desired”

reviews.title: “Google Hangout is Best for Business Interviews & Meetings”
reviews.text: I know about Google Hangout for 4-5 years but can not use it cause in my circle people are not using it. Almost 9 months ago I used it when I was searching a job.
reviews.pros: Some of its features are desirous i.e., "Conversations , Audio & Video Calls "like companies use it for contacting with candidates and they use it for interviews both audio and video. Its amazing software that google offers. Like Google's others products it is "free of cost and easy to use." Any one can use it without less effort. It offers "messaging app" for chatting with others or employees." Group video calls" is best function that it offers both for personal and business use. Maximum 25 callers join a business or education group. Its best for low businesses which can enjoy its benefits at low cost.
reviews.cons: Its best app I think but its not common, I think Google should adopt such a strategy that people use it like a whats app. It can become people's addiction. Google should improve its interface by adding more options and features.

reviews.pros: It's very beautiful and simple to communicate with others.

reviews.title: “Excellent application”
reviews.pros: I use Google Hangouts every day for work. It is free, except for international calls other than Canada.
reviews.cons: I wish that I could leave prerecorded voicemails to the people that I call because a lot of them do not answer.

reviews.title: “Really Nice Communication App”

I can use it directly from my Gmail software and on the designated app as well without a hitch. Notifications are reliable and it is a fast and easy way to reach out to clients, friends and family.

reviews.cons: It is a simple meeting tool so they can add more advance features. Themes should also be added to this application to make it a little more appealing for users.

reviews.title: “Goole Chat”
reviews.text: EXCELLENT! Like I said I just discovered it and I LOVE it! I honestly can't wait to use it more and see how else it can promote better communication between departments.
reviews.pros: I recently discovered this when another coworker sent me a chat message. I love this feature because it sits inside your Gmail but works like text messaging. It is great to use for easy simple questions and basic communication that is too simple to require an entire email. It has been very convenient for basic communication.
reviews.cons: I have not found a con yet. I think the more communication we have across the company will ultimately lead to future success, and Google chat is simple and very easy to use and will help facilitate more communication.

reviews.title: “Student using Chat for E-Learning”
reviews.text: Easy to communicate with others on school needs!
reviews.pros: It is very user friendly and easily accessible with a gmail. I like that it is free since I am a college student.
reviews.cons: Not everyone has gmail accounts so it's not a universal app.

reviews.title: “Google Chat”
reviews.pros: I am able to receive and send quick notes to and from students without clogging up my email inbox.
reviews.cons: I wish that students could more easily see when I have sent them a message.

reviews.title: “Google Chat is a simple way of communicating with email contacts”
reviews.text: Overall, an intuitive experience that beats some alternatives like Facebook Messenger.
reviews.pros: I wouldn't use Google Chat for lengthy conversations or conducting an actual meeting, but it is useful for quick status updates and small talk with email contacts.
reviews.cons: Search functionality is helpful but sometimes seems inconsistent.

reviews.title: “Google Chat”
reviews.pros: Google chat is easy to use on the computer. It’s very straightforward: you type and hit send. Very easy for basic communication.
reviews.cons: I haven’t had success with sending documents or photos with this. It’s also not my default choice for use on my phone.

reviews.title: “Google Chat”
reviews.pros: Google Chat is a great way to quickly communicate without needing to be on the phone. It is especially perfect for remote workers!
reviews.cons: I don't have anything I dislike about the software. It is free and easy to use!

reviews.title: “Communicate with people from within Google Mail”
reviews.text: It allows you to chat with colleagues and get instant responses
reviews.pros: This application allows you to communicate with people whom you are emailing in realtime.
reviews.cons: The application can be a bit finicky at times and doesn't always fully load things. It also lags sometimes.

reviews.title: “G Suit chat!”
reviews.pros: Easy to use, I can talk with my friend all the time.
reviews.cons: It does not have too much emojis to use.

reviews.title: “If you're switching from Hangouts you might be disappointed...”
reviews.text: Hangouts is being deprecated and Google is pushing organizations towards Chat. It has a similar interface. I do like that you can start threads in a group message. You can share files and pictures. Its a simple chat program. If you need anything more complex there are other apps out there.
reviews.pros: The chat interface is similar to Hangouts.
reviews.cons: In a group chat you can't see who has read a message. You can only do this with a DM to 1 person.

reviews.title: “Works great for my office”
reviews.pros: Many coworkers in my office tend to work with headphones on so this program is a .great way to comuunicate throughout the day with others!
reviews.cons: I wish you could search within the chats to find past conversations.

reviews.title: “Similar to other platforms - nothing special”
reviews.text: Overall not a bad product, but also nothing great.
reviews.pros: I like that it is linked to Google accounts, which makes it easy to integrate into my calendar, emails, etc.
reviews.cons: Kind of slow and nothing unique compared to other videoconferencing. I would not recommend it, but I also don't dislike using it.

reviews.title: “i actually loved this app”
reviews.text: i would for sure recommend it
reviews.pros: i love how you can search on the app and i also loved how easy it was to schedule something because i forget everything without a reminder
reviews.cons: i didnt care for the startup process where you cant do anything on the app unless your signed up for the google chat part first

reviews.title: “Easy to use, free chat service”
reviews.pros: Google Chat is straightforward and reliable, with options for read receipts and privacy.
reviews.cons: Inviting new users can be cumbersome. Google Chat is less mobile-optimized compared to Facebook Messenger and SMS.

reviews.title: “One of the best chat software programs on the market”
reviews.pros: The ease of use and price is unmatched with comparable software.
reviews.cons: None really. I have been pleased with all Google products.

reviews.title: “Review for Google Chat”
reviews.text: It can be the ultimate communication tool for an extensive Gmail and other Google apps user since all those are tightly linked.
reviews.pros: Simple and efficient communication tool. Since it's part of Google product suite, it is easy to collaborate with other tools and can access from range of devices. Can easily share files from google drive.  Chats and rooms are linked with Gmail contacts.
reviews.cons: Unlike most other communication tools, the UI look a bit simple and primitive and doesn't attract users in my opinion. However for some users simplicity might be the reason to like the very tool.

reviews.title: “GSuite Chat feature as a work communication tool”
reviews.text: Chat is not something I regularly use but it definitely comes in handy, especially when you need to send a quick note to a colleague who is also on GMail.
reviews.pros: My company uses Google Suite for Business so accessing and using Gsuite Chat to communicate with others in my office is really easy. We are always open to the work email and this tool allows us to send quick messages back and forth in regards to project updates. It's also very helpful when you are on a conference call but need to send a quick note.
reviews.cons: This is a great tool for quick communication but it doesn't have enough power as a tool to be useful for much more.

reviews.title: “Great app for group calling”
reviews.pros: I used this app a lot for group calling, works like a charm
reviews.cons: They lack new features which could have made it lose limelight

reviews.title: “Best Before  Discontinued”
reviews.pros: Before Google made the switch from Hangouts to Chat, it was an integral part of my workday.  It was so easy to file share during conferences, chat in real time, and just stay up to speed on developments with my team.
reviews.cons: Honestly, what I liked least was it being phased out. While the new Google Suite software is good, I miss Hangouts!

reviews.title: “Convenient and Free”
reviews.pros: Chat is convenient, free, and easy to use.  There is a mobile app to correspond to the desktop website which can be used anywhere.
reviews.cons: Sometimes the messages I receive from the mobile app are delayed.

reviews.title: “Works well”
reviews.text: Overall, I like using Chat aka Hangouts. It's simple way to instant message.
reviews.pros: I think this product is now called Google Hangouts. I like this product, it is easy to use and can message anyone using wifi. This is great to use if someone does not have a phone access.
reviews.cons: There is not anything that I do not like about this product. It's easy to use and can converse with others in text message fashion without having to use emails or an actual phone.

reviews.title: “Review on Google Hangouts”
reviews.text: My overall experience is pretty good I use it to chat with my friends sometimes and do video chat so its kind of cool that hangouts is keeping up with every other app.
reviews.pros: I liked how  they are keeping up with everything hangouts had video chat, voice chat option and as well as the emojis that everyone loves to use. The best thing about this is you can add people with their email address for me its a lot easier and fun.
reviews.cons: The thing that I would like in this chat is the type of emojis that snapchat has they have like a face emojis. So that is the only thing I would like in hangouts

reviews.title: “Google Chat Review”
reviews.pros: The ability to chat with multiple people while working through other google products
reviews.cons: It is a negative that it can be difficult to search through old chats.

reviews.title: “Free software for making video conference calls”
reviews.text: Its a great free software for both audio and video conferencing.
reviews.pros: Its a free software with the option of making both audio and video conference calls. It allows screen sharing too. It enables both images and gifs sharing during chatting. Its very easy and straightforward to use.
reviews.cons: It allows conferencing with a maximum of 100 people at a time. It needs stable high speed internet with large bandwidth.

reviews.title: “Time Saver!”
reviews.text: It's helping me stay organized and not become overwhelmed with an extreme amount of e-mails. This is so good for my head space!
reviews.pros: I love the fact that this is nestled in my gmail page! Once a colleague told me about this feature, it has helped me quickly communicate and collaborate with my colleagues; without clogging up my e-mail inbox!
reviews.cons: I at times wish the 'mute notification' setting had a time expiration on it. Sometimes I turn it on, and don't hear any messages, and then forget I had it turned off. Maybe a silent, pop up notification would solve this problem?

reviews.title: “Google Hangouts - Not Necessary ”
reviews.text: It can be nice to message others on their computers in the office but I find it much simpler to send than an email or a text instead of using Google Hangouts.
reviews.pros: I enjoy that Google Hangouts allows for messages with other people on different platforms no matter what device they may be on.
reviews.cons: I am not a huge fan of this software because with developing technology of other messaging platforms, Google Hangouts just lacks in its ease of use and I do not really see a need for the software.

reviews.title: “Chat works like a google product”
reviews.text: Group discussions are made simple and user friendly with this software
reviews.pros: Very clean interface and clear google connections make it a priority to use for me
reviews.cons: I haven’t found anything that I can complain about yet

reviews.title: “Un servicio de chat como cualquier otro en general”
reviews.pros:
La sencillez del programa, si ya tienes acceso a una cuenta google ya tienes todo para empezar en este servicio de chat, es fácil y te entrega lo que generalmente entregan todos los programas de conversación. es una buena alternativa cuando no están disponible los programas de comunicación 
de facebook.
reviews.cons: Los pocos usuarios y la poca masificación, hay una gran competencia en la categoría  de redes sociales y este servicio queda como la últimas opciones, es sencillo cumple su función solamente.

reviews.title: “Use it for work everyday ”
reviews.text: Helps with communication and flexibility
reviews.pros:
Easy to chat with anyone 
Keeps the history of all calls and texts 
Fast and functional
reviews.cons: It freezes sometimes and you have to reopen and refresh the system

reviews.title: “Fast and easy way to chat with colleagues”
reviews.pros: The big plus for Chat is that almost everyone I deal with is using Gsuite and can jump in and chat with a moment's notice.
reviews.cons: I'd prefer to have a bit more control over the window size, it feels awkward, but it's not a big deal

reviews.title: “I love using chat!”
reviews.text: Overall, a great feature to use at work!
reviews.pros: Chat allows me to write quick, concise messages and communicate my point clearly and effectively. I enjoy using it with colleagues and also appreciate that it connects nicely into my gmail and other google features.
reviews.cons: The only con I can think of is that the chat autocorrects certain combinations into emojis, and I am not sure how to avoid this.

reviews.title: “Love- nothing not to like about this! ”
reviews.pros: I love having the ability to quickly chat with my browser. It makes life easier than going between windows- or going back and forth to phone while attempting to work.
reviews.cons: I don't see any downsides. They've changed it so you can hide or be invisible as needed and so that you have to essentially request to chat with someone- it doesn't just automatically make you active and live chat with all your contacts on google.

reviews.title: “Chat Review”
reviews.pros: Google Chat is an amazing product. It is easy to follow and coincides with all of the other Google products that are out there. I love it!
reviews.cons: This product can sometimes have a lot of different niches that are difficult to follow, but is overall an amazing product.

reviews.title: “Google Chat”
reviews.text: My overall experience with google chat is good. Some of my friends and colleagues use it and that is how I was introduced.
reviews.pros: Google chat is a nice chat platform for professional and personal chat. It’s easy to use and simple to sign up if you’re new to google products.
reviews.cons: I wish you could link more accounts together. The mobile platform is also decent but not favorite.

reviews.title: “Good ”
reviews.pros: It’s easy to communicate through the chat.

reviews.title: “Best Software for Internal Communication with Team”

reviews.pros:
Google Hangout is very good software if you are using Google Business email.
Hangout allows me and my team to share files, communicate easily. It's also integrated with Google Meet that helps me to share my screen with my employee.
The best part of hangout is I can see my send message in the sent box of business email.
reviews.cons: There is nothing in google Hangout that is liked least, everything is good enough for my use.  Also, it gives a popup sound while receiving a message.

reviews.title: “I liked their old version better”
reviews.pros: I like that I have the ability to see the status of people on chat when I log into my google email.  The notifications are great to pop up and there's a lot of customizations.
reviews.cons: I don't like how bulky the new look is and I can't see my contacts anymore. It only shows my recent conversations. It's not easy to see how to change the layout.

reviews.title: “Messaging and groups chat”
reviews.pros: Easy to use very friendly, is free as it is integrated with your Gmail account, I used to use this app when we have conference with another coworkers from another country is a powerful tool and allow you to share almost  anything you want, the response in conference and chat are really fast I love it.
reviews.cons: The only thing I can say is that not a lot of people use this app and is difficult to find somebody willing to use it I don't know why as it is free.

reviews.title: “Chat With Everyone!”
reviews.pros: I use Google Chat to talk to personal and business connections. It is so easy to chat with anyone with a gmail account (a.k.a., everyone).
reviews.cons: Nothing I can think of that I don't like.

reviews.title: “Convenient platform for video and text chatting”
reviews.text: Overall a great platform for messaging and the best I've found for video chatting.
reviews.pros: Really like Google Chat because its implemented with the rest of my google suite. The program makes it easy to chat with people while checking/writing emails. Video chat is high resolution and doesn't lag like it can in other programs.
reviews.cons: Only con is that not everyone is on google chat - would be nice if it integrated with other chat/email platforms.

reviews.title: “Google Chat is Obsolete”

reviews.pros: Google Chat is just like messages but for your email.  So it's cool, but sort of unnecessary in my opinion.
reviews.cons: Google Chats is kind of stupid because everybody has text messaging and Slack and stuff so why even use it?

reviews.title: “Google Chat Review”
reviews.pros: The entire software is helpful and very easy to communicate with coworkers, share files, etc.
reviews.cons: There was a lag at times. Perhaps the chat feature could be incorporated into Gmail.

reviews.title: “Love Hangouts Chat!”
reviews.text: We use this to communicate internally. Our company primarily consists of remote employees.  Before Chat it was time-consuming to make sure that everyone was viewing the correct thing during our frequent conference calls
reviews.pros: It comes free with G Suite. It's a central location to share Google Slides, Sheets and other shared docs during calls within your organization. It helps our small businesses operate as a large enterprise.
reviews.cons: I can't think of any issues. Just happy that it's solved the problems that we had initially. You can't go wrong.

reviews.title: “Hangouts to Chats, Okay!”
reviews.pros: It's pretty straightforward. It's simple to use, it allows our team to communicate with ease.
reviews.cons: I miss being able to "archive" or delete a group. You can leave a group, yes, but if you want to remove it completely, it's not an option.

reviews.title: “Google Chat is easy and free to use”
reviews.pros: I love that google chat is so easy to use since I'm checking my e-mail all day anyway and it's right in my e-mail. And it's free.
reviews.cons: I wish it was more user friendly on a phone.

reviews.title: “Easy chat box”
reviews.pros: I liked we can chat and also do video hangout
reviews.cons: I don't think I have any issues to complain about it

reviews.title: “Chat Review ”

reviews.pros: It’s easy to communicate with families and students without giving personal identification

reviews.title: “Good software but not amazing”

reviews.title: “Great Service”

reviews.title: “For every big, however big or small!”
reviews.text: My overall experience is not bad. I used it to communicate with my colleagues and acquaintances, and not to forget, all the different teams. It did not disappoint me.
reviews.pros: I had a google chat for my college and my work both. And, believe me, it is one of the best chat rooms I have ever used. I had to be involved with different departments and cross-functional teams. So, scheduling meetings with each and every one of them became very organized and easy. Another thing I liked about it is it supports 28 languages so that you can have a personalized experience.
reviews.cons: The thing that I least liked about G Suite's Chat is that it is only a casual app. It is not safe to share very important or confidential information over Chat at all. There is no end-to-end encryption. Also, the user interface could be designed in a much better way. Progress is still awaited!

reviews.title: “A Nice Supplement For Chats Within Your Team”
reviews.text: Chat is a fine product and software overall, but I would prefer to use a software like Skype to continue chats for the sake of ease and the ability to more easily import photos and documents.
reviews.pros: I enjoy the offerings from the Google Suite overall, and I appreciated the ability to access Chat with the same ease I could access Gmail, Sheets, and other products.
reviews.cons: I didn't feel like Chat was best optimized for a business setting as much as it felt more of a beautified group chat. I didn't think that the ability to import documents was all that simple.

reviews.title: “Easy to quickly chat with colleagues”

reviews.cons: Sometimes clunky, everyone has to be on board for it to work effectively

reviews.cons: Sometimes, using it on your phone can be harder to understand. Needs to include simpler instructions on how to enable notifications for calls, texts, etc. I have missed calls because I did not know anyone was calling.

reviews.title: “Great communication/chat tool”
reviews.text:
Positive-good instant communication tool for my team!
No complaints with this product and it has been helpful for my team to stay connected.
reviews.pros: This is a quick and easy way to have a chat with employees- I do not use this for a long meeting, but if there is a quick questions I need to ask one person or small group, we will use the chat tool.
reviews.cons: Nothing- we have realized this is able to be used from pretty much any device (computer or phones work). It is a fast and efficient way to communicate with team members and share information.

reviews.title: “Easy to use!”

reviews.cons: sometimes i wish the notifications were less big. I can be in the middle of a project and notifications just create huge interference in what ever it is I am doing. Maybe if they can make it like a smaller version it would be more helpful.

reviews.title: “Chat by Google ”
reviews.text: I like using chat for colleagues or friends, because when you are already on Gmail, it's a lot easier than texting or other messaging tools.
reviews.pros: Chat is a very easy and seamless way to talk to your Google contacts, especially when you are already using Gmail or other Google sites. It has a list of people you can instantly talk to, and you can send messages to groups too. I have always liked using it when I know the person I am reaching out to is online, which it shows next to their name.
reviews.cons: It takes a little while to figure out how to add people to a group, and sometimes that feature doesn't work well. It also does not send videos, and pictures don't go through well. I think the notifications could be improved as well.

reviews.title: “Nice app as part of the G Suite Universe ”
reviews.text: Three/ Four years ago I used Chat every day with team members.  However, it's functionality is limited. As a team, we migrated to a more comprehensive software where we could chat more efficiently and invite people from outside G Suite. It's still a good app to have, but Google needs to improve it.
reviews.pros:
- Easy access and integration with other apps in G Suite 
-Instant messaging with team members via the 'Chat' box
- Fast option to create a Hangout with team members "
reviews.cons:
- Is native to Gmail. If people don't have Gmail they can't connect via Chat.
- It has not kept pace with other instant messaging apps.

reviews.title: “Chat by Google”

reviews.title: “Google Chat”
reviews.text: The collaborative team that I work with needs to communicate with each other quickly and easily. Google Chat solves this problem without having to call or email someone.
reviews.pros: It is very easy to use, I can ask a question and get an instant answer, even if I am working on something else.

reviews.title: “Perfect for any communication needs”
reviews.text: Perfect all around
reviews.pros: I remember having the original instant messenger when I was a kid. It was clunky and sometimes parts of the chat disappeared. This is anything but that. As an office of personal trainers with different clients, we all have a variety of schedules and it can get hard to sync up with someone. Chat/Hangouts lets us get in touch with each other during work hours easily and without missing a beat. Couldn't be happier with it.
reviews.cons: Nothing, it's totally intuitive and easy to use.

reviews.title: “A Great Free Resource”
reviews.text: Overall, Google Hangouts is a great free option. For being a Google product, I expect it to have a little more functionality compared to competitors, but it's hard to complain when it comes at no cost.

reviews.cons: I've run into some issues with everyone being able to join the meetings. I wish there was a more user-friendly invite function.

reviews.cons: Seeing messages sent and deleting messages is a big issue. Having the ability to receive notifications if others received ones messages or having the ability to delete messages sent by mistake, because stuff happens. Fragmentation of features could be worked on. Boring appearance could be worked on.

reviews.title: “Professional Method of Communication”
reviews.pros: Chat has a professional look and feel to it. Chat gives users the ability to easily share files (both via upload and Google Drive integration), direct message, and have video calls. Chat shows other users your status, allowing them to see if you are active or away. Within the platform you can easily create groups and rooms- rooms allow you to add bots that will trigger notifications for certain events (for instance, the DriveWatcher bot will give you notifications of changes in your Google Drive). Within rooms, users have the capacity to create threads, easily separating topics of discussion to avoid confusion.
reviews.cons: Unlike Google's sister platform, Google Hangouts, Chat only allows you to have one discussion open at a time (as opposed to Hangouts, which allows multiple chats in one web tab).
